product_title: Donna Morgan Women's Rhea Short One Shoulder Dress
review_headline: The dress fit like a glove
review_body: I purchased this dress to serve as a bridesmaid in my friend's wedding. I was pleasantly surprised to find the dress on Amazon, as it was a bit cheaper than purchasing it from Nordstrom where the bride picked out the dresses. Even though the other bridesmaids ordered their dresses from Nordstrom, mine matched perfectly. The dress fit like a glove, and is true to a normal dress size. I'm a size 2 and the size 2 fit perfectly without the need for the expensive alterations that usually accompany bridesmaid dresses. The dress itself is beautiful, very elegant and classy and has a great flow to it. The wedding was outdoors at a vineyard in Virginia in mid-September, and the dress was perfect for the 70 degree day. The sterling color is medium grey in tone. I received many compliments on it throughout the day.

product_title: David Archy Men's 4 Pack Micro Modal Lightweight Sexy Bikinis and Briefs
review_body:
I normally prefer to go commando in the summertime but for work, when I'm wearing dress pants and a dress shirt, it's not quite so feasible. In colder temps I'll happily wear boxers and in freezing cold long johns, but I really hate the traditional cotton briefs (a.k.a. "tighty whiteys") as well as their skimpier cotton "bikini" versions.

Had never heard of "David Archy" before, but these undies got my attention because of all the glowing reviews here on Amazon, and the description of the material, as well as curiosity about a penis-pouch...a feature I've never had in any of my underwear before. Plus the price wasn't as crazy as some of the others (cough cough, Calvin Klein!).

Well, tried them out as soon as they arrived, and a couple hours later, have to say that I am most pleased! The material is soft and breathable not constricting or scratchy like the typical Hanes/Fruit-of-the-Loom or the ridiculously overprice Calvin Kleins. And that pouch, goofy-looking as it is, definitely gets the job done: provides impeccable support and comfort! Yeah I admit I would feel pretty sheepish if I were caught dead in say, a crowded gym's changing room wearing this thing, but I usually put on my gym clothes before heading out the door anyways so that's not an issue.

My only concern with this product is long-term durability of the fabric. Have never seen briefs come in individual cardboard containers within a multi-pack, each with its own packet of dessicant beads! And then there's the care instructions on the ridiculously long rear tag (which I promptly scissored off of course): "Machine Wash Cold. Wash with like colors. Tumble dry low. Cool iron. Do not wring. Do not dry clean." (Who in the world would think of ironing or dry cleaning their briefs???)

So, will keep my fingers crossed that the material is not overly delicate. Since I plan to wear them for only a month or two out of the year, that should not be too big of a deal.

PS. It's hilarious how many guys are using their Amazon reviews to shamelessly flaunt their stuff in the photos...is Amazon becoming a meat market pickup joint these days? lolshould not be too big of a deal.

PS. It's hilarious how many guys are using their Amazon reviews to shamelessly flaunt their stuff in the photos...is Amazon becoming a meat market pickup joint these days? lol

review_headline: It fits perfect since I need that extra at the hips so ...
review_body: I read the other reviews before choosing the XXL since they said it runs small. It fits perfect since I need that extra at the hips so it will zip and not bunch. Still have room for layering underneath but not likely in South Texas. Love the reflector strip on the back. It's great for being seen walking at night. I could even wear it for cycling but may get too hot under the waterproof rubber outer side. I couldn't find a jacket like this at a local store for the price. It went on sale and that cinched my decision. I love the red. Looks good, great quality, and fits perfectly. Thanks for such a great product!

product_title: eShakti Women's Bird print sash tied dress
review_body: I get a lot of compliments on this dress. A woman who was in her car stopped even rolled her window down to say cute dress! It's so retro and adorable. I wear it with a little pink cardigan and nude suede flats. Someone else described it as "very Anthropologie" if you've ever shopped there, and it is for sure. The quality is very good. It's lined. product_title: Mato & Hash Toeless Half Toe Yoga Socks With Grip
review_headline: A bit fussy to get on, but they work very well
review_body:
These socks are very nicely made and quite comfortable to wear. The "grip dots" on the sole make a big difference in helping me maintain balance on a mat or hard floor, but are not so grippy that they are cumbersome to use. The fabric is soft and reasonably cushy.

The only problem is that they are a bit fussy to get on. These are not "pull on and go" type socks -- they are more of the "sit down and get your toes into the holes one by one" socks. But the effort is well worth it -- you get the freedom and comfort of using your toes to grip plus get some extra help with the non-slip dots.

Well made, well designed and very useful to have. Highly recommend.
[Sample provided for review]

product_title: i play. Baby & Toddler Girls' Rashguard Set with Built-In Absorbent Swim Diaper
review_body:
This suit fit my baby well and was very durable.
I could ask for few minor improvements such as the little design in the middle came off after couple of months of use. Also the bottoms fit tight (which is good as a bathing suit) but hard to put on a baby. I wish there was another option with side closure or something to make it easier to put on and take off.

Another thing is the sizing but it may be due to the heat and sun that it stretches.
I had purchased a SMALL size when my baby was about 3-months. Now she is 15-months and I purchased the next size. But when we looked at the MEDIUM we received it was clearly smaller than the SMALL we had. We lived in Borneo which is hot and humid all year round. So the heat and sun might have caused the material to stretch but I was a bit confused to see that the new MEDIUM was smaller than my old SMALL.

product_title: Wrangler Authentics Men's Short-Sleeve Classic Woven Shirt
review_body:
My husband wears an XL. His shoulders are broad and medium build. It fits well.

He likes the shirt, even though he normally doesn't care for short-sleeves. We are heading into our "summer weather" here in the Bay Area, and a casual but nice-looking shirt like this will come in handy.

He wasn't crazy about the gray lining for the collar, but without it, the shirt might look a little plain. I think it rounds out the nice touches of the buttoned pockets.

The material seems a decent quality, as does the stitching.

It's a deep, cranberry red.

product_title: Genuine Leather Trench Coat w/Double breast button closure and belt
review_headline: This Trench Coat Is NOT Made From REAL leather
review_body: I foolishly purchased 2 of these so-called \\"leather\\" trench coats on eBay in December 2011; same manufacturer lable (i.e., Giovanni Navarre) except these were size 3XL. After paying about $90 in tailor's fees, when I picked up the coat, the tailor told me that this was not a leather coat, but rather a Chinese imitation of leather. What each purchaser will find out, is that after wearing these coats for 2-3 weeks, and perhaps folding the coat, that the black finish of the coat will start to crack, particularly in the areas of the coat that are bent the most while wearing it (e.g., the arm-shoulder area, the elbows), and will then break/peel off exposing a white, heavy woven-fabric substrate beneath. The slightly elastic, black \\"leather\\" coating applied to the woven-fabric substrate appears to be some sort of polymeric finish. After reading one of he earlier reviews from another buyer, I asked my tailor why this coat had so much stitching on it so as to make it appear to be made from sewn-together pieces of leather. His response was that this specifically was done to stabilize each sewn coated area from excess movement so as to keep the polymeric finish on the coat. Said he, \\"If you know leather like I do, you can tell just from the feel of this garment that it is NOT leather.\\" I've been using a balck magic marker to stain the peeled-off coat areas black again and the coat looks horrible.

review_headline: I am addicted to these boxers
review_body: Two years ago I got my fist pair of Diesel boxer briefs. It was then that I came to a realization that it does matter what I wear underneath. I had always chosen cost over anything when it came to undergarments but since owning these quality boxers I have not looked back. Yes the cost is a bit steep for some but if you are even reading this that means you are on the fence. So let me give you push and tell you I now have 10 pairs and have tossed my other underwear. Get these and you wont regret it. Word of advice, Diesels main site runs sales all the time on these types of underwear.

product_title: Mordenmiss Women's Summer New Cotton Linen Dresses with Hollow Hook Flower Pockets
review_headline: Nice for summer layering, but persistent sickly-sweet smell
review_body: Nicely made the shoulders are only about 13-14 inches, but set so that the sleeves are ok anyway. I have two of these: one in blue and one in red (more of a brick-red). Pockets are nice and deep. Fabric is light weight and nice for summer, sort-of a gauze material that requires something under it. But nice for summer layering. This brand is extremely inconsistent. Even with the two dresses, one has an oddly long button placket. The biggest drawback is that one arrived with a sickly-sweet smell. I've washed this twice, the second time with Lysol and scented washing liquid, but the rotten candy smell persists. I am trying scented dryer sheets with copious amounts of fabric odor-neutralizer. Hopefully, that will do the trick.

product_title: Carhartt Men's Ripstop Color-Block Utility Scrub Top
review_body:
After reading the reviews about most finding this top sized bigger than most, I ordered a size smaller than I usually get. It almost worked, but not quite. I'm 6ft and 165lb. Small is too small. With a full stretch, there was some binding and it was hard to get on and off. I'm sure the medium will be a bit big, but I need full range of motion. I love the shirts look. It feels like it will last a long time.

One super small grievance- the pen pocket is way to short for most pens. They would fall out way to easy. I usually use a pen with a clip so it will fit fine in the taller pocket behind.

I ordered 2 more in the medium. I'll update after a few months.

product_title: Wacoal Women's Spot On Contour Bra
review_headline: Could have been perfect if not for some comfort issues
review_body:
I really wanted to like this bra. The spot jacquard patter is very cute, and the fit was perfect. It also gave me a nice, frontal-projecting shape. A lot of bras tend to make me look flatter and wider. I got this in a 32DDD. I agree that the cup runs big which worked out for me because sometimes a 32DDD is a little too small for me and in this one it was perfect. I ended up returning it though, because the high gore was very irritating and gave me rash. Also, I didn't really like texture of the straps, they were not very nice looking and were difficult to adjust.

I also wanted to add that Amazon, or whoever packs these bras needs to be more careful, this bra was very wrinkled when I received it and while the outside looked smooth, there were a lot of creases in the inside molding and those can be permanent.

review_body: For the price, this slip is awesome. I checked out some slips at Target and the ones at Target felt slightly nicer but they were more than twice the price. I ended up ordering the ones on Amazon because I like the thick lace hem (I think it's sexy) but it's the lace hem that I also took off one star. It has a funny scallop design in the back (I wish the back was the same as the front or that there were a picture of the back so I knew before I ordered it) because the scalloped part makes it really obvious that it's \\"underwear\\" and not nice looking when it peeks out through a slit of dress or skirt. The slip is also relatively \\"high waist-ed\\" so it doesn't work for some of my skirts meant to be worn around the hip (I can't just pull it down because then it's too long/longer than my skirts). Also, I felt shipping was a bit high considering it's so light and small but I bought four slips at once so that made it more reasonable. The sand looked more like a pale yellow than the pinkish beige in the picture but it's a beautiful color and I love it.

product_title: eShakti Women's Tipped trim shift dress
review_body:
I was so excited to find eShakti a few months back...customized clothes in a range of sizes sound great, right? So, so wrong! I ordered a bunch of items, including a dress like this one. Everything went back because everything was very poorly made. Nothing fit well and the fabrics felt cheap. The clothes all felt like some sort of high school home ec project. So of course I have to pay to return everything. And when they were way late in processing the return, I emailed customer service and got no response. I called, and they have one of those automated messages, that after about 30 seconds, goes to \\"all of our rep are busy, leave a message.\\" click. I finally get the return processed and I receive a $40 bill from DHL for the US customs charges! According to the voicemail the customer service rep left (because, again, you can't reach a live person when you call), it's noted somewhere on their website that if you order over $200, you'll be charged a fee by US customs for an international purchase. Really? Maybe you want to raise the profile of that bit of info a little. Like, when you basket gets to $200, you're prompted with a screen that says, \\"hey the price of your order is now going to get jacked up 20%, but you won't get the bill until weeks after our poorly-made clothes arrive...are you sure you want to proceed?\\"

Honestly - just not worth it.

product_title: Bslingerie Womens Waist Cincher Boned Corset With Brocade
review_headline: Fits Small - Boning not strong enough
review_body:
This corset worked good for my costume; however the boning in it is not very strong. It dimpled easily and did not hold everything in place as it should. This may work better for women who are slimmer. I would suggest ordering 3-4 sizes larger. (ie I wear an XL tshirt - and a XXXL was still too small.)

The lacing in the back should be about 2-3inches apart, when I put mine on it was more like 6inches. If you are looking for medical grade boning in a corset for something that will last long term, this is not an ideal choice.

Also, the ribbon that came with mine was not long enough, I had to purchase more. It only came with one piece, typically in a corset you need 2 - one from top, one from bottom, tie in the middle. This allows for you to adjust as needed. I also found that the clasps in the front were very difficult to get into, causing me to have to unlace from the back first in order to get in/out of the corset.

Rule of thumb: when fitting into a corset 2-3inchs apart with the lacing is ideal; double laces in the back helps a lot; if it fits properly, you should not need to ever unlace the back unless you need to adjust the tightness - you should always be able to unclasp or untie from the front to get in/out with ease.

I would recommend this for someone who is just looking for a cute corset in a pinch but does not want to spend the money on a more sturdy REAL corset/bodice/waist cincher.

product_title: Columbia Sandy River Cargo Short
review_body:
We go to the beach about twice per week, to walk and also to sit and read. I don't wear a swimsuit usually, just old shorts and a tank top. My old cotton cargo shorts have just about worn completely out, so I got this to replace them. Need at least two good sized pockets for my phone and keys. These shorts fit well (I wear an 8 or 10 in most pants/slacks, and I ordered the medium), and are lightweight so that if I do happen to wade into the water, they dry very quickly. I'm sure the nylon fabric will last much longer than the cotton did.

All the seams are tight, no loose threads or apparent weaknesses in the construction. Thirty-four dollars was a bit more than what I wanted to pay, but after visiting two or three local stores without finding anything close to what I was looking for, I quit driving around, bit the bullet and ordered these. I'm glad I did. Now I can spend the time at the beach instead of driving from store to store!

product_title: Pigment Dyed Bucket Hat-Yellow
review_headline: Fits but the inside band is not sown down
review_body:
I bought this for a Halloween costume (Either Madeline from the children's books or the Morton Salt girl) so I was mainly concerned with color and price.

It's a great shade of yellow - not too light, not too dark.

The hat fits great and it's of material I would expect for an inexpensive bucket hat.

My biggest complaint is that if you turn the brim up (instead of letting it lay floppy) the inside of the hat where the crown fabric meets the brim is not sewn down so it can invert and stick out the bottom towards my face.

The fact that the seam is not sewn down or trimmed down is not a huge issue since I won't be wearing this all the time, but I would invest in a better hat without the seam issue if I were going to be using this hat regularly.

product_title: Bali Women's Comfort Revolution Wirefree Bra with Smart Sizes
review_headline: This is a great bra for that
review_body: Ingot this as sort of a lounge bra. Sometimes you are having day when you don't want to be fully dressed, but you need the girls semi-contained in case company shows, and so they don't fall into the skillet. This is a great bra for that! No padding, just soft, stretchy, silkiness. No pinching, fits perfect. I'm a 42DDD and the 2XL fits perfectly.

product_title: Splendid Women's Tank Maxi Dress
review_headline: Feels cheap and looks poorly made
review_body: I was so excited to see this dress available in my size as I've been stalking it online for a while. It looked so great in the photos that I couldn't wait to order it. However, when I received it and tried it on, I couldn't have been more disappointed. While I love the style of the top, particularly the racerback, I found the material to be rather sheer. In addition, the button placket was completely crooked, as if it was intentionally sewn on the diagonal. The dress looked like an outlet piece or a factory second that should have been marked 'irregular.' Also, the skirt is not gathered as it appears in the picture. In fact, there was very little gathering at the junction of the top and the skirt on the dress I received. It might as well be a long sheath dress. Perhaps I don't have the figure to fill out this dress, but it was so ill-fitting, I'm pretty sure a floor-length potato sack would be more flattering. Finally, the skirt's fabric felt cheap and seemed as though it would be prone to wrinkles. I own several Splendid dresses and this one is definitely not up to par. For a dress that was $100+, I expected a whole lot more.

product_title: The Oilskin Drover
review_body: I am a female about 5'2" 135 lbs (wear jrs pants size 5-7 and small-med shirt). Bought the XS size and it fits nice. Sleeves are a little long but when tightened up fit fine. Length is good and it has enough room to wear a jacket underneath comfortably. Good, weatherproof material. Seems like it will be warm in the winter. The sleeves and neck have straps that snug up to keep heat in and the wind/snow/rain don't seep in and make you cold.I have not rode in it yet but has enough room it should fit over a saddle nicely. Quality was above expectation but I will see how it wears over time. It is nicer than ones I found at the local western wear store and about half the price. Was nice enough my boyfriend (lifetime cowboy) bought one after seeing mine because he was impressed by the material and price to boot. Not as nice as the super expensive ones but for under $100 you cannot go wrong with it. I would suggest going to downundersaddlesupply.com and looking under the jackets page where they have a sizing chart that makes picking a size so much easier especially for women.

product_title: PattyBoutik Women's Raglan V Neck Ruched Sides Top
review_body:
I didn't notice the ruche when I bought this because the Patty model thing is obviously a size 0.

If you are normal sized - the ruching will be your best friend or worst enemy. I have mixed feelings. I am the widest at my hips and the ruche adds to that. I'm not ashamed of my curves but sometimes I feel "fat" in this. A little fixing in the bathroom and I feel better and the rucheing hides everything I want it to.

The top part will suck in at your natural waist - so if you have a small natural waist or an hourglass figure, this will do nicely.

It is a good quality piece. It is not super-soft, it is a thick material. It's not harsh on the skin, just not like rabbit fur or something.It is warm though - I like to wear it in the cold.

I am about 5'7 130-135 and I got a medium.

I don't really need a slim silhouette when I'm freezing up in Boston, so I don't mind, but if that's a requirement for you, and you're short, then don't get these, because there's a lot of excess material. They seem pretty warm, and the pattern is pretty, so I'm keeping them, but these are not made for petite people!

product_title: PrettyGuide Women's Power Studded Shoulder Notch Lapel Denim Jacket
review_body:
I wear size US14 clothing and was skeptical on ordering the said US14 size on this amazon clothing page because they're Asain sizing... but I said... Here goes! *no regrets*

I got it on date promised, and was stunned at how heavy the package was. It looks like a well constructed jacket in the pic and I thought it wouldn't be in person... WRONG! IT IS SUPERB!
It came in a sort of ziplock bag that was in a sealed bubble wrap envelope. The bag and the tag says 5XL which made me go HUH!? but the minute I put in my first arm I knew they got itvright! heavy, sturdy, perfectly constructed, looks like I spent a fortune on this thing! The blue is a tad lighter but nothing to be bummed about. It's fully lined too! The only thing is the smell... it has a musky smell as if it was boxed up for some time... nothing a lil airing out can't help... no biggie. I bought a pair of black leather fitted pants to go with this bad boy. Sorry about not posting pics at the moment but I definitely will update with it.
Bottom line... go with their US sizing if not sure of Asian size and PURCHASE THE DAM THING! I'm totally getting the green one now!

review_body: This is a beautiful top. The lace is pretty and the length not too short which can be a problem when you are on the taller side. Plan accordingly for the bust if necessary. It's hard to find a top in plus size that doesn't look like a moo moo, and I'm not even that much of a plus, but this fit the bill. A little expensive for what it is but the designer definitely has it down how to make a larger size look great.

product_title: Brixton Men's Guild Strap Wallet
review_headline: Fit for a cowboy or rocker.
review_body: lately all sorts of brands have been making \\"magic band\\" wallets. hard graft was the first i believe, but at 300 bones, thats pretty steep. they make no brand ones too, but the bands on those tend to stretch out quickly and the leather/pleather on them seem to wear out also, fraying at the corners and edges. there seems to be a trend lately where men dont have the basic fold out wallets. the bifold or the trifold. rvca, makes a decent one, black with a racing stripe on the side. its pretty sharp. black magic band wallets are nice. but for those that want a brown one that doesnt look bad at all, i give you the Brixton Men's Guild Strap wallet. the bands havent stretched out for me yet, and the brown is REALLY nice. its got a cowboy boot feel to the outside, and the grey colored felt inside contrasts with the exterior. why is it felt on the inside? well, if you do happen to get your wallet wet on say, a river rafting ride, normal wallets' bills tend to stick to the wallet. the felt inside keeps the bills from sticking to the wallet, thus making them easy to remove even when wet. on top of that, this wallet also has a custom shaped pocket made just for putting guitar picks in it. great place to hold a spare, when the one you usually stick between three strings on the frets, has gone missing.

product_title: Award Winning Deluxe Police Dress Up Costume Set - Small 4-6
review_body: I got this outfit for my four year old for Halloween this year. It was a Big Hit!! We Always go to a place that is hosted by police officers and they even loved it! It is very durable and very life like. The patches are sewn on and the buttons are also, But the outfit actually velcro's up for a perfect snug fit. This outfit was not a cheap feeling outfit like store bought brands, it feels like a real police officers outfit. It comes with handcuffs and whistle. I just purchased a toy gun at the local Walmart for the gun holster and the outfit was set. Oh I also paired up a pair of black shoes too. It was soooo cute!! I would soooo recommend this to anyone wanting a police officer outfit!!! Pretty good price also for a more durable costume that can be passed down a couple of years!!!

review_headline: Feel like actual denim (more cotton than "stretch" for once!!)
review_body: I ordered these because I love the style and was excited that they have a "short" inseam (hard for my 5'2" self). Was disappointed they were not double button - I'd looked at so many styles I guess I got another pair stuck in my head when I ordered these and somehow thought these had the double button waist... they do not, but are clearly not pictured to have that so it was my mistake I was thrilled when I tried them on and they actually feel like real denim jeans (like you can not find anymore, but how they used to be made in the 90's and before)... I couldn't be happier and will definatley be ordering more. Oh, a note on the "short" inseam... longer than I expected. I am 5'2" and have more torso and less legs than average, My inseam is 30" and these drag on me if I wear them with flip flops or ballet flats. Paired with boots or heels it's fine. I'd estimate the inseam is 31 or 32.

I am very pale and my nipples are clearly visible through the fabric, without the undershirt.
Aside from the sheerness, the dress is lovely. It's very flattering in the cut and hangs beautifully. I feel so pretty when I wear it.

product_title: Fruit of the Loom Women's Plus Size "Fit For Me" 5 Pack Heather Brief Panties
review_body: I only wear panties under my night clothes and around the house. I prefer cotton. I recently lost 40lbs and all my panties were stretched out and too big. I ordered new ones in my usual brand in a smaller size. The quality was awful. I shopped around online and found nothing but bad / low rated reviews for cotton panties. Decided to try Fruit of the Loom and one other brand. The other brand fit better then these. In both brands a nice cotton material although a lighter weight then I am used to. After washing the fit over all is not comfy mainly because the leg openings are too large and gap. No elastic in that area. Nice colors and I will wear them for awhile but I will not order this brand again.

Probably is a minor thing but, i am not sure if is an original shirt from Tommy. That's why i do not give five stars to this product.

review_body: These jeans fit as expected but do stretch out about one full size after wearing a full day. (I tried on a pair size 6 in a store - fit better but leg length was too short) I am 5"5" but need a 30" inseam. Size 8 is a 29" inseam. These "Skinny" legs are not too tight either if you tend to have bigger legs. I don't believe they shrunk in leg length in the dryer...they do not require any ironing if removed immediately from the dryer. The fabric is soft, beautiful & comfortable. review_headline: it looked to me like it was navy blue and red
review_body: As I scrolled the item, it looked to me like it was navy blue and red. The description did not say it was black and red or navy and red. I'm 5'1 and 115-120lbs, I bought a small and it fits great!
Not too loose, however I'm wondering how an XS might fit. An XS might be a little more form fitting for me, but it's really not a big deal, it still looks great! I'm perfectly satisfied with the Small.
The skirt is definitely not too short on me, overall the costume is very comfortable and soft. The bows and brooch are very nice quality. Gloves fit very nicely, also very comfortable. The choker is great as well, not irritating to wear at all. I was worried the tiara would be too big, but it's actually really nice and comfortable, not tight at all. The hairpieces are also really nice too!

Overall I'm very satisfied with this costume and its accessories.

These keep everything tucked out of the way and don't dig in. They're all I wear anymore.

product_title: Claire Chase Leather Executive Computer Brief
review_body: [[ASIN:B003NFCK20 ClaireChase Executive Briefcase]]The zippers on this bag are not well made or well designed. It is possible that they have received a new batch of zippers that are defective. The pull tab attaches with a hook to the slider bow. The hook only attaches to the slider bow on one edge, and it appears to be made of cheap pot metal or something. One of my zippers was broken on arrival. Another broke the first time I used it. The chains are big and tough, and opening and closing the zippers will require considerable force, which the hook on the slider bow is not capable of withstanding. I would not buy this company's products until they fix this zipper design- it is very poorly engineered.

The sizes were a little confusing when I was ordering this costume. I ordered the 1/2 size. It would easily fit most 12 month olds. My son was 6 months when I tried it on him. The legs and arms were a little long, but he will get to wear it again.

It's a really cute outfit. I like that the headpiece comes off. The body of the costume could be used for other dressup outfits. You could easily put layers on under the costume to keep the baby warm. We love it and think our son is a supercute ewok.

review_headline: MAGICALLY AWESOME PANTS!!! AMAZING AMAZON ORDER COME TRUE!!
review_body:
I was skeptical of ordering pants on Amazon but after finding no more of my favorite Nautica pants available to civilization, I had no choice. Finding the near perfect size for me, I paid via amazon payments and had the pants shipped to me in three days! In a horrible week of moving and a car accident, these pants were the holy grail I needed to find! I am happy to have been well pleased by the experience and look forward to buying a Dunkin Donuts or McDonalds hat this way very soon.

Love, Elliot

product_title: Carhartt Men's Quilt Lined Duck Coveralls X01
review_headline: ORDER SEVERAL SIZES UP, I MEAN SEVERAL.
review_body: Bought this for my boyfriend as he works in construction. We had NO IDEA how to order it size wise due to all of the feedback left on fitting, my advice READ ALL THE COMMENTS UNTIL YOU FIND SOMEONE WHO DESCRIBES THE SAME PHYSIQUE YOU'RE DRESSING AND ORDER THE SIZE THEY DID! Seriously, I spent about an hour reading but it was well worth it because boy even with our size up guesstimate we were way off. He's just under 6ft about 180lbs. Normally a 32 or 34 waist in pants ( and even that is a bit baggy) so we were going to order a size 38 or 40. Glad I researched, wound up buying a size 46 and it fit perfectly. Seriously, when they say size up, SIZE WAY WAY UP. We probably could have gotten away with a 44 but at least with this he can still fit sweat pants or hoodies and jeans under this for extra layers. Other than that he loves it and I'm much happier knowing he's warm!

product_title: Philadelphia Rapid Transit Men's Blues Brother Hat
review_body: I was expecting a much better quality of hat after I read the one review. Looks and feels like a costume or Halloween type of hat. For 60 to 70 bucks, I don't recommend. I went and ordered a different one from another co. Waste of money. Won't order again from this co.

product_title: Secret Wishes Star Wars Female Darth Vader Costume
review_headline: cute but short in the butt
review_body:
I am a size 8-10 and 5'7". I bought 3 different versions of the same costume (Boba Fett, Darth Vader, and the X-wing Fighter). They all were great except that they didn't account for butts. Mind you, I have no butt. Zip. Zero. It's more like an extension of my back. Even so, I felt like I was always pulling it down. I wore tights and a pair of "cartwheel shorts" underneath to help with this problem. The rest of the fit in the arms and chest and torso were pretty true to size although I would have appreciated it a few inches longer (especially in the rear) so I would have felt a little more comfortable in public with my kids. If your goal is to be super-sexy though, it was a perfect fit.

The fabric is a spandex like expected and fairly well constructed but it would have been nice if the belt had another part of the costume to attach to so it would stay in the same place. The dress itself has a low waist so when it rode up due to the butt (or lack thereof) problem, the belt would move too and so it tended to look awkward if I didn't readjust it every 4 min.

All in all, it worked and it was a great choice in a sea of "let's see who can be the sexiest person for one night" contests!

review_body:
Years ago when I wanted some deluxe white t-shirts, I simply went to the store, bought Calvin Klein, and I still have one of those - super soft, nice fit, easy. Not so easy to find now, I ordered these because I like all things slim these days.
Well, I had a hard time even considering the actual fit because the collar was so uncomfortable. All 3 shirts had what I think is called \\"facing\\" exposed on the inside collar seams - whatever it was, it was not cotton and it completely chaffed at my neck as soon as I put it on. I waited too long to return them, so off to Goodwill they went. I did wash 1 twice to test, no change.

review_body: I'm not one to wear beanies or hats but this one caught my eye. I was so excited when it came in the mail. I tried it on and it was a perfect fit and very flexible on the head, plus it's reversible! Best beanie I've worn to date.

product_title: Leg Avenue Costumes 5 Piece Deadly Ninja Costume
review_body: What a great costume! I'm 5'6" with a 36DD bust and it fit me perfectly. I love that it's not overly exposing my body like most female (Halloween) costumes do, and the form fitting and plunging neckline still made it really sexy. I wore a cute red bra with it to match the straps since your bra will show with how deep the neckline is. Again really great and comfortable costume with just enough sexy and no sleaze. Would definitely recommend.

product_title: Wacoal Women's Embrace Lace Cupless Shape Camisole
review_body: My boyfriend bought this for me. I think it's adorable. My first thought was \\"omg Minoan bodice!\\" because I'm kind of a nerd. It's not functional shapewear for me (I'm petite-- I usually wear a size 2 and would hope that I don't really need shapewear), but it's a cute little top that could be worn over something or worn by itself as a sexy little piece (but obviously not out of the house). I think the lace detailing on it is very pretty and it is very form fitting without making me feel like I'm squeezed into it. It does ride up a little bit, as another reviewer mentioned, but it doesn't ride up very far and since I don't use it as shapewear this doesn't really bother me. However, I'm giving it 4 stars because I realize that this might be a problem for people who would consider buying it.

Shipping free both ways is great, especially when looking for a special dress. Amazon did have the best price that I found. I will try again.

product_title: Tengs Exclusive 32" 80cm Spiral Curly Cosplay Costume Wig
review_headline: Great wig for the price, looks great
review_body: The wig did come as it appears in the picture, purple, vibrant and pretty. I didn't notice a strong smell as some reviewers had complained and was satisfied with how it looked. I bought the wig for a Rarity cosplay I was doing for a 3 day anime convention, and I felt it definitely did the job well. My only complaint was that perhaps due to my having to transport the wig, the humidity of San Antonio, the amount of times the wig was removed and reapplied, or my general ignorance of wigs in general, by the third day the wig was unruly and fizzy. I haven't tried to have it refreshed so I'm unsure if the wig is salvageable. Even frizzy, the wig looks pretty nice it just wasn't as \\"clean\\" looking at it originally was. Ultimately I'm very satisfied with the wig, and with how quickly it was shipped over, not to mention the affordable price. I would repurchase from this company and seller.

product_title: OISK Women's Chiffon Elastic Retro Long Maxi Skirt Vintage Dress
review_headline: Soft, Shimmery Tutu Pink Twirl Skirt
review_body:
First to note: this skirt will fall to your ankles or feet depending on how long your legs are or how low you wear the waistband.
Secondly: wearing this where hiphuggers usually fall lets the layers of chiffon hit just below my ankles and I stand at 5'7.
Third: Take precautions regarding size; their medium fits like an extra small in most elastic waistbands here.

I love wearing this skirt because spring, summer and autumn this works paired with tanks, leather jackets, rhinestone tops, structured blouses - it's really versatile!

I'm 5'5" 120 lb and I ordered a large. It's definitely a little larger than expected, but it fits around my waist fine. The top sags down a little bit but it's not a problem because I have a small bust, but I could see it potentially being a problem for larger chested girls.
It's also a little long since I ordered it in a large, but the torso fits comfortably. The material is a little sheer though, so just be cautious about what you wear underneath.

product_title: Kaito KA500 5-way Powered Emergency AM/FM/SW Weather Alert Radio
review_body: I ordered this radio from the World Net Daily Web-store. I had recently signed up to receive their email updates and as a thank-you bonus I was awarded a 50% off discount code. I decided to purchase this Kaito 500 radio. The price I paid was $30.35 and that included shipping. I ordered it on Saturday evening and received it the following Friday morning. The radio was packaged well and when I opened the box I was happy to realize it had been delivered in excellent condition. After plugging the rechargeable battery in per instructions, and cranking the dymo for 1 minute, it powered right up and I was able to tune to my favorite AM station. Although the speaker is small the sound was excellent at a fairly low volume. I flipped to the FM band and that all sounded good too. I haven't tried either SW bands yet but will test those at night. I tested the flashlight and reading light function. Both worked without flaw. I was able to pick up the weather band on channel 1 but it did not pull that broadcast in nearly as good as a smaller weather radio that I have so the weather radio of the Kaito 500 could be much better. The radio comes with various charging cables for cell phones etc. I have not tested this function yet. So far I rate this radio a 4 out of 5 stars due to the weather radio reception issue. I have no serious complaints especially for the price I paid.

product_title: Sanus Systems LL11-B1 51 x 80-Inch Ultra-Thin Flat Panel Mount for TV
review_headline: Low profile mount - but too low profile?
review_body:
I purchased this mount because I wanted to mount my Samsung 63\\" [[ASIN:B003A7X5HU Samsung PN63C8000 63-Inch 1080p 3D Plasma HDTV, Black]] as close to the wall as possible, and this seemed to be the lowest mount available with the exception of the Samsung picture frame style mount, but that mount was over $200 and I had qualms about the stability of that mount (just mounts into the drywall - no thanks).

I had read some of the negative reviews about this ultra low profile mount where users had a problem with having room for wires. On my Samsung, the inputs are oriented towards the side of the TV, so I figured I'd have plenty of room for wires.

Installation wasn't too difficult, but the included instructions were pretty bad. I didn't find out until after installing that they have a video instruction on the Sanus website - I highly recommend viewing before installation. One thing to make sure you do before mounting the TV, is make sure you adjust the strings behind the TV so they hang down low enough (almost as low as the bottom of the TV) that you can reach them. You will need to pull these strings to make adjustments, plug in your inputs, or remove the mount later - so neglecting to adjust the strings prior to mounting, as I did on my first pass, can leave a major headache (I was able to fish them from behind the TV, and I removed the TV from the mount and adjusted the wires correctly and remounted ... again, had I watched the video I wouldn't have made this mistake in the first place).

So why 3 stars? Well I have a couple of problems with this mount. The bracket that attaches to the TV grips the top of the wall mount, then is supposed to \\"click\\" into place at the bottom in order to form a secure mount. Problem is, if there is anything back there at all blocking the TV, it won't click into place. This is the problem some of the negative reviewers who have TVs with inputs facing backwards have - it didn't leave any room for the HDMI or other input cables. In my case, my cables are perpendicular to the TV and don't seem to be the problem. What's even worse than the lack of clicking, is my TV isn't quite flat against the wall - the front of the TV is a little under 2\\" from the wall on the left side, and a little over 2\\" from the wall on the right side, for a difference of over half an inch. I think my culprit might be, the wall I have it mounted on is in a spot where an exterior concrete block wall meets an interior wall, with a sheet of drywall over the interior and the drywall has a very very slight (barely noticeable, and in fact not noticeable at all had I never tried to mount this to it) bulge to it. I think that very slight roundness is what is causing my problems with this mount. Yes, I realize this is mostly my own problem as I don't have a perfectly smooth mounting surface - but my point is, this \\"ultra slim\\" mount by leaving only .55\\" inches behind the TV leaves you almost no room for error. If there is any obstruction, including wires or anything else, you could have problems.

Other than that, the quality of this product is pretty good. The one week spot I would point out, and I haven't tested it for failure, but the mechanism where you pull the strings to release the lock seems pretty flimsy. If this mechanism were to fail, you would potentially find it extremely difficult to remove the TV from the wall. And again, with the extremely low profile of the mount at only .55\\", you'd have very few options to get back there and try to get the thing loose.

Overall, this isn't a terrible product, but I have to recommend it with reservations. If, like most TVs, the inputs on your TV face backwards requiring some room for wires, I would look for a mount that isn't quite so close to the wall. Similarly, if your wall is anything but perfectly flat and smooth (get up with your eye next to your wall and look, the imperfection I'm talking about is not noticeableotherwise), this mount could give you problems. On top of that, the flimsy string mechanism would worry me a little bit as well. Finally, if your setup can accommodate an ultra low profile mount and you do decide to buy this product, make sure to watch the installation video on the Sanus website, and if installing into concrete, I'd go out and buy better anchors than what comes with this mount.

3 Stars. Under perfect conditions it probably works fine and it does get the TV nice and close to the wall, but frankly I wish I'd just bought a less low profile mount to start with - it would end up looking just as good with much less hassle. I will probably replace this mount with one that has a little more forgiveness, likely one of the cheaper Amazon Basics models that get good reviews.oblems. On top of that, the flimsy string mechanism would worry me a little bit as well. Finally, if your setup can accommodate an ultra low profile mount and you do decide to buy this product, make sure to watch the installation video on the Sanus website, and if installing into concrete, I'd go out and buy better anchors than what comes with this mount. 3 Stars. Under perfect conditions it probably works fine and it does get the TV nice and close to the wall, but frankly I wish I'd just bought a less low profile mount to start with - it would end up looking just as good with much less hassle. I will probably replace this mount with one that has a little more forgiveness, likely one of the cheaper Amazon Basics models that get good reviews.

product_title: Flips Audio Collapsible HD Headphones and Stereo Speakers
review_body:
I received these headphone straight from Flips audio themselves, I took there try before you buy challenge. I used them over a couple of weeks to them an honest try. I used them as headphones and also used the unique feature and as the name suggests the ear cups flip out 180 degrees to act as powered amplified portable speakers.

Here is the break down of the head phones.

Presentation.
The overall presentation of the headphones are very nice from the sleek packaging stating all the aspects of the headphones to the ample amounts of padding used to secure the headphones themselves. The headphones themselves are stored inside a semi hard shell. The. Hard shell itself Is more of an egg shape to accommodate the headphones in their folded positions. Inside the case comes the headphones in their folded position and a USB charging cable to charge the battery that is used when the headphones are used in the flipped out speaker position.

Build quality
The overall build quality of the headphones are a mixed bag. Some parts are built for use and abuse, like the sturdy metal hinges that are used when folding the phones to store them. While other parts seem just a little too weak for the job at hand. Ie. the pivot points of the actual ear cups have a very slight wobble when you flip out the ear cups to use as head phones. I do not know if they are designed that way or not. Also the headphones are a tight fit, after using them for an extended time the pressure of the head phone can be felt on the temples, even more so if you use glasses.

Sound quality

The sound of the headphones are good but not great. The sound range of the headphones seem to be somewhat limited are a bit flat. Mind you all of the sounds are their and can be heard. But the overall mix of the speakers seems to limit what these speakers are actually capable of doing.On the up side they do sound much better when they are flipped out and usedas powered speakers.

Overall

These headphones are descent headphones. But there are a few nuances That seems to keep these headphones from being great. I.e. the tight fit and the limited soundscape of the earphones keep these head phones from being a great pair.

I hope this honest review of these head phones help the maker consider some minor changes to these to make these head phones a great pair.

But as with all reviews it is up to you to come up with your own conclusion.

product_title: Sony NTM-910 900 MHz BabyCall Nursery Monitor, NTM910
review_body: We had used a Sound and Lights monitor for our first child, but when the baby came along and we needed a second monitor, I chose this one because of the many channels. I wanted to make sure that there wouldn't be interference with our first monitor. The difference between the two monitors is overwhelming! This monitor does not make popping/crackling noises, or that odd bounding noise that my sounds and lights monitor does. In addition, the monitor really picks up the baby sounds well and makes them stand out over the background noise. We play a white noise machine (washing machine noise) and the noise cancelling feature does not eliminate this as background noise- however, it does minimize the sound in comparison to the babies noise in both modes. I cannot begin to say how wonderful the lack of static etc is, not to mention the choice of 27 channels! My only complaint is that using this monitor has made me supremely dissatisfied with my older monitor- so I may have to buy a second Sony!

product_title: Sennheiser Closed Circumaural Hi-Fi Headphone
review_headline: Comparable sound, not comparable comfort to the HD555s
review_body:
I just purchased these to replace my HD555s at work. Aaaand - I just printed the return label.

I love my 555s, but the open design is not ideal for a shared workspace. There's substantial two-way leakage, meaning that, in order to block out my more obnoxious cube mates, I must jack up the volume... in turn contributing to the general obnoxiousness!

On the other hand, the 555s are the most comfortable pair of cans I've ever put on, and I can wear them for an entire day with minimal fatigue. I've got some seriously sensitive ears, and even a bit of pressure or displacement becomes very uncomfortable quite quickly.

Upon opening, I was immediately concerned with the slightly less space in the cups, and the leather-like padding material (in contrast to the 555's velour-y padding). FWIW, I was aware of the leatherette cups at purchase, and thought I could probably live with it, (hoping they'd not be too sweat-inducing). I had, however, purchased the 448s hoping that sticking with the brand would mean the same voluminous cups. Alas, it proved not to be so.

Along with the above concerns, I wasn't impressed with the build quality by comparison. The whole kit was very plastic seeming and the cord was noticeably more flimsy than my triple-5 friends.

I gave the 448s an hour. I immediately noticed the outside attenuation, which was a good start, but also noticed a bit more pressure and less room in the cans. Sound was good through the laptop -> E5. Maybe a bit less transparent, but that was expected, and asked for. I didn't experience major discomfort, but I was *aware* of them the entire time, and thinking about how long it would be until I was going to experience cumulative discomfort.

Then the decisive moment - I put the 555s on to compare. Ahhhhhh. Little fluffy clouds.

Take note, Herr/Fraulein Sennheiser - closed version of the 555/558/595 design will be in my shopping cart the moment I am aware of such a product.

So, back go the 448s, sadly, and obnoxious co-workers will continue to be battled with reciprocal obnoxious volume-raising. Extremely *comfortable* obnoxious reciprocity...

[[ASIN:B0001FTVDQ Sennheiser HD555 Professional Headphones with Sound Channeling]]sadly, and obnoxious co-workers will continue to be battled with reciprocal obnoxious volume-raising. Extremely *comfortable* obnoxious reciprocity... [[ASIN:B0001FTVDQ Sennheiser HD555 Professional Headphones with Sound Channeling]]

product_title: Logitech Harmony Ultimate Remote with Customizable Touch Screen and Closed Cabinet RF Control
review_body: Setup, input, and connection are as everyone has posted - Amazingly Easy. But the design of the remote buttons is terrible. Logitech needs to have one of their designers actually use the remote and then send everyone the newly designed remote with an apology for letting this one out the box. It's long design screams keeping the most used buttons together - which didn't happen. You can actually stretch a thumb ligament finding the info button. DVR-GUIDE-INFO need to be moved up to where the EXIT MENU buttons are. An analog PAGE UP PAGE DOWN rather than 'sketchy" TOUCH SCREEN BUTTONS would add a flowing experience to the remote. I've owned Logitech mice, keyboards, and now this remote. And as the opening sentence shows, they're on the right track, just missed the bus with the layout.

product_title: RCA RP7887 Super Radio 3
review_body: This radio really DOES pull in some distant stations! I haven't been able to listen to KDKA since 1960 (a good year to do it!) I can finally pull in Cleveland's ESPN station, which is so low power you can't get it on most receivers.

product_title: Zeimax Q38i Super Bass Inear Headphone Earphone Headset For Apple iPhone 6 / 6 Plus / 5 / 5S /5C, HTC One (E8), One (M8), Samsung Galaxy S5 Android Smartphone (Black)
review_body: Its okay sound is good up to the level of Sennheiser but one big disappointment was that it was incompatible with my Sony Xperia play.So no good sound on the goo for me used it with my pc works fine...

product_title: Marshall Hanwell 50th Anniversary Speaker (04090736)
review_body:
I had been looking for a good sounding "portable" speaker. I must have seen about 20 different options. I started looking in the $200 USD range, obviously not the Marshall, but the reviews (i.e CNET) of such portable speakers would always make comparison to other better sounding speakers, including the Hanwell.
I am quite picky about sound.( I currently have a KEF home theater with a Velodyne subwoofer. I have my own dj sound system with Gemini amplifiers, JBL standing speakers and Mackie sub, AT 50 MX headphones. You get the picture. I am a sound freak.) I am always trying to get a good sounding system for different purposes.
So what about my verdict? I used to play the Bose Sound Dock 10 and it sounded so good. Now we own the Bose Soundtouch 30. Bose is really capable of delivering good music devices. The Hanwell is something else.
I just got mine. It is not produced by the same Marshall guitar amplifier/speaker company in England but by Zound Industries in Stockholm for Marshall. This company also produces their Marshall headphones which have great reviews too. I am not sure what components they are using but they could be from SEAS, a Danish company nearby with excellent components. I will have to write Zound to confirm this.
The Marshall sound is really outstanding as a "portable" speaker, considering you can carry a 23 lb speaker. It is not a speaker you will take with you around town, but is "portable" around the house. I wanted it for an outside dinning terrace, and it's just perfect.
As it is a single enclosure it will not give you any type of sounstage, but the mids and highs are good. Nice voice and guitars, and the lows are terrific for the size. It carries 2 6"; woofers, but it sounds like 10 inches subs.
I couldn't be happier with my selection.
I got myself a Logitech Bluetooth device and it works perfectly with my ipad and iphone.
This thing Rocks. It will be good for a small party(dancing included), if it's not set in an open area. I suggest to place it next to the wall and floor, tilted at 45°. This way you get a better bass response and still direct the highs toward the ear level.
I used an SPL (sound meter) and at 1 meter it was pushing a very decent 97 dB. That's party level and not good for continuous listening, but it's nice to have it handy for that song that you really love.
So, if you want to have the best available sound from a "portable" 100 watt speaker, look no further. The looks are great too. Need Bluetooth? 30 USD and you are set.
I loved it so much I have ordered another one to play it in stereo. Now I will have a "portable" party system. Who could ask for more?
This speakers are a commemorative item, so they will become collectibles. The original price was 1000 USD. Under $600 they are a steal. They sure sound like a thousand dollars. Thanks Marshall. Thanks Zound Industries. From a grateful sound freak.

product_title: Satellite Oasis Directv Hd Satellite Dish Rv Tripod Kit
review_body: Easy to set up and worked perfectley. I was happy that I did not spend the extra money for a dish that automatically finds the signal. I use it on my trailer for camping and love it!!!!!!!!

product_title: Maxell SSB-1 Maxsound Soundbar Tabletop Speaker w/ Built-in Subwoofer (High Gloss Finish)
review_body: You get what you pay for. We have a small TV with awful sound, and this thing only mildly improves it.

product_title: Acoustic Research ARi3G 3 3 Device Universal Remote Control Compatible with Apple Products (Black) (Discontinued by Manufacturer)
review_headline: Great control concept with a couple flaws
review_body: I'm giving this five stars purely on function, it is not the best tactile experience and lacts some programming features but fills a nitch that i could not find anywhere else. If you are no longer using a cable STB and watch a majority of video content on the web (I'm using it with a Mac mini htpc) and don't want a 40 button monster remote then this is a perfect fit, Of the three functions, one is your tv which becomes the standard channel up/down volume up/down input select and mute. The next two become your audio receiver or a/v receiver and the last becomes your media device (apple tv or htpc for example). Programming is pretty standard but I could not reprogram the menu button since it is used to exit the programming mode. Other than that the only other problem I have with it is the small throw of the buttons. I could not find the programming code map on the web so if you are wondering it includes a very large tv, av receiver and audio receiver list along with a list of media devices like apple. That is it - no DVD/blue ray for example. This product is all about simplification - it's very small (half the size of a standard universal remote), goes completely black (other than the ar label) when it's not moving (it has a tilt sensor to activate the button LEDs) and limits the buttons to an absolute minimum.

product_title: ViewHD AV Converter (HDMI to Composite AV + S Video Converter | VHD-H2STV)
review_headline: ViewHD Universal HDMI to Composite / S-Video Converter
review_body: Works Great, easy to install, arrived on time and great price. Great picture conversion from HD to analog screen at home.

I listen to a lot of EDM and I found these to be perfect.
For the price, these are a no brainer, and the wood does make a diference, can't really explain it, but I feel it specially in more bassy sounds. Recomended

product_title: Blimark Direct DB4 Multi-Directional HDTV Antenna (Discontinued by Manufacturer)
review_headline: UHF only, and not very good at that!
review_body: I have actually owned (and built) uhf antennas that were shaped like this, but that performed far better. What irks me most is this came up highly rated in an amazon search for an outdoor antenna that could pick up uhf AND vhf signals. It is not good for vhf signals, because it has no wide-armed element (I should have known better from my own experience). It only picks up ONE hd uhf station and that is from the public television tower that is a mere five miles away. It is advertised as having a range of 55 miles, but that is nonsense! I am forty miles only from Franklin mountain (el paso) which has several uhf hd channels; there is nothing between me and them, it is a straight, line-of-sight projection; and yet I pick up none of these signals! I actually did better with an old indoor antenna that I rigged up to sit on the roof!! I will go back to that one and sell this on amazon.com I guess. (Oh, I also assembled it correctly, mounted it correctly and followed all other instructions). Very disappointed!

product_title: Electrified UX-21516 Replacement Bulb Only / 69374 for Hitachi Televisions
review_headline: Replaced my original bulb in my Hitachi 50VG825
review_body: I replaced the bulb in my Hitachi 50VG825 LCD rear projection TV. The bulb was the original and I was surprised how long it lasted. When the bulb finally gave out, I didn't want to invest a lot in this older TV even though it is just like new. I saw bulbs from 29.00 shipped all the way up to the original Philips unit as high as 150.00. Since there are options with the case and without the case, I read the reviews and decided to forgo the case as most people ended up taking the bulb out of the case and putting it in their original case to get it to fit back in the tv properly. There are two wires that are attached with nuts to the bulb, on on the rear of the bulb and one on the side. Be careful with the one on the side. It is not as secure as the original bulb. Hold it firmly so it can't move and tighten securely. The new bulb was noticibly brighter, possibly because mine was so old. It is like having a new tv, even the colors are brighter. I am happy for now. I am interested to see how long this bulb continues to work, but for the price and improved quality, I can't complain. I will follow up when my new bulb quits!

product_title: Altec Lansing iM227 Orbit MP3 Speaker
review_body: I use this little speaker on my work laptop as I never know what to expect when I travel to do presentation work. I have used this in a meeting room that seats 12 to 15 people and everyone can hear, loud and clear. Small and packs easily too.

product_title: Sony HT-CT150 3D Sound Bar System (Discontinued by Manufacturer)
review_body:
My sister bought this product first, so we took her recommendation when we were looking for a system. It's small, but comes with a big sound. There are multiple menu options (although we tend to leave it on standard), which can add to the sound clarity.
I watch TV while using the elliptical, so being able to turn the sound up and still hear everything over the sounds of the machine is great.

The subwoofer doesn't take up much floor space. Purchase, plug in, and relax.

product_title: 4-PACK Rechargeable / Reusable AA Ni-MH 2700 mAh Rechargeable Battery *** Includes Mini Tripod and Battery Holder**
review_headline: Great batteries! Pro Series Premium High Capacity AA 2700 mAh Rechargeables

These Pro Series Premium High Capacity AA 2700 mAh Rechargeables held on through some 50+ photographs and 4 or 5 video clips, all with the LCD turned on. I recommend them highly to anyone who needs batteries that won't die at just the wrong moment. The battery case is a nice little plus, and the mini tripod is very sturdy and steady, not at all like some flimsy ones I've seen. All in all, this is quite a bit of bang for your buck!

review_body: These earphones work very well for what I use them for. I am a medical transcriptionist. I had been using the bugs, but wanted to try headphones. These work very well. The sound is good and they are lightweight.

review_body: Don't waste your time or money on this worthless piece of crap!! And as if that wasn't bad enough, I then went out and bought a SECOND stop watch, made by the same company \\"sports line\\", that at first glance, appeared to be an upgrade. Bottom line, it too stopped working in a similar fashion and I am now done with sports line. As a track coach, you can imagine my frustration. I have since written to the company asking them for a full refund for both items. This ia a classic example of \\"ya get what ya pay for.\\"

review_body:
They aren't THE BEST sound quality, but the price of these totally makes them worth it. I've tried earphones that have a similar sound, but cost in the $20's range. For 7-9 bucks, these are definitely worth what you pay for them. I use my phones to exercise a lot meaning I do end up replacing these pretty often, but I can feel good about buying these often for such a great price!

Would recommend for people who aren't too picky on sound quality. The bass line suffers the most at this price, I think. Also, if you use your smartphone for music, make sure your case leaves plenty of space around the earphone jack.

product_title: Sennheiser Professional Headphones with Sound Channeling
review_body: Just a quick one from me. I own both this pair and the cheaper also excellent HD485. Just a word of warning on the HD555. If you like me enjoy the \\"bottom end\\" sound of music, perhaps are or were in to dance music in it's many forms, enjoy the sound of the base, perhaps spent a lot of time in dance-clubs as a youth listening to anything from deep house music through to reggae, jungle, drum and bass, etc then these are not for you in my humble opinion. For classical music, guitar, vocal, folk, rock these are wonderful and have great high end clarity. If you want to hear the warmth of the bottom end save a few dollars or pounds or euros and go for the 485.

product_title: Sennheiser Digital Wireless Headphones
review_headline: When you are looking for the best
review_body: I am not an expert by any means. I just listen and see if I like what I hear. I found the RS170 to be very comfortable and easy to wear. It took just a little time to get use to where the headphone buttons were but no real problem. Even though the surround sound is digital simulation it is sure good enough for a non expert like me. It also surprised me how quickly the headphones recharged. I have some hearing loss and found that these headphones actually help with clarity of high frequency sounds. All in all I was very pleased with my RS170 and would highly advise giving them a try. The quality is every bit of what I had expected and more.

product_title: Aurum Ultra Series - High Speed HDMI Cable with Ethernet - BB-N …
review_body: Does what is expected of an HDMI cable. Made of good sturdy material, as well as sturdy collars (where cable meets head connector). Recommended usage in light commercial or residential applications. No complaints so far. Have ordered these in various lengths.

product_title: ABLE PLANET True Fidelity Around-the-Ear Active Noise Canceling Headphones
review_headline: Buyer Beware - Warranty is Just a Joke With These Guys
review_body: I do not recommend buying Able Planet products. I bought a brand new, retail packaged pair of $350 Clear Harmony NC1050 that failed within two weeks. Under warranty, I requested a repair or replacement, per their written terms on the warranty card. What they sent back were a pair of USED Sound Clarity NC510B ($149 - they called them "open box" but the padding clearly was worn down). When I complained they said they don't have anything else that is an equal replacement. After multiple emails, including to their VP of Sales and Marketing, I was promised a new $199 pair. This was still not a fair replacement but they never even sent those! So, buy at your own risk because if your headphones fail, you can't count on this company to honor their warranty or to act in an ethical way.

product_title: VideoSecu ML531BE TV Wall Mount for most 22"-55" LED LCD Plasma Flat Screen Monitor up to 88 lb VESA 400x400 with Full Motion Swivel Articulating 20 in Extension Arm, HDMI Cable & Bubble Level WP5
review_body: This wall mount is a very good product. I have my 46 Inch Samsung smart TV conveniently mounted on the wall using the wall mount. Its been couple months now and its holding on great. The installation was also very easy. All you need to ensure is that you locate the stud properly. Beyond that, it was very easy.

product_title: Creative Zen Micro Photo 8 GB MP3 Player
review_body: Pros Great sound quality Perfect size - smaller than I expected Easy installation and file/playlist transfer A lot of space for the price Cons Battery life shorter than expected. Menu a bit clunky I've had it for three weeks and am still not used to the touch pad. I always end up selecting things I don't mean to. Who needs photos on an MP3 player? I think they just add that to raise the price. I wish there was an 8GB without photo capability that was less expensive. Overall To me the most important thing in an mp3 player is sound quality. That combined with the amount of space and the easy transfer of playlists makes this a good deal. I would buy it again if I had to do it over.

product_title: Elite Screens Spectrum Series, Electric Drop Down Projection Screen,
review_headline: A great screen at bargain price
review_body: I have done a lot of research on screens after purchasing an Epson 5010 projector. That particular projector was a bit past my budget, so I had to cut corners on the screen. I was looking for the best bang for the buck while trying to achieve the best picture possible. I found that in the Elite 100" electric screen. I have owned the screen for about 3 months, but it was only installed 2 months ago. I wanted to wait a bit before reviewing as I was concerned about a few things I had read in other reviews. First, I bought this screen at about half the price that it is now. Amazon had a great deal going right about the time I bought it. I was worried that a "budget" screen wouldn't do my Epson justice but that is not the case. The picture is fantastic. I had read about problems people were having with curling. The sides of the screen do curl a bit, but it does not affect the picture at all. The motor is SUPER quiet, and rolls up and down with an elegance that belies the price. I popped the batteries in, pushed the remote button, and my screen was rolling. I had called Elite for some suggestions on placement, and they were excellent in responding, and even though they do not install screens they offered advice on how to install my screen in a drop ceiling. I leave the screen down to avoid wear and tear on the motor, but it works just like it did from day one. The picture on this screen is better than I could have ever expected, and for a "budget" screen this is just an excellent way to save some money while enjoying your movies in a larger-than-life adventure. At the price I paid for this, this is just an excellent screen. Highly recommended.

review_headline: Good design, but a bit grainy

My only complaint is that the screen seems a bit grainy which distracts from the images shown a bit. Not a problem for text or simple PPT slides but noticeable when showing graphics.

product_title: JAYS Headset
review_body:
I had the a-Jays Four and loved them! I had them for 2 years until they gave up (R.I.P).
Now I went and bought these and thought that they would be better...
The sound is the same as the a-jays four you really don't hear a difference.
The worst thing about this new model now is that they fall out of your ears all the damn time!!!!!!!
I mean, whats the point of having "in-ear" headphones when they don't stay in your ear???
They are covered in some weird coating that makes them slippery and reason being why they wiggle out all the time.
And thinking about working out with these? Don't forget about it. It's not gonna happen. On each and every damn set they will fall out.
Frustrating to the bone, worst headphones ever!!!!! DO NOT BUY!!!! Buy the previous model instead (a-Jays Four)! THEY ARE WAAAAY BETTER BEYOND MEASURE!

product_title: Apple 8 GB iPod nano 5th Generation Silver
review_body:
Do not purchase this item unless your name is Val Kilmer or Viktor Krum. The item was fine except for the fact that my \\"new\\" iPod nano came engraved with the initials \\"VK.\\"

I searched, but could not find any photos with a stock iPod nano marked \\"VK.\\" Thanks, A&B Imports LTD (Wall Street Photo) for sending me an item which has obviously been used. Perhaps, I will add my initials to the back and then pass it onto another poor unsuspecting buyer.

Time for a return.

product_title: Sony HTCT100 Sound Bar with Subwoofer - Black (Discontinued by Manufacturer)
review_headline: A great solution for the price
review_body: Pros - Only 2 pieces as opposed to 7 with a traditional 5.1 setup, which also means... - Only 2 wires! A power cord and a wire to connect the sub/receiver to the soundbar. - Decent sound. This is NOT going to sound better or even as-good-as a standard 5.1 system, don't fool yourself. - Price. My wife found these for $250, and that's a pretty darn good price. - Connections. The thing has a LOT of them. Cons - The remote. Seriously, the thing has about 40 buttons and I only use 5, volume up/down, mute, power and input. And crazy enough, even those aren't laid out very well. - Setup. People complain that there is no mid-range or that voice is hard to hear. These are people who obviously have either never set up a 5.1 sound system before or didn't read the manual. By default, the center channel is very quiet and the subwoofer is very loud. It took me about 15 minutes of going through the manual before I finally figured out how to alter those two settings, and now there's no issue with quiet speech or the lows drowning out the highs. - As I mentioned, this does not sound as good as a 5.1 system. Soundbars are for people who want decent sound at a reasonable price and don't want to monkey with receivers or wires snaking through their walls or under their carpet. In that regard, this product is a resounding success. I lament the fact that I don't get a true surround sound experience anymore, but I'm happy that my children no longer pull my speaker stands down on top of them, or futz with my receiver's buttons and throw everything off. It's easy (once you set it up) and it sounds great. You can't ask for much more than that.

product_title: K-TOR Pocket Socket Hand Crank Generator Portable Power Supply 10 Watts 120 Volts Made in the USA
review_headline: A Handy End of the World Device
review_body:
Well folks, 2012 is finally here and some people tell us it's the end of the world again. Are you prepared if something natural or manmade knocks out the power system for an extended period of time?

A solar eruption like the Carrington Event of 1859 would fry the planet's electrical grids. Try manufacturing millions of replacement transformers when the world has gone dark; it could literally take years to restore power. Then there's foreign enemies setting off EMP weaponry high in the atmosphere with the same devastating result. Of course, more mundane weather disasters could also knock out power.

The K-TOR Pocket Socket along with a battery recharger and rechargeable batteries will give you some solace and keep your battery powered lanterns, CD player-radios, fans, and other devices working. I tested my K-Tor on recharging the batteries in my portable 9 inch DVD player. The good news is that I can relax in my bunker and keep watching my favorite programs on DVD after civilization has collapsed. The bad news is that it takes over 3 minutes of \\"light, easy cranking\\" for every 1 minute of viewing. Or you can attach your K-TOR to the Lenmar DVDU923 battery pack; recharging it offers a lot more resistance and requires some muscle power, but delivers about 16 minutes of viewing for 5 minutes of cranking. [[ASIN:B0011MZORU Lenmar DVDU923 Universal Li-Ion Battery for Select Portable DVD Players]] A competitor, the ERDVDMAX battery pack provides 17 viewing minutes for 5 cranking minutes. [[ASIN:B00076QBHS Technuity ERDVDMAX Battery, Universal Nimh for Portable]]

My initial effort at battery recharging suggests it could take an hour or more of cranking to recharge four AA battteries. Obviously, only an exercise freak would use this device so long as electricity is flowing out of wall sockets. But if/when there's no other source of electrical power, the K-TOR could be worth its weight in gold.
