product_title: Tecsun PL880 Portable Digital PLL Dual Conversion AM/FM, Longwave & Shortwave Radio with SSB (Single Side Band) Reception
review_headline: Excellent AM and FM, not so good SSB, Sync, or weak signal DX.
review_body:
There are many things to like about this radio. It appears to be of high quality construction, the tuning knobs have a good feel to them and operate smoothly, and it has a sound bigger than the relatively small size of the speaker would suggest. There are some problems with it, however, mainly related to SSB and weak signal reception. I would urge prospective buyers to research the radio in the Yahoo Groups for the PL-880. It was brought out in the group that there appear to be multiple firmware revisions available, and that batch 8820 is the most recent. Earlier versions had even more problems than the 8820, so do yourself a favor and check.

The radio does have sync detection available by pressing and holding either one of the SSB keys. However, sync does not hold well at all, and it also adds considerable distortion. There are multiple filter options available, but SSB is limited to 4 KHz, even when sync detection is activated, which limits the fidelity of the radio. There are also other problems with the current firmware which cause the bandwidth to change when you try to tune a SSB signal, and also cause the audio to jump around when trying to listen to a weak signal. The front end overloads easily with an outdoor antenna, even when the signal is attenuated by using the 3 position switch to cut down the antenna gain.

If all you are looking for is a good looking radio with a great sound for AM and FM only, I would recommend it. If you will be listening to more Shortwave, Longwave, or SSB, and want a functional sync detector with a reasonable bandwidth for good fidelity, then I would hold off until the design matures more. Also beware firmware revisions 8819 and below at this time. These should be "B" stock and not sold as new.

product_title: Sangean MMR-77 Emergency AM / FM Portable Radio
review_headline: Excellent Portable Radio with Crank Charger
review_body:
Having purchased a smaller unit Eaton several years ago, I was prepared to be unimpressed. But this slightly larger unit has far superior tuning, reception and sound quality. I was disappointed to see that it doesn't come with a wall adapter, but later realized that it's not necessary because the crank is so incredibly effective. A brisk two-minute crank literally powered the radio for over five hours! It's so easy there really seems to me to be little reason to install batteries in storage and watch them slowly die.

It should be noted that the manual indicates a limit on the total number of manual charges the internal battery can sustain, which means cranking may not be a suitable technique for routine operation! But as a standby communication device it seems just about perfect.

I'm quite impressed with the value contained in this nice little package.

product_title: Audio Technica AT-LP2D-USB Fully Automatic Stereo Turntable with USB Output, Includes Recording Software and Dual Magnet Cartridge (Discontinued by Manufacturer)
review_body: I have a few days with this turntable and I have to say that so far so good. The sound is good, the automatic start/stop play feature, the USB conection, the integrate amp and the free software are good things. Perhaps a counterweight is missing in order to avoid skipping. Even though it's a good equipment for the money you pay. Spanish: Tengo algunos días con este tocadisco y le spuedo decir que hasta el momento ha funcionado como se esperaba. Tiene buen sonido de reprodución, el mecanisco automático para iniciar y parar mientras toca un disco, la conexión USB para conectarse directamente a la computadora, el amplificador integrado que permite conectarle a receivers sin entradas tipo phono y el software gratis que trae (Audacity, Pyro) lo hacen atractivo al comprador. Lo unico que hace falta para hacerlo perfecto es talves un contrapeso para evitar los saltos (skips) en los discos que no estén en óptimas condiciones. Pero puedo decirles que es un buen equipo por el dinero que pagas.

product_title: 50mm / 2" Foam Earphone Ear Pad Earpad Headphone Covers, 72 pack / 36 Pairs
review_body: I've got a number of headset and headset/mic headphones that I don't care to replace just because the ear cushions tear or crumble. These replacements are just the ticket.

product_title: Zune 80 GB Video MP3 Player
review_headline: Great Device, Wish I would have waited
review_body: I love this Zune. As a fan of Joy Division and their descendant New Order, I couldn't wait to buy it when it was released. While I have a low numbered unit (#35) I paid over $350 for it from the Zune Store thinking, incorrectly, that with only 500 units world wide they would sell out quickly. Now nearly 7 months later it looks like Microsoft sold their remaining stock to Amazon to unload. Oh well, it is a fine device and the presentation is awesome; the photos do not do it justice. Another bonus is this version is the only way to get an all black Zune. The other models have a stainless steel back. Not a big deal, but it does make it look better.

product_title: WIFI 10 dBi 2.4GHz Antenna
review_headline: Location can allow these antennas to work well or worse than a short antenna.
review_body: Location can allow these antennas to work well or worse than a short antenna because near by objects can greatly effect the signal. In the open with an antenna which is not broken I have seen noticeable improvement. However indoors I have had to move the location so that the longer antenna would work properly, like it would in an open field. If you can not get away from metal objects within a foot or two at the same level as your wifi devices then yes this could likely give worse results than a short antenna, but the fault is how radio waves travel not the design of the antenna itself.

product_title: BAFX Products® - IR Repeater Kit / Remote Control Extender (Single or Triple Zone)
review_body: I connected this to my DirectV DVR to try it out. I was going to connect to my receiver and Blu-ray player once i knew it was working properly. I worked for me for about 2 to 3 sessions, after that it stopped working. The receiver would light up like it was picking up the remote IR, the box would flash the blue llight when this happened but the emitters would not work. I tried for a couple hours trying every possible combination, with no luck. I think you get what you pay for. I am sure there are many people that purchase this and never have any problems. I believe that if I bought another one, it may work for me also, but I am not going to get burned twice by the same device.

I wanted a long cord to avoid the bending and tweaking that a short cord would have to make between the couch and the TV, and this delivered--for like $13 cheaper than a 6 foot cord at the store. Would recommend to anyone looking to save money.

product_title: GP ReCyko Rechargeble AAA 850mAh Battery (4-Pack) SALE!!
review_headline: These batteries pack a lot of juice.
review_body:
I received my \\"AAA\\" charged out of the box. Using a Lacrosee BC-700 battery charger's charge/test function, each battery was rated as follows:

Battery 1 = 868 mAh
Battery 1 = 875 mAh
Battery 1 = 892 mAh
Battery 1 = 878 mAh

Consistent with its rating of 850 mAh.

Recyko is the low self discharge nickel metal hydride battery manufactured by GP (Gold Peak - a Hong Kong based company). I find them comparable to other low-discharge batteries from Sanyo, Rayovac, Duracell, Yuasa, etc. Package says 850 mAh, 1.2V. Printed on the battery itself says 820mAh. These batteries does not look as sleek and sexy as the Eneloops; they are wrapped in thin metallic plastic, but for sure pack a lot of juice for the money. Made in China.

product_title: Sony ICF-C318 Clock Radio with Dual Alarm (Black) (Discontinued by Manufacturer)
review_body: Needed a new alarm clock, nothing fancy, but had to be dependable with easy to read numbers, yet soft on the eyes. The Sony display numbers are 0.9” tall in a light green LED, which are very good. This Sony device fits the bill with a fairly small footprint (approx 6” wide, 6” deep and 3.25” high). In fact, for the money paid, it comes with a couple of features that, for me, are a bonus. First, it has Automatic Time Set, which is adjusted by your time zone, and should never have to be reset with the built-in lithium battery. With that is a daylight savings time adjustment feature that works automatically with the built-in calendar. This is not a huge deal, but a very nice convenience. But I did get this primarily for its alarm feature and it does not disappoint. There are two alarm settings (A and B) and I use A for weekdays and B for weekends. Nice and convenient. While it does have a snooze control that works, I do not particularly use that feature, but it is there if and when needed. The tuner is pretty good and will, more than likely, be affected by how well AM and FM signals are in your specific area. For me, I am able to capture my favorite few stations. Overall, this Sony AM/FM Clock Radio is a very good purchase.

I'm a six foot tall man and they loosen from the ear canal when walking. Kids, like my son, will loose the silicone tips and then there's no replacement available, rendering them useless. If it weren't for excellent sound quality, I'd have given them 1 Star.

product_title: SANOXY laptop coolers
review_body: Thankyou much!

product_title: 1byone OUS00-0565 Shiny Antenna Super Thin HDTV Antenna with 16.5ft High Performance Coaxial Cable
review_body:
I was provided this antenna free for an honest review. It just so happened I was in desperate need.

I have not had cable for about 5 years now. It was just getting ridiculous. So, like many others, I bought an antenna to get local channels. I tried three or four antennas of various cost, and it was always chopping and crappy. I could never get a solid digital signal. I gave up on ever seeing my local channels again.

This antenna, on the other hand, is totally different. It has a pretty good range on its own (despite being paper thin), but it also has a signal booster. It is powered by USB if you have a USB port on your TV (most TVs have this, and it says "for service only," but it works great); if not, there is a little power adapter you can also attach. The cords are all nice and long.

With this antenna, I am getting channels I didn't even know existed in the area. My local channels are clear as can be, no choppiness at all, and I get the public channels as well. I'm thrilled! I had given up on ever seeing them again, but now I have them, for free, with this antenna, which works where other antennas totally failed me.

review_body: Works very well in czech republic, hungary and austria. When we got to Switzerland the hotels we stayed at had only one plug that it would work in(the plug where the TV was plugged in). All the rest of the plugs were either recessed diamond shaped and too small for the adapter or the prong holes were too small for the adapter. We unplugged the TV for one and utilized our power convert with small prongs for other chargers. Two in one function was excellent as we had 3 cameras, one video camera,a tablet and an I-touch that needed charging(electronics you get when you take kids with you). They had to stay in touch with their friends via facebook every night.

product_title: HeadphoneMate USB Powered Compact Charger for Parrot Zik Headphones (Zik First Generation Headphones)
review_headline: Much better than the other few options on the market.
review_body:
Much thinner than the zutcharger. I can fit this charger, the usb cable that came with the headphones, the audio cable, and a spare battery all in the little zipper pouch in the Zik hard case.

From totally dead battery (plugged into 2012 13" macbook pro usb 2.0 port) to fully charged in 2.5 hrs. Nice overcharge protection (green light comes on when charged). Nice red "breathing" pulse when charging. Overall, I would DEFINITELY recommend this product!

product_title: Yamaha RX-V473 Receiver
review_body: There are a lot of options and I still have not figured out how to use most of them. Great receiver.

product_title: Grace Digital GDI-IRDT200 Hi-Fi Internet Radio Tuner
review_headline: GREAT addition to my home theatre!
review_body: I just received my Grace Tuner the other day, and I must say, this is an AWESOME product. I have been looking into various internet radios, namely the Squeezebox, and did not see anything that looked like it met my needs. When I saw the Grace Tuner and found out I could get internet radio stations, Pandora, and stream my MP3's from my NAS drive, with audio coming through my stereo, I had to try it out. I have the product installed using ethernet because I keep my router with my home theatre equipment (for PS3, XBOX 360, and Kaleidescape) so I cannot speak to the Wifi but every review I have read says the Wifi works great. From the moment I powered it up, it has worked flawlessly. I have located several local radio stations, setup my Pandora account to stream to the Tuner, and connected my Cisco NAS 200 box to stream my MP3 collection. I am using my iPhone as a remote, which is a great FREE feature for this device. The LCD screen, as many have said, is not that detailed, but it is clear and bright. My only gripe would be that when scanning through my 50GB of MP3's, I have to scroll through all the artists or albums to get to the one I want, so if I want to listen to Warren Zevon I have to scroll from the A's to the W's. Would be awesome if the iPhone APP had a search by letter feature for your files. Other than that, this is a great product and probably one of the best purchases I have made in the past few years.

product_title: AmazonBasics 16-Gauge Speaker Wire - 100 Feet
review_headline: Speaker wire - just like it says

product_title: Sennheiser Lightweight Collapsible Headphones
review_body: I've been an audiophile for over 40 years and these headphones deliver as much value as one can expect for the price. Very nice sound reproduction over the listed frequency range and for all kinds of different music/instruments. The headphone design turns the earpices direcly in toward the ear canal in order to deliver more sound to the inner ear instead of around the outer ear. Very comfortable foam earpads that don't cause ear fatigue over several hours of listening. The only downside is the length of the cable. I use my phones for my computer at work and a 6' or longer cable would be nice. The 4.5' cable length should be fine for iPods or other portable devices, though. Buy 'em, you won't be disappointed.

product_title: Bluetooth Speaker, DKnight Magicbox Ultra-Portable Wireless Bluetooth Speaker Powerful Sound with build in Microphone, Works for Cellphone
review_body: Haven't used it much but sound is better than I thought it would be seems like good quality and was easy to set up

product_title: Apple iPod nano 8 GB Graphite
review_headline: Good for it's intended purpose - exercise - but no cover flow
review_body: I won't rehash all of the previous reviews. If you want more features be aware that this stripped out a lot of the stuff that's unnecessary for exercise. Also sort of a downer for me is that cover flow is not enabled on this new generation of nano. Otherwise it's great for what it's meant to be. Does flap around on your sleeve while exercising, unlike an armband.

product_title: GE 24700 Flat Panel Amplified Indoor HDTV Antenna (Discontinued by Manufacturer)
review_body:
Just bought a brand new panasonic passive 3d tv to replace an old sony in which we were still using a converter box. Don't have cable, never have, never will. Anyhow, decided to buy a new antenna. My husband picked up this model @ Home Depot and its junk.
When we first installed it, couldn't even pick up channel 49(ION) Had to rescan at least 6 times. Every time you change channels, you have to get up and fiddle with the antenna, I mean everytime! If you're on 26(FOX), flip to 49(ION), antenna won't even pick it up, screen goes black and tells me channel is unavilable. If you're on 49 and flip to a major channel like CBS/NBC/ABC, picture continuously pixilates, sound goes in and out, so jump up and fiddle with the antenna. What's the point of remote control if you have to keep jumping up to move the antenna? Sometimes I just give up and turn it off. I've tried putting it in the window, turning it upside down, horizontal,vertical, antenna all the way up,half way down, all the way down and I only live about 12.7 miles from most of the major towers with no tall obstacles in the way! A couple of them are around 17 miles away, but those aren't the stations I have trouble with.
We have a 4 yo HD Magnavox in the bedroom, using a 4 yo,$5 Dollar store loop antenna that gets better reception than this amplified, optimized HDTV GE antenna does. I'd give it a minus 0, if I could. Guess we'll put our old 6 yo antenna back on tomorrow. Good thing we kept it.

product_title: Sennheiser CX 300 II Precision Enhanced Bass Earbuds, Black
review_body: Didn't read there was no inline volume control. Sound quality just ok but what do you expect for a mere $25?

review_headline: Great product to have if you have an older (read ...

The iPad app also works well, except the FM tuner isn't the greatest, but that's not why I bought it. I usually end up carrying it around the house and outside like a \\"boom-box\\" and leave my iPad in one room (when my son or wife aren't playing games on it), and can still control the music using the little remote that stores nicely in a compartment in the bottom of the unit. They are also very responsive to customer comments/questions/etc... Excellent customer service. Overall, I am very happy with this item.

Right now he has it mounted in the attic and it takes a minute for it to pick up channels but he said that he going to mount it on the roof of the house because he thinks that it would perform even better. review_body: I use it in my fairly noisy car and I'm able to hear it loud and clear with decent bass. Of course the quality is just a notch below my desktop Harman Kardon 06941V speakers when it comes to bass and sharpness, but is louder than the desktop speakers.

review_body: Great little clock. I bought 2 others (not Sonys) and returned them before ordering this one. The sound quality of the Sony is far superior to others I tried. I love the dimming of the time feature. I have not tried the projection of the time feature because if I wake up in the middle of the night I don't want to see it. It is easy to set the alarms, and I have one set for weekdays and one for weekends. I'm very happy with this clock radio!

product_title: Outdoor Technology Privates Headphones
review_body:
I bought these about a year ago, and they are as VERY good head phones.. they do block out most sound and the quality is VERY GOOD. Good bass and gets loud. They are light weight and durable. Beats by Dre are better sound and appearl quality, but for the money you cannot lose on this...

The only that i personally didn't like was the way they looked.. comparing them to beats, they're not as stylish. . Other than black or grey, all the colors we ugly to me. And I didn't care for the controls on the headphones.

Outdoor tech, do have earbuds available, however I'm not sure how good they are.. if they are anything close to the quality of the privates, I'll be getting those as well.

Good luck!

product_title: TRIODE HEADLAMP, WHITE LED, BLACK (2280005)
review_body: I own several of these lights. Keep one in each vehicle, fishing tackle box and survival pack. They are tough and sturdy and the greatest thing is they only take ONE AAA battery. Love to night fish and they stay in place on the bill of your cap. Great for changing lures and tying knots.

product_title: iriver H140 40GB MP3 Jukebox
review_body:
If you're using Napster 2.0 (the legal one) don't bother buying this product. You'd think from the description (supports wma files) that it would be easy to do but they don't support drm wma. DRM is Microsoft's way to control the industry and moving a drm wma file to iRiver entails first burning it to a CD, then copying it over to the iRiver device. What a total pain-in-the-$#%.
Good luck figuring out iRiver. You have to download firmware and driver updates with instructions written by somebody with a clear lack of understanding of the english language. I've spent 20 years in the computer industry and am a PC expert - but the iRiver support staff was nasty, implying that it was MY FAULT that their system didn't work! Unbelievable.

product_title: SYSMAX COMBO Intellicharge i4 Li-ion / NiMH Battery Charger V2 & (4) Ultrafire 3000 mAh 18650 Batteries
review_headline: Highly recommended, good charger and batteries
review_body:
I bought this mainly for the charger but could always use some more batteries. The charger is nice, has the best charge light indication I have seen in any LiIon charger. I like that the charger can charge many sizes and types of batteries, I have tested and it worked great! If you don't buy this combo you should look for this charger separately, it's worth it.

Some batteries sold as 18650 LiIon batteries don't have a large enough button at the top to make contact on many devices. These batteries don't have that problem and they work in everything I have tried them on. I use them mainly for flashlights but work in laser pointer as well. I haven't tested the batteries for claimed charge, but they do last longer than any lower rated 18650s that I have so they do last well.

Lastly the price for the combo here is great, I couldn't find a better deal. I would highly recommend this combo.

review_body: The best ?

product_title: RCA TVPRAMP1Z Preamplifier for Outdoor Antenna
review_body: Works great for me. Saw my signal strengths boosted by an average of 20 to 30 points on the 0 to 100 scale. I am using an attic fractal antenna and am 27 to 46 miles from transmitters. However, I also receive signals from two transmitters 103 miles away - one station all the time and the other about 75% of the time. That's 18 transmitters providing 50 digital channels. Hook up was very easy. I plan on adding a distribution amplifier to my other sets and then cutting the cord with cable. I should add that my TV shows max signal on several channels, but they never seem to be overloaded as the picture and voice are perfect.

product_title: ViewHD HDMI Splitter
review_body: Right now, we use only 2 Splitters - ViewHD 2 Port 1x2 Powered HDMI Mini Splitter & OREI HD-102 1x2 1 Port HDMI Powered Splitter. They work! And appear to be the same Device, different paint job. We're always looking for HDMI Splitters. As long as these work, no need to get firmware hacked HDFury HDMI Splitters from China. BTW: All of this gear is made in China. Anyway... This ViewHD 2 Port 1x2 Powered HDMI Mini Splitter can also be Rack Mounted. We've found 2 ways - Compression Shelf or DIN Rail Mounts. The Rack Mount Compression Shelf is less expensive. We currently use Middle Atlantic OCAP-2 2U Vented Clamping Rack Shelf. We have 4 HDMI Splitters Rack Mounted and wired into an HDMI Patch Panel. We can reconfigure, on the fly, for whatever a Presentation requires. Getting Power to 4 HDMI Splitters was more difficult. Solution: USB Power! Using Cargis 6 Port USB Charger & StarTech 3 foot USB to Type M Barrel 5V DC Power Cables. Works! Hope this helps!

product_title: Quik Pod Pro+ with Attachable Legs
review_headline: it IS as fantastic as you think it's going to be!
review_body:
like most 20something year olds... i'm obsessed with taking photos. especially straight-on self portraits or ones of myself and friends all trying to desperately squeeze our faces close enough together that we'll all be in the picture.
thank goodness for being able to digitally delete and redo!
i really can't count how many photos i've taken that aren't capturing anything more than less than flattering angles of only parts of people's faces.
we're all familiar with extending our arms as far out as we can and snapping the pic, then quickly clicking to view what ends up being only everyone's forehead.
how i didn't think of this invention first.. pains me, financially. but, i am happy to give my 30 bucks to the real mastermind.
it's awesome, truly.
you can extend it out far enough to completely capture everyone's entire face.
and once you REALLY get the hang of it... you can include some background in there. great for scenic vacations! or slyly getting that hot guy behind you in the picture, too.
it also seems totally plausible that you could just extend it straight up and over everyone's head in crowds to get decent pics at concerts and such!
everyone that's seen me use it comments on how ingenious it is, and i couldn't agree more!

product_title: 4 Port Cable TV/HDTV/Digital Amplifier Internet Modem Signal Booster Internet AMP
review_body:
OK, to the defense of this product, the instructions leave little hope that this will increase your watching pleasure with a long sort of disclaimer that you need to have a signal to amplify a signal, and the amp can also amplify interference and actually make your signal WORSE...so wtf is the POINT if you can already see a channel? It is, however, a nicely made heavy piece of metal equipment but I think it will only work in the flatlands.

I'm hanging on to it to try a different config. and installation. Currently, I'm running it between an attic mounted DIY DTV antenna and 1 TV. That works great for a handful of channels we can get in the mountainous terrain here. I am going to add TVs and will need the splitter for that - good but not work another star. I hope to get more channels when I get my antenna up higher outside the house and grounded for lightning and all that.

MEH...

review_body: Use caution when ordering, if you don't buy the item from Amazon itself. The vendors selling the \\"same\\" item for significantly less are likely to just send you a bag of generic jacks, not the nice C2G ones with the load bars. I was able to get a refund from the vendor and I'm probably going to go ahead and use the jacks anyway, but it wasn't what I had hoped to receive.

product_title: OontZ Angle Bluetooth Speaker [ORIGIINAL] Ultra Portable Wireless with Built in Mic up to 10 Hour Playtime works with iPhone iPad tablet Samsung and smart phones - Black Grille
review_body: This speaker produces great sound for its size. I was also surprised at the microphone clarity when having a phone conversation with the built in Mic. Minimal muffle, minimal echo.

product_title: X-Mini II XAM4-B Portable Capsule Speaker, Mono
review_headline: Very loud speaker, but there's a small chance you'll get a defective one
review_body: I have four of these speakers. Of those four, one is defective. The volume isn't as loud as the other three speakers, but if you tinker with the volume wheel you can eventually get it to sound as loud as the others, considering you don't touch the volume wheel or move the speaker too much. From this, just know that there's a small chance you'll get a defective speaker. I cannot comment on return policy since the defective one was a gift. Of the ones that do work, expect surprisingly loud sound. Turn your MP3 player, iPhone, etc. to max volume and turn the speaker to max volume and, trust me on this, you will be surprised by how loud this little speaker is. Plus, it has its own headphone jack to plug into your music player, phone, etc. so you don't need a separate one. All you need to do to charge is to plug it into your computer's USB with the included cable and the battery lasts a long time. I also like how if you buy two or more you can connect them to each other to play music through all connected speakers. I really recommend this speaker for gifts. I take it everywhere I go.

product_title: iHome iHM77 Rechargeable Mini Speakers for iPod
review_body: I bought these as a mothers day present, and while they sounded decent when initially used, they started getting a lot of static after a few days and stopped playing after about a week. They shouldn't have blown out either, since the volume was not very high. I sought out an Altec Lansing IM5 as a replacement present, which works very well.

review_body: Have had the Dash for almost 4 years now and it's still running strong. It's been the greatest alarm clock, iPhone charger, Netflix viewer, and Pandora player ever. Sure, button presses are slow and there hasn't been a firmware update since who knows when, but it still works amazingly well.

And the merchant I got it from (Global Electronics) was quick on delivery and quick on questions and issues via e-mail. Very tempted to get another, and when I do I'll go with Global.

product_title: Sony ICF-C05IP 30-Pin iPhone/iPod Clock Radio Speaker Dock
review_body: This is great for me. I have a regular Sony Dream Machine and I wanted one that would work with my Ipod so that I could fall asleep to my relaxation apps and audio books. It works great. I thought it was very easy to set up and it took less than 5 minutes out of the box! The directions were clear and it was pretty intuitive. I love that you can dim or turn off the LED completely. The sound is just as good as my other Dream Machine and I would explain it as "personal use" speaker. I wouldn't use it any louder than 16... it's not a boom box it's an alarm clock radio and as such it's great! It met all my criteria: Ipod compatible, back-up battery, LED dimmer, Sleep timer, FM radio to wake-up to my favorite station, Antenna to ensure my favorite station comes in, and it is just the right size. For an Ipod it doesn't come with the seat part so you do need to have that piece that comes with your Ipod to fit in the clock and hold the Ipod in place. Mine was white and I think it looks cool to have the white piece on the black clock. It does come with three various seats for different versions of the IPhone. Overall I am very pleased.

product_title: APC AV C Type 2-Outlet Wall Mount Power Filter, 120V
review_body: Received the power filter before requested promise date and I used the free shipping option. :) The unit is very well built with a heavy duty power cord and plug - nice that the plug is a right-angle plug so it fits snuggly against the wall outlet. The unit came with its own mounting bracket - though I did not use the hardware included - wanted to be sure it never came loose from the wall so used screws that were a little more substantial. The mount bracket slots are spaced nicely and accepted the heavier screw, (my choice) also included is a template to mark the location of the screw holes and a sketch of the unit to show the dimensions of the filter prior to mounting as to not contact the TV mount. Having the LED lights on the end plate of the filter is a great location making them easy to read with a glace behind the TV. All in all - very satisfied with the packaging, construction and ease of mounting and would definitely purchase another one of these for a second/third TV an or home theater device in another room.

Not even good coasters :-(

product_title: Monster 1000hd Ultra-High Speed Right Angle HDMI Cables
review_body:
The cord itself is well built and delivers as a legit monster product. However...unless you have an old TV with one HDMi slot, this cord will block your other ports and forget about using it on the side HDMI, the angle of it makes it useless. You can put the right angle in the output of the digital device but you will then have to place your device on a book or something to lift it off the table to account for the length of the angle. This is with a 55 inch Vizio. On my 42 inch Sylvania LED, the HDMI ports are on the bottom of the TV so the right angle bumps into the front face plate and cannot be plugged in.

It's a good idea to make sure the HDMI ports on the back of your TV are flush and not close together otherwise it will block the other ones. Also, the side HDMI is a no go as newer TV's are thinner than the inch and half angle length making it so you can't even plug it in. This will only work with a flush HDMI slot on the back of your TV. It was created to eliminate the wasted space from your cables jutting out like zombie arms. Good idea, but to be used for ideal situations as listed above.

product_title: Philips SRU5106/27 6 Device Universal Remote Control (Discontinued by Manufacturer)
review_body: Purchased this remote after reading the reviews. Was a bit worried with some of the negative ones, but since it was compatible with the the dish network figured I would give it a try. When it got here looked for the code for the dish and followed the directions which were easily understood. First code I entered was a hit and I could again changes the channels on the dish. Then tried to look up the code for my TV. Not so lucky there, they did not have it. Tried using the 0 code that was suppose to work if your TV was not listed, but that did not work. So then tried the learning command. Again no luck, tried a few times, but could not get it to work. Figured since I really had only gotten it to replace my dish remote was not a big deal. Even though it would have been nice to only have to use one remote. After reading the learn directions again realized I might have been doing it wrong. So today tried again to learn some of the TV remote commands. This time it was successful with one minor glitch. When I use the volume control it works backwards. When you turn it up it goes down and when you turn it down it goes up. Not a big deal since I can now control the dish and TV from the same remote. The off and on for the tv works fine. I did not program anything else yet because for now that is all I need, but it is nice to know that if I want to put more things on the new remote I can.

product_title: Denon AVR-1611 7.1 Channel A/V Home Theater Receiver (Black) (Discontinued by Manufacturer)
review_body: I bought a AVR-1611 a year ago and use it with Energy Take Five Classic speakers, a Samsung 3D BluRay player and a very good Panasonic 42\\" 1080P Plasma TV. What an awesome system. My wife and I go upstairs once a week for our in-house \\"night at the movies\\" to watch and listen to this system - we can actually hear the cars coming thru the walls and the gun casings rolling across the floors)! This is my third Denon receiver and every one has been excellent - fantastic amps and relatively easy setup for a component with so many options!!! I once had a Yamaha receiver and it excelled at providing lots of different spound effects (jazz club, outdoor ampitheater, etc., etc.) and I found that I simply preferred to close my eyes and imgaine the performers were right in front of my easy chair! So give me great amps (plenty of power and very low THD) and plenty of control (which is exactly what the Denons do) and I'm perfectly content! I'm now shopping for a second AVR-1611 before the new ones are gone (with the next model year already released).

product_title: PCT MA28PN RF Amplifier Passive Return CATV Amp 8-Ports
review_headline: It worked, but was not compatable with Verizon FiOS
review_body:
I bought this because I was having a problem with the HD signal on some existing wiring. The coax was fairly old. The signal was boosted fine and the problem with the HD signal went away. However, another problem came up. I use Verizon FiOS and the Version DVRs send signals back to the Verizon servers using the high end frequency ranges. All of my DVRs had the similar problems - they were either "unable to connect to the server" or they were unable to see the content on the other boxes After spending time on the phone with tech support - the result was "check your wiring".. I replaced the static, unpowered, splitters with one that were designed for HD signals and reran a new RG6 cable to the box that the other boxes could not see. The "can't connect to server" error went away, but all of the boxes were not able to see everyone else. I then removed the 8-port device and rebooted every server and every box could see all of the others.

I did return the box and received a refund.

So, even though it did not work completly in my case, it is still a good product.

product_title: Paramount Articulating LCD Wall Arm (22" to 40" Screens)

product_title: Apple iPod classic 160 GB (7th Generation) NEWEST MODEL
review_headline: Apple goofed...or they want people to abandon the Classic platform.
review_body: I'm really surprised. I wanted to like this but Apple was asleep at the wheel. Never thought I'd say that about them. I just started using it, so there are things I haven't experienced yet. I used to own a 5Gen iPod, 80 GB, which I loved. But it got stolen and this was a replacement. I'd now sacrifice the added capacity to get my old model back. FTR, I also own an iPad 2, another great Apple product. I have been considering buying a Macbook Pro and leaving the Windows universe. This product is so flawed I'm reconsidering...seriously. Here are my first impressions...I'll start with the positives. PROS 1. The face looks more elegant than my previous iPod and the unit is thinner (a constant aspiration of iterative Apple design). 2. Double the memory of my 5Gen, 80GB (though I still had room to spare on the 5Gen). That's it for the PROS. CONS 1. The HD makes noise when you use it. Other people comment on this, and it's true. My older iPod was silent. This one chirps/whirs every time I click the controls. It's not loud, but it gets really annoying. 2. MY BIGGEST GRIPE: The edges are SHARP! It's an Apple iPod for crying out loud. Apple is known for its elegant design and feel. What were they thinking? The seam between the metallic back and face is a sharp edge that goes all the way around the unit. And I've got big, tough man hands...Used tools all my life. This thing feels like a cheaply manufactured piece of Asian garbage. When I rub my fingernail against the edge, it planes off shavings...seriously! It really is sharp. If I don't return the unit I will run a file around it to soften the edges. Shouldn't have to. 3. The split screen may have seemed to a young, inexperienced designer like a cool idea to pack more info, but the truth is (as others have said here) it just mucks up what used to be a clean, usable interface. It is useful for things like Settings, where it give more detailed info, but for most of the use it just shows pieces of album covers -style over substance. The user should be able to modify its function in Settings. There has been a trend to add thumbnail pics to everything, including smartphone apps. Often, though this adds tiny visuals that add nothing but get in the way of great clean interfaces. There is a reason Craigslist still rocks with its seemingly stone age interface. IT WORKS! You get exactly what you need without superfluous visual muck that competes for your attention. I consider it a step backwards. I have not yet tested it thoroughly to hear if, as other have mentioned, the sound quality has been degraded over previous models. For me the CONS are significant. The Classic has been out for years now. Every change should be an improvement. I really wonder if they WANT people to run away from non-iPod \\"Touch\\" models. If so, making people waste money on unpleasant designs like this is a pretty annoying way to do it. Good money for a device that feels like handling a steak knife by the blade. Recommend evaluating a unit physically before buying online to see if you like it.

product_title: Sony High-Resolution Noise Cancellation Audio Headset
review_body: walls block reception pretty easily

product_title: Maxell 298022 60 Minute Digital Mini Video Camcorder Tape - 4 Pack
review_headline: Maxell Mini DV Works well with HDV Too!
review_body:
I have been buying these tapes for years because of their higher reliability compared to cheaper mini DV cassettes, such as some JVCs that I tried before. I do a lot of HDV recording, but the price of Sony \\"HDV cassettes\\" is way too high to be efficient. My archive library consists of over 300 mini DV tapes because they hold so little footage, and I trust these Maxells to store my HD footage. They record for about 01:02:30, that being about 2.5 extra minutes you get out of them which I have used on occasion! They work well with my Sony HVR-M15AU mini DV/HDV deck and dropout rate is very low. I used these as a backup for a critical show production requiring pristine quality video where computers would otherwise fail. Because HDV is a digital format, the tape quality does NOT affect picture quality, but it DOES affect reliability (i.e dropouts and errors). If you need cheaper tape stock for HDV recording and playback, I highly recommend these as a cheaper alternative to the \\"HDV\\" labeled cassettes.

Say NO! to the HDSLR revolution!!!

product_title: VideoSecu Mounts Low Profile Tilt TV Wall Mount for most 32 - 55 Inch Plasma LCD LED TV, some LED up to 60" with VESA 200x100 to 600x400mm 3N9
review_headline: Works as expected but would be nice if it had a way to fine tune the level
review_body: I especially like the pull cord release mechanism which makes for easy TV install and uninstall once the bracket is fastened to the wall. The reason I didn't give it five stars was due to the lack of fine adjustment for leveling the TV after the bracket is mounted to the wall and because I thought the bracket held the TV away from the wall more than it should have - it wasn't as low profile as I would have liked. I'm happy with the performance of the mount and its price.

product_title: Auxiliary Audio Cable Right Angle 90 degrees
review_body:
I have always connected my smart phone to my vehicles audio input jack for music and navigation. I've used several \\"headphone extensions\\", auxiliary cables, and brand name \\"audio cables\\"....they all turned out to be losers, regardless of price...

This cable works perfectly with it's right angled plugs. It's much harder to accidentally unplug the cable when it mounts more flushly. The audio quality its excellent! Much better than expected as the cable seemed to be thinner than previously purchased cables (which is generally a \\"trick of the trade\\"...add thicker insulation/shroud to give the appearance of a higher gauge/quality wire). I will also note that some 3.5mm \\"headphone\\" plugs themselves do not \\"lock\\" firmly when attached but these plugs seem to make FULL contact with the \\"female\\" plug and lock firmly in place for less accidental disconnects exposing the poor guy at Starbucks to your horrible Ipod mix of 80's workout jams :) I'd recommend these highly!

product_title: Component A/V Cable for Playstation 2
review_body: Slow ship but the comp wire was correct.I hooked it to my playstation2 works great!!! What a different picture with this cable love it!!!Much clearer pic and graphics!Old games seem new with this cable highly recommend it!!I play on a 32inch SHARP LCD HDTV!!!

product_title: Sony ACE60HG AC Adaptor (Discontinued by Manufacturer)
review_body: Exellent! Thank you very much!

product_title: Sony MDR-XB50BT Extra Bass Headsets
review_body: Awesome. Bass is great. Treble is good. Blue tooth connected no problem. The sound great. Best head phones I've bought.

product_title: La Crosse Technology BC-9009 AlphaPower Battery Charger (Discontinued by Manufacturer)
review_body: I can't even begin to tell you how great this charger is. NLee the Engineer has by far the best reviews on this type of product, and everything that compares to it as well. I would strongly encourage everyone to consider his reviews and a few others too, that put this charging system and it's other models by La Crosse, high on the "must read" list. So much more than a quick charger, take the time to learn how to use this (which won't take much time at all) and you will love it!!!

product_title: Maxell Hp21 Headphone and Cell Adapter Kit
review_body: Fits most types of audio needs. Very nice set of adapters. Good Quality. A must have, for audio on the go.

product_title: LG LHB977 1000-Watt Blu-ray Disc Home Theater In a Box (Discontinued by Manufacturer)
review_headline: Everything that I wanted - and more!
review_body:
I bought this unit for my Family Room because I wanted to have the following there: 1) Better sound from the front speakers, 2) Bluray player, 3) Working surround sound (had problems with some FOX programs), 4) Netflix streaming. 5) Ability to use HDMI to connect everything

I had an older THX certified Onkyo receiver and a Panasonic DVD player connected before - neither of them had HDMI support. I had surround sound, but it was using the small cube speakers from Cambridge.

I am very happy with this unit. The front speakers have three drivers each and the sound is a lot fuller than my previous setup. The stands are kind of big, so you need to allocate floor space for them. I don't see any way to use the front speakers without the stands. You can use your own speaker wire for all speakers - something that is very important for me and not seen in some of the cheaper units. Since the subwoofer amplifier is in the main unit, you can move the subwoofer to anywhere you can get the speaker wire. My previous subwoofer had a built-in amplifier and I had to keep it behind the TV and use shorter line level cables to the receiver. This new subwoofer was actually vibrating the surroundings back there so I had to move it to another corner of the room with more open space. Was pretty easy since I had a large spool of speaker wire. I did not use any of the wire that was included with the system. I used a much heavier gauge with no problem.

You should buy an analog sound meter to calibrate the speakers. There is a setup menu on the GUI that lets you send white noise to all the speakers. I had to knock down the center speaker a bit and crank up the two surrounds to get everything equalized. You can find a few on Amazon, like this one: [[ASIN:B0000YHNKG Extech 407706 Analog Sound Level Meter]] - but they are also available at RadioShack. Set it at 70db, C weighting, slow response. Send the test signal out the left front speaker. Adjust the volume until the meter reads 0dB. Then you just cycle through all the other speakers and adjust them so that the meter also reads 0dB. It's pretty simple and the meter is worth the money. You cannot do this with your ear. I have had my meter for years.

The Bluray performance is great. The movies look sharp and crisp on my Sony SXRD projection TV in 1080p/60Hz. The Netflix streaming was also flawless. I didn't order anything from CinemaNow, but the interface seemed to work quickly - just like the entire GUI. Before this unit, I had never heard of Pandora Radio. It's very cool and super easy to use with this system. The unit must enable some Dolby matrix setting because Pandora radio comes out from the surrounds too. YouTube was also easy to use, but I think that prefer the Apple TV interface for this. I did not try Audio CDs or the USB port yet. Don't really need those with the Apple TV pulling all those stuff from my iMac automatically. The iPod dock seems pretty convenient, but again I don't need that since I have an Apple TV. I did try plugging in my iPod touch (first generation) into the dock and it couldn't seem to access it. I have some newer iPods that I can try - the manual shows a very complete GUI interface for the iPod integration so it should be a nice feature for those without an Apple TV. Now that I think about it- if I had bought this device first, I may have never purchased an Apple TV.

The only thing that I am having trouble with is the integration with my Harmony One remote. It seems that LG does not supply discrete remote codes for source inputs. The 'InputNext' button downloaded to the Harmony was also not working. I had to re-learn that function and program it to the 'Enter' key for each Activity. The Harmony could not seem to switch between activities using this button, so I will just do it manually. I couldn't seem to find a way to have the LG skip over my unused inputs - like FM, AM, Coaxial, Optical. I am hoping for a firmware updatethat would do this because it would speed up the input switching task. I suppose they could also add these discrete codes using a firmware update. That would be great, but I'm not sure how long it would take Logitech to get the codes into their database.

This system really is a great buy. I have not found another device close to this price that included HDMI inputs and full range front speakers. My room is about 15 x 20 and the sound levels are fine. I can recommend this device for small to large rooms without hesitation. I have a front projector in my basement paired with much larger in wall and a full 7.1 speaker system setup. This LG is a much easier setup that has great performance. Unless you are willing to buy and build a real home theater setup, you should be very happy with this unit.

UPDATE 12-31-09: The iPod dock does work. Finally realized that I needed to use the iPod button on the original remote to access it. The InputNext button on my Harmony One would not cycle to the iPod. Also, the USB interface did play music and photos from a USB drive fine, but as was mentioned by others will not play videos.ed up the input switching task. I suppose they could also add these discrete codes using a firmware update. That would be great, but I'm not sure how long it would take Logitech to get the codes into their database. This system really is a great buy. I have not found another device close to this price that included HDMI inputs and full range front speakers. My room is about 15 x 20 and the sound levels are fine. I can recommend this device for small to large rooms without hesitation. I have a front projector in my basement paired with much larger in wall and a full 7.1 speaker system setup. This LG is a much easier setup that has great performance. Unless you are willing to buy and build a real home theater setup, you should be very happy with this unit. UPDATE 12-31-09: The iPod dock does work. Finally realized that I needed to use the iPod button on the original remote to access it. The InputNext button on my Harmony One would not cycle to the iPod. Also, the USB interface did play music and photos from a USB drive fine, but as was mentioned by others will not play videos.

product_title: Sennheiser On-Ear 926MHz Wireless RF Headphones with Charging Cradle
review_body:
I really rely on user reviews when buying unfamiliar technology, so when I was tempted to by a cheap IR wireless headset, I started reading reviews. I quickly decided to go with RF instead of IR because I wanted to walk all over the house, outside, etc.

But there were tons of choices. The reviews kept taking me back to the Sennheiser RS-120, so I bought one. They are great!

They are comfortable to wear, and the sound quality is great. I can walk anywhere in the house or in my backyard or front yard, and there's no problem with reception.

What I really love is the way they stay charged. The headphones are equiped with rechargeable batteries, and when you drop the headset back in it's cradle, it charges automatically. Two hidden metal contact points in the headband automatically make contact with the metal points on the charger, so you don't have to plug them in. They are always ready.

Now my wife wants her own set.

product_title: Yamaha Natural Sound Custom Easy-to-install In-Wall Flush Mount 2-Way 150 watts Speaker Set (Pair of 2)
review_body: We recently converted from a rear projection TV to a wall mount plasma and we bought these speakers to replace our floor standing units. While I did not expect these speakers to do as well as my high end towers, I was pleasantly surprised by the sound quality. While they don't sound as good as my old Image speakers, they are a close second and are a fraction of the cost. The sound quality is improved by adding fiberglass insulation behind the speaker, but you may have to drive them a bit harder to get the same volume. I also had some issues with the clips not spinning out, but realized this was because I test fit the speakers a couple of times (first to test the fit, secondly to add insulation). I found that the problem is that the plastic clips get lose when you run the screw through them a couple of times. A bit of Locktite (nail polish would also work) will hold the clip to the screw allowing it to spin into position.

product_title: Logitech mm22 Portable Speakers for iPod
review_body: I did a bunch of research on ipod speakers and found some that were pretty loud. But why do they have to be so expensive? The ipod is the technology and what we are looking for is just speakers. (tiny ones). I needed speakers for the beach, not for my house or to entertain many people. Just my wife and I at the beach. For me,paying $184 for tiny speakers for the beach would be rediculous. But this Logitch mm22 is perfect for me. I was actually impressed by the sound. Like I said it is for the beach and sits on the blanket with us. Someone wrote that the cradle kept falling. Well don't use it! Just lay the Ipod next to it. You don't even have to fold the speakers up. Just leave them down. If you buy ipod speakers for looks or major entertaining, you're a fool. Buy some rechargable batteries and you are good to go. Enjoy

product_title: HDMI-High-Speed
review_body: Just would like to say I am very impressed with the fast delivery and more impressed with the quility of the cable even though it's made in China. Whats not these day's!

product_title: Sony NH-AA-B4EN Cycle Energy High Capacity AA Size 4-pc Blister Pack (2500mAh)
review_body:
I do a lot of instrumental music recording and performing, and I use these Sony rechargeables EXCLUSIVELY in my gear, the most power-hungry of which are my [[ASIN:B000VBH2IG Zoom H2 Handy Portable Stereo Recorder]] and my [[ASIN:B0015YG34M GigLight Compact LED Music Stand Light]]. I also use them in my [[ASIN:B000V1VG2E Canon PowerShot A720IS 8MP Digital Camera with 6x Optical Image Stabilized Zoom]] when going \\"optical\\" rather than \\"audible.\\"

I can EASILY record two hours of music on my H2 with two of these batteries at 44.1kHz, 16-bit. I have never even come close to their running out early, and I've never had the device quit because of a lack of power. And I have recharged these MANY times for MANY gigs.

Loading my GigLight with these, I have found I can run it OVERNIGHT -- even 24 hours! -- and not drain them completely.

Plus, the batteries last between 200-400 pictures in my Canon, depending on whether I'm using a lot of flash and whether or not I leave the AF on \\"continuous.\\" I'm never short of power. It's amazing.

Charge time is very reasonable, and when I use the H2, which uses only 2 batteries, I have a spare pair at the ready if I need them.

These leave Alkis in the dust! HIGHLY recommended -- and that's high praise because I'm generally NOT a Sony fan. But I am a fan of these!

product_title: GOgroove Earbuds In-Ear Earphones with Deep Bass & Custom Ear Gels - Noise Isolating Design , Durable Alloy Housing , & Angled for Comfort - Great for the Music , Podcasts , & More
review_headline: Best in ear headphones I have ever owned
review_body: I have tried many in ear headphones over the years, with varying success. Most of them have ended up breaking within a few months. Not these. Aside from being durable, they sound fantastic. The bass response is very good, better than any other in ear headphones I have used. Excellent clear treble as well, I have never heard any distortion out of these headphones, and they can get surprisingly loud. Forget the pricier in ear phones, and buy these!

product_title: Philips LightScribe CD-R 52X 80Min 100PK Spindle
review_body: Only lightscribe CDs I use. Always a good buy and always delivered intact.

product_title: VonHaus Ultra Slim TV Wall Mount for 15-42 inch LCD LED 3D Plasma TVs Super Strong 88lbs Weight Capacity
review_body: is what it is a cheap wall mount 40 inch samsung was on the wall in less than 10 min reeeeal close to wall

product_title: Panasonic Advanced Individual Cell Battery Charger with eneloop AA New 2100 Cycle Rechargeable Batteries
review_body: I've been very happy with Eneloop rechargeables for a number of years now. My stocks got depleted when I moved and since the number of battery-operated devices I had was increasing, I went ahead and got the full set. Charger, batteries, "C" and "D" cases. They charge quickly, they hold a charge well, and they're good quality batteries even after Sanyo sold them to Panasonic.

product_title: AmazonBasics 16-Gauge Speaker Wire - 100 Feet
review_body: I ran this from my receiver to a tower speaker, and the sound is great. I can't detect any signal loss or distortion due to the length of the cable. It reminds me a lot of the horrible overpriced Monster cables.

product_title: iFox IFS303 Ultra Portable Wireless Bluetooth Speaker for iPhone iPad iPod Android or PC with FM Radio, AUX, SD and Speakerphone, Outdoor and Indoor
review_body: A simple to use device that was ready to go out of the box. My 14 year old had it clipped to his bag as he road his bike to practice about 10 minutes after opening the box. The sound is clear and reacted as expected to changes to the equalizer setting on the iPhone 6, which it is linked. It is also linked to an iTouch, 3rd generation. No issues at all. The first full charge lasted about 9 hours of play time. Great value!

product_title: Sony MDRZX100 Headphones
review_body: I bought two pair for both my son's because we travel a lot and they can use them on there DS and also the screens that are in the car. Amazing quality. They are super clear and they adjust to both there heads perfectly. Would def recommend!

product_title: Cables To Go 3.5 mm Male/Female Stereo Audio Extension Cable, Black
review_body: Awful sound quality, strange static and ringing noises regardless of what I plugged into it. Purchased two and both were malfunctioning. Didn't feel like it was worth the time to get my money back.

product_title: HDE 4K Mini DisplayPort 1.2 to HDMI Cable High Definition PC/Mac Display Adapter
review_headline: worked like a charm on my Surface Pro Tablet
review_body: it worked like a charm on my Surface Pro Tablet. I have no complaints this is great for on the go plugging into a projector or into a nice big monitor at the office so I can have two screens!

product_title: CyberPower Intelligent LCD UPS Compact
review_headline: Works better than expected but can't see display at angle
review_body: I'm happy with the performance and it has already protected my Apple Mac Mini and LCD TV set up during a storm and during power outages. My only beef is the display, which shows interesting information is impossible to read, except from directly in front of it. Mine is on the shelf in the cabinet below the TV, flat on its back. The only way to view the display is to pull it out with all the cords attached. Other than that, it works great.

product_title: Sennheiser Headphones Black
review_body: These sound like toy headphones, the cord is cheap, they are not particularly comfortable... no reason to buy these

product_title: Insignia Portable HD Radio NS-HD01
review_headline: A small package delivers a lot.
review_body: Very compact design and you will need to read the instructions carefully to save stations because its not all that intuitive. Having said that, the radio delivers what it promises. HD FM radio. HD radio is similar to HD TV- the signal is very strong or gone and if you scan stations in one location, they may not be available in another. I rode the train with this radio and found it satisfactory in holding stations (with occasional loss of signal for a moment or two)and clear sound delivered through small earbuds. There is no AM frequency, and the only way to charge the battery is by connecting to a PC unless you buy additional accessories.

product_title: Triple C bluGenius Bluetooth Speaker Magnet Wireless Bohemian Rainbow
review_headline: Poor sound, the internal speacker of an iPhone give a better sound!
review_body: Product is too heavy to place on shirt, Magnet is hard to remove and the sound quality is really bad!

product_title: JVC Mini DV Head Cleaner (Discontinued by Manufacturer)
review_body: This didn't work to make my video camera start working again but I think there is something more seriously wrong with it and I need to take it in for repair.

product_title: Kng 028623 Mcqueen Alarm Clock Radio
review_body: My mother-in-law bought this for my 5-year-old son for Christmas. It's a nice looking clock and sounds decent. However, it is virtually unusable. It has, I think, 7 cones on it for control buttons. However, you have to use exactly two of them to set the time, the alarm time, the alarm on/off and the date. I'm an engineer and it takes me time to figure out how to do it. There's no way my 5-year-old can. And for him, he'll just hit the cones and change something and then you have to reset everything. Also, with the radio, it's not AM, only FM, despite the description. And there are no presets or even an indicator of what channel you're on. All you have is a Scan button. Hope you don't miss the channel you were looking for. This is just a very poorly designed clock. It looks nice, but I can't imagine they let anyone try to use it before they put it in mass production.

product_title: Sony STRDH520 7.1 Channel 3D AV Receiver (Black) (Discontinued by Manufacturer)
review_body: i had a sony before this it worked great. i had to upgrade though when we bought a 3d tv. i was disapointed the remote would not work with other products that were not sony.

product_title: ZJchao 3V 1A AC Adapter to DC Power Adapter 5.5/2.1mm
review_body: It works with no problems.

product_title: Premium External Power Supply 5.0v 2.0A (2000mA) AC/DC Adapter for USB HUB and 2.5-inch HDD Enclosure
review_body: This product arrived quickly to my residence. It was not the correct piece of equipment. It matched the specs for my unit but did not have the corect end piece. I had to order another product.

product_title: Phiaton PS 20 NC Active Noise Cancelling Earphones
review_headline: Decent sound but negligible noise reduction
review_body:
The audio quality of the Phiaton PS 20 NC is above average: full bass, clear midrange and slightly rolled-off treble. The overall sound is \\"warm\\". Using an equalizer to boost treble can restore some of the high frequencies. The large audio drivers may be uncomfortable for people with smaller ears.

I used a set of Comply foam tips to improve ear comfort for longer listening sessions. The Phiaton's active noise reduction does not function effectively. Jet and wind noise are very audible with or without the noise reduction engaged. Compared to the Audio Technica ATH-ANC23 earphones I had previously, the Phiaton PS 20 NC provide negligible ambient noise reduction on a jet airliner (McDonnell-Douglas DC9-50). I tried back-to-back comparisons in-flight with a set of Ultimate Ears UE700 passive earphones with Comply foam tips, and the UE700 earphones allowed significantly less noise leakage than the Phiatons. In a relatively quiet office environment, the Phiaton's provide a subtle reduction in background noise, but it is not worth paying a premium for this minor improvement.

product_title: Lowpricenice MH2001 5-in-1 Wireless Headphones w/Microphone Emitter & FM Radio - Listen to Music, Chat Online & Monitor Other Rooms!
review_headline: Neat to have when there are a lot of people in your house!
review_body: These headphones are such a good price. They are not the highest quality but for the price they are more than worth it. If you like to have audio at a certain level (whether lower or higher than the other person you are watching tv with) then this product is worth your investment.

product_title: Sony NW-E107 Network Walkman 1 GB Digital Music Player
review_headline: Very good sound quality, less than an oz, long battery
review_body:
This new line of flash-based, coin-like (but they are thick coins, esp. in the waist!) MP3/ATRACT players from Sony are the latest models of their Psyc line of digital music players. The new-age styling of these MP3 players does psyc you out. Which is not a bad thing, as they are more euro-cool than the rather bland and boring iPod and the downright butt-ugly iRiver. The more I look at the Psyc, the more I like its looks.

The new silver Psyc MP3 player features 1GB of flash memory, which is great for those of you jogger jocks out there. You can shake this thing violently and it won't skip a beat, unlike those hard drive-based players. Before you insert an AAA battery, the Psyc weighs in at an amazingly light 0.9 oz. -- that's right, folks, it's less than an ounce! With the AAA battery, my guess is it's about 2 oz. It's very small although, relatively speaking, it looks a little thick -- esp. in the middle area where the single AAA battery resides. (About 0.75 in. at its thickest part.)

What, you ask, it uses an AAA battery? Yes my friend, and this one AAA alkaline battery can power the player up to 70 hours! That's almost three full days of continuous playing. The phrase \\"up to\\" here means that in order to get all 70 hours of playing, you must 1) play ATRAC3Plus songs encoded at 48kbps and 2) do not press buttons or do random play (i.e., just leave the player playing sequentially). In the real life we like to skip a song, fast forward, random play (a.k.a. shuffle play), turn it on and off and on and off, and most importantly, we play MP3 songs. All these operations reduce the battery life. Given my experience with previous Sony MP3 players, my estimate is one good AAA battery should last you 40 hours or more. (With my beloved Sony NW-HD3, I routinely get the advertised battery life of 30 hours even when playing MP3 files.)

Of course, the use of AAA means you get an abundant and ready supply of cheap power source, and you can trek in the Amazon for weeks on end without having to worry about finding an AC outlet.

The Psyc also comes in three other colors (green and blue for the 512MB version, and orange for the 256MB version). It has a nice, sharp backlit LCD screen, so you always know what you are playing as opposed to having to guess as on some other certain MP3 player. It plays MP3 as well as Sony's ATRAC songs. If you are an ATRAC fan you'll like the sound quality of this little player; it's at least as good as Sony's MD players. For MP3's, the sound quality is a bit \\"muffled\\" compared to my NW-HD3 20GB player, but still quite good if you pair it with a good pair of headphones (i.e., ditch the stock earphones).

Sony still has a long, long way to go in the user interface department, as this has always been its weakness, whether it's digital music or digital video or anything else. The Psyc is not hard to use; its basic functions are no-brainers. But, for anything beyond play/pause/skip, its interface, whether on the unit itself or on the PC transfer side, is still not polished and was clearly designed for a Japanese audience -- Japanese consumers reportedly love to play with complicated gadgets; no surprise given how elaborate sushi-making and origami are. We American consumers like things that are elegant and simple, and Sony has a lot of room for improvement in this regard.

In short, I don't think you'll be disappointed in the new Psyc flash-based MP3 players. They are stylish and lightweight and lasts forever on cheap AAA batteries. They have good sound quality and are priced right. Just be prepared to spend some time with the manual and experimenting a little with transfering music. If you are stuck, you are welcome to e-mail me at gadgester @t hotmail with your questions.

Recommended.n trek in the Amazon for weeks on end without having to worry about finding an AC outlet.

Recommended.

product_title: AmazonBasics High Speed HDMI Cable
review_body: Purchased this cable to connect my PS3 to my receiver. Build quality is excellent. No problems at all. I would recommend this product to anybody needing a quality HDMI cable at a reasonable price. I would not hesitate to purchase other AmazonBasics products in the future.

product_title: Gel Adjustable Wrist Rest
review_body: The wife bought one of these over a year ago and absolutely loves it! She also has the mouse pad. Yes, they do stain after awhile, but, they sure help her when using the computer all day. I give this five stars!!

product_title: Bose QuietComfort 20 Headphones
review_body: I purchased these for my husband who wanted some high end head phones. He tried to like them but they just did not work. I used them to see what was wrong and thought they were more complicated than necessary. For one they had to be charged prior to use. I am not sure why as they could be used without charging but reportedly you get a better sound with charging, I could not tell the difference. The control box attached is big and bulky and awkward if you are trying to listen to something on go you need to have a pocket to put this in and lastly the earpieces just did not fit snugly or stay in my ears despite changing the size of the tips. I was very disappointed especially at this price point.

product_title: Quirky Headphone Rapster
review_body: This is the most simple and most handy little do-dad i have ever seen! I love it! It makes is very easy to carry your headphones with you any where you go without having to untangle them when you get there. I highly recommend this little gem!

product_title: Big Stream Wireless Streamer, Go from small screen to big screen,Bigstream™ takes images, videos, games, presentations and other content from your mobile device and wirelessly streams them in real time to your TV screen.
review_headline: Here's what they don't tell you....
review_body:
....& need to fix: Video quality. It's poor, static-prone & easily bumped by external factors such as mobile phones, computers etc.

The biggest problem i had with it tho' is the internal battery. Although rechargable, the charge lasts for less than two hours (not 2.2 as mentioned)---far shorter than most of the activities it's being used for.

Worse yet, the receiver only has a composite video output with stereo RCA audio jacks. Most TV's & especially monitors these days have HDMI as the standard. And as there are no adapters, you're going to have to hunt for an old fashioned TV to make this product work....

product_title: J-Tech Digital Premium Quality SPDIF TOSLINK Digital Optical Audio 3x1 Switch with Remote Control (Three Inputs one Output)
review_body: Purchased this to expand the number of optical inputs for a new sound bar and it works perfectly. Quick switching, low profile and makes my soundbar purchase that much sweeter. I didn't even know this type of product existed until I found it on Amazon. Been using it for 2 weeks and no problems

product_title: Zipbuds Juiced 2.0 Earbuds
review_headline: Happy overall but wont be buying them again.
review_body:
These lasted me awhile, maybe 6-8 months, with constant use (I like to listen to music before i go to sleep). I don't think I will be buying them again though, because the zipper loses its coolness after a couple weeks, and became somewhat a nuisance due to 2 thing:
The zipper adds some weight to the cord, and the zipper itself just feels weird.

product_title: Phiaton PS 20 NC Active Noise Cancelling Earphones
review_headline: I never knew earbuds could sound this good!
review_body:
I never knew earbuds could sound this good! The difference in quality is stunning. Both with and without the noise cancelling I am hearing parts of my music that I hadn't heard on my Galaxy 3S before using these earbuds. I had just assumed it was the limitation of the phone, but listening to orchestral or vocals with these earbuds revealed that there is nothing wrong with the signal. This sound rivals my full sized Infinity speakers.

The noise cancelling is very effective. Having a "kill" button in the lanyard is a nice feature to have so that I can converse with a coworker or child without fumbling with my phone.

review_body: I bought this for my wife as a gift. It was easy to install and works flawlessly. She is well pleased with it so that pleases me greatly. I do think it was a little pricey but certainly within range. Thus, I have given it an overall good rating.

product_title: Sony Walkman NWZ-E354 8GB Digital Music Player (Blue)
review_body: My daughters, ages 13 and 8, both bought one of these with their holiday money. What a great choice! It came ready to go straight from the box. Both Sony's were fully charged and started right up, navigating was simple and syncing with our computer was a snap. Even our 8 year old opened it right up and moments later had videos uploaded and was happily listening to her favorite songs. The video quality is absolutely amazing. The screen isn't overly large but the image is crystal clear. Sure, they both love the ipod touches and admittedly, this lil gadget is only for music/book listening and video watching-not playing games or communicating electronically--but for the price and given their primary desire was to listen to music and watch some videos, this was a perfect choice and is still compact enough to easily carry around or even run with. A+ My only regret is not yet upgrading my own Philips GoGear

The radio is flawless too. The only thing missing is Dolby NR capability but at $30, who's complaining. Perfect for those who want a good reliable cassette walkman without shelling a ton for those on ebay with absurd prices.

product_title: Koss KTXPRO1 Titanium Portable Headphones with Volume Control
review_headline: These have no right to sound so good!
review_body:
I bought these headphones to sacrifice their drivers for a sound isolating headphone mod, and thought that I'd give these a try.
At $14, these are ridiculously good for the money. They aren't Audio Technica M50s. However at 10% of the price, they don't have to be.

First, the weaknesses:
1. Look and feel cheap (they are cheap!)
2. No isolation (they're open headphones, duh!)
3. Not the richest, most airy, most resolving, or warmest headphones.
4. Cheap headband. Pinches the ears after 10 minutes of wear.

Strengths:
1. Very coherent. While the highs aren't the highest and the bass isn't the strongest, overall the package works very well. There's no overemphasis on any particular spectrum. (Eg. Grado trebles, Beats bass).
2. Nicely textured. Voices are nice and lively, textured.
3. Really cheap! Most headphones in this class are around 4x-7x more (Sennheiser PX100, Grado 60i).
4. Includes a gold plated 1/4 jack converter.
5. Cables are not microphonic.

product_title: Tooks SPORTEC BAND (FLEECE) - Headphone Headband With Built-in Removable Headphones - COLOR: BLACK, Soft 100% Micro Fleece Keeps You Comfortable From Sports to Sleep, Unique Gift Idea
review_headline: ... item about 2 years ago and it has worked great for me since
review_body: I originally purchased this item about 2 years ago and it has worked great for me since. I recently purchased a second one for a backup. I use it when sleeping at night to mask unwanted noises. The speakers are not too large for my ears - they fit fine as long as I use a soft pillow. I can imagine that using a harder pillow might be troublesome. The quality of the speakers are as I would expect and are very acceptable. The cord provided is not quite long enough for me to place my smart phone (which I use as the noise source) on my nightstand so I am using an extension cord. The only problem with the second purchase is that the headband seems smaller than the original and is very tight on my head. It seems that the product is now being promoted as a sports headband and not for use while sleeping so maybe a tighter fitting headband is more appropriate? Maybe it will stretch after some use, but it's definitely smaller than the original band I purchased. If it weren not for the smaller headband I would have given the product 5 stars.
