product_title: Mount-It! MI-484C Articulating Corner Mount for TV Premium Swivel Full Motion Wall Bracket for 37-63 inch Screen LCD OLED Plasma 4K Flat Panel Screens VESA up to 800x400, 132 lb Capacity, Black
review_body:
It took some planning and measuring and the use of a stud finder was very helpful. Mine came with instructions only for concrete/brick walls. If you're application is into regular study/drywall rooms then here's your guide:

Step 1: use stud finder to find edges of studs and mark them.
Step 2: measure for desired height of tv/mount and mark holes for lag screws (6 inches apart (center to center) top to bottom)
Step 3: mark holes for third (and/or 4th) screws on each arm of mount. note these will not go into a stud...read on:
Step 4: use toggle anchors or I recommend using Cobra Driller Toggle drywall anchors for securing extra bolts in drywall applications
Step 5: drill pilot holes for lag screws and anchors
Step 6: screw in anchors
Step 7: have someone hold up the mount while you screw in two of the stud side lag screws on one of the mount arms (helper dismissed till step 12)
Step 8: screw in lag screws for other mount arm
Step 9: screw in bolts for anchors
Step 10: use built in level to adjust level-ness and then tighten the screws securing mount arms to mount surface
Step 11: bolt mounting brackets to tv - back out the screws that will secure the brackets to the mount from underneath.
Step 12: use helper to help hang tv/brackets onto mount (helper dismissed!)
Step 13: tighten underside screws to secure brackets to mount
Step 14: enjoy / sigh relief!

Install certainly takes some measuring and planning but it's worth it. My wife and I have our 55" tv hanging from the wall with this mount so that it is on there rock solid. There is NO CHANCE of the TV falling over if kids are running/jumping around in the living room. (Important especially if you have a wii!) I'm a worry wort and I feel much safer with the tv bolted to both walls of the corner with this rock solid mount. Love it.

product_title: Etekcity Cleaning Cloth
review_headline: Not a bad cloth for the money.
review_body: Considering the amount of them you get for the money they are not a bad deal. It wasn't exactly as I was expecting for a micro fiber cloth. I was looking for the kind that I get from the eye clinic that comes with my glasses, but can't seem to find that kind. These are a little fuzzier but do work and seems to do the job.

product_title: Sangean RCR-5 Digital AM/FM Clock Radio
review_body: I am very happy with this alarm clock. It has a lot of features and also allows for adjusting the brightness of the digital clock. Also, the radio sounds pretty good for it's size, if you like to wake up to the sound of music.

product_title: V-MODA Bass Freq Earbuds
review_headline: good bass but a little disappointing overall.
review_body: After having some of the reviews, I had high hopes for these ear phones but I'm a little disappointed. The audio quality is definately good, especially the bass, but i feel the treble can be a little piercing and the the mid could be clearer. Although this definately depends on the the genre and quality of music you're listening to. These are the first in-ear headphones i've owned so they're not as comfortable as out ear headphones i think. These are still definately very good headphones, especially for the price. I would reccomend them for people who enjoy heavy bass, but there might be better options if you're looking for more balanced sound.

product_title: Sony STR-DE895/B Receiver (Black)
review_headline: After 7 years SONY has lost my business
review_body:
(Although the product is not exactly the same as my purchase, they are very similar; so take this review at that) I purchased the STR-DE995 7.1 "Home theater" receiver. After less than one year, it deteriorated into an overpriced stereo receiver. For your amusement, I attached the letter I sent to SONY of America's CEO.

Mr. Howard Stringer,

I am writing to inform you that your company has just lost my business. Over the years I have purchased many products from Sony and its subsidiaries, including a SONY Walkman, a Car Discman, 3 stereo receivers, a CD/DVD 5 disc changer, a WEGA TV, a PlayStation and its software, and DVDs and CDs distributed by SONY and its subsidiaries Columbia and Epic.

With the recent purchase of the SONY STR-DE995 receiver, I experienced audio problems 9 months from the date of purchase. The chronology of action taken is outlined below.

In an email, I wrote:
"Audio problem - When Dolby/dts (or any surround format) is selected a rhythmic, chirping noise is sounded through the center and rear speakers (currently have 5.1 setup). The noise is amplified as the volume increases. There is no recognizable noise when the receiver is in stereo
mode (since the surround speakers are not enabled). I've tried the following connections: RCA analog, Digital Coaxial, and Digital optical. The receiver is stored in an entertainment center, and is connected to a SonicBlue ReplayTV DVR and Sony DVP-NC655P (both devices have the same sound output problem). The audio problem began about 2 weeks ago. No devices/cables/wires have been added or removed leading up to the problem. I've had no other problems with this device."

Follow-up email from customer service stated the problem would need to be serviced. My reply:
"The service offered is very unsatisfactory. I treat and have treated all my electronic devices in excellent condition, and this productwas purchased less than a year ago (09/26/2003). The recommendation was to have it serviced. Since the closest Sony Service Center is over 2 hours away and the closest authorized center is 45 min away, I'd have to mail it to one of
the centers. Figuring 2 business days to and from the center and about 3-5 days to be serviced (if it can be repaired at all); that would leave me without a receiver for at least 2 weeks. With the many years doing business with Sony, I expect its receiver to be fully operational for many years, not just 9 months. Also, the out of pocket expenses that would be charged at my expense to get the receiver to one of the service centers is not acceptable.

I take a great deal of time researching the best products for the resources I have available to me; when I decide to purchase that product I not only expect the product to be exceptional, but the service as well. Therefore, since the product is under warranty, I want the STR-DE995 replaced with a new one, and I will ship the "problem" receiver to Sony at its expense."


A 2nd follow-up email was sent stating customer service would need to be phoned. When I spoke with a rep this morning, he stated SONY's policy would not be able to honor my request as stated in the above email. When no progress had been made I requested to speak to the manager. He said he was the manager. I reiterated my request to speak to his supervisor. He then transferred me to a rep named Luke. He basically mimicked what the precious rep had told me; insisting policy must be adhered to. I continued the conversation stating, I expect perfection in the products I buy and the service that comes with that product. He replied that SONY equipment is constructed by humans and mistakes will be made. With that said, am I to believe that now and in the future I can expect less than perfect products from SONY? Even if my receiver is serviced, what's to guarantee there will beno other underlying problems? He didn't have the knowledge to answer my questions; instead he repeated the warranty policy. I went on to say, if SONY will not compensate me with a new receiver and pay for shipping costs, it will lose my business and will recommend to my friends and family to do the same. He told me I shouldn't base this decision on emotion, and tried to explain to me how businesses worked. I cut his rhetoric short by restating my position. He offered to fill out a service request. I said, you have lost my business and be sure to pass the message onto your supervisor.

With the end of the conversation, the SONY Car Discman that I've been using at my workplace for the past 6 years went right in the garbage. I will not advertise SONY or any of its subsidiaries. I will not purchase any SONY product and encourage my friends and family to do the same. I will not buy advertising that supports the Spider-Man franchise or Columbia/Tri-Star films, nor those products advertised on Wheel of Fortune and Jeopardy!. Finally, until I have the resources, I will be replacing all my SONY products with non-affiliated brands.

product_title: Elite Screens VMAX/Manual wall and ceiling hanging L-brackets
review_headline: These things are perfect. Just what you need to mount a projector ...
review_body:
I used these to mount a Homegear 120" screen. These things are perfect. Just what you need to mount a projector screen.
Very sturdy, made of metal.
You can mount on the tips, or within the slot in the middle to set the position closer to the wall. Mounting in the slot allows you to adjust height on each side so you can be sure it's level.
Worth the price to simplify the installation.

product_title: Onkyo TX-NR616 7.2- Channel Network A/V Receiver (Discontinued by Manufacturer)
review_body: I wanted to give this unit a shot despite all the bad reviews. Glad I did. It has a lot of features - takes some getting used to. No issues so far.

product_title: Titanium Smart Fast 16 Bay Ni-MH AA/AAA Battery Charger AC 100-240V + DC Adapters MD-1600L
review_headline: Hands down, the smartest buy for anyone that has lots of AA or AAA batteries that they need to keep charged!
review_body:
Smartest battery charger I got yet. It's great, it knew what batteries were defective and charges individual AA or AAA batteries. Takes the guess work out pairing batteries and finding defective/low batteries that kills your good phones.

It's not fast, but I've got 2-3 dozen of AA and AAA batteries to keep my controllers going even when friends come over. I don't feel bad trying to top off batteries either as it does a better job of topping off or trickle charging than any of the Name brand chargers (Duracell, Energizer, Rayovac, etc).

product_title: Audiology 100 Series Strange Trip Headphones
review_headline: May or may not be defective...
review_body: I've owned these for a little over a month, and for a long time they were really nice to have. The sound quality was fine, and I just loved the tie dye design. Unfortunately, just the other day, the sound changed. Music now sounds slightly garbled and almost metallic, and I can't find a reason as to why. The wires are all in tact, and the headphones seem to be in fine condition. I'm thinking maybe I accidentally crushed them in my bag (as these headphones do feel slightly flimsy) or maybe it's a defective product. I will be ordering a new pair next week in any case, only because I love these headphones a lot, and want to know whether or not I accidentally broke my original pair somehow, or if it's a faulty product. Either way, I'd say store these carefully if you're bringing them with you out of the house. The plastic is a bit too lightweight to suggest it can withstand a lot of abuse.

review_body: I own the 705 with 7.1 wharfedale RS-10 speakers. I love it. I talked to my audio tech about the impedance and output power, something we do once a week. By no means do I know what I'm talking about, but the 805 topic came up and without me asking he immediately said that the 805 get's very hot when you mixed speakers with different impedance, example 8 ohms center and 6 ohms surround speakers, I know the receiver can handle both, but it makes is very hot. This comes from an audiophile. Well just helping does who might be having problems with their units running HOT. :) Mine doesn't even get hot and is running 7 120w 6 ohms speakers, plus 250w sub. Here is the link in case you care to know what speakers I'm using. [...]

review_body: I bought this strap to cinch down my custom Maglite holder in my truck. I like that there are two straps in the pack. I can assure you that what ever you wrap this around, will not move. Very well made cinch strap.

product_title: C2G / Cables to Go Audio Unlimited 900MHz Wireless Rechargable Stereo Headphones
review_body: I must admit, I was a little worried by the reviews I read; seems a lot of people had trouble with these headphones. Thankfully, my experience has been compltely positive. I bought these because I have a new baby, and in the rare instance that I have free time to play a game, I didn't want it to wake her up. These are fantastic for gaming. The sound comes through clearly and- once you find the right channel & frequency- static-free. I will go so far as to say it even enhanced my gaming experience because I don't have surround sound, and with these stereo headphones I can now tell which direction a sound in the game is coming from. The range is fairly short, but if you're using it to watch TV or play video games that isn't a problem. One point of consideration if you're buying this for the same reason as I did: one of the channels (there are 3 total) is the same as our baby monitor (Graco), so it couldn't be used. Also, even on the channel that doesn't interfere, if I wear them into the room with the baby monitor microphone, there is substantial feedback. So there's probably no way to use them too close to the nursery. Overall, this is a fantastic product for the price; this headset is about half of what the other highly reviewed sets were ranging. I absolutley recommend them.

product_title: Coby Jammerz Platinum High-Performance Isolation Stereo Earphones
review_body: I liked these so much, I ended up coming back for another pair. They do not have the absolute best sound and they are not my favorite headphones, but for the price I love them! They have lasted longer than some of the more expensive ones I have purchased.

review_body: Avoid this product. 7 out of 10 discs failed to properly burn. One would think I should have had 10 successful burns, but only 3? How I would love to return these for a complete refund. But since I only had 30% successful burns, I cannot. I would have been better off burning my money instead. I would have felt like it was well spent. Not on this shabby product.

product_title: Flipper Big Button Universal Remote for 2 Devices
review_body: This was a great try at a universal remote. Nice size and features. Unfortunately it only worked with one of my Direct TV STB's and not the other one. Also, the biggest disappointment was that it requires "line of sight" between the remote and STB to work. The factory Direct TV remote will work through a closed cabinet or around corners. Not the Flipper, no way. For this reason alone I would have sent them back.

product_title: Onkyo HT-S3500 660 Watt 5.1-Channel Home Theater Speaker/Receiver Package
review_body:
This product is just the right stuff for me. Somehow, I missed any instruction that mentions fiber optic cable as a requirement to connect this machine to the HDTV. It took 2 days to figure this out. Now this machine works like a gem with my HDTV. I am waiting for my blu ray (smart) to connect to this system. I guess I will need to update my system every couple of years to stay current with all the new digital developments. My old audio system was 7 years old and already looks like an antique compared to this system. .
Forget about the technical support. It took almost 2 hours to get someone on the line.....and that was not even helpful. The Tech guy asked me to ship it back for service.

6/2/13: Update:
I used cheap HDMI cable (just my thought) to setup this system with my smart Philips HDTV. Everything was fine until about 4 months later when my HDTV firmware update; then my Philips HDTV would no longer output sound through the Audio System. I finally got it right again after replacing the HDMI cable with a genuine and more expensive one. Now my Audio System and my HDTV are back in sync. You will need a good quality (certified) HDMI cable for these electronics to get what you want out of them. It is still a 5 star.

review_headline: The picture quality is great (yes, some HDMI cables CAN be bad

However it's done very well, we've not had a single issue while using it. The picture quality is great (yes, some HDMI cables CAN be bad: do your research, people!), it's stood up well against a bit of abuse moving the computer around the house, and when I need a new cable for the TV, I'm going to be buying another one very soon. product_title: Altec Lansing iM-237 Orbit Ultraportable Speaker for MP3 Players (Silver)
review_headline: Great sound in a tiny package
review_body: The IM-237 Orbit speakers provides very good sound with a wide dynamic range - from a tiny speaker in a package about the size of an orange. Great for presentations - you don't have to lug big speakers with you - or listening on an ipod. Far bigger, deeper sound than the built in speakers in my 17\\" Macbook pro. If you are expecting this little device to sound like your home stereo system you'll be disappointed. But the compromise of small size, portability, low price and very acceptable sound makes the iM-237 Orbit well worth it. Battery life is OK. The cord wraps nicely around the base and the mini-plug stores into a recessed area on the base. However, at only 6\\" long, it is maddeningly short. Minor flaws aside, this is a very good product at a reasonable price.

They also have a great bass, sound quality is superior but if you want to spend on the $20 version for Wicked it's what you would expect out of ear buds for that price and much more bass and decibel intensity. product_title: RHA Noise Isolating In-Ear Headphone with Remote and Microphone - 3 Year Warranty
review_body:
These headphones have a warm, non-fatiguing sound. Maybe the best sound I have found for the price.
Physically, they did get a little tiring.
I would rate them 5 stars except for build quality. The design, while the speaker-housings are strong & made of stainless-steel, the rest of the product cannot keep up with the sturdiness of the earbuds. The cable is not on parr, & separated from the mic/remote in the first week of use. Also, they were a little unwieldy, more so than other similarly shaped headphones I've owned... I think this is due to the weight of the earbuds in relationship to the cables.

If their primary use will be super gentle, I do recommend these... they sound amazing & the RHA people are helpful & honer the 3 year warranty. They sent me another pair before asking me to send my first pair back!

product_title: Creative Zen Micro 5 GB MP3 Player
review_body:
I recieved the Zen Micro as a present and although I had never heard of it, I was excited to get a new MP player, and even more excited to get one that played 2,500 songs.
After recieving it, it took about an hour to download the software onto my computer and then 7 hours to fill my player with songs and create albulm for them. With the Creative media player that installs on your computer and takes over as the primary media player wether you want it to or not, the process of uploading music involves moving track by track and about a minute per song.

After getting about 800 songs on the player it was full, what Zen only writes in very fine print is that the player holds 2,500 WMPAs, which I had none of. Still excited to have a small player to put in my pocket on the treadmill, I headed out to the gym. After less than two minutes the player was broken. I tried rebooting it acording to the intructions, this involved awkwardly pulling out the battery and hitting some buttons, nothing happened. Also some of the aptions in the rebooting menu that pops up an not only wipe out your music, but wipe out all the firmware on the player, and because of the desighn of the virticle touch pad, accidently hitting on of these options is all too easy.

On the phone with Creative, they said they would replace it. Since my player was bought off of Amazon during the holiday season and I did not get it until two months later it was too late to return it to Amazon.

A month later I recieved my replacement. Again after spending the good part of the morning and early afternoon uploading my music, I headed off to work with my new player in hand. Then it happened again, this time I was running to catch the city bus when the player froze. Again nothing happened when I tried to reboot it.

Creative replaced it again becuase that was all they could do, they refuse to give me any type of refund.
I just recieved my third Zenmicro yesterday, oddly enough it arrived on the same day as my new IPod mini. The ipod took less than an hour to download the software (itunes)which had a much better interface even on my PC. Another hour later, itunes had uploaded 1,000 songs as promised to my IPod, which has proven to work wonderfully walking around, riding the subway, catching the bus, and yes working out at the gym. Also the circular pad is much easier to use tha the vertical pad of the Zen. The rebooting process also only involves hitting one button as opposed to opening up the player and giving yourself the oppertunity to wreck the whole thing.

Six months after first using the Zen Micro I am now happily part of the MP player carrying community with my new IPod mini. All I can say is that it's on top for a reason.

product_title: Cable Matters Micro USB SlimPort (MyDP) to HDMI 6 Foot Cable with 6 Foot USB Charging Cable
review_headline: A good concept, unfortunately does not appear to work with ...
review_body: A good concept, unfortunately does not appear to work with either LG G3, or even the Droid Mini. Used the cable with the G3 as well as with the Mini on multiple TV units, but no luck! Have returned the unit. It appears that the connectivity is limited to specific units of mobile phones. Check for compatibility before ordering.

product_title: CA Internet Security Suite and 2GB Flash Drive
review_body: I bought this internet security suite because of the attractive price, features, and reviews, but when I installed it on my new Dell Inspiron 531, it slowed everything on my machine to an unbearable crawl. Since nothing seemed to alleviate the problem, I followed the instructions to uninstall it. When I booted up afterwards, my machine was still painfully slow. Putting the computer in safe mode, I discovered that the CA program files were still loaded and could not be deleted. After many hours of frustration, I finally managed to contact tech support online, and someone in India took control of my computer and finally was able to get the software totally off my machine. Right after that, my speed was back to normal. Given the frustration and time wasted on this software, I would never recommend it to anyone.

product_title: Amplified HD Digital Outdoor HDTV Antenna 150 Miles Long Range with Motorized 360 Degree Rotation, UHF/VHF/FM Radio with Infrared Remote Control
review_body:
This product is fantastic. I tried one of those flat, window mount devices but the reception was spotty. I live in a major metro area and I knew I should be able to get better reception. It took me about 15 minutes to assemble and about 30 minutes to mount to my old Dish network mount on the roof of my home. The reception is awesome. I now get 55 channels, all clearer than my cable or dish service ever got them. I know some people said the antenna is "flimsy" but all outside antennas are light weight. I guess a lot of folks have forgotten the old outside antennas from the 50s, 60s and 70s before cable, but they were all light weight aluminium.
Just be sure to ground them and clamp them tightly to your mounting pole. It is a real joy to watch these channels now at no monthy expense. (P S) I have tried the motor driven part and found four more channels so I am up to nearly 60 channels.

product_title: Radio Alarm Clock for the Home- Digital, Modern LED Display. Electric Wall Plug With Battery Backup. Adults, Teens & Kids of All Ages. 1-16 Volume Range: Extra Loud for Heavy Sleepers, Soothing Levels for More Natural Wake Up. Big Sleep Button
review_body:
The clock has a number of advantages, but please note that the instructions specify to remove the batteries if you use the power adapter. In other words, if you were expecting a clock that normally used wall power but would keep time during a long power outage, this isn't the one you want, at least if you follow the directions. In the clock's favor, however, I noticed that the clock kept the time for a couple of seconds after unplugging it, so it looks like a momentary power glitch wouldn't bother it.

Also, I found it difficult to program the clock without the instructions in front of me.

On the positive side, I liked the electronic tuning and the fact that the clock display doesn't glow during the night. (Better for sleeping, according to one sleep expert I recently heard.)

product_title: Sharper Image Sound Soother White Noise Machine
review_body:
I was dealing with bad insomnia for the past few months, and my efforts to wake earlier (so I'd be tired enough to sleep earlier) were not helped by me constantly sleeping through my alarm. I was looking for a clock with a few specific functions: 1. It had to have a gradual wake feature, as the shock from normal alarm clocks always left me groggy in the morning, 2. It had to be able to use some kind of nature sound as the alarm, simply because it's more pleasant to wake up to those than it is to a beep, and 3. It had to be lit with cool blue LED lights, because this is less jarring to look at at night, and the blue is more soothing to look at than the normal red LEDs, which just look ugly to me.

It was really impressed with how many sounds there were on the clock (20), I didn't expect it to have that many. I've never heard the earlier model so I can't comment if the clarity was better with those, but the sounds are fine to use as an alarm. They are definitely not clear enough to use as a sound machine or sound soother; there is a lot of noise, like the sounds were recorded through a cheap microphone, or possibly the speakers are cheap. But since I did not buy the alarm clock to listen to, and just use it as an alarm, it personally did not matter to me.

Some of the sounds are also pretty clear. I like to use the wind chimes sound as my alarm, since it's a gentle way to wake up, and the sound clarity is better than some of the other sounds like the ocean or the brook.

It's very easy and straightforward to navigate the clock menus and set up the alarm. You can also program 2 alarms, which is a nice bonus! And you can set each alarm to go off everyday, every weekday, or every weekend day. I was impressed with how many features the clock was programmed with.

My insomnia is also a lot better now, and this clock looks great on my blue desk! It had an unobtrusive yet slick and modern design, and the numbers have 3 levels of brightness that are all aesthetically pleasing. There is also a daylight savings time button on the back of the clock, so you can adjust that with the flick of a finger instead of programming it through the clock buttons manually.

I am happy with my purchase and glad I bought it despite the negative reviews. :) There really wasn't any other alarm clock on Amazon that fit my criteria, and if they did they cost over $100 and there was no way I was paying that much for an alarm clock, so I'm relieved that the one clock that is reasonably priced turned out to be better than what I had been expecting.

product_title: ART USB Phono Plus
review_body:
I read almost all the reviews and agree with most of what's said. But I have a warning. First, my story. I bought this gadget to listen to and record the old albums I last heard back in the 80's. So I dug out my old Sony PS-X600 turntable (high end in its day), made all the connections to my home theater system, cued up \\"Innervision\\" (by Stevie Wonder), and let rip. AWFUL! Sound quality was terrible!

I started going through everything trying to find the problem. After all, I was an audiophile back in the day and I should have the know-how to troubleshoot this mess. Well, I found it. The moving magnet style M97 Shure cartridge, which was high end in its day, was shot. I replaced it with a new one (got a great deal here on Amazon), and then WOW I got blown away by Stevie singing \\"Superstition.\\" Then I cranked up Pat Benatar, then Spyro Gyra then Chicago Transit Authority. All sounded fantabulous!

For all you baby boomers out there, the warning is this -- just because your turntable spins the record it still might need a new cartridge or a new stylus. The sensitive internal stylus parts degrade and deteriorate over time even if you never use the turntable. So if you buy this Art Preamp and the sound quality sucks, check your cartridge, people!

product_title: Nature's Way Extra Virgin Organic Coconut Oil, 32-Ounce
review_body: I've used serveral different brands for coconut oil and this brand is my favorite for several reasons. 1. Packaging...comes in a user friendly heavy duty plastic tub which makes it easy to store and scoop and the opening is perfect for measuring spoons or regular spoons and mini spatulas to get the very last bit. 2. Texture.....much creamier texture than most brands and melts smoother when warmed up. 3. Taste...I know a lot of cooks and chefs prefer a more neutral flavor but I personally love the more pronounced smell and hint of coconut. 4. Versatility...with the everyday user in mind I love to use this oil for popcorn, sauteing veggies or roasting as well as using as a scalp and hair treatment and makes for a wonderfully gentle makeup remover esp for the hard to budge waterproof mascara...be sure to rinse away from eyes very well tho...can block the delicate pores! I have also used this stuff to remove adhesive from my hands mixed up with a shake or two of salt!

review_body:
This is the protein bar for me! I love having one after a run. It is chewy, with a little gooey, and a great crunch factor - probably because there are real nuts all up in there. It is delicious - more like a candy bar than a protein bar. There's no aftertaste, no weird sour milk taste that I find so often in other protein bars, no chalkiness, no grittiness, and it's got some moistness even.

Sure there are bars out there with slightly better numbers, but, at 13.6 calories per gram of protein, this one is in the top because when it comes to taste and texture - it doesn't get any better.

I've only tried two of this brand, the Almond Fudge Brownie and a cookie flavored one, the cookie one was pretty good, too, but not as good as this one.

I personally do not like most of the emergen-c flavors that people like, but I kept drinking it, knowing all the benefits. Then, I finally found a taste I love and can drink with pleasure...this one. I guess this stuff is very taste specific...just find the flavor that suits your palette best and drink up! ;-)

For those of you that might not know much about this product, here are a few facts:
1. It contains bio-available forms of certain vitamins and minerals (for instance, C is included in zinc ascorbate and chromium ascobate forms)
2. It does NOT contain aspartame or sucralose las in Airbourne; instead, it uses stevia.
3. It contains no artificial colors, flavors, or preservatives.
4. It contains 1000IU of vitmain D3 without including a potentially dangerous level of vitamin A palimate (also in Airbourn)

Support seems better than ankle sleeves with an open heel though, however, the top part of this ankle sleeve digs into the top of my ankle bone, where it creases when I dorsi-flex my ankle. product_title: Omron Body Composition Monitor with Scale - 7 Fitness Indicators & 90-Day Memory
review_body:
I was very excited to purchase the Omron Full Body Comp Scale. It appeared to be state of the art and with its 4 point of contact I was hoping for extremely, or more accurate body fat numbers. In 24 hour spans there were BODY FAT swings of 4% or more. I know from being involved in fitness that these types of swings are highly improbable, some would say impossible.

The scale also has an \\"Age\\" feature, which uses an algorithm that produces your \\"Body Age\\". As someone who trains 5 days a week and engages in a very active lifestyle my \\"Age\\" was consistently 80 years old!

I am starting to believe that our technology just is not yet available to offer a cost effective methodology of accurately measuring body fat. I have used Omron before and they get high grades in construction and durability. My hope was for a device that if not record accurate BODY FAT measurements at least record consistent records so you could gauge if you were moving in the right direction. Unfortunately that does not seem to be the case.

So there is frustration in trying to gauge my actual fitness levels using this scale - though it does appear to run a true and accurate body weight. Additionally, while the body age feature was an attractive lure for motivating me to get back to High School fitness level it would appear to have the opposite effect and rather than getting fitted for my High School Letterman Jacket had me thinking of getting fitted for dentures and depends!

product_title: Bort KubiTal Padded Elbow Bursitis & Tendonitis Sleeve
review_headline: Cubital Tunnel Syndrome Sufferers Will Like This Sleeve
review_body: I am in search of the ideal elbow sleeve to relieve the pain of cubital tunnel syndrome. When the sleeves provided by my physical therapist came up short when it came to pain relief, I decided to try this sleeve. So, here goes with what I like about this sleeve: - It is sturdy. - Generous gel padding helps protect the ulnar nerve from being aggravated and causing the pain. - Sleeve fits snugly and doesn't move around on the elbow. - Sleeve fabric quickly adjusts its fit to your arm instead of forcing your arm to adjust to it. - Offered in a nice, blue color along with beige. Now for the nits to pick: - It is pricey (but what cost is too much if it does the job well?) - Make sure you select the right size! The way Bort Medical sleeves, braces, and other devices are listed in Amazon does not include a size selection from within one web page. You have sift through all of the Bort Medical items available on Amazon (17 pages of information according to my searches) to find the product you want with the size indicated in its Amazon listing title. - Develops a funky smell after one day of use. It can be hand washed, but washing it once a day and letting it air dry isn't convenient.

product_title: California Baby Hair De-tangler Spray - Calming, 8.5 Ounce
review_headline: This did help add shine and definition to my baby's hair when it was short, but it doesn't help de-tangle.
review_body:
I purchased this product last spring to help de-tangle my toddler's hair. Back then, she was only 14 months old and still had short (but curly) hair. Even then, this didn't really help us comb out the tangles in her hair. It DID help define her curls once her hair was already combed, plus it did add shine - which was nice. I followed the directions on the bottle and used this when her hair was still wet. I also tried using a conditioner first and also tried using this when her hair was dry. It still didn't help de-tangle.

Now that she's 22 months old, she has hair that goes almost down to her shoulders when it's wet. Her hair is fine and she has lots of tight Little Orphan Annie curls. With her hair now being longer, this stuff no longer does anything for it at all. In fact, I'd say that it even dries her hair out. After using this, her hair turns into a frizzy mess in a matter of hours. Her hair seriously looks better WITHOUT this product in it.

I do love that the ingredients are safe and this stuff also smells fabulous. The bottle lasts a long time. I really do wish it would work. However, I've now switched over to using California Baby Calendula Conditioner in her hair to help tame it - and that does work wonderfully - but I'm still hoping to find a natural de-tangler that actually does what it's supposed to do.

* (I use Earth Mama Angel Baby or California Baby shampoos on my baby. I use either Healthy Times or California Baby conditioner. I have very soft water and only wash my baby's hair a couple times per week. The only reason I mention this is to point out that my baby's hair care routine isn't overly harsh, so it shouldn't be making this product ineffective.)

product_title: Bachelorette Cheers Bitches Party Banner
review_headline: Surprise: No Returns Accepted, Item is Shorter and Smaller than Anticipated
review_body:
The package was lost in my building by the manager and was not found until after my event was over. I requested to return the item because it was no longer needed, however Vert Delivery would not take the unused, unopened item back. They said:

"Due the personal nature of the products we sell, ALL SALES ARE FINAL. Â We are unable to return or exchange purchased toys and/or novelty products. This is for the health, safety and peace of mind of our customers.

Once these items leave our warehouse, they are considered used, and therefore cannot be returned."

I had no idea their return policy differed from Amazon's. So since I am now stuck with this banner, I opened the package and found that it is much shorter and the letters are much smaller than anticipated. I would not recommend purchasing this item.

product_title: Body Fortress Super Advanced Whey Protein, 1.95 lb. (885 g)
review_body:
I can think of several better brands then the Body Fortress brand (EAS, BSN, MuscleTech etc...) but Body Fortress is probably the best bet if you're on a budget and can't afford the high price tags of the bigger brands that are out there. Cookies N Cream is easily the best flavor for this particular brand, which isn't saying much because the rest of the flavors a completely horrid. However, to this flavors credit, it does taste a little bit like the flavor that's labeled on the container.

Despite what many people might think because of its price tag, Body Fortress is a high quality protein source and the fact that its Whey products are 52-60 grams of protein every two scoops is really impressive. The only problem that has plagued this product, is once again, the taste. This is really the only flavor from their Whey Protein Powder line that is actually somewhat easy to chug down, because the regular Chocolate, Strawberry, Vanilla and the awful Chocolate and Peanut Butter are not.

So overall, this is the only flavor that gets a passing grade from me.

review_headline: Not so nice for sensitive skin!
review_body: Thought that I was making the right choice by buying these diapers...wrong idea. My baby's skin broke out with a reddened groin/buttocks area within 3 days of usage. I knew that these diapers were the culprit because I had not made any other changes to his natural care routine (organic foods, creams, lotions, etc). Narrowing it down to these \\"free and clear\\" diapers made me trash the rest of the unused portion. Will not make that mistake again! The area of the diaper that came in contact with my baby's lower abdomen skin broke out into a bit of a rash. Love Seventh Generation's dish liquid and laundry detergent but will never venture out to get any diapers by this brand. Very disappointed considering that this company prides themselves on being natural and safe. I will stay on the safe side and continue buying Huggie's Naturals and Kroger's chlorine free diapers..both have never upset my precious baby's sensitive skin!

product_title: DC Brands International Dickens Energy Cider, 16-Ounce Cans (Pack of 24)
review_body: I have been a fan of this drink ever since i was given a can at a motorcross in 2003 event in murray ky,i use to have to drive 40+ miles to get it so i usually bought two cases a month,in 04 i moved to galveston island texas and could not find the drink there,after a web search and much pleading i started buying direct,the shipping was high but i did not care,after about 1 1/2 years i was directed to go to Amazon to order.my first order did arrive with a coulple of empty cans due to poor packing but again i did not care,then came the day i ordered and was told the item was on backorder.not a problem as i had some reserve stock but i did quit sharing with others at the bar i managed.thinking i would get the chance to order soon but to my sadness i learned that DC brands in its infinate wisdom had discontinued the product.i contacted DC brands and was told this was true,asking if anyone had any unsold product i was told one dist. had a pallet but would not break it for case sale.as i was trying to figure out where i could come up with the money to buy a whole pallet and where i would store it if i did,the rep from DC brands e-mailed me saying the pallet had been returned and would break it for case sale.i bought all i could manage to afford (10 cases) now i see Amazon has some so i will be buying what i can get here.I can't believe that DC brands discontinued this product.how dumb is that. Dickens Cider is the best drink i have ever found if served ice cold as it recomends,i was raised drinking \\"hard cider\\" and it reminds me exactly of that.no after taste and no jitters if you don't drink more than 2 cans in 24 hours.as a club manager i put in 12-16 hr days at times,all my staff knew that at 11pm i would be comming behind the bar to get my can for the night,this allowed me to run the club till 2 am,close,oversee restocking and close out.by the time i got home at around 4 am i was able to shower and get a good nights rest.WHY WOULD DC BRANDS STOP OFFERING THIS WONDERDRINK?

product_title: Nellie's All Natural Laundry Nuggets (30 Pre-Measured Packets)
review_body:
I love Nellie's Laundry Nuggets! Several members in our family have sensitive skin and Nellie's is okay for all of us. It works well on toddler clothes as well. Surprisingly so! I've put things in the washer thinking that with liquid soap I would always pre-treat a stain. Not needed so far - all our clothes come out clean and stain free.

One user commented on the nuggets being hard. That is true for me as well. I put a nut cracker in the box of nuggets and just crunch up each nugget before I use it. It may not be a problem for machines where you add soap with the clothes. I use a front loader with a dispenser and we have had hardened chunks that did not completely dissolve. I'm able to crunch the nuggets with the nutcracker and it doesn't burst the outer pack. Just a few squeezes and the hardened nuggets are ready to use and dissolve easily with nothing leftover.

product_title: Nature Made Fish Oil, 300 mg OMEGA-3, 250-Count
review_body: The Nature Made Fish Oil 1000mg Liquid Softgels, 250-count is a good value. It is 1000mg with 300mg of Omega 3. 2 soft gels taken with a meal provide the recommended daily amount of 600mg of Omega-3 - including 500mg of EPA and DHA. The recommended daily serving is the equivalent of 2 servings of fatty fish. There is no color added, no artificial flavors or preservatives and is gluten free. Ingredients included however are gelatin, glycerin, water and tocopherol (vitamin E). There is a note that it contains fish (anchovy and sardine) as well as soy. The fish country of origin is Peru but it claims to be manufactured and tested in the USA.The expiration date on the bottle I received is 3 years out and expires January 2018. They are easy to take and have no after taste. Too soon to know if it produces results or not, but I can update my review in 6 months when I know for sure whether or not they are effective.

product_title: Nutribiotic Gse Capsules Plus, 125 Mg, 90 Count
review_body:
PLEASE do not ingest this stuff! Go ahead and use it topically or in your laundry or whatever, but for the love of Pete, don't take it orally. If you think that this is a "natural" disinfectant or anti-fungal, you are wrong. Unfortunately grapefruit seeds do not have natural antimicrobial properties.

The FDA and DEA have issued MANY warnings to the manufacturers of "Citricidal" in the last few years because these products are heavily contaminated with benzalkonium chloride. What exactly is this chemical? Well you may already know it as HAND SANITIZER.

I can't speak for the purity of liquid extracts, but the powders are most heavily contaminated. Please read the industry trade article below:

http://www.nutraingredients-usa.com/Suppliers2/Expert-dismisses-grapefruit-seed-extract-false-positive-explanation

TL;DR - one of the manufacturers stated that Citricidal is the same molecular weight as BZK, giving a false positive test result. This is total BS, as explained by one of the nation's top chemists, director of Flora Labs, James Neal-Kababick. This guy is a consumer advocacy crusader who does this for a living:

http://www.nbcnews.com/id/19230748/ns/health-health_care/t/bogus-ingredients-put-consumers-health-risk/#.VWzlIM5vb0c

They've even found TRICLOSAN in these powders...that's the disinfectant in your anti-bacterial soaps. So PLEASE do not consume this, and understand the only reason it kills your athlete's foot or yeast infection is because it has artificial sanitizers illegally and unethically added to it.

review_body:

This post keeps the chamber loading hinge pin from getting misaligned. I had to do some major rebuilding in order to get it to work again.
After this repair, it continued to function reasonably well for an additional 5 months. However, the spoon injection proximity switch failed a couple of weeks ago. So it goes to the spare parts bin.
We made about 50 cartons of cigs before this injector failed. So at 11 cents per pack it may still be a reasonable price price/pack. But there must be something more reliable.

product_title: Now Foods Sunflower Lecithin Non GMO, 1200mg, Soft-gels, 200-Count
review_headline: Good quality supplement, no side effects
review_body:
I can't claim that taking the recommended 3 softgels daily (3.6g) was responsible for any measurable memory improvement, weight loss or lower cholesterol but I can say that doing so didn't hurt at all. While the benefits of Lecithin are being debated and research is ongoing, I am happy with NOW's product because it has no 'bad' ingredients such as sugar, corn starch, salt, yeast, wheat, gluten, corn, milk, egg, shellfish or preservatives. NOW also states that their product is GMO-free - a good thing.

Given the suggested serving size of 3 softgels, the 400 quantity should last for about 4 months if taken as suggested. The gels are easy to swallow and, since this Lecithin is extracted from soybeans, there is no aftertaste and I haven't experienced any digestive trouble.

I am unaware of any negatives other than the lack of consensus on Lecithin's actual effectiveness but for a 'food supplement', not a miracle cure, this is a good product.

product_title: EZ Tactile Long Ring Timer
review_body:
I fly remote control planes and needed a timer I could hear when measuring flying times and battery discharge. My wife has one of these in the kitchen and loves it so much she won't let me touch it. The alternative was to purchase my own. Since I am hard of hearing, the long, loud ring on this timer is just perfect. All those digital timers with their little beep beep beeps were out of the question.

This timer fits my needs perfectly. Easy to read, easy to set, and easy to hear. The only negative is that it is one minute off. For example, you must set it for one minute longer than the time you want to measure. This is not a problem for me. Maybe it's just in my timer. My wife's is accurate. I would definitely recommend this timer to anyone. You don't have tobe a rocket scientist to operate it. Price is right too.

B.W. in Savannah Ga.

product_title: NorthShore Premium, 17 x 24, 8 oz., Blue Disposable Underpads (Chux), Small, Pack/25
review_headline: a must for a new baby
review_body:
Small chux pads are a must for a baby. We use them on top of the changing pad so we don't have to wash the cover every time there is an accident. We also carry them in the diaper bag so any couch (or lap) can be turned into a changing pad.

The second time around, I ordered similar pads from another seller because I assumed they'd be the same and those were a little cheaper. Turns out, they are a little different. We like this brand better because it's softer and seems a little more absorbent. Not a huge difference though, sort of like a preference in paper towels - at the end they all do the job.

Update: Now that our little one is a year old, we don't go through these pads quite as fast. They are still a must on our changing table. Our baby is very squirmy and sometimes it's hard to keep all the mess inside the diaper. If it wasn't for these pads, we'd have to have several changing pad covers and wash they much more frequently.

product_title: Telemergency ClearVoice 2000 Emergency Telephone with Wireless Pendant
review_headline: So far, seems to be working
review_body: We bought this for my wife's 88 year old aunt who lives alone. She doesn't want to pay (or let us pay) the monthly fees for an emergency call service, so we're trying this. Be forewarned: programming is complex, so it helps to have some geeky experience, and even at that it takes a good twenty minutes or more of patient work. But once programmed, it does dial numbers in sequence, awaiting a touch tone response before continuting to dial at one minute intervals. We put 911 in the fifth slot. In testing, I tried to hang up just as \\"9\\" showed on the display. But 911 called back a few seconds later. Even though I said it was just a test, a cop shows up five minutes later \\"to make sure nobody is holding a gun to my head.\\" Standard procedure. Yikes. Anyway, it seems to work.

product_title: Gurin GO-410 Finger Pulse Oximeter
review_headline: Always nice having one of these in the house!
review_body:
What a very good thing to have in your house in case there is ever an emergency, you can tell a lot just from the pulse. Some need to constantly be aware of their pulse, so having one at home is useful! Gurin sent me their Finger Pulse Oximeter for testing purposes and for my honest review and at 42 years of age and a person with a heart murmur and inverted T Waves, I feel much better knowing i have the little machine in case thereâ€™s an emergency and 911 needs to know the persons pulse, i can take it.
This little device measures quickly and accurately pulse rate and SpO2 blood oxygen saturation of arterial hemoglobin levels.
It is seriously so easy to get your reading. First, take everything out of the box and insert the batteries that come included in the box.
Then, stick your finger into it and make sure the bottom of your finger is touching the sensor inside the Oximeter.

product_title: Babyganics Foaming Dish and Bottle Soap, 16oz Pump Bottle (Pack of 3)
review_headline: Foam Makes It Easy To Use. Rinses Off Quickly With No Residue.
review_body:
We have this dish soap in both the citrus scent and unscented varieties. I prefer the unscented kind. My sister, on the other hand, prefers the citrus scent. So I guess your preference will depend on if you like a scent to make things smell fresh or if you'd rather have less "soapy" smell. There is no residue left on the dishes after I use this unscented soap, and I love not having them smell like soap or fragrance of any kind.

As for use, my sister and I are both loving the product. When I first put it in the kitchen, my sister kept making unsolicited comments about how much she loved it, so that makes it a winner in this household. No babies here, but we like to use products made for babies because we are sensitive to harsher ingredients. I especially love the foaminess of this soap. It's so easy to use just a little bit for quick cleanup of a dish or two, and it rinses clean without having to use scalding hot water. Definitely recommended.

product_title: Fitbit One Wireless Activity Plus Sleep Tracker
review_headline: data held hostage; sporadically counts severely excessive flights of stairs
review_body:
three issues:

(1) your raw data is locked into the fitbit online service unless you pay $50/year for the premium service to unlock it. in terms of owning the data about yourself this is a really unfriendly policy.

(2) could just be my device, but i've found that after it has been in use for 5 days+ without a full reset it will start to claim that i've climbed a flight of stairs every ~100 steps even on level ground. this causes me to end up with 100+ flights in a day which is really annoying because you can't remove just the stairs from your activities.

after much searching i learned how to reset the device and now when i charge it i deliberately reset it (you plug it into the USB charger and hold the button for ~10s and it will power off, then you release and press the button again to power it on). when i reset it like this i also notice that it also seems to recalibrate its battery charge indication, and is frequently more empty than it was showing prior to the reset.

in case it helps fitbit folks mine claims to have FITBIT 6.60 when it powers up.

(3) (2014-07-12 edit) in the span of 3 days fitbit awarded me the 1000 floors badge and the 2000 floors badge, and the above bug (2) didn't even occur during this period: nothing on my tracker indicates i climbed 1000 floors.

product_title: Fitbit One Wireless Activity Plus Sleep Tracker
review_headline: So far so good but make sure you secure it well
review_body:
A friend's company were offering it's use as a wellness program and it caught my interest. I researched and purchased from Amazon.com

Pro:
Small
Light
Tracks sleep pattern, stairs, distance walked, calories burned
Nice integration with web or android apps, sends encouraging emails when goals are met or close to be attained
syncs to my Galaxy SIII via Bluetooth and to my PC app via supplied Bluetooth micro dongle
Battery lasts 5 days
easy to plug in USB charger design

Cons:

Have to remove it from the silicone case and insert into a pouch on a Velcro attached wrist strap -- not hard to do but a bit of a pain to have to remember every night (not an issue if you don't care about tacking your sleep)

The Clip while seemingly well made and securely attached to articles of clothing, can eventually detach based on where it is attached: My story: Just a quick note to ensure you know where your fitbit is at any given time -- Mine was hooked to the inside of my left pants pocket facing in. It seemed like a secure fitting clip but somehow, (maybe the getting in and out of my car), it shimmied loose and went AWOL..

Luckily, based on the last time it synced and knowing where I generally was at that time, I was able to zero in on where it might have detached and amazingly lucky for me I called the Office Depot that I had been perusing around that time and they actually found it and put it aside for me!! VERY LUCKY!

I have since engaged my trusty Brother label maker and affixed my cell # to the back of the device and inside the clip to hopefully help it find it's way home should it ever happen again...

If it was lost, for me, I was not going to spend another $90 unless there is a better designed belt clip...

Over all a great tool to keep track of your fitness and to get an idea of your sleep pattern.

product_title: EatSmart Products Precision Getfit Digital Body Fat Scale with Auto Recognition Technology
review_headline: Slick Design, Accurate Weight Measurement, but Body Fat % Off
review_body:
There are hundreds of reviews on Amazon about this scale, and they are overwhelmingly positive, which is why I chose this particular brand and model. After two weeks of use, here is my summary:

Design: Perfect! Sleek, modern, light weight, and super thin. Now I just need to by a modern loft downtown to put this thing in! Did Apple design this scale?

Weight Measurement: Perfectly accurate and delivers a very quick reading, less than three seconds. What more could I ask for?

Body Fat Measurement: Relatively accurate, but needed to be calibrated by adjusting the height of the individual. This was a bit of a disappointment. After programming the unit for myself and the wife, my body fat reading was at least 10% off, reading much less than my actual body fat. Unfortunately, I knew what my body fat % was, so I couldn't be blissfully ignorant and content with the 14% reading, which is optimal health. My wife, on the other hand, was off about 5% in the other direction. In the time it took for the scale to be delivered, she got 5% fatter!! WTF? I emailed EatSmart, and they replied within hours, giving me instructions to change our heights in user program. This will either slow down or speed up the electrical signal to align the measurement with what we knew our actual body fat percentages are. From here on out the scale will be calibrated correctly and the measurements accurate. So far so good, over the two week period or percentages have remained constant, as expected.

Other Measurements: Water, Bone, & Muscle. These are just bonus numbers to me, all I am really concerned with is weight and body fat. The numbers seem to fall in line with what I would expect from the charts listed in the user manual, but I really don't pay too much attention to them.

Overall: After the adjustment to the body fat settings, I am happy with the scale, and I love the step on technology; no buttons to push or taps needed. I deducted one star for the body fat issue, otherwise this would be a solid five star scale.

product_title: USA SELLER _ToysHeart Bordeaux by [ CoolMaleSexToy ]
review_body:
I was initially pleased by the quality and texture of the toy, not to mention the suction is an absolute plus compared to others. However, cleaning it proves to be difficult, as the only way it will dry is if you manually reverse it and hand-dry with a towel. It will not air-dry, which is important in maintaining longevity and preventing other things from accumulating (think of hair/fuzz from a towel, etc). I left it hanging upside down in an open, airy room for a full day and it was still damp. Not good.

That minor detail aside, however, the real dilemma is the way the inner lining is formed. The outside is a thick pink mold, whereas the inside is a very thin sleeve bound along the edge of the sleeve itself. Within a week of very minimal use, the inner sleeve started to detach from the wall of the outer mold. Now there is a gap between the two layers that lets water inside (when cleaning) and is impossible to dry or clean out. It also slides and detracts from the experience of using the sleeve. The more it is used, the more it detaches. If I really wanted to, I could just slide my finger to the bottom between the layers and detach it entirely and remove it. Unfortunately it is this inner sleeve that provides the texture so that is a major issue.

The fragile state is worrisome, as I cannot get much use out of the toy since purchasing it originally. It took little use to degrade to its current state, though I'm sure it is just a fluke in my particular unit's molding. Others seem to enjoy their sleeves, so I would be hopeful that anyone that purchases it has a better experience than me.

product_title: Douglas LaboratoriesÂ® - B-Complex w/ Metafolin - Supports Blood Cells, Hormones, and Nervous System* - 60 Capsules
review_headline: contains a supplement derived from pig
review_body: Says vegi caps but that is misleading. Only the capsule is vegan. This supplement contains intrinsic factor derived from pigs (porcine). Intrinsic factor is produced by the stomach and is essential to the assimilation of B12. Some people need intrinsic factor supplement because they no longer produce intrinsic factor in sufficient quantities to assimilate B12. Yet I fail to understand why a company would bother to create and advertize a vegi cap when contents are derived directly from animal. On the positive side, the B vitamins are phosphates or methyls -- no oxides. That is very good and, truthfully, very hard to find. Despite being a vegan, I'm going to finish these vitamins because I'm not a total fanatic. But they get one star for misleading description. How many people even know what porcine is? I knew but missed the fine print. So, I recommend these B vitamins if you really need intrinsic factor with your B12.

review_body: There are some other reviewers who have noted that the newborn diapers aren't so great. I have to agree. The Huggies worked great but were so expensive that we decided to go back to the 7th Gen when our baby got big enough for the size 1 diapers. Now he's on to size 4 and we've had no complaints. The only \\"leaks\\" we've had were from the crazy blowouts that I don't think any diaper could have contained. So, to sum it up, if you're reading this review then you obviously care about things like chlorine free diapers, environmental impact, etc and if you care about those things then you certainly can't go wrong with these 7th gen diapers as long as you stay away from the Newborn size.

product_title: Nexcare 524560 Basal Digital Thermometer
review_headline: Battery Died in less than 30 days
review_body:
I really liked this thermometer until the battery died during my first cycle of charting. I brought this product new on Amazon and it died after using it less than 25 times. I thought at first it had broken somehow when I had it in my luggage (travel for work), but I just swapped out the battery from a fever thermometer I've had for about 5 years (battery still going strong!) and then my Nexcare thermometer worked again.

I missed about 3 days of charting in my luteal phase--I am not happy about that because I am tracking with FertilityFriend.com and I want to be able to compare my charts over time.

product_title: Withings WS-50 Smart Body Analyzer
review_body:
I spent 1 year thinking about this scale: "Is it acurate? Do I really need the wi-fi? Is it worth the money?"
And I came to the following conclusion:
- It's the most beautifull scale I've ever seen
- The weight it's super accurate - It measures till 0.01kg - not that I need it, but it's good to have that precision.
- It's the most simple thing to use in the whole world - You just step on it, and it reads your weight, body fat %, and BPM. And at the end it recognizes you and sends the data to your account. Currently 5 people use my scale and the scale works perfectly.
- The Wi-Fi, THE WIFI - This is the thing that makes it all worth it. The ease! The simplicity. This saves you so much work. At first it may seem useless, but when you use it... I fell so good seeing my progression from this last 3 months (when I bought the scale).
I can see my everyday weight from this last 3 months; and because I track my calories too, I can make a correlation and figure out what is working with me and what is not.
- I dont really need the BPM but it's nice too see mine slowing down as I keep doing cardio and geting used to it.
- The Health Mate Website is super clean, and shows you everything you need to see with precision and beauty.

I absolutely recommend it to EVERYBODY. It could be a bit cheaper, but the scale is great and a good investment. It improves your life quality easily.

product_title: Depend For Men Incontinence Guards, Maximum Absorbency 52 ea
review_headline: This is a great product that just work right out of the package. They are absorbent and do not show when worn correctly.
review_body:
This review is for:
Depend Guards for Men, Maximum Absorbency...

We bought these for my father, who is 83. He has been having a bit of trouble with incontinence at night while sleeping. These Depend Guards for Men are just what the doctor ordered. Literally, the doctor said he should get these. Because he's embarrassed about his problem, we had to get them for him and show him how to use them.

These are a thick, absorbent product that fits men well. The guards are shaped like underwear and have an adhesive strip that holds them in place in your underwear. They stay put well and are absorbent enough to capture and hold almost any accident, day or night. The package contains 52 guards for protection day and night. They are not noticeable when worn in the underwear. They work in boxer-briefs and briefs. They do not work well in standard boxer underwear.

This is a great product that just work right out of the package. They are absorbent and do not show when worn correctly.

**I purchased this product at full price for personal use.

product_title: Herbalife Formula 1 Nutritional Shake Mix
review_body: I got 2 packages of herbalife formula 1 when I started a weight loss challenge, french vanilla, and cookies n cream. The "cookies" in cookies n cream were gross, and they all sunk to the bottom of my cup. Both mixes were clumpy unless mixed in a blender. I had 2 shakes a day with protein-rich snacks, a nutritious dinner, drank lots of water, exercised, and cut out sweets. I lost a grand total of 1.5 pounds. I was also in a very foul mood the whole time I was doing this challenge despite eating better and exercising. Come to find out, herbalife shakes are made out of soy protein, and soy disrupts your hormones. A disruption in hormones for me meant I was sad, very irritable, and tired. I wish I would have done some research on soy before I made it such a big part of my diet. I will not be purchasing any herbalife products again and certainly don't recommend it.

product_title: 100 Grams (3.53 Oz) Phosphatidyl Serine Bulk Powder
review_headline: More detailed product specifications would be useful
review_body: This is a decent value, however buyers should be aware that the product is only 20% by weight of phosphatidyl serine (PS). I believe that the seller should clearly state this. (This product is derived from soy beans, and the remaining 80% consists of other phospholipids such as phosphatidyl choline.) (NOTE: 20% strength is typical for PS powder; other commonly available strengths are 50%, and 99%; most PS supplements in capsule form use a 20% strength powder). What this means is that for each 500 mg of powder, you are getting 100 mg of PS. Thus 100 grams of this PS powder gives you 20 grams of actual PS, which is equivalent to a bottle of 200 capsules each containing 100 mg PS. With this powder, you are paying ($35.55/200) = $0.18 per 100 mg of PS. For comparison, the best value bottle of PS I could find on iherb (Doctor's Best, Best Phosphatidyl Serine, 100 mg, 120 Veggie Caps, $31.98) worked out at around $0.26 per 100 mg serving. So with this powder, you ARE saving money (18 cents versus 26 cents per 100 mg serve). There are other advantages to powder over capsules/ softgels. Powders can be sprinkled on foods or blended into smoothies. I like to blend my PS powder in my whey protein drink for example. Regarding storage, I tip the entire pack of powder into a plastic tub with an airtight lid, and store it in the fridge. If you keep it chilled, it's possible to take a spoon of the powder and sprinkle it into e.g., a smoothie without the powder sticking to the spoon.

product_title: Magic Wand Massager
review_headline: THIS THING IS INCREDIBLE...but it's a little rough with frequent use.
review_body: When you purchase the Hitachi, you've got to know what you're getting. You're not getting one of those novelty vibrators that'll work for about 100 uses (six months at best) and then putter out or otherwise breakdown. You're also not getting a regular vibrator, with service vibrations simply do the trick. The Hitachi is incredibly powerful, packing up to 6000 rpm on the high setting, its reputation is very good and it will last in all likelihood a large portion of your sexual life. We're talking years, and decades if you care for it well. In addition, the vibrations that the Hitachi provides are not only powerful, but penetrating and deep. It woke up parts of me that I didn't know were there. It's funny because I thought that the sheer vibrating power of the Hitachi would make me less sensitive and stop me from enjoying my partner as much. Wrong. If anything, it was a sexual aid and made me more sensitive and responsive to my partner, and even other vibrators. I've had my Hitachi for 4 months, and at the beginning I didn't like it as well because it \\"worked\\" so quickly that there was no build up. But after spending a few months with it, it's hands down my favorite toy. Also, amazon's pricing is a steal for what you're getting; other websites or sex shops sell the Hitachi for as much as $50. The one thing to watch out for, and the one downside, is that although it is a machine with incredible, deep vibrations and last power, the material isn't really built for sensitive tissues, and it shows. It's made out of vinyl and with frequent use, even if that's just every couple days or so, it tends to irritate skin. Even so, it's worth the buy and putting a condom over the head or buying an inexpensive attachment (I just ordered the natural contours g-spot attachment) you can make an awesome toy damn near perfect.

product_title: NOW Sports 25Oz 3-In-1 Sports Shaker Bottle
review_headline: Update to "Not a 3 in 1 bottle" review
review_body:
Update: Well it turns out I did receive the wrong bottle. I'm not sure if that's the fault of Amazon or Online Healthy Offers. That being said, I can't praise Online Healthy Offers enough for correcting the mistake. I received an e-mail and a phone call from them and they rushed out the correct bottle and a prepaid return postage sticker for the wrong bottle.

The correct bottle is a little on the large side. However, the powder container can be stored inside the bottle when storing in a cupboard. Supplements/vitamins can be stored in 2 compartment in the purple lid behind the drinking spout. The powder container has a purple lid that then screws onto the bottom of the orange bottle (although it screws on in the opposite direction) This bottle does have markings for 25 ounce. Overall I think it's a good value for the money.

Pros: A true 3 in 1 bottle with 25 ounce markings, good value
Cons: Bottle is a little large

Original Review: I purchased the 3 in 1 Sports Shaker Bottle. That's how it was advertised and that's how it's labeled on the product but that's not what I got. I got a simple shaker bottle. It's just like any other shaker bottle. There's no bottom mounted powder container or vitamin compartment. The bottle is clear not orange as advertised. It's a 25 ounce bottle but the markings only go up to 20. I don't know if I received the wrong product because it doesn't look like their posted picture and isn't a 3 in 1 despite how it's labeled.

review_body: After two years of trying various orthodic insoles to deal with plantar fasciitis pain, I finally went an Orthopedic who put me in one of these. The exact item and brand. I bought another one. Recommendation for wearing: if you sleep on your back your toes will point at the ceiling. This item does a great job of allowing that, as it protects your toes from getting crushed by the covers that are too tight. I wore mine loose and never tightened the side tension straps. My foot ached the first few nights so I would take it off. If you roll around in bed your other foot might get banged up a little bit (think about walking around in one ski boot) which is why I bought a second one. A body pillow between your feet would also work.

product_title: Jillian Michaels Fat Burner 56 Cap
review_body: I have been taking this product for 2 years now (off and on of course, can't over do it) and I managed to lose 30 lbs. in the first 1 1/2 - 2 mos.! Then I slacked off and took maybe 2 pills a day and gradually added back in a little more food. I did quit junk food altogerther. But later (and It took a while to even have craving again,surprisinly) I could add in a tiny snack and be fine. I even in the beginning cut down to 1-2 meals a day... I know that's bad, but honestly I'm so used to it anyway cause I have digestion issues. but later I did start adding in like 3-5 really small meals with no issues and no weight gain. This is THE ONLY PRODUCT of like the 20+ I've tried that actually works! And I also like, unlike most, it doesn't make you jittery or headachy or sick..however, on me I have found if I don't eat at least a couple bites when I take it, it tends to make me feel sick. but mostly, i'm fine. Also, after a couple weeks or so I will start feeling sick so it's my cue to hold off a while. I usually, just to maintain weight, take 2 a day for about a week then take a week off sometimes more. So yeah, definitely watch how much you take for sure...don't go overboard. If you stay in low doses and take breaks, it doesn't make me sick or jittery. In the beginning or every now n then when I need to lose a poumd or two I've gained, I take 4 per day. but go down after few days. I also used the Jillian cleanse first too. and every few months I'll take a few days of it just to get rid of some bloat.. It also works really well...not harsh like a laxative. It's a gentle, maybe frequent, normal like, over a couple days kind of thing. I RECOMMEND JILLIAN FAT BURNER. Oh, but stay away from the red bottle one. I've gotten it in by mistake(?) once and I tried it but it didn't do squat! Not even a mild energy., The white bottle like this one does give you a "just right" energy unless of course you take too much you'll notice your heart rate go up!

product_title: Source Naturals MSM Cream (Pack of 2)
review_headline: Started using this for skin elasticity, will continue to use it for other reasons
review_body:
I came across more than one online person claiming that MSM in soap bars and creams helped their skin rebound after weight loss. As someone who is restarting a diet (after losing 32 pounds and maintaining for more than a year), I want to see if it helps with elasticity issues (anyone who has lost a lot of weight knows what I mean...that stretched out and unappealing look of skin that was expanded with fat and is deflated with fat loss). I'll update if I notice improvements by next year (by which time I hope to be down anothe 32 lbs).

I do find that it has a nice absorbent, creamy, moisturizing quality. I use it on upper arms, belly, bosom and thighs (I use fragrance free sensitive skin moisturizers elsewhere, except feet, where I like to use perfumed lotions). It absorbs fast and leaves skin nicely soft. Not greasy at all. If it gets in the bloodstream and helps joints, all the better. (I will be starting to take the MSM powder for my aging knees and ankle joints which often hurt after exercising).

The scent is light to medium-light (not heavy or annoying) and is herbally (probably from the chamomile extract and rosemary leaf oil.

So far, I'd say this is another quality product from Source Naturals. If it does half of what I hear about it, I'll be happy--but especially if it helps my skin's elasticity and health. The price here with S&S is very, very good and this two-pack is convenient.

I want to thank the other reviewer for posting about the eyebrow hair-regrow use. I'm going to start trying it for that (if my facial skin can tolerate it, as I do have a supersensitive face with dermatitis/eczema issues). I also have thinning eyebrows since perimenopause and then menopause hit. They've definitely gotten a bit \\"bald\\" with age. So, thanks for that tip.

Hope this review helps those considering this product...be well...

UPDATE: The advice for eyebrows is correct. Mine are filling out in the bald spots. :) Now, I also started taking Biotin with this cream, so it may be synergistic, but I had taken Biotin alone in the past and it alone didn't have the effect on eyebrows this combo does. So, whether it's the both combined or principally the MSM cream, dunno. I use a Q-tip to apply. I have had to pluck a bit more. :D

I can't tell yet if it is having any good effect on skin elasticity, but I'm continuing with it. I had to discontinue oral MSM due to an allergic rash reaction, but the cream isn't affecting my sensitive system/skin, so I hope it will have good long-term use effects. I did start using a sage and MSM powder mix on my scalp where my hair is thinning a bit post-menopausally, and I hope that since I can't take it internally, that application pre-shampooing will be efficacious.

Hope this helps...ream, so it may be synergistic, but I had taken Biotin alone in the past and it alone didn't have the effect on eyebrows this combo does. So, whether it's the both combined or principally the MSM cream, dunno. I use a Q-tip to apply. I have had to pluck a bit more. :D I can't tell yet if it is having any good effect on skin elasticity, but I'm continuing with it. I had to discontinue oral MSM due to an allergic rash reaction, but the cream isn't affecting my sensitive system/skin, so I hope it will have good long-term use effects. I did start using a sage and MSM powder mix on my scalp where my hair is thinning a bit post-menopausally, and I hope that since I can't take it internally, that application pre-shampooing will be efficacious. Hope this helps...

The 'Fresh Scent' gives my house a fresh smell and kills about 99.9% of bacteria and viruses. Also, removing the wipes from the container is hassle free and easy to remove, and the lid stays on tight to preserve the wipes from drying out. These wipes are also great for cleaning your office (keyboard, desk, mouse, phone, etc.).

I recommend the Clorox Wipes over the competition since they are more moist and cost effective from a company you can trust.

product_title: Emerald EnergyÂ® Defense: Superior Green Superfood with Premium Hawaiian Spirulina
review_headline: Good way to start the day
review_body: I used to start my day with fruit juices like orange and pineapple. They would give me a quick energy burst (probably because of all the sugar), but would eventually wear off, making me feel tired and run-down by mid-morning. A long time ago, I switched to spirulina supplement drinks in the morning. mixed just with water. They do a better job of getting me started and keeping my energy and focus up all morning. Here's a good way to start your day: Mix this up with water and drink. (For a more creamy drink, you might try rice milk, almond milk, or coconut milk instead of water. But that does add a bit of sugar). Since you have to wait about 20 minutes after drinking and before eating, that's a good time for some exercise, like a brisk walk. After about 20 minutes of exercise, then have breakfast. I should add, if you don't like the normal \\"green\\" taste of most spirulina mixes, you might want to try this one. While each person's taste are a little different, you might find it tastes better than the others.
