product_title: Diva Cup Diva Cup #2 Post Childbirth
review_body:
I have only used it one month, but already like it more than tampons. I was a little worried at first about getting it out based on some of the other reviews, but really had nothing to worry about. The instructions are very detailed, although the cup is easy to use. Really just place and forget for hours! My heavier days I empty it out about every 6 hours but lighter days I can go as long as needed. I try to think ahead to where I'll be in 12 hours and if it's be easy to empty then. If I know I'll be out and might be in a public restroom, I empty then and know I'll be home in at least 12 hours from that point. It does get a little tricky in public restrooms where you're not right next to a sink, but a cup of water works (although you look a little strange going into the stall with a cup of water). For me I try to empty it at home as much as possible because I still squat down for removal and insertion (maybe others have perfected it in more of a standing position). And squatting is also awkward in a public restroom. Also make sure you have a good grip on the cup when empting, it can get slick and you don't want it falling into dirty water....or maybe always flush before empting.
It can be messy when you're emptying it but you wash your hands anyways. I feel much better using this than tampons but I'm the type who has always hated having my period anyway.

product_title: Scivation Xtend Refreshing Blue Raspberry 418-Grams
review_body: Honestly, I've taken a ton of supplements throughout my bulking and cutting phases in bodybuilding. I believe Xtend is definitely one of the best BCAAs to take, but honestly, the taste of blue raspberry is pretty damn bad. It's like I'm drinking splenda (which I hate) with some blue raspberry flavored drops. I never thought I'd ever hate a blue raspberry flavor (I like any candy that's this flavor), but for one, I did... and sadly, it's on Xtend. Get another flavor if you can, but I doubt it'll help (considering their ingredients). This product is as effective for the higher doses you take so it can also get quite expensive, but if you're a hard lifter, this might become a near necessity. Benefits-wise, you can't go wrong. Taste-wise, goddamn, you're going to cringe when it's time to drink up.

product_title: Scivation, Xtend BCAAs

product_title: Applied Nutriceuticals Igf-2, 240 Caps Bottle
review_headline: One of the supps that works
review_body: I have just finished up my 2nd course of IGF-2 along with a few other Applied Neutricuticals products (HGH-Up, Neovar) and I've had serious strength gains in the last 3 months. I have also increased my caloric/protein intake though so it is definitely not a one-bottle solution. Take this review as much for an endorsement of the whole App Nut. stack rather than IGF-2 exclusively. As mentioned it's one of the more expensive supplements but I've had good experience with it. Numbers don't mean much because my regimen is going to be completely different from yours, however: Time Taken: 84 days (with app nut stack) Lifting: 4 days week x 90-120m BF Change: 1-3% drop Weight change: + 17 lbs I'm writing this review primarily to report an unexpected benefit. From the very first night I started taking IGF-2, my sleep cycle was better regulated than ever. I've suffered from an irregular sleep cycle all my life, but once I started dosing 3-4 capsules, say about twice a day, the 2nd being right before bed, I found that I wake up every morning at 6-8am regardless of how much sleep I got. If I'm exhausted I often consciously go back to sleep, but it has somehow given me some sort of internal alarm clock. It's quite noticeable because it will go away if I don't take it for a day, and come back immediately when I start again. It's a major game changer and I plan to consult my doctor to find out if it's safe to take this stuff indefinitely. Maybe it has something to do with insulin control? Who knows.

review_body:

I have used so many products that promised growth of my edges but this actually works. My edges have have filled in quite a bit and my hair everywhere is much, much thicker.

This product does have a strong smell and I use it on my edges once a day and I grease my scalp with it twice a week. It does have a smell to it but do not let this deter you. If you use it at night, the smell does subside by the morning. You have to be sure to massage it into your scalp and you will see results. I have just started on my second tube and I will definitely be purchasing more.

product_title: Zarbee's Naturals Children's Cough Syrup,4 Fl. Ounces
review_headline: Great for kids allergic to CINNAMON, one bottle contains 22 doses
review_body: Zarbee's Naturals children's cough syrup + mucus relief - grape flavor does not have Cinnamon like some of the other brands of natural children's cough syrups, so this is a better option for any kids that are allergic to cinnamon (either face or diaper rash). The only ingredients are: blend of dark honeys, zinc, vitamin C, water, natural flavor, grapefruit seed extract (to preserve freshness), and citric acid. Ivy leaf extract is also added to the Cough Syrup + Mucus Relief version to help thin and loosen mucus. Our stubborn daughter does not resist taking it, so the taste must be pretty good. *Note, that it can NOT be used with children under one year old, since it does contain honey. Children one year to five years old are directed to take 1 teaspoon, and children six year old and older, 2 teaspoons per dose. One 4 fluid ounce bottle contains 22 teaspoons, or 22 doses for a child one to five years old. 11 doses for a child six years or older.

product_title: Alessi Vinegar Balsamic Red
review_body: Having bought various types of vinegars hoping to find the right one but never did until now. My local hyper market sells various brands of balsamic but some have a heft price tag, the more aged typically the more it cost. Honestly have bought some cheap ones but got a glorified bottle of plain vinegar or was un-naturally sweet. Made a pot of my homemade(from scratch)pasta sauce, while it's also been really good 2 tsp of Alessi made it great. Can't believe the taste it gives to a tomatoe based sauce, was eating by the spoonfuls before adding to the pasta. Wanting to experiment some more, I have been wanting to make some roasted red pepper remoulade to jazz up a BLT or Roast Beef sandwhich. This was the key ingredient even more so than the roasted red peppers. The balsamic cut the fatty taste of the mayo(not a fan of may alone except potato/pasta salad)and added an interesting sweetness but not like sugar. Ate couple spoons of that as well. Not to worry I am not a double dipper even in my own house. I think this will wake up a roast beef gravy and who knows what else. Now I know what to buy and can also afford.

product_title: Drive Medical Steel Folding Bedside Commode
review_headline: Drive Bedside Commode is not suitable for adult handicapped
review_body:
This is a very cheaply made product. It is suitable for a child or for a camping trip, but definitely not for a handicapped adult.
The bucket is made of very thin plastic, the insert shoot is too short, and the commode lid is so narrow that it does not even completely cover the bucket lid edge. The armrests are very narrow, which is a problem for a handicapped person who needs to push himself up by leaning on them.
The width between the legs is only 21" (not 22.5" as stated) which makes the commode unstable. We should have ordered another regular Invacare commode but only the bariatric and heavy duty are offered on Amazon. Previously we have been satisfied with Drive medical, and that is why we ordered from them.

product_title: Aquasana Shower Filter
review_headline: filters well, but fragile it is
review_body: We've had this for almost 3 years now. It seems to do pretty well at filtering out chlorine, judging by smell and how my skin/hair feel. It does make a difference in how both feel. I'd love to see actual measurements of chlorine reduction over time. There's two of us, we take a shower each almost everyday (a bit overkill in my mind, sorry mom) and the filter seems to last 3 to 4 months. But remember there's no quantitative analysis going on here. The whole contraption, with the exception the connections, is plastic. Given the mechanical loads it undergoes it's not surprising that it breaks fairly easily. The housing has fractured on ours with no unusual force being encountered. ( Ahhh epoxy... Wasn't I trying to *reduce* my exposure to something or another? Oops. ) Taking apart a used filter reveals a simple case containing what I assume to be activated charcoal, exactly like you may buy for an aquarium filter with a little bit of paper or synthetic mesh I assume is for sediment. Only thing is that if you did buy this much charcoal from a pet store, it would cost about one tenth what a replacement filter cost. All filters must reduce water flow to some degree. This filter does pretty well here, the reduction is minimal. If you're looking to reduce the odor (at least) of chlorine and don't have kids, and don't mind the steep replacement filter costs, and promise not to ever overtighten anything, nor ever to drop, pull, or stare directly into its eyes then this is the filter for you!! Not awful but not recommended.

product_title: Personal Trainer Foodâ„¢ Weight Loss Meal Program: Lunch & Dinner
review_body: I ordered a package that was on sale here through Amazon Local. I ordered the protein package. I am sorely disappointed. I only am enjoying about one out of five of the meals. Many of the chicken cutlets are not cleaned properly of their tendons and grizzle. The spices and/or additives used might make one feel more full yet it often gives me a headache and when I can't eat it because of an odd taste I find that the family dog doesn't want it either. The package did come quickly, in cellophane packages still very frozen yet it is not an easy item to return. I learned that there is only a five day window in which to complain and for me I was still hopeful and sampling the foods during those first five days. I would not recommend this to anyone I cared about. I would only say that it might be better than starving if you are going through an extremely stressful patch in your life. Otherwise the least expensive frozen diet meal like Lean Cuisine in my opinion would be way better quality and when your supermarket has sales would be way cheaper than the Personal Trainer Food. I am writing this long review since this is one of the first Amazon purchases I ever made where I felt the reviews misled me. I really am more disappointed in this than any other item I ever purchased on Amazon or on line period. I also feel badly that there was little recourse for me-the PTF rep wrote to me basically saying I only had a five day window to voice my concerns and that was it. The only frozen food I ever purchased that was as sub par as this was some frozen prepared meals from Walmart--but Walmart backs up their products and PTF does not after five days.

review_headline: If I could I'd give it 0 stars, scary side effects.
review_body:
First off let me start with my stats:
5'2 female 130 pounds

My BF bought these for himself and then decided he still wanted to bulk not lean out so he passes them onto me since that's what I'm working on.

I took 1 on an empty stomach as the directions said, within 15 minutes my whole body turned red and felt as if it was on fire. I jumped in the shower stayed under the cold spray, only way to dull the pain. Instantly started to feel nauseous began vomiting as well as my nose began to bleed.

I almost passed out in the shower from the burning sensation, and seriously considering calling an ambulance.

After 30 minutes of this I was finally able to crawl out of the shower without feeling on fire, laid on the bathroom floor and began shaking, unable to stay warm.

Crawled to the couch am still bright red 2 hours later and under 4 blankets.

PLEASE DO NOT TAKE THIS!! Incredibly scary and quite averse side effects.

It was delivered when the temp was 85 degrees fahrenheit and was on the truck for many hours. When it arrived, the bottles were hot. I found the following on the web after I bought it: "It is also important to beware leaving serratiopeptidase on the dashboard of your car or in your car in hot weather. Just 15 minutes at 55Â°C (132Â°F) will deactivate the enzyme, robbing all its health benefits. Always store serratiopeptidase in the refrigerator, with the bottle tightly closed."

Despite this there is no temperature warning on the bottle. I am giving it one star for not having a heat warning on the bottle. I was concerned enough to look for that info when I received it and would have returned it had that info been on the label. I may never be able to judge if it would be effective if it was subjected to too much heat during shipping.

I have been diagnosed with Multiple Sclerosis and being a practicing naturopathic physician and nutritionist, I understand the importance of the amino-acid glutathione in the body. This amino-acid is extremely important for helping to rid the body of free radicals that can cause or aggravate serious disease. It is hard to get into the blood stream via the digestive tract as it is destroyed by hydrochloric acid in the stomach. Absorption through the skin eliminates this issue.

Ever since I started using it, I have noted an improvement in mood, memory, and energy. It didn't happen overnight but, after about three weeks, I started noticing a difference. I have been using it on myself for about one and a half months now. I have also noticed that my nails are growing faster and look healthier overall. I plan to use this for some of my more chronically ill autoimmune patients after doing the proper testing to ensure they are good candidates. It makes total sense to me that this would improve function at the mitochondrial level and thus improve overall health. I recommend you ask your holistic health practitioner about this product if you have an autoimmune disease, fibromyalgia, or chronic fatigue.

product_title: Doc Johnson Titanmen Big Stuff Large
review_headline: very heavy, very good, with a superb gravity-assisted exit
review_body:
Curved backdoor toys are supposed to add extra sensations on top of what they are otherwise designed for. These can be curved column dongs which provide a better fit for the naturally arched inner cavities. These can be prostate stimulators, most often in the shape of towers or permanent plugs. Finally, all sorts of curved fantasy shapes are possible too. The point in using them is to tickle a specific spot, hence choosing the right tool for personal anatomy is key.

Titanmen Big Stuff Large is a a very simple curved dong. The 62 mm bead at the top gives way to two rings followed by a curved column. The dong is quite heavy, and features a massive base with a sucker, allowing for safe riding once the column is all in. It is a superbly made toy, much easier to use than others of similar girth.

Build and Entry:
------------
Big Stuff Large is quite large, but I could easily imagine a 10 mm thicker dong that would be as easy to use. I wish they had made an XL version. The top bead is 62 mm in diameter, although since it's an ellipsoid, it will be as easy to insert as toys which are 3-4 mm smaller in diameter. The two rings that follow are 57 mm in diameter, followed by a shallow 51 mm gap. From that point on, there are no features on the smooth, curved column, that continues to slowly increase in girth, reaching 60 mm in diameter at the base, at 170 mm of insertable length.

Even though 62 mm might sound like much, this is by far the easiest toy to insert among my large collection of 60+ mm backdoor toys. Once the top bead is in, there are no difficulties to come -- it simply slides in all the way to the base. It is really quite surprising! If only some of my other toys were as easy on my bum.

Capture:
------------
Since it's pointless to stop at the gap which follows the rings, the sphincter will be always dilated, anywhere from 50 to 60 mm, depending on how deep the toy is in. The best use of Big Stuff is fastriding. It is not a probe, but since it's significantly curved, it will bang just above the prostate, repeatedly, if the insertor chose to sit on this thing all the way down. I have found that prostate stimulation is more effective if the curved dong is only 2/3 of the way in. As such, I prefer to use it standing up.

Exit:
------------
Now for the fun part. Although it is really easy to extract by hand, I now do it hands-free, standing up. Just letting go of the column will let gravity do its work. Since it's so heavy, it will begin sliding out on its own, accelerating in the process. There will be a slowdown when the bead hits the sphincter from within, and a gasp-inducing plonk will eject the bead also, and the heavy dong falling onto the floor. I can't imagine using this toy and not trying a gravity assisted exit ;)

product_title: Organic Stevia Extract Powder No Fillers 1lb(448g)
review_headline: BEST PRICE around on any stevia extract powder around. GREAT QUALITY!
review_body: I bought this stevia for the first time, a few months ago. I've been using stevia extract powder (1/32 tsp. = tsp. sugar) for almost 10 years and this brand is just as good as the other brands and the cheapest price I've seen around per serving. This is such a great deal compared to the other brands of stevia I've purchased in the past. A pound (16 ounces) of stevia extract powder for $40 is such a great deal. The Now brand sells for $55-60 a lb. and around 7-8 years ago I paid more than that for that size bottle at a local health food store and it lasted me more than a year (I was only able to buy it once from that store like that. They no longer sell the big bottle like that. They use the bottle to repackage in smaller zipper baggies and sell by the ounce. They were surprised I wanted to buy the big bottle which they did have a price on.) The last few years, I was purchasing a 3.5 ounce bottle of the Kal brand for $28-30 at another local health food store and that much wouldn't last me 2-3 months. I use a lot of stevia, mostly for my cold green tea with lemon, which I drink like water, from 1 to 1 1/2 liters of tea a day. Also, I refill an old small (1 oz.?) Now bottle of stevia, and carry it around in my purse for sweetening unsweet tea in restaurants, which I use about once or twice a week. I also use stevia to sweeten coffee, which I had only been drinking once or twice a week but lately I have been drinking coffee more often. As far as the taste and sweetness, it's just as good as the other brands like Now and Kal. It's just as good as the store brand that I bought for several years from Vitamin World, which they used to sell a few yrs ago (which they don't anymore, they use a more \\"watered down\\" stevia powder now). The Kal brand is slightly sweeter but a lot of times I was easily using too much of that brand anyway. If I was using 4-5 scoops of Kal brand to sweeten a large glass of tea in a restaurant, I may need to add an extra scoop or two of this brandto get it just as sweet but this brand is still such a great deal and I'm less likely to use too much. It's been awhile since I've used the Now brand but far as I can remember it's similiar to Kal brand but Kal may be slightly sweeter. Again, this is the best deal around on stevia. The best price and just as good as other brands. I still have a lot left and will definitely purchase this brand again. It may be a year before I need some more but this brand is dated 1 1/2 yrs from now (which I've already had half a year). I'm sure it would still be good long after the sell by date but I'll have it used up long before the date. I HIGHLY RECOMMEND this stevia.

1- FIRST, ask your doctor about your new plan.
2- have a blood test before consuming these pills (including cholesterol)
3- NEVER leave you cholesterol pills, just accompany both as u work your way up till you stop the cholesterol pills.
4- NEVER rush it, u've been living with cholesterol pills for how many years!!! so take it easy and work your way up month by month till you reach it.
one last hint, the Dr. told me to give my mom the CoQ10 pills every morning because the cholesterol pills accelerates ageing, so it increases wrinkles. CoQ10 pills recovers from it (that's what i remember.. i guess) so i gave her a pill of CoQ10 in the morning and 2 pills of this Yeast at night, and she feels super good.
last but not least i wish you all good health, we have tried it and it worked miracles.

product_title: Supernova Naturals 7 Day Herbal Colon Detox Cleanse
review_body:
I eat pretty healthy, but I occasionally eat junk food. The manufacturer contacted me and offered me a free bottle in exchange for a fair and honest review. I was up for it.

There's always a bit of trepidation when taking something like this because I don't know if there will be weird side effects. I followed the instructions carefully and felt no side effects.

This product has been uber effective, and I feel great.

There are a lot of natural ingredients in here, though I would prefer the capsules did not use gelatin. Still, this is a product I can heartily recommend.

review_headline: Product is fine... Company is not
review_body: I ordered this product and payed for fast shipping in order to try it sooner. It didn't arrive in the time promised, I had no return communication from the company, and when it did arrive the next week it had been shipped 1st class mail. How is that expedited shipping? The product may have helped my hunger some, but not as much as I wanted. Also it claims it's a 35-40 day supply. Not even close. I have been using it as the bottle says (6 drops, 6 times a day) and it's about gone after 2 weeks. Ridiculous! I suggest trying a different company. This one is frustrating!

review_headline: Wonderful refill, great ecologically and economically
review_body: I've had trouble finding foaming soap refills, and ordered a box of these. This should last me about a year (we have 2 people in our household). The scent is light, and it foams beautifully. Not as much recycling or cost as buying the whole foaming soap bottle each time.

product_title: Peeper Keepers Eyeglass Retainer | Supercord | w/Bonus
review_headline: A Comfortable Way To Keep Glasses In Place
review_body: I have a nasty habit of falling asleep with my glasses on, and other times they simply slide off my nose. Either way they wind up on the floor or under me - neither of which is good for the glass frame. The Peeper Keepers keep the glasses from falling any farther than my chest, and neither can they swing underneath me. Glass frame saved. From other reviews I've read, the ability of the retainer strap to stay on the glasses is an issue. These do not suffer from that problem. They stay in place wherever you put them; yes, sliding them in place takes a little bit of effort, but they don't move either. And the material they're made from is comfortable enough against the skin. A good, basic product that is well made and works as intended; at Amazon's price for a three pack, its a bargain as well.

product_title: Ziploc Vacuum Starter Kit, 3-Quart Bags
review_headline: Good to have around for the price...
review_body:
[[VIDEOID:mo2Z765I8AEXTOX]]I have the Reynolds vac sealer that I bought over a year ago as well. That works just as well, however they no longer sell it in my area, to my knowledge anyawy,so when I saw this pump I was curious. First of all, you can't beat the price. The refill bags are reasonably priced as well. I purchased them at a Walmart in my area. The pump and the battery powered Reynolds sealer are comparable to each other in function. I have used the pump many times and have had one instance where there seemed to be some air leakage; to remedy the problem, I re-pumped and placed 2 strips of tape over the pump entry point- so far so good. The way I see it, even if it doesn't work 100% all the time, it still gets more air out than using an ordinary zip seal bag alone, and at such a cheap price, I feel it more than pays for itself.

In the video, I demo both the Reynolds and the Ziploc so you can see how they match up to eachother. Also, you'll notice that the Ziploc bags can be used with the Reynolds sealer ,which is good to know if the Reynolds bags are no longer available in your area, and you own one too.

product_title: Kerasal Nail Fungal Nail Renewal Treatment 10 ml
review_headline: Works great for thick, discolored toenails
review_body: My toenails had gotten thick and slightly yellow, so I decided to try Kerasal Nail to see if it would help. After just a week or two, my toe nails were clear, the thickness had returned to normal, and they were no longer brittle. It's simple to use (just apply to clean, dry toenails by rubbing the applicator tip over the nail, around the cuticle, and along the open edge of the nail once a day, at bedtime), and there's no staining of socks, sheets, or other fabrics. No strange odors, no weird sensations, nothing. Just let it dry for a few minutes before putting socks on, if you're going to put them on after applying the treatment.

product_title: ActiveRest - Natural Sleep Aid: Better than Melatonin!!! - 60 Capsules
review_body: As someone who is normally hesitant to use sleep aids, I am glad that I have finally found one in Active Rest that I feel comfortable using. Many sleep aids are loaded with unidentifiable drugs, but Active Rest's simple and wholesome formula assures me that I know what I'm putting in my body. Now, after several weeks of using the product, I have seen first hand the benefits of taking Active Rest before going to sleep each night. I no longer wake up groggy, but instead hear my alarm and get right up out of bed to start my day. And, since I'm getting better sleep, I'm also drinking less coffee, so I would also recommend this product to anyone trying to reduce their daily coffee intake.

product_title: MDHearingAid Acoustitone PRO Hearing Aid (Set of 2)
review_headline: Be careful when cutting the tube & I have questions!!
review_body: This is a review and two questions. My review: The manual says to be careful when I cut the tube to fit around the ear. Well...I cut a little too much, and so the tube is too short now. I called the company and explained the situation. The tube kit, which also includes dome-shaped plug, is $25.90 for pair. plus $3.95 S&H. So, be careful when you cut the tube because they don't sell just the tube. The customer service also said that they sell a thin tube kit, which they say is more invisible, for $34.90. plus $3.95 S&H. I guess this is a must because, although I was impressed with how well it worked, I was a bit disappointed with the size, and how visible it was. My questions: How do I make sure that tubes don't fall off. When I pull out the plug, the tube often gets disconnected. Is it ok to glue it? That is, I carefully use crazy glue so i don't clog the tube. Another question is about the setting. H is for those who have sloping hearing loss. But what if I have a little bit of both? I set my volume to about 1 and 1/3 under N. it gets too loud if i set it to 2. So, i guess my hearing loss isn't that bad. but it gets worse when there are distractions like in outside. Are there many people who switch from N (low pitch) to H (High Pitch, distraction) when they go out in a crowd? And then, back to N when they come indoor?

review_body: I'm pre-menopausal, so I was looking for a product to help reduce my newly acquired belly fat. I've always been very thin until recently. After taking this product for two weeks, I lost no belly fat, but I did develop huge cyst-like bumps on my back and forehead. I also suddenly became very tired, even though I wasn't sleeping soundly. I took the medicine exactly as prescribed. I think this is dangerous medicine and I do not recommend it. I'm 45 and I'm still trying to deal with the cystic acne on my back. I have never had acne until now, even as a teenager. Hopefully, my fatigue and acne will subside soon, but I'm still trying to recover from this horrible experience.

product_title: Starwest Botanicals Organic Spirulina Powder, 1-pound Bag
review_body:
The reviewer who advised looking at other sites was right. Amazon was the only place excessive negative reviews were placed on the basis that the product was manufactured in China.

After reading negative spirulina reviews based on how \\"horrible\\" the product tasted, I tried 1 teaspoon with 1/3 cup of Silk plain cocoanut milk (6 grams of sugar per cup) so only 2 grams of sugar if sugar is a concern of yours. To my surprise it tasted great!. There was to my taste buds no fishy, seaweed pond scum, etc. taste whatever! Most of it dissolved but not all. Still the excess was still semi mixed with the cocoanut milk and that went down fine too.

Don't forget too that to get the organic seal a product has to meet strict standards.

Since this is my first try at this product, I will revisit this review in 6 months and post an update regarding effectiveness vis a vis any improvement in energy levels and the like.

product_title: Derby Extra Stainless Steel Double Edge Razor Blades
review_body:
In spite of the controversy on the shave boards you either love these cheap efficient cutting blades or you hate em and want to use your PERSONNA HOSPITAL grade blades at 6x the price.
I use em and get 3 to 5 shaves from a blade. I have medium hair growth and let my beard grow for a few days between shaves so the blade gets quite a cutting workout.
ATG, WTG, XTG...is my method.
Prep is VERY important!!!
Wash your face with soap. Use a good lathering tallow soap or cream...let the lather sit on your wet, clean beard for a couple o minutes and shave away.
Tom

review_body:
As I've written in other reviews, I have a very dry nose with crusting/bleeding that never really goes away. I've tried using a neti-pot, humidifier, and saline sprays, but none of them really seemed to help. I've tried Ponaris, which is pretty good, but I stopped using it because it's uncomfortable to use every day and has a strong aroma.

Nozoil works nicely because it's aroma-free, and feels quite mild in the sinuses. I use it in conjunction with Rhinaris Lubricating Mist, and it has REALLY helped. Would absolutely recommend to anyone with a dry nose.

product_title: Honeywell C7189R1004 Wireless Air Indoor Sensor
review_headline: Updated review: Sometimes setup is troublesome
review_body: I ordered 4 of these for 2 thermostats, and the setup and install for the first two was a breeze. There are some limitations as to how the thermostat will use the thermostats temperature, but thats really a problem with the thermostat, not this product. However, for the other two I had problems. During setup, the unit kept giving me an orange light, when the manual only mentions either a green or red light. Even if I assumed that the orange light was supposed to mean "red," that didn't make sense. Red indicates a dead battery, and I used several fresh sets of batteries. I never could get one unit to install. I contacted Honeywell support, and since this is supposed to be a contractor installed item, they will not help. If you do purchase this item, make sure you install it immediately. That way if it doesn't work, you can just return without having to deal with honeywell support. There are reports that these units might work initially, but fail/stop connecting to thermostat in a year or so, so that is still a concern you must deal with.

review_headline: basic & bright, good value, but no switch?

It has a cord with plug on it, but no switch? Maybe I should have paid more attention to the description or maybe another model has a switch, but I expect most lights with a finished plug would have a switch, and those with unfinished tails I would expect to get hardwired. Its a debatable 4 or 5 star point, just be sure you know what you are getting. Using the switch on a power strip is an easy work-around, so I'm otherwise happy with it after the first week.

product_title: Under Cabinet LED Lighting 21 LED 3 Panel Deluxe Kit pack-parent
review_body: I just finished installing this into an unlighted cabinet-- a great deal of fun watching things light up, cabinet and kids. It took all of 10 minutes to install (most of the time spent emptying and restocking the cabinet). The wire clips, LED's etc all have adhesive backings that make installation a snap. A butter knife easily detached misplace light strips, but for those with picky spouses, you may wish to tack them up with a touch of putty before setting. I do recommend the dimmer (LED 4-Position Dimmer Switch) which makes selecting the right amount of light easy. Everything is plug and play. I also bought a pack of "PilotLights Adhesive Wire Clip for cable management, cable organizer" which gave me enough sticky clips to make the wiring manageable and look professional. The pack comes with three 3' connector cables, which I found just about right for a 34" wide display cabinet. So far so good. Highly recommended.

product_title: Korky 16BP 1.6 Toilet Flapper, 2-Inch
review_body:
I BOUGHT THIS FLAPPER BECAUSE I WANTED TO USE THE LEAST AMOUNT OF WATER PER FLUSH. NOT ONLY DOES THAT SAVE WATER BUT IT TAKES LESS TIME FOR THE TANK TO FILL UP. IT WORKED GREAT FOR ABOUT A WEEK OR TWO AND THEN I NOTICED IT STARTED TAKING LONGER AND LONGER FOR THE TANK TO FILL UP. WHEN I TOOK THE TANK COVER OFF I NOTICED THE FLAPPER WAS STAYING UP LONGER LETTING MORE WATER OUT OF THE TANK WITH EACH FLUSH.

THERE IS A PART ON THE FLAPPER THAT YOU CAN ADJUST TO DETERMINE HOW LONG THE FLAPPER STAYS UP. BUT GRADUALLY OVER A WEEK OR TWO THIS PART SHIFTS ON IT'S OWN. UNLESS YOU ENJOY ADJUSTING YOUR TOILET FLAPPER EVERY FEW WEEKS, I WOULD AVOID THIS PRODUCT.

product_title: Hyperikon T8 4FT 18W, Single-Ended, 3000-6000K, Clear
review_headline: These LED lights are really great, I've installed 12 of them in my garage ...
review_body:
These LED lights are really great, I've installed 12 of them in my garage and its like working in a surgical room. These emit a very clean bright light (like a clean bright florescent would be my guess, seems more like 6400K Lumens...if these are the 5000K I guess anything brighter would be like seeing the light at the end of the tunnel).

I will be buying more of these in the future for my under house storage area (approx 1700sq ft) once the current florescents start to burn out. I might also pick up another 4 pack and try using these for my spring vegetable grow starts (just to see if they work since they seem as bright as the 6400K florescents).

One thing I will caution you of is to make sure you have current tombstones that are non-shunted (tombstones are the end mounts in florescents). This will save you around $20 if you pop open your current fixtures and check, just look up on youtube about installing LED florescents and there are some pretty good video explanations.

review_body: Just had this unit installed, and from the initial uses, it is very quiet! We haven't put large quantities of food down it yet, but with one HP, I don't anticipate any problems. One problem I did have was that I bought a new sink and the stopper/strainer to match the color of the sink, but when the plumber came to install the disposal, the stopper/strainer that I purchased would not work on this Waste King disposal! product_title: BOND DISTRIBUTING LTD 00200 Natural Wood Stain/Sealer
review_headline: Lasted 7 years on my deck and color still good!
review_body:
Lasted 7 years on my deck and color still good! Like the other reviewer I don't get all the negative comments here. I had my handyman put this on my silvered, wearing badly deck with full, west/south sun exposure in SC 7years ago. He properly cleaned and prepped the deck and had recommended this noting the cost was worth it.

It not only turned the silvered, rough boards a lovely pale cedar color (1/2 natural + 1/2 cedar mix). It also lasted until this to year when my deck had gotten very dirty and algae'd with the SC moisture and humidity. Just got the deck power washed this week to get all dirt and grime off. It's clean now and really surprisingly the deck boards are back to the nice cedar color! Amazing as I did literally no maintenance in 7 years.

I'm now buying a couple more gallons to refresh it and re-seal again and expect another 7 years. Worth every penny just not to have to resell/stain deck every 2 years like I did in my prior home when I used Behring or Thompson stain and seals. Highly recommend this stuff!

product_title: LE 16.4ft LED Flexible Strip Lights, 300 Units SMD 3528 LEDs, 12V DC Non-waterproof, Light Strips, LED ribbon, For Garden/Home/Kitchen/Car/Bar, DIY Party Decoration Lighting
review_headline: This about sums up what you're to expect from these LEDs....
review_body:
These LED strips have their ups and downs.

It seems this is a common problem I've seen when buying these strips. The first 12v power cable interface is solid but the 2nd one (that's included in the package) seems to be either broken or on the point of breaking. Not to mention that i got my packages somewhat damaged which didn't affect the LEDs but could have caused damage with the power cables.

Remember this: These are "sticky" strips and, if you don't go over them and keep pressing them down (the first few days) they may actually come loose. And whatever you do, make sure there is NO stress where the cable is connected or it will pull loose. An alternative might be "stapling" them into place where the power cables are attached to ensure they will not come off whatever surface they are attached to.

How these units respond to very hot weather....I'm not there yet but they don't seem to lose their adhesiveness during cold weather. I'm in Alabama so summers don't get much more hot/humid here so i will update this in a few months.Still, as an alternative lighting source, i have to admit...these aren't bad.

I would guess that if someone could develop a USB connector with a wireless switching system (or just toggle switches) this could make any RV, or possibly even a man-cave look really nice.. It's all about the direction they are being used and the angles. Also, having them project onto a "white" back surface has a much nicer effect.

Oh, you might want to limit their burn period to a maximum of 16 hours, those 12v adapter get pretty HOT when the LEDs have been used for a long period of time.

And, by the way, do NOT try to run 2 strips on one 12v adapter...you will probably get a burnout in 12-18 hours. Already made that mistake in hopes of getting two for one...won't work.

I know people are planning on using these in cars but you had better make sure they are secure because, if they fall, and are kicked or dragged, they won't endure it. Tough is something these LEDs are not meant to be.ause, if they fall, and are kicked or dragged, they won't endure it. Tough is something these LEDs are not meant to be.

product_title: Frost King SP57/67 R6.7 SP56/67 Water Heater Insulation Blanket
review_headline: Total junk - didn't fit a standard 50 gallon tank
review_body:
As many others reported, this blanket, which claims it will fit around a 50 gallon tank, doesn't wrap completely around it. The tank is in a newer townhouse I bought, which I plan to move to after other work is completed inside. So, I looked it up on Amazon and as others stated, it doesn't fit many tanks and there isn't enough tape to completely seal the seam either. What's the point of not enclosing enough tape to seal the seam? Just so we have to buy a roll of some sort of tape to finish the job?

I measured the circumference of the tank before buying a blanket for it, so I thought I had the correct product. How can this company claim it fits around one when it doesn't? So I measured the width of the blanket, and yes, it's the size stated, so not sure why it doesn't fit the tank. Luckily, I bought this at a local hardware store, to which I returned it, with no hassle, but the store didn't have anything else in stock, so I left without a water heater blanket. I then tried both HDs and the Lowe's stores in my city, but the only ones they had were the same thing, or nothing on the shelves. I guess they had sold out.

Upon doing extensive research now, I've decided that a fiberglass blanket that's so thin, isn't going to be enough added insulation to make my water heater much more efficient (trying to reduce stand-by loss). So I'm looking for a thick mineral wool blanket instead. Mineral wool is both waterproof and more fireproof than this piece of junk.

Remember to insulate your water pipes as much as possible too. I know that's difficult in a finished home, but do what you can.

Installation is super simple with PEX a crimper and the collars, even in a tight crawl space. Just ordered a few more for future projects. And as compared to the original plumbing / valves ... they made things really great in the 50's, but way to complicated ... this is a simple ball valve that is built really well whereas the original is built really well but has multiple seals, 5 turns to turn on or off, junctions etc ...

product_title: Lava Lite Grande 250-Ounce 27-Inch Lava Lamp
review_headline: Get ready to pull out your old records...
review_body:
It's funny how you end up doing some of the things you do...this is a perfect example. I had been given a couple of smaller Lava Lites left over from a TV commercial, and as a goof we put one on top of a subwoofer in our home theater off to the side of the screen. My wife and I would catch ourselves staring over at it on commercials or during bad TV episodes or films. So when I found out there was a BIG A** version of it I just had to one-click it on Amazon.

We have had a BALL with this thing-literally! We got the yellow and purple based on other reviews-It does have an excellent contrast of the colors, though I think it's kind of a drag not to be able to buy additional colored bottles once you have the base unit. Did I mention it is BIG?? NOT 250 ounces like the ad (That's almost 2 Gallons!)- The bottle is actually 57 ounces, so about the size of a two-liter bottle- a little wider on the bottom and and around 4\\" taller because of the cone effect of the lamp shape. Patience is a virtue here; it does take over two hours to heat up to the point where it's dripping red ball shapes. Up until that time the wildest Formaldehyde Baby, hydrogen bomb cloud, Area 51 alien, and cellulite fat looking shapes ever imagined form at all levels of the lamp-which is cool on its own! And the amount of activity once it's fully warmed up is awesome as well- it's so big inside that seeing 6, 10, or more balls dripping while large ghost shapes are behind is common. As other reviews have said, make sure you center the lamp-another advantage is with this size one being so tall the actual bulb for the lamp is far enough off the base that you don't need to worry as much about heat damaging veneers underneath. We keep it on a black Paridigm sub for six hours with no signs of damage, but you're on your own here for your use. And the sub if if anything seems to help the experience. And we heeded the advise of another good reviewer and we do limit the total time to six hours, not the eight the one-sheet that comes with it says.

Over a month now, and running 2-3 days a week, it's been fantastic. This is a blatant trick by Amazon to make me go buy SACD's of Dark Side of the Moon, Goodbye Yellow Brick Road, and a few other classic 70's LP's... and it WORKED! A great talking point, stress reliever, and reason to get slightly altered and turn up the volume. Highly Recommended!

product_title: FiberFix Combo Packs
review_body:
I saw this on Shark Tank and was intrigued. I had a broken yard rake that I had previously tried to fix with
liquid cement, and even Gorilla Glue. Both rebroke after less than half my front yard. I did the fiber fix wrap, and it's like brand new. I was not even able to get a smooth wrap because it broke at the base with the tines, but I wrapped the top part of that section, and there has been no looseness, no wobble at All! I immediately bought a supply in all sizes just in case. Best buy.

product_title: Kingston Brass CC554T Vintage Wall Mounted Clawfoot Tub Filler with Personal Han,
review_headline: Kingston Brass lack of customer care
review_body:
We were pleased with the quality and price of the faucet we received; however, our experience in dealing with the technical service department at Kingston Brass (George) was disappointing. They were they were hard to reach, were unpleasant on the phone, and did not seem to care one bit about helping us with our issue. They also sent our part later than promised - even though we paid for 2nd day shipping - which caused delays in our bathroom renovations. Speaking with a Kingston supervisor did not amount to anything either.
In addition, we ended up ordering a part from our local plumbing shop over a month ago, who received twice the wrong part from Kingston Brass. We have yet to be able to use our brand new Kingston faucet.

Our conclusion is that Kingston products are high in aesthetics; however, we will certainly hesitate in purchasing future Kingston products because of their lack of customer care.

I really had to clean out a lot of gunk though. I can't believe how much locksmiths charge to do this kind of stuff.

review_headline: Just as i was expecting, and no suprises
review_body:
I purchased this to make some toys for my bird. I had ordered another roll of sisal from a different manufacturer, and i came dark and stinking of petroleum, yet the description on amazon nor the label on the product mentioned the use of anything but sisal.

That roll went back, and i found and ordered this roll. Notice in the photo how light colored it is? That's how it should be!

I learned that apparently, some manufacturers soak sisal in petroleum, to keep bugs away or something. Whatever it's for, it was no good for pets.

So i was pleased when i received this roll, it was light, and smelled juts of sisal and no chemicals. 1/4" thickness is just right for pet toys in my opinion.

product_title: Suncourt Flush Fit Register Air Booster Fan and Flush Fit Mount Adaptor
review_body:
I have a wall heater vent that is about 40 feet from the furnace. The contractor that put in the bedroom addition decided to connect the duct to the end of a duct that already feeds two other rooms. In the past, I had to close the other two vents in order to feel any appreciable flow out of the end vent, and still the room was much colder than the rest of the house.

Although this model is described as white in color, the booster that I received is closer in color to the gray outlet- and switch plates. As others have mentioned, it is somewhat loud, and removing the inner grates helped to some extent. On closer inspection, I found that one of the fans would not spin freely. I discovered that both fans were not assembled correctly. Specifically, the fan bearings were not pressed fully into the hub. When I looked at the gap between the fan (the rotating part) and the frame, I could see the coils of copper wire inside. Supporting the hub, I pressed each fan down until it seated fully. The blades sit much closer to the hub support arms. I noticed that both fans spin much more freely and the booster is noticeably quieter.

The fans are model DFC902512M by coolingfan.cn, 12VDC, 0.20A. This model is not listed on their website, but a similar 92x92x25mm, 12VDC, 0.20A model listed has the following specifications: voltage: 6-13.8VDC, speed: 2500rpm, airflow: 48.1cfm, pressure: 2.60mmH2O, noise: 31dBa, weight: 77g. Tach measurements give the following fan speeds: low: 2000rpm, medium: 2200rpm, high: 2500rpm. At medium speed, the noise level seems comparable to that of the unboosted vents closer to my furnace. There is a more significant jump in speed and noise from medium to high than low to medium. I use medium.

While the unit was open, I also desoldered the thermistor from the control board and extended it with a pair of wires by about 8 inches out the back. I was able to thread the two thin wires through the original hole for the thermistor and out of one of the rectangular access holes for the fan catches without the need for drilling an additional hole. The thermistor now sits deeper inside the duct. The unit no longer cycles on and off repeatedly at the start and end of the heater cycle due to the fan blowing directly on the thermistor. There is no hysteresis programmed into the controller, so the fans cycle on and off at exactly the set temperature.

The LEDs for the indicator panel fit into tubular guides. You can inserted a small wad of cotton or tissue into each tube to dampen the amount of light emitted, and not alter the external appearance of the booster.

The booster comes with a 12VDC, 500ma transformer-type wall wart. According to my Kill-a-Watt meter, it is drawing 1W at idle, 5W on low, 6W on medium, and 7W on high. Note that the fans are rated 2.4W each according to the labels, 4.8W together. When power is reset, the booster seems to remember the last-used settings.

This booster fits best if the duct opening is flat and square. In my case, the metal duct extends slightly from the drywall and the spackling is uneven. Due to this protrusion and the design of the plastic faceplate and adapter, the unit does not sit flush against the surrounding drywall. I will have to either trim the duct and spackling flush with the drywall, or adhere a strip of thin foam insulation around the perimeter of the back of the faceplate to close this irregular gap.

The room is warmer and comfortable with the booster installed and running. Considering the quality of parts and type of materials used, I do wish it was a little less expensive. I also had to order the adapter plate for larger vents, plus a 120VAC flat-plug extension cord so that it can be plugged into a wall outlet behind furniture. However, it is relatively simple device that can be completely disassembled and is servicable to the circuit board level with readily-available parts.

product_title: Nordic Pure 20x20x2M13-3 20x20x2 MERV 13 Pleated AC Furnace Air Filter, Box of 3, 2-Inch
review_body:
It's always somewhat surprising to pull out an old furnace filter and see how much dust it has collected over a few months. My particular system uses a 2" x 20" x 20" filter -- a size that is not readily available from the "big box" home centers. This proved to be a blessing in disguise, as it caused me to research what "MERV" meant -- and I discovered that the filters carried by local vendors were of rather low quality in the level of filtration. As an allergy sufferer, I was pleased to be able to purchase a higher level of filtration that should reduce the allergens moving though my home's air handling system. These filters appear to fulfill my needs very well and were quite reasonably priced.

In my home, the furnace is in the attic, and the filter is positioned just behind a grill in the ceiling of a central hall. The measurements of filters tend to be slightly less than the nominal measurement, which made installation a 'three hand' situation. (Solved by turning on the system fan, allowing the air flow to hold the filter in place while closing the grill that holds the filter in place.) The filter does not firmly contact the sides of the filter box, but the duct behind the filter is slightly smaller, so that in operation, the air pressure holds the filter against the duct giving an adequate seal.

The filter appears to be sturdy and should preform its task without structure failure.

product_title: MK Diamond 156426 Portable Mobility Stand
review_body:
This cart is a must have if you own the 110lb MK-101Pro or similar saw. It makes transporting much easier. Previously I had to dissassemble the saw into two pieces plus the stand and carry each piece to or from the trailer for transport.
There is some pretty good engineering with the ATS stand but it could have been designed better, especially for the price. The legs are held in place by 1/4" bolts which I doubt will last long because of the extreme stress placed on them when raising and lowering the saw. The instructions that came with the stand showing the purchaser how to attach the saw are all but useless. The pictures are pitiful. It took me almost an hour to figure out things that with proper instruction would have taken minutes.
The pneumatic tires are secured only with an axle cap. The tire wabbles. It would not surprise me if this method of attachment doesn't fail quickly.
Other parts are the saw stand show thought and engineering. The way the legs fold out of the way is good. A stand on the end of the saw, which allows it to be placed on end ready for wheeling to or from the job site, can be removed after raising the stand into its working position and placed in slots on the side of the stand for an additional working surface. I really like that feature. With the saw attached the unit is well balanced for transporting like a handtruck.

product_title: GE WR57X10051 Ice Maker Double Solenoid Water Valve
review_body: It was suppose to be a direct replacement for my 22 year old GE Refrigerator but is was not. The supply line on my old valve was a flare type and this valve required a compression type. Not really a problem I just cut off the flared end on my copper supply line and purchased compression fitting and furrel. I believe the newer refrigerators have plastic supply lines that use a compression type connection so this should not be a problem for newer refrigerators. Also the solenoid terminals were smaller and required an 2 adapters and there was only one in the package. I saved lot on money by doing it myself so overall I happy with this purchase.

product_title: Bosch 1600PS LP Aquastar 4.7 GPM Indoor Solar Whole-House Tankless Liquid Propane Water Heater
review_body: I have a 'batch' solar hot water tank on my roof I put in when I built the house in 1990. It preheats the water before it goes into a water heater, and previously I had an LP gas heater, a 40 gallon tank. That system worked well, but four years ago I did an addition and put in a Bosch solar type tankless heater designed to back up the solar hot water. It works very well, sensing the temperature of the water coming from the roof and firing up only as needed to increase the temperature if the water from the batch heater isn't hot enough. While it works perfectly there are two concerns. One is that the solar unit has a standing pilot light rather than electronic ignition; I believe they could figure out how to fix this. Secondly, the unit is small and if someone upstairs calls for hot water while I am in the shower the water gets cold until I adjust the mix, then the water is hot enough. This heater will not work for a large family, though putting in two might work. It has saved a lot of money in LP gas, and I have noticed the reduction since putting in the Bosch compared to the previous method. I can't say how much because I used to use LP gas to cook and when I did the addition we switched to an electric stove, so the gas use would have been reduced anyway. Still, I use very little LP gas on a yearly basis, only 200-300 gallons for home heating and water heating for a 2700 sq. ft. house; not bad!

product_title: Stanley Hardware S819-401 CD8368 15 Pc. Garage and Workshop Kits, Zinc Plated
review_body:
I'm a huge fan of having my shop organized, and these are what make it possible. Overall, they're very study hooks that should last forever once installed. I found in one older sheet of 1/4 in peg board, I had to hammer the bottom peg in on some of these since they're so tight. That's the kind of fit I like in hooks since it means they won't pull out.

That being said, I found a few minor quality control issues. First of all, the bottom pegs seem to just be tack welded on. Under normal conditions, I can't imagine this would be an issue, however like I said, I had to hammer a few of these into the holes. Out of this pack, I had one rear peg break off. The only other issue I had was the spacing between the top and bottom pegs. I found some instances where they were more than an 1/8th of an inch too low, or too high.

In the end, I have to admit, I ordered another pack of them. Despite the few throw away pegs, it's still a good deal for sturdy pegs. I'd recommend them.

product_title: Duro Super Glue
review_headline: Best cyanoacrylate glue ("super glue") I've tried
review_body:
Some of the best cyanoacrylate glue ("super glue") I've ever used.

As a bit of background, I am sometimes called upon to 3D print costume elements for friends and family for parties and such. Because of this, I print a lot of stuff with ABS. It's durable, glues together well, and can be smoothed down with acetone. But for larger elements like helmets, I have to print them in multiple pieces and glue them together.

Anyway, one day I ran out of glue mid-project. I bought some of this brand at a local store, tried it, and it worked better than any super glue I had used before. I returned to the store, bought them out, and ordered a bunch more here on Amazon.

Now, so you get the best mileage out of it, some information on cyanoacrylate glue:
How cyanoacrylate glue does *not* work:
* "Drying."
* Melting the plastic on the two sides together.
* Evaporating.
* Pretty well any other method of bonding you've ever heard about for it.

How cyanoacrylate glue *does* work:
* In the presence of water, liquid super glue polymerizes. In other words, the individual molecules of super glue plastic which make up the liquid form bond to each other in long chains and turn into a solid plastic. This solid plastic is what holds the two sides together.
* Blowing on a cyanoacrylate glue works because the moisture in your breath kicks off the polymerizing/solidifying. Touching it with your skin also works due to the moisture in your skin, but this is a very bad idea since cyanoacrylate glue has no problems bonding to skin.
* Spraying cyanoacrylate glue with water also very quickly kicks off solidifying, but you may not get as good of a joint as if you let it dry a bit slower.
* Because you're literally filling the crack with a different type of plastic, ideally you want to use as thin of a layer as you can get away with. You want to use the strength of the surrounding plastic, not try to add strength using a weaker filler plastic meant solely for bonding.
* As with any cyanoacrylate glue, keep the fumes out of your eyes. They hurt. I speak from experience many times over.

This stuff is quick drying and very strong. It holds together ABS very well. It also seems to hold PLA together pretty well, though I have less experience on that front than with ABS. But it's the best super glue I've tried.try to add strength using a weaker filler plastic meant solely for bonding.
* As with any cyanoacrylate glue, keep the fumes out of your eyes. They hurt. I speak from experience many times over.

This stuff is quick drying and very strong. It holds together ABS very well. It also seems to hold PLA together pretty well, though I have less experience on that front than with ABS. But it's the best super glue I've tried.

review_body: Just got mine in so I have only been able to give it a test run, but it appears to do the job. If you decide to use it to clean gutters you attach the stabilizer normally as you would for a vertical wall, then move the bottom (base) of the ladder out from the wall to form the angle.

product_title: Cosco Retro Chair/Step Stool Yellow
review_body: This Cosco chair has been part of my kitchen for 50 years - first as a child, and my mom still has hers. Then in my home for at least 20 years. And now I need another one - not because the old one failed but because I have another kitchen. The chair gives a good step stool, is good for at the countertop for writing, paying bills, and the kids love to sit on it doing homework. Am glad to see Cosco still makes it and Amazon carries it for a reasonable price.

product_title: ROOMMATES RMK1555GM Spring Blossom Peel & Stick Giant Wall Decal
review_body: I put this in our guest room which has the same coloring as the pictures. Turned out perfect! Good buy and got me out of re-paining our chocolate walls.

product_title: NuTone 0695B000 Motor Assembly for QT80 Series Fans
review_body: The purpose for which this motor was bought (replacement) has been completely fulfilled.

product_title: BMOUO COM003 5050 Sigal LED Strip
review_headline: The lights themselves are terrific. the self stick is horrible
review_body: The lights themselves are terrific. the self stick is horrible. They will test your patience, I INSTALLED THEM ON NEW CABINETS CLEANED WITH A THINNER WIPE AND SLOWLY BUT SURELY THEY ALL CAME BACK DOWN IN TWO DAYS. GRRR I THEN PUT LOCKTITE POWERGRAB ON THEM POOF DONE. THEY POWER SUPPLY ARE NOT THE BEST BUT FOR 20 BUCKS NICE.

product_title: Fasco A134 115 Volt 3060 RPM Furnace Draft Inducer Blower
review_body: Installed easily and actually appeared to be of a higher quality than the blower it replaced. Has been operating for two years with no issues so far. So no complaints from me.

product_title: 2x Homegear M2 Contemporary Adjustable Swivel Faux Leather Bar Stools
review_headline: Looks nice and functions as advertised. Good for the price.
review_body: Arrived quickly and was well packaged. Very easy to put together- about 5 minutes each. Quite short in the seat area- on the verge of being uncomfortable. I wish that the seat was a little shorter (lower to the floor) and the back was a little higher, too. The base is quite light but feels sturdy when seated in it. I just hope that it holds up to use. Of course, I needed a small stool for my island so I guess that I got exactly what I needed.

product_title: Niagara Earth Showerhead
review_body: Definitely saves water, but is a little weak for my taste. Go 1.75 and you'll be happy. Plain and simple.

review_body: Its a decent electrical outlet and cheaper here than at Home Depot.

product_title: National Hardware Touch'n Hold Screen/Storm Door Closer
review_headline: Good, but this company makes an even better one: "Smooth"
review_body:
Greenstar, who make this very good closer, also make one that's even better--it closes more smoothly: [[ASIN:B004ROJ1YG Touch'n Hold Smooth Single Kit - White]].
The closer on this page, like most of its kind, starts to close rather fast, and as you are stepping inside, may whack you on the Achilles tendon.

Greenstar has a neat video that shows how their \\"smooth\\" version reduces this problem: [...]

I have bought both closers and can confirm that the \\"smooth\\" version is much superior for this reason. It also includes the excellent step-on button to hold it open. Also available is a top-and-bottom pair which helps to ensure that the screen door closes more tightly at top and bottom: [[ASIN:B0058JLBEW Touch'n Hold Smooth Dual Kit Storm and Screen Door Closer]]

product_title: Wagner 0520000 PowerTex Texture Sprayer
review_headline: Too messy. Not precise at all and forget doing ...
review_body: Too messy. Not precise at all and forget doing ceilings.

product_title: GE 50828 Blue Screen Night Light, Always On
review_body: I bought this light to replace previous one in my bathroom that lasted for many years. This one is probably 50% larger and gives enough light to see, but is not bright enough to be annoying or disturb sleep. With the smaller light I had to use 2 when I had guests so that they could navigate, but this one is adequate on its own. I was unable to find this light retail, so I was happy to find it on Amazon.

product_title: 3051-SN-10 GlideRite Satin Nickel 3-inch T-Handle Birdcage Cabinet Knob (Pack of 10)
review_body: These drawer pulls are so nice and really did give a facelift of sorts to one very old white dresser. Just be careful when you're handling them, as there is a sharp piece in the back of each pull. Once they're in place there's no danger.

product_title: Intermatic EJ351C 120 Volt 24-Hour Programmable Mechanical Security Timer
review_body: I bought one of these about 5 years ago, and it worked like a charm. It finally died. I ordered a new one, and it didn't work. Got a replacement, and it didn't work AGAIN! Tried for a third, and it finally worked... Amazon was great with the return and replacement... but the Intermatic quality is REALLY iffy now. I was going to give up on it completely if the 3rd didn't work... I put it in today, and it's working - fingers are crossed. Bottomline - if you get one that works, it's an awesome switch. Easy to use, etc. But if you get one that doesn't work, good luck...

product_title: Lithonia Lighting FMML 13 827 DDBT LED Flush Mount Light
review_body: Installed this above a new shower. It was easy to install, looks great and gives a lot of light. This 4000K is typically 'cool' white, that is it doesn't have a yellowish tint. That's great for me because my shower was white subway tile and marble, so I didn't want the 'warm' color light. I probably will get another one for another shower.

product_title: SadoTech Model CXR Wireless Doorbell with 1 Remote Button and 2 Plugin Receivers Operating at over 500-feet Range with Over 50 Chimes, No Batteries Required for Receivers, Fixed Code C Series

product_title: SimpliSafe Wireless Home Security Command
review_body:
Get this system!
Easy to install. Works great right out of the box. I had no problems.

I've relocated alot because of my job. In my last 7 homes, I've installed a system from a 'traditional' security company. Over $1000 in install (or more) and then then the commit to monitoring at $40 per month.

On this house, I got the run-around so much from the 'largest local security firm' that I said "enough is enough" and tried Simplisafe. Awesome!

Took me lass than 2 hours to install and test the system. Works great!

I will never go back to the run around.

Thanks!

product_title: LEDwholesalers 3-level Dimmable Touch Switch Folding LED Desk Lamp 7 Watt, Pure White 2403WH
review_body: I love it. It is indeed space-saving product. The light is very good.

review_body: I bought this as an Xmas gift for my mom last year. It's a little smaller than I expected, and you can barely see the light in it. But it's very pretty, and has lasted a year out in the weather with no problems.

product_title: Speakman Napa VS-2007 2.5 gpm Multi-Function Hand Shower Head

product_title: Leviton Decora Outlet, Z-Wave, Tamper Resistant, Split Duplex, Works with Amazon Alexa (Old Model)
review_body:
Absolutely love it. I ended putting this up in my wife's bathroom so that if/when she forgets to turn off her curling iron I could just go in (through our Z-Wave module) and turn it off. There has been numerous times we were well on our way to a vacation and sure enough the wife had forgotten to turn of here hot hair products. This device is wonderful and works perfect with our Vera light z-wave.

Also the picture is when the unit is off. So when it's off there is a blue LED light when there is power to it there is no light.

product_title: Solid Red Oak Cove
review_body: exactly as advertised.

product_title: Slide-Co 241862 Bullet Catch with Strike, Brass Plated

product_title: Happy Life Portable Plastic Bathtub, Blue
review_headline: The valves seem pretty exclusive to the pump
review_body:
I'm not sure it's worth what I paid, but it does get the job done. The skinny PVC support pipes are only enough to be use exactly as intended. I put a 14"-ish length piece of 3/4" copper pipe underneath before filling to allow it to drain to the center shower drain. The valves seem pretty exclusive to the pump, and the pump is pretty cheap.

I'm just so dratted grateful I can take a bath in my shower-only current living quarters.

product_title: PUR 2 Stage Faucet Mount Filter #RF-3375
review_body: The Pur replacement filters were the brand name and the cost was less than in stores. The faucet filter system is easy to install and the filters are easy to replace. The system flashes a green signal when filtering correctly and a red signal when it is time to replace. I would recommend this to anyone.

On the current dimmer, they dim fine but I only move the dimmer down about half way before they go off. Overall, a good value.

review_body: I love that this light stays on in the dark and is not motion sensitive. It also doesn't shine up into your eyes, but where you will walk. I want to see where I am going BEFORE I get there!

product_title: Yodel 12 Inch Solid Ultra Thin Stainless Steel Rain Shower Head
review_headline: A great deal! This Rain Showerhead is Awesome
review_body: A great deal!This Rain Showerhead is Awesome! It is so easy to install,I could do it myself. No tools are needed,you just take the old one off,put this one on and you are ready to go. This showerhead is Huge,it makes me feel like I am in a fancy hotel somewhere.The Shower Head is made with Stainless Steel so you know that it is going to last.I love standing under this,as it really does feel like you are in the rain.

product_title: Waste King Legend Series 1/2 HP Continuous Feed Garbage Disposal with Power Cord - (L-2600)
review_body: I love this item. It was a bit hard to install. The instructions are not all that clear. When you attach the disposer, to the bottom ring, there is a tendency to put it too high. It doesn't come with plumber's putty and it should. Apply a generous amount of putty when placing the top ring. (see you tube videos) The disposer runs great and is quiet and very efficient. It also has a removable splash guard and the competition does not.

product_title: Amerock Highland Ridge Collection Latch
review_body:
As advertised. Used for some tall garage cabinet doors that get used regularly and slammed thoughtlessly. They are well made and robust.
Note: Before installing them, I opened the service panel beneath the latch (access is provided by lossening a small phillips head screw) and added a drop of oil to silence a slight squeaking.

product_title: Jasco Products 50246 Door Stop Security Alarm
review_body: have to turn it off and on to use which is fine but I think it is more useful for a motel room door than an actual family home security item.

product_title: Werner (MT) Telescoping Multiladder
review_body: Easy to handle and fits in my trunk. Love it . Arrived quickly. It was great to use this for Christmas decorating.

product_title: Philips 823031 CFL Light Bulb 13W T2 Twister Daylight 6500K, 60 Watt Equivalent; 4-Pack
review_body: Lights work good, just as described

product_title: Feit CE13T2 Conserv-Energy 60W Equivalent CFL 13-Watt Light Bulbs, 4-Pack
review_body: Got a 4 pack a year ago and 2 died. The original incandescent bulbs lasted 7 yrs compared to theses which lasted just under a year. ROI on these do not break even. 4 bulbs saved me about 5 cents a month in electrical costs per the killawatt tool.

product_title: Radio Thermostat Company of America CT32-Z-Wave 7-Day Programmable Thermostat
review_headline: Great thermostat but lacking install ease.
review_body:
I love love love the thermostat itself. I have a rental home an hour from our house that we rent a few days at a time. We use this to verify the temp and reset after guests leave.
That said. The setup can be abhorrent. I'm a 30-year IT industry executive so it's not 'above' me, it's just. Finicky. I've had to setup the same stat about 6 times in the past 2 years, after power outages and most recently a wifi access point change.
Sometimes it takes moments to set up. This time took me about 3 hours spread over 4 different days. The setup would finish and then error about the auth code being invalid which leaves you with no cloud access, just local.
So. Buy it and know once installed, you'll very thoroughly enjoy it.

product_title: Kohler K- Purist Robe Hook
review_body: All Kohler products are of the highest quality. This robe hook matches the finishes of the faucets and control valves in our newly renovated bathroom. Price is reasonable - quick delivery.

product_title: Umbra Postino Wall-Mount Mailbox
review_body: nice looking, does need to be cleaned, leaves finger prints

product_title: Mr. Beams MB850 Wireless Motion Sensing LED Under Cabinet Light
review_headline: Good for lighting up walkways at night
review_body:
To make my home safer for the kids, I needed light at certain areas at night, but some of the switches were placed in sub-optimal positions: too high for the kids, too far from the walking traffic etc. These motion sensor lights met my needs. I had a few requirements:
sufficient light to reduce possibility of tripping / walking into obstacle
remain switched on as long as activity was detected.
remains switched off during periods of sufficient illumination (i.e. day light)

I bought 3 pairs of 2. So far I have tested 5.
4 of the 5 worked well, and met my requirements.
1 of the 5 did not work well. It switched on even in a bright environment, and even if there was no activity.

product_title: Altus 15-Amp-120 Volt/277V Decorative 3 Way Switch
review_body: These switches are not good quality and over time do not work. Several of my switches do not click any more and I had to replace them!

review_headline: Very happy with price compared to other offerrings in the marketplace

product_title: Red Devil Steel Wool

product_title: Whirlpool W10120998 Screen for Dryer

I've done a lot of laundry in the last 3 months since I purchased this and have seen no indication that the felt is going to pull loose, and it seems to be doing its lint-filtering job very well.

review_body: Installed and worked as expected, dishwasher is draining much better.
