review_headline: works well but a bit over priced, as soon ...
review_body: works well but a bit over priced, as soon as I bough this found the same one near my house for half the price, it is built well and has been used many times

product_title: Flotec FPDMP21SA-P2 Self Priming Drill Pump
review_body: I wanted to use a drill pump and siphon to drain bathtubs for watering diruing our Georgia drought of 2008. On the first test, I got some water moving, so I assembled hoses and bought a cordless drill. On the second try, nothing. I tossed it. I am disappointed.

product_title: American Standard Laurel Elongated Toilet Seat with Cover
review_body: No issues. I have an Americam Standard unit that came with my house. For some reason they put Church seats on them. It was time to replace. White matches perfectly. Smooth feel. Easy installation.

product_title: Cooper Lighting 300W Plastic Twin Head PAR Dusk to Dawn Floodlight
review_headline: For ten bucks how can you lose?
review_body: This was very easy to install, and the nice thing about it is the range of where you can point the lights. This is an under the eve (not wall) installation, and so far there have been no problems with it. The sockets adjust very easily. I didn't want to spend any more than I needed to. This turned out to be just fine. I think if I was looking for something to last well into the future I might have spent more, but who knows? This could last a long time as there is very little of anything that is subject to corrosion. Very happy with it.

product_title: Krylon I00500A00 12-Ounce Triple Thick Clear Glaze Aerosol Spray
review_body: Because of "alienlady's" review and photos, I was worried about trying this spray. I'm glad I went with my gut. I bought the spray today, sprayed it on $3,900 worth of beadwork that had managed to get dull, forced myself to not panic over the cloudiness, and walked away for an hour. When I went back, the cloudiness had dissipated, and my beadwork was shiny and beautiful. This spray SAVED my project, and I will be able to deliver it to my client.

product_title: GE GeoSpring Hybrid Water Heater GEH50DNSRSA
review_headline: Better hope it doesn't break down!
review_body: Purchased this unit about 4 1/2 years ago. Very please with it until just recently. Stopped running in the heat pump mode. VERY hard to find anyone to work on it. Called GE and finally was able to make an appt with a service company. The repairman arrived, expecting us to already have the part for him. GE told us HE would be bringing the part. He spent over an hour and a half trying to figure out exactly what was wrong with it, all the while on the phone with either his company tech or GE tech. So, he eventually left and had us order the part from GE. Part arrived. Called to make another appt for service. Called the day of the appt (to find out if it would be morning or afternoon when the service guy would arrive)....and was told they had no record of appt. THEN they proceeded to tell us that we were to get the part from THEM....WHY had we ordered it from GE??? AUHHHH. Made ANOTHER appt for the next day. Service guy arrives, installs the parts that GE sent us (2 fans)...still wouldnt work. After an hour on the phone with GE, they decided that the "board" was the problem. Now that is ordered and we are waiting for it to arrive, then there will be ANOTHER service call appt. Have NO IDEA how much this is going to cost us. Yes, GE covers the part in the 10 yr warranty, but not the labor. THREE SERVICE CALLS!!!

product_title: Delta RP50813 Palo Soap / Lotion dispenser,
review_headline: Leave it to Amazon; they HAD THIS IN STOCK!
review_body:
We just remodeled the kitchen (Okay, we are in process... everything that was in the kitchen is now in the living room)

The Delta Faucet we bought is fantastic, and this little gem matches the single dispenser that came with the Faucet. (Somebody explain why Delta doesn't put dispensers in for BOTH HOLES!

Pumping action is everything you'd want it to be. It's quick to prime the pump, and it pumps quantity in accordance with your hand pressure.

The bottle that holds the liquid has adequate room, but considering the difficulty involved in putting high quality dish soap and hand lotion into these bottles, they would have done well to have offered a tube that plugs into a large bottle on the floor under the sink. Short of that, it would be valuable to have received a funnel. The dispensers can be filled without removing the bottles. I don't recommend it if what you're adding is thick. It won't go in through the top. I removed the bottles and tried a funnel and was able to encourage my hand lotion to slide through the funnel neck into the bottle, by poking the dispenser "straw" through the funnel and into the bottle... many times. I'd not want to have to fill this very often. I made a mess, but now have very clean, very soft hands!

I'll solve this problem of filling the bottles and get back to you! I think it may involve water.

product_title: Lux WIN100 Heating & Cooling Programmable Outlet Thermostat
review_headline: Exactly what I was looking for.
review_body: Required piece of equipment to run a manual air conditioner. Turns it completely off when not required, but back on again when needed!

product_title: SimpliSafe Wireless Home Security Command
review_headline: This is the BEST system a person could ever get
review_body: This is the BEST system a person could ever get! I have so much control over where I place the sensors, how many I have, and what i think is important to protect. Plus NO WIRES! The only piece which needs an electrical outlet is the base station and I can decide where to place it. I ordered more display signs and extra sensors and love the fact I am not bound by a contract so I'm not wasting my money. This system is well worth the price for the peace of mind I get daily. I highly recommend this to everyone I talk to about do-it-yourself home security systems.

product_title: Delta Faucet 138293 Greenwich Toilet Paper Holder

The brushed nickel finish matches the door hardware in the room and also the hardware on my office furniture. This gives a nice bright look and with the dimmer, I can soften the look if I wish.

product_title: Hubbell-Bell 6357 Rotary Switch Single-Pole with Single-Throw 2 Circuit

review_body: The product arrived earliy, as a hard-to-find replacement for an heirloom lamp, at a fair price, in a new, pristine conditon. What more can you ask for?

product_title: Watts WH-LD Premier Whole House Filter System
review_headline: A must have for homes with water...
review_body:
I'd recommend a plumber do this install because of the potential for things to leak (just my opinion).
I don't think it's a popular item by the way the my plumber looked at it, but he noticed the metal threads in the cap and gave me his approval. Along with a quality tank, it comes with 3 filters and a tool.
I'm pleased with the results...It's been about 1 month and the filter is starting to get murky, catching all the sediment, sand, & dirt that would be going into my plumbing and appliances.
It's a small investment, but it may pay off by giving my plumbing fixtures & appliances a longer life span by keeping the dirt out...not to mention a nice pre-filter for my drinking water filter setup.
I think it should be on every home's water main (just my opinion)...

product_title: Niagara N2615 Tri-Max 0.5/1.0/1.5 GPM Showerhead, White

product_title: RAVPower Filehub WD03
review_body:
I love this.
I cannot get my computer to recognize my iPhone 5 as a camera despite many hours researching and working with it. I was having to use my husband's computer and it was slow and unreliable (lost many videos)
This solves all those problems.
I can quickly pair my iPhone and Rav and load all my picture and videos to the sd card, then load them to my computer.
The only thing I don't like is that you don't get a thumbnail picture of the videos, just a generic icon.
I also like that I can load movies onto it to use as an external hard drive so that I don't take up valuable space on my phone.
I haven't used it as battery boost yet, but it's nice to know it's an option.
Great invention

review_body:

I used it out at 1,100 ft in partial shade and it worked 90% of the time. Moving it in to about 800 ft, in full sun, it never misses a car. I would recommend this to a friend, may give it as a gift to others or even buy more for myself to put one further away. I only rate things that are 1 star or 5 stars and this is one of the best products I've found and I don't have to change batteries every few months.

product_title: Keeney K835-9 High Performance Adjustable FlushAll Toilet Tank Flush Valve, 3 in. to 2 in.
review_headline: a little too big and too thick, but it works; bad chain
review_body:
First of all, it is a tall flush valve: the overflow tube adjusts from 8.5\\" to 13\\" and is by .5 \\" taller than the OEM. I thought my Eljer Emblem toilet was standard height (it is 9.25\\" tall to the front rim or the flush lever hole), but the valve barely fit, given that the fill valve's critical level should be higher by 1 inch than the top edge of the overflow tube. All the parts seem larger now a days, which does not mean better. A Plumb Craft fill valve I got adjusts from 9\\" to 14\\" but even when critical level line is just 1/4\\" above the flush valve, the total height makes the lid not to fit. You may want to consider getting a pressure actuated fill valve (no float no rod) or measure your toilet carefully.

The main idea behind this patented performance enhancing valve is the funneling effect created by a wider mouth, where the flapper sits and a narrower opening at the bottom of the valve. The flapper is really wide, so make sure you insert the bolts prior to attaching the flush valve or you may have problems with getting them through the holes.

I could not position the flush valve perpendicularly to the tank walls, I rotated it a bit counterclockwise, because the flapper was brushing against the front wall. This would be OK, if it worked smoothly afterwards, but then the chain was catching the flapper, by hanging behind it and holding it up vertically in the air with water running forever, unless I wait and release the flush lever again. If I wanted to rotate the valve the other way, I'd have to disassemble everything and start over. So, I replaced the chain first, since it was really poor quality. This did not help, the smaller gauge chain still held the flapper up until I lowered the water fill level. If this water level proves sufficient, it will save us even more water, though the water saving claims are suspicious even after realizing that the valve leaves 1 inch of water at the bottom of the tank when drained (the seat disc is positioned higher than in the previous valve). So make sure to rotate the flapper clockwise towards the fill valve, not away from it. In my opinion instructions should include this advice.

The tank to bowl gasket is very thick and it did not work for my Eljer (I was warned about it) - the tank wiggled so much with the bolts fully tightened, I had to get a more stable one (designed specifically for Eljer toilets, with bolts' gaskets and 4 tank rubber \\"feet\\" incorporated), which included its own bolts. Also, there are just two tank to bowl bolts included even though the pictures on the package shows three. Not that I need them, but it is false advertizing. However, I liked the bolts from this kit better because they have larger heads and wing nuts rather than standard hexagonal nuts. Extra rubber washers proved helpful, too (why would I ever put metal washers or nuts directly against ceramics?).

It flushes just fine now, we will see how it holds up in time. I did not buy it for performance improvement - my tank leaked at a tank to bowl bolt.

The manufacturer's web site claims that this valve can improve performance OR reduce water usage. The flapper's cone has an internal rotating slot, which will reduce water usage the most when positioned in front and improve performance the most when turned all the way back.

By the way, it took me a while to learn that a standard 2 inch flush valve's diameter is not an exact measurement and may actually be as large as 2 1/4 inch (the gasket fills in the space) and all the toilets built prior to 1994 complied with this standard.ed higher than in the previous valve). So make sure to rotate the flapper clockwise towards the fill valve, not away from it. In my opinion instructions should include this advice.

The tank to bowl gasket is very thick and it did not work for my Eljer (I was warned about it) - the tank wiggled so much with the bolts fully tightened, I had to get a more stable one (designed specifically for Eljer toilets, with bolts' gaskets and 4 tank rubber \\"feet\\" incorporated), which included its own bolts. Also, there are just two tank to bowl bolts included even though the pictures on the package shows three. Not that I need them, but it is false advertizing. However, I liked the bolts from this kit better because they have larger heads and wing nuts rather than standard hexagonal nuts. Extra rubber washers proved helpful, too (why would I ever put metal washers or nuts directly against ceramics?).

It flushes just fine now, we will see how it holds up in time. I did not buy it for performance improvement - my tank leaked at a tank to bowl bolt.

The manufacturer's web site claims that this valve can improve performance OR reduce water usage. The flapper's cone has an internal rotating slot, which will reduce water usage the most when positioned in front and improve performance the most when turned all the way back.

By the way, it took me a while to learn that a standard 2 inch flush valve's diameter is not an exact measurement and may actually be as large as 2 1/4 inch (the gasket fills in the space) and all the toilets built prior to 1994 complied with this standard.

product_title: Eddy Water Descaler Electronic Water Softener
review_headline: 6 months after installation.... not perfectly scale free, but much improved.
review_body:
There seems to be much confusion as to what this product is supposed to do. So I will start with what the manufacturer says it will not do and I did not expect it to.... It does not remove anything from your water. If you will have your water tested for hardness before and after, if there is any difference, it is not because of the Eddy Electronic Water Descaler. This product does not make your water feel any different or soap lather better.

What it does do is prevent the minerals in your water from adhering to the inside of your plumbing, things like shower heads, faucet aerators, clothes washer, dishwasher, inside of your water heater, etc. The minerals are supposed to simply pass through the system and down the drain.

SIX WEEKS ago I installed a new water heater to service my 5 bedroom, 2 1/2 bath home. At that time I also disassembled and cleaned the mineral crust from every shower head, faucet aerator, kitchen sink sprayer, etc. I installed the Eddy Electronic Water Descaler the same day the new water heater went in. The Eddy was installed in a location that protects everything in the house, hot and cold side. In the past, when I descaled all that I described above, within 4 weeks I was seeing evidence of scale build up again. (Note: I have city water that is reasonably good quality, but still some mineral content) After six weeks with the Eddy, I see nothing yet. I won't call this a definitive test until I get to 5 or 6 months out with the same result.... but so far so good. I'll update this review at six months.

SIX MONTHS out now... I am starting to see a need to clean shower heads and the kitchen sink sprayer. So, I have come to the conclusion that under my conditions of city water, with light mineralization, two people using water here, the Eddy reduces the need to clean scale from faucets and sprayers from every 30 days to about 6 months. An additional benefit is that cleaning is easier than it was before... the scale that is there now is not as firmly attached.

This is my last update on this product.is there now is not as firmly attached.

This is my last update on this product.

review_body: I bought this to replace my old Rapid Fit bathtub drain plug and it works perfectly! I was glad it was so easy to install, too. Then I just followed the instructions that came with this new plug to install it -- took less than two minutes. If your existing plug still has the top on you should be able to just hand-twist off the chrome knob, then remove the nut that's underneath the knob to separate the top from the spindle, then twist the spindle out with your pliers. product_title: Grohe 31251000 Pure Chilled and Sparkling Dual Function Faucet
review_body: This is a unique product in the US market, but it has a fatal flaw in the many geographic locations where tap water is soft: the carbonation level is much lower than in bottled seltzer. That means, for example, the water out of this system is pretty flat in most of New England and in NYC due to the low carbonate hardness in public water supplies. Otherwise a very trick system and probably great where carbonate hardness levels are high. Contact your local water authority before ordering to obtain carbonate hardness levels. Also might not be a bad idea to discuss with Grohe tech support before ordering, they are very helpful.

review_body: Love this light, just wish the batteries lasted a little longer. I converted our old pantry with bi-fold doors to a walk in pantry and we needed light. Instead of tearing into the walls and running electrical (which I could do myself), I decided to give this a try. Works great! As soon as we open the door the light comes on and is more than enough light for the pantry. It works day or night without fail and turns off in a respectable amount of time. There are times it turns off before I would like it to, but then I just move and it turns back on right away. My only quibble is I wish the batteries lasted a little longer. I figured being LED they would last a little longer...but then again if it were a regular incandescent I'd probably be changing batteries weekly and the light output would be abysmal. For our need this is a 5 star product.

product_title: Schlage A53TUL625 Polished Chrome A-Series Tulip Keyed Entrance Door Knob Set A53PD-TUL
review_body: I put three of these locks in thirty years ago and never had one problem, and they got used a great deal. I recently changed three entry doors and tried Schlage residential secure key and regular lever locks. I did not know this lock I installed 30 years ago was a light commercial lock, but I can sure tell now. These new Schlage lever locks are junk compared to my old A53PD TUL. The new lock when you open it with the key outside has to be relocked when you come in or with the key. The original lock had a button on the inside that stayed in even if you unlocked it on the outside, so you didn't have to lock it every time you came in. If you manually turned the button on the inside and let it pop out, then it would stay open one both sides but once you push it back, it stayed open on the inside but always locked on the outside. You can also tell the quality of both locks, and the residential feels like it could be ripped off with your hand but not the old lock.

product_title: Genie GER-2 Garage Door Opener Universal Emergency Release Kit
review_body:
Installation was easy and I tested that it works properly. The lock is on the cheap side. One tip: make absolutely certain that you install it such that the teeth of the keys face up when you insert the key into the lock. Otherwise, the key may not be able to turn in the lock because gravity is going against the springs inside. At least, that was my experience. Once I installed it with the correct side up, I tested it to work a bunch of times with no problems.

Edit: okay, now I realize the actual problem with the lock not turning. The instructions tell you to cut down the bolts that attach the lock to the door, but they don't tell you why. The reason is that when the cylinder on the lock turns, it also causes the steel cable to rotate. If the bolts are long enough, they block the cable from rotating, which blocks the cylinder from rotating. So it is important to cut them short or rig up some other solution to that problem. I used a Dremel cut off wheel.

product_title: Stanley Hardware 2-Inch and 50-mm All-Weather Solid Brass Security Lock
review_body:
Solidly built, heavy, and weather-resistant are apt descriptors for this Stanley padlock. It certainly gives the impression of being well-constructed and strong. I bought it for an outdoor hasp.

By the way, it's important to be sure the hasp is as strong as the lock. This should be pretty obvious, but I learned the lesson the hard way. I lost two inadequate hasps that a thief cut off around the lock shackles, thus defeating the locks without even touching them. The locks themselves were left on the ground undamaged.

product_title: Little Giant Ultra Step 300-Pound Duty Rating Fiberglass Ladder
review_headline: Step Right Up to the Next Level
review_body: A well built gadget ladder that works in a variety of situations like unlevel surfaces or stairwells. It is the best ladder I've ever owned. Here's a couple of bits of information that might be helpful: 1. When fully extended, the highest rung/step rated safe to stand on is 69 inches above the level ground surface. It is the second rung from the top. So, this 8-foot ladder offers a maximum safe standing height of 5 feet 9 inches. 2. The next step up - or the first rung from the top - is labled with \\"Danger\\" and \\"Warning\\" stickers. \\"This is not a step.\\" Well, it is built just like the other rungs and is solid. Therefore, it is a step, if you have uncanny balance and want it to be a step. It is 80 inches above level surface, but I wouldn't want to stand on it without something sturdy to hold on to. Another thing that makes life easier with this ladder is a good quality silicone spray like CRC Heavy Duty or NAPA. Don't use the foaming junk! Silicone does not collect dirt and dust like WD40. It is a clean lubricant. Spray the sliding boom, latches and hooks as well as the slide locks on top. After playing with the ladder right out of the box for a few minutes, I sprayed it with silicone. What a difference. It adjusts and glides into position smoothly. 34 pounds is not an issue. Move on up to the next level, which, for a change, is one you can actually see and touch.

product_title: Wattgate 381 AG Audio Grade Duplex Receptacle, Silver
review_body:
After spending an inordinate amount of time howling at the moon, my wolfen brothers and I ran through the arctic forests of Johanngeorgenstadt, Germany hot on the trail of the No-armed man. I could still hear that tragic, heart-wrenching melody of Do The Limbo Dance from the [[ASIN:B0000070S1 Looking For-Best of David Hasselhoff]] concert where I had tracked the No-armed man and been ambushed by a lead pipe to the back of the head. Only now the shoe was on the other foot, and the three wolves and I chased after the No-armed man with the help of their keen sense of smell and the radioactive tin of [[ASIN:B000796XXM Uranium Ore]] I had been mashing against the side of my head for warmth.

Finally, after thirty years, I saw the image I had burned into my retinas, the No-armed man running ahead of me, almost within my grasp. My wolfen brothers stopped me, knowing I would catch the No-armed man now, and said their farewells. This was not their war, as much as they may have wanted it to be, and knew that I must go on alone now. We laughed, we cried, we remembered many stories that we had shared, and then we parted ways.

I ran after the No-armed man and quickly caught up to him at the edge of an enormous cliff. To one side of him flowed a massive river that dwarfed the Amazon, to the other side of him rose a sheer cliff, and behind him, a drop of nearly one mile to the placid surface of the lake below. And yet his deadliest choice was infront of him, me. It was then that I heard his voice for the first time and his words shocked me to my core.

\\"I didn't murder, John W. Trimmer, the author of [[ASIN:0870334336 How to Avoid Huge Ships]],\\" he said. \\"And he's alive with your ex-wife.\\"

product_title: Ventamatic CX2500UPS Cool Attic 1650 CFM Energy Efficient Power Gable Mount Attic Vent
review_body:
Construction:
1. The fan shroud is flat with only one formed rib. This allows the shroud to contort once mounted causing the fan to hit the HEX head (should have been round-head) mounting bolts. Additionally, it is designed to be put into a PRE-CUT CIRCULAR HOLE of the exact size to give the shroud needed stability and prevent distortion to the shroud. *Plywood NOT INCLUDED.

2. The available mounting slots in the shroud are limited to two choices which, AGAIN, limit you to a PRE-CUT CIRCULAR HOLE in a sheet of plywood for mounting.

3. The electrical box is slightly undersized with no shielding for the 'hot' terminals going into the thermostat. An unshielded standard Romex ground can easily come into contact with either of the hot terminals if you're not EXTREMELY careful when putting the cover back on.

4. There is no vibration padding/dampening anywhere at any of the mechanical connections.

5. NOT BALANCED!!! The fan blade unit was either not balanced or the hub was not perfectly centered. It is vibrating and loud in the house.

Conclusion:

I WOULD NOT recommend this fan.

This was a replacement fan for me. Because it was so flimsy and would not fit a straight top and bottom frame support, I disassembled it from its shroud housing and put it into my old shroud. Once in the sturdy shroud from my old unit, the fan had the balance issues; balance has to do with blades and would not change in a different shroud. We'll see how long it lasts.

product_title: Rinnai RU98IN 9.8 GPM Indoor Ultra-NOx Condensing Tankless Natural Gas Water Heater
review_body:
I had this model Rinnai installed in February 2013, so I've been using it for 5 months now.

Usage:
Usage is *almost* like when I had a tank water heater. There have been some minor annoyances. The biggest annoyance, and most reproducible, is when I shave. When I shave, I turn the hot water on, run the razor underneath, and turn it off again. Shave a section, water on, rinse razor, water off. Repeat. Eventually, the Rinnai decides that I'm not using any hot water and does not heat the water. Every single time I shave, I have to deal with eventually getting cold water from the tap when I ask for hot. I have called Rinnai tech support and they were unable to help with the issue. If not for this issue, I would give this model 5 stars.

I think the culprit is a problem with their flow rate algorithm - I am actually using enough gpm (gallons/minute) to keep the heater on, if you average out my usage while shaving over a whole minute. However, during smaller windows of that minute I use 0 gpm and so the Rinnai's computer shuts off the heater. Rinnai, please fix this and you'll be rockstars.

There is a smidgen of longer latency when you turn on the hot tap until when you get hot water, but it's hardly noticeable.

Energy Usage:
During these periods I lived in a 2 person household with 4 bedrooms, and I switched from a large tank heater to a large tankless heater (this one). My natural gas usage during spring and summer months (not using the air heater) has dropped, on average, in half - from 12 therms/mo to 6 therms/mo. This only saves me about $6/mo, but I'm happy to reduce my environmental impact. I also have a gas stovetop and dryer, so my gas usage isn't all for hot water.

I also measured the electricity used by this Rinnai - it uses about 0 watts when idle (as it should) and 30 watts when running. 30 watts is slightly more than I expected, but it at least does not run very often.

Installation:
You should know that this is not going to be a simple job to replace a traditional tank water heater due to these complications:

* The RU98IN uses a dual venting system which combines intake and outtake in a special pipe. IIRC, the exhaust pipe is inside of the intake pipe in concentric circles. It may be a pain or impossible to run an additional vent, e.g. to the roof. In my case, it is mounted on the external wall so it vents through the wall outside.

* The RU98 requires a 3/4\\" gas line, and your tank water heater may have used a smaller line.

* This RU98IN also has a condensate drain, and so you must locate the water heater near a drain. Warning: the condensate is somewhat acidic so if you have older iron drainpipes you may want to not install this system. On the plus side to the condensate drain, the condensate itself is a by-product of this unit efficiently burning natural gas - so there is a good reason for it.

* The RU98 also requires an electrical outlet to be nearby. If you don't have one there already, you'd need one installed.

Maintenance:
About once a year you should clean and flush the system to prevent scaling (flushing might only be in hard-water environments?).

Update: I completed a maintenance cycle a year after installation. It was fairly easy and I used these Amazon products:
[[ASIN:B002NJ99PS PETRA X1109-8FF-TP Black Rubber Washing Machine Hose, 8 Foot]]
[[ASIN:B000X05G1A Superior Pump 91250 1/4 HP Thermoplastic Submersible Utility Pump]] (The pump works great, though it is higher velocity than is required)

product_title: Waterpik RainFall Showerhead with Adjustable Arm, Chrome #JP-130
review_body: I got the WaterPik JP-130 to replace a shower head that was set too low for my husband. Installation was easy enough, though, we had to purchase plumber's white tape to get a good seal. Other showerheads I've purchased have come with the tape included which is why I took off one star. The arm was long enough that my husband can step under it and still have clearance from the wall. It creates a soft fall of water that I really enjoy and the head is large enough that I am actually able to wash my hair more quickly as it hits more of my hair at one tim. I've not had any problems with the thumb screws and I have been move the unit quite often so that I can shave my legs. I've loved this product so far and would definitely purchase again.

product_title: Delta Faucet 7-Setting Hand Shower
review_headline: Excellent showerhead for an excellent price
review_body: You get what you pay for. At under $30 this is a great showerhead for a great price. I purchased it during a bathroom renovation for my guest bath. It has received nothing but praise from those that have used it. Was very easy to install. Yes, there are plastic pieces, but go ahead and hand tighten them, they won't break or leak if you give it a good, tight turn. It is a durable product. I have no leaks whatsoever. Good water flow on any setting. And it looks sharp with a modern, sleek design. UPDATE - sad to say one year later I had to replace this shower head because if starting leaking water from the plastic connection connecting the head to the tube. I took it apart, cleaned it well, reassembled tightly and still kept leaking. So, my first line above \\"You get what you pay for\\" is definitely applicable here.

product_title: Bagster 3CUYD Dumpster in a Bag
review_headline: If I could give negative stars
review_body:
DO NOT BUY A BAGSTER!!!!! The product itself seems to be fine. The customer service is probably the worst that I have ever seen. The day of my bagster pickup I came home to find it sill sitting in my driveway with no note attached, no phone call, nothing. I called customer service to find out the problem, and they had no information to give me but assured me that they would call me back and get it resolved. Next day no phone call and no pickup. Called back and got yes sir we will get it rescheduled and picked up ASAP. Three days pass and no call, etc. I call them back after noticing a $50 fee on my credit card from them. After speaking to a rep I asked to be transfer to a manger but was transfer to scheduling. Finally she transfers me to a manager. Then she tells me all sorts of BS about not being able to access the bagster in my driveway (BTW - my drive is 35 feet long and 11 feet wide with plenty of space to get in and out. Then they said it was obstructed by a Ford Explorer (There was no car in my driveway at the time plus I don't own Explorer and live alone). My question was why didn't the driver a) call me b) leave a note. Of course these questions cannot be answered. After asking for a refund for my $50 I get answer that she will forward it to her Ops Manager who will then decide if I get my money back. Of course I will never see this money again.
DO YOURSELF A FAVOR - if you can, pile the debris somewhere on your property cover it with a tarp and call a LOCAL junk/debris removal company. You will save at least $70, a giant headache, and can sleep well knowing that you are supporting a local business instead wasting your money with Waste Management.

product_title: Legend Wave Style Lever Handle Privacy Bed and Bath Leverset Lockset
review_headline: Quality levers at a great price. See UPDATE after three years:
review_body:
These Legend handles were a great buy! They are attractive, sturdy and inexpensive when compared to their competition from the home improvement stores. This variation is the one you would use for a door you wish to have the option to lock, like a bathroom or bedroom door. There is a turn knob on one side of the levers. Included with each box is a two sided lever, a striker and a tumbler mechanism along with the required screws. We replaced ALL (21) of the doors knobs in our house with these types, some locking, some key-locked and some standard levers; they all look, feel and operate great. Installation was simple, too. The price of these levers was about two thirds that (64% to be exact) of the home improvement store. I handled (pun intended) the brand at the home improvement store and it felt to be of similar quality to these Legend levers. Overall, these were a great buy and they add a subtle elegance to our home versus our old builder-installed brass knobs.

UPDATE 7/2017: These levers continue to look and function great! After almost three years installed, I have no real complaints. If I had to point to a few very minor nitpicks it would be that the outside levers (exposed to the elements) have had a bit of their finish wear off; I kind of give that a pass though. Also, some of the springs in the frequently used levers have weakened a bit and the lever hangs slightly below a perfect 90 degree angle...however for non OCDers that shouldn't be an issue. I still definitely recommend them.

product_title: Milwaukee Hand Trucks 30151 Flow Back Handle Truck with 7-Inch Puncture Proof Tires
review_headline: Very good handcart/dolly for home use
review_body: I knew that I was going to move twice this year so I decided, after years of pondering, to purchase a dolly. I figured that they would be expensive but I was surprised when I found this one. I read some of the user reviews and the price I bought it at was a no brainer. If the previous reviews were wrong, then I wasn't out much money. Anyways, I have to say that this little guy is just right for light moves around the house. I would not recommend this for heavy use as I think it might not hold up. However, if you are moving, or move stuff around the garage or house and your back just isn't up for it anymore (like mine) then get this. If you're feeling like you might want something more then get a cart with inflated tires. But for home use this is more than adequate.

product_title: Tommy Bahama Ceiling Fans TB135DBZ Cabrillo Cove Tropical Ceiling Fan
review_headline: Balanced itself, really moves the air, lots of light, great quality
review_body:
If you are short on patience or arms, you might want to choose the paddle-blades instead of the tropical blades. It comes with both sets. The tropical blades make it difficult to wire up, because they are wide, and you have to reach around them and really extend yourself to get everything wired correctly. It can be done though - my husband ended up reaching around it with one of the blades mashed against his face to wire it. It wasn't very comfortable, but it can be done.

Installation at first went along amazingly simple, at the end of step 4 to step 5, I realized the directions in section 5 were for NO LIGHTS, and I needed lights, so make sure to pay attention there, as the book didn't seem all that clear to my husband, and he ended up having to redo the fan so we had a light.

On 6.3 in the directions, it shows 2 wires just exposed hanging, and it doesn't tell you what to do with them. We put caps on each one. It would be nice if the instructions were more clear there. In any event, that did the trick and it worked.

It came balanced and it is PERFECT. We didn't have to use a balancing kit at all. It works really well, it puts out a lot of wind - I could feel it across our kitchen/dining area, and our old fan could never be felt that far away.

The hanger bracket and the hanger ball make it really easy to put into place while you do the wiring. In the past, we had ceiling fans where it took 2 people, but with this, you put the bracket up, and set the fan in it, and it holds it fine until it is wired up. We had a bit of a business interruption, so work on the fan had to be stopped for a day, but it hung in place until the next day when we could finish it.

Don't be intimidated by the electronic receiver. My husband commented that it looked like an octopus with the wires coming out of it, but they are color coded and easy to match.

We only have 8' ceilings, so we didn't extend it down, but it's fine for clearance when mounted 'short' for us. For inside use, you don't have to stuff the wires in this little box- so there's a bit more care that needs to be taken with the wires for outdoor use.

For right now, I put it in my kitchen, and I love the color- it's a rich chestnut brown. I did have a white fan there, but the blades constantly showed any dirt, this one won't do that. Also it is a lot brighter than the one I had - the old one only had 2 lights, this one has 3. It comes with 3 compact florescent bulbs too, which was a nice bonus.

The remote works well - it runs on a 9 volt battery that is included. It comes with a holder that mounts to the wall. They included a bit of extra hardware in case anything got dropped.

It's a very solid attractive fan, and there's no wobbles at all, and it really moves the air. It's easy to see the quality of it by just looking at it. It's very well made.. For inside use, you don't have to stuff the wires in this little box- so there's a bit more care that needs to be taken with the wires for outdoor use. The remote works well - it runs on a 9 volt battery that is included. It comes with a holder that mounts to the wall. They included a bit of extra hardware in case anything got dropped. It's a very solid attractive fan, and there's no wobbles at all, and it really moves the air. It's easy to see the quality of it by just looking at it. It's very well made.

product_title: Fasco D727 5.6-Inch Direct Drive Blower Motor, 1/3 HP, 115 Volts, 1075 RPM, 3 Speed, 5.9 Amps, OAO Enclosure, Reversible Rotation, Sleeve Bearing
review_headline: I'm happy to say it worked out great and fit existing ...
review_body:
I have Payne 376B 24040 furnace, wich, according to my long research calls for motor HC39SB115 (newer part number), which is only available from few retailers and ranges from $350 to $790(!) in price. There is no way I wpuld pay that, to I took a bit of a risc of getting this generic unit. All parameters seemed to match, the only grey area was sizing. There was no info on its diameter, which was critical to fit into existing mount.

I'm happy to say it worked out great and fit existing mount perfectly. Wiring was very easy (reused stock plug harness) and it works great and quite.

Having looked around I found that the trailer supply companies were asking for a ridiculous price on these things. I turned to trusty Amazon and found what I was looking for and it was less than half the price. The knob arrived on time and was an easy install. The directions also gave instructions on how to accommodate various door widths. If your in need of a quality knob at a good price, this should work for you. Also.........The door had an existing extended door latch so I swapped the latches and it worked like a charm.

product_title: Nest Learning Thermostat - 1st Generation T100577
review_body:
The Nest Learning Thermostat is a great upgrade to a smart thermostat. The Nest was very easy to install and the included instructions were very easy to follow, making installation only about 20 minutes. I probably spent more time re-spackling and repainting the wall that our old thermostat covered after installing the Nest (The Nest has a very small profile and doesn't take up as much space on the wall as the old thermostat). Nest.com even has a video tutorial on their website to help you walkthrough the installation process if you need it. Everything you need to install the Nest is included in the box, so just use your existing wiring that came with your old thermostat.

The Nest is also simple to use and it makes saving energy fun (as well as addictive). :) We had this now for a little over a month, and we look forward to seeing how much we have saved with this neat little appliance.

product_title: Viribright Lighting 73547 Benchmark LED A19 10-watt 60-watt replacement lamp
review_body:
The ViriBright Benchmark LED bulb is an excellent quality bulb. Matrix Lighting has done an amazing job at mimicking the color temperature of a burning tungsten filament that we are used to with traditional incandescent 60 watt bulbs.

Humans have evolved throughout the history of the world lighting their environments with fire. Campfires, candlelights, gas lantern, and incandescent bulbs. That is the core of the problem with CFL and LED bulbs to date... we want fire, we don't want the cold, pulsating, and frequency humming light generated by many of the CFL and LED bulbs sold today.

But this ViriBright bulb offers what we want. A true 2900 color correlated temperature. I've seen other bulbs claim these numbers and lower, 2700 in one case, but no LED light I've seen comes this close to looking like a incandescent.

This bulb is also running at 10 watts, which is a lot of bang for you wattage.

For reference, here's some of the bulbs I've tested and use:

[[ASIN:B00AYII2YE SWITCH - SWITCH75 - 18.5 Watt - 2700K Warm White - Clear LED Light Bulb - 1100 Lumen]] - This bulb is probably the reining all around champ. It's bright at 1100 Lumen, has a great color of 2700, solid build, and is liquid cooled so that you can put it in enclosed fixtures. But it runs at 18.5 watts and is expensive. It's also hot as hell after running for awhile. The light spreads evenly throughout the room.

[[ASIN:B006OTAE8Y Philips 418590 17-Watt A21 LED Household Light Bulb, Dimmable]] For the price, this is a great bulb. Perhaps the color looks a little too \\"orange\\" and not enough \\"fire\\". The light spreads well but is more directional than the Switch and the ViriBright. It's also bright at 1100 lumen. It runs at 17 watts. This is air-cooled, like the ViriBright, and cannot be placed in an enclosed fixture.

I've used and tested other older technologies but would not buy these new bulbs new today, so I'll leave them out for now. If I was to buy new bulbs today, the ViriBright, the Switch, and the Philips are what will be added to my cart.

An advantage of the ViriBright is that it is running at 10 watts, compared to the 18.5 and 17 in the above examples. The disadvantage is that it only outputs 800 lumens compared to the 1100 in the above examples. A disadvantage of the ViriBright and Philips bulb is that they cannot be placed in an enclosed fixture, the Switch can. The color of all three of the bulbs are good.

I'd recommend this ViriBright bulb in lamps or open-air fixture of a room where more than one will be used. I could see three of these lighting a room really well. Bravo, excellent product.e them out for now. If I was to buy new bulbs today, the ViriBright, the Switch, and the Philips are what will be added to my cart.

An advantage of the ViriBright is that it is running at 10 watts, compared to the 18.5 and 17 in the above examples. The disadvantage is that it only outputs 800 lumens compared to the 1100 in the above examples. A disadvantage of the ViriBright and Philips bulb is that they cannot be placed in an enclosed fixture, the Switch can. The color of all three of the bulbs are good.

I'd recommend this ViriBright bulb in lamps or open-air fixture of a room where more than one will be used. I could see three of these lighting a room really well. Bravo, excellent product.

product_title: PUR by Whirlpool Refrigerator Water Filter "FILTER1" W10295370A (Pack of 1)
review_headline: A bad purchase, a Bad System for me
review_body:
I use these made by Pur with my Whirlpool refrigerator and they last a month. I tested Total Disolvable Solids with my HM Digital water tester and get a great reading of 46 without the Whirlpool filter. Incredibly when I run water through the filter I get a reading of 47ppm.

I have had a bad experience with either the filter, the fridge it was built for with an in the door ice maker or the combination of the two. I now keep a filtered pitcher in my fridge and get Zero ppm.

No one at Whirlpool seemed to care enough after I spent $1500 on a new refrigerator and had service come out several times. They said it must be my water. Tests proved otherwise. My old Kenmore(made by Whirlpool) worked great with it old style filter.

product_title: Mr. Beams MB722 Battery Powered Motion Sensing LED Stick Anywhere Night Light
review_headline: Mounting restriction and short duration make for an annoying light
review_body:
I bought these to install in our bathrooms to provide a little ambient light so we wouldn't have to turn on the main lights at night. The sensor works well and the light is plenty bright (brighter than I prefer actually), but there are two things that really annoy me. First, the bracket requires that the light be installed as shown in the pictures - that is, the LED shines down. I wanted the opposite - I wanted to mount the lights near the ceiling, shining up, so that a soft reflected glow would light the room. The light is much more pleasing that way. The bracket doesn't allow this configuration (it falls off the wall if you try), so I ended up just using the double-side sticky tape to mount it the way I wanted. That's fine for now, but I worry I'm going to rip the paint off the wall when it's time to replace the batteries, not to mention the tape may not re-stick.

The second problem is the short duration of the light. It only stays on for about 30 seconds, which is not enough time for me to finish my...umm...business in the middle of the night, leaving me standing at the toilet in total darkness. It doesn't work to wave my arm to re-activate it as the sensor is not sensitive enough for that. You have to move your whole body several inches, which is not a smart thing to do when you're peeing in total darkness. Worse, it does reactivate as I walk away, unnecessarily lighting an empty room for another 30 seconds.

I don't know if another night light would have been a better choice, but knowing what I know now I wish I had done more research.

product_title: Genie 33950R Garage Door Opener Limit Switch for Genie
review_body: Since I am reviewing four products today I will copy and paste this review into all four for easy cross reference for anyone else who goes through what I did. All four products came from Sanford and Son? Overhead Doors and fulfilled by Amazon. All four shipped quickly and arrived very fast. The three Genie parts were the same as the originals. I was replacing the Genie 34107R.S Screw Drive Carriage which had stripped and was no longer opening the door (http://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B000CST1L4/ref=cm_cr_ryp_prd_ttl_sol_14). I believe this stripped because the Limit Switches were installed in a shabby fashion on my garage door opener, the Genie Excelerator screw drive system, and the open limit switch (http://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B00286CVAQ/ref=cm_cr_ryp_prd_ttl_sol_3 ) stopped working (both switches, for some reason, the wires were run under the switch itself and srewed onto the rail, which caused them to strip over time because the wires were not tied down properly using the clips; versus just using the clips and tying the excess wire in a loop with a twist tie at the end closest the power head assembly) . The Excelerator will shut off when enough force is exerted on the bumper mechanism, so even though the open limit switch stopped working the door would stop once it pushed hard enough against the bumper. However, this use of force to shut down the system over time wore down the screw drive carriage (took a little over a month for me). Since the close door limit switch (http://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B00283OBXY/ref=cm_cr_ryp_prd_ttl_sol_8) had also been installed improperly and also seemed like it was having problems (sometimes it seemed to work, sometimes it seemed force was taking over) I decided to replace the whole setup. So, two new limit switches, a new screw drive carriage, and a tube of the grease folks seemed to recommend over the higher priced Genie brand 3 pack (http://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B000FJ07W2/ref=cm_cr_ryp_prd_ttl_sol_7) and I'm back in business. I am no expert, believe me, but the install of all three was a very easy one person job. Simply release the carriage from the Curved Door Arm, unscrew the one screw from the Head Bracket, and lift the rail high enough to slip off the old drive carriage. Have the new carriage ready to go and slip that right on. Lower the rail back on the head bracket and screw it back in place. Reconnect to the Curved Door Arm. The limit switches unscrew and screw easily back on. The wire clips just pop off very easily and are easy to reuse. The new limit switches do not come with the screws that hold them in place, so make sure to keep your existing screws because you will need to reuse them. I used the clips to hold down excess limit switch wire until I reached the Power Head Assembly, and then I just rolled up the rest of the excess, tied it up with a twist tie, and laid that on top of the Power Head Assembly. The greasing directions that Genie provides with their grease (available here from the Homedepot site ([...]) has you wipe down the rail before you put the new grease, and then wiping off excess once you grease the screw drive shaft. Not sure how necessary that is, but I did it, and then found I needed to do a few runs of grease along the rail to lube it up right. Maybe they meant wipe off mess that does not go on the drive shaft or rail...because you need the grease on those. One final note, once I reassembled eveything I realized the rail was not straight because the carriage was moving on an angle. It turns out that the Rail Strap had bent (this thing is heavy metal) presumably because of force causing the door to stop closing instead of the close limit switch. I had to go back and take that off and bend it by hand to straighten it out. Two months later and all is working...although I need to hire somebody to come out and balance my door because I realized when I took everything apart that the door came down very hard when not connected to the system and it should almost be balanced and not go down at all. Since balancing a door could be a bit dangerous I am choosing not to try that.

product_title: GE GEH50DEEDSR GeoSpring Hybrid Electric Water Heater - Energy Star
review_headline: How I Cut My Energy Bill for Water Heating by 76%
review_body:
My home's nineteen-year-old LP Gas water heater was starting to show its age: brown rusty water, high gas bills, and a gas smell every time we went into the garage. While the old gas water heater still worked, we didnâ€™t want to wait and be stuck with no hot water and a 2 year old needing her bath time. It was time to begin looking for a new water heater.
My wife and I had noticed many commercials advertising the efficiency of instant gas water heaters. Even our gas company had a deal with financing. After asking a professional on Green Home Guide we focused our search on finding a heater that has a high â€œEnergy Factorâ€ (EF).
We researched the following water heating technologies:
1. Solar thermal: The best on energy factor however didnâ€™t meet our budget and had to be installed on the south side of our roof which was the front of the house. My wife didnâ€™t like that.
2. LP Gas tankless: The energy factor is around .94 and is consider by most to be more efficient than the LP Gas tank water heater we currently had at .63 efficiency. Honestly this was the one we thought we would go with from the start. However, I would advise you to weigh the pros and cons before purchase. We found out we would need a water softener to prolong the heat exchanger, warranty coverage, and a larger duct vent through the roof than the one we currently had. A three to four inch duct vent is required. This added 40% to the original price quote. We also noticed a lot of false promises on true savings.
3. Electric tankless: The energy factor was comparable to the gas instant/tankless. However we needed to upgrade our electrical panel for the install because the electric instant water heater pulls more amps than the standard tank water heater. Plus they advised us a water-softener or pre-filter would be a good idea too.
4. Hybrid water heater: This product appealed to us because it was the most innovative and had the highest efficiency -- EF 2.35. Plus it was a lot cheaper than going thermal solar water heating. It also still qualified for the Energy Star tax credit, and was more efficient than gas instant or electric instant water heating.
We decided to buy the hybrid, a GeoSpring Hybrid-Electric Heat-Pump Hot Water Heater.
What ultimately made me buy a Geo Spring water heater?
There are several factors I considered.
â€¢ The product and the GE website information were great.
â€¢ High efficiency over conventional models without having to go thermal solar. I understand thermal solar watering heating is the best. However so is the hybrid water heater in my opinion and the return on investment is shorter.
â€¢ Price was less than going thermal solar with having to install panels on my roof.
â€¢ No commission to a sales person.
â€¢ Warranty.
â€¢ Tax write off! Use IRS tax form 5695.
â€¢ Easy to install. I didnâ€™t have to install a gas tank, or cut holes in my roof to go thermal solar. I could put it in myself! This one was a big reason for me! I like things done right and other ways to learn about appliances or ways to save energy and protect the environment at the same time.
From $1,038 per year to $250.56 per year
Based on DOE test procedure, my projected energy costs for water heating with the GeoSpring will go from $1,038/year to $250.56, a reduction of 76%. That means I'll recoup a return on investment (ROI) in less than two years, not counting the $300 Energy Star tax deduction or the 27% reduction in kWh rate I'll get from my utility by moving into a lower usage tier. My cost for the GeoSpring water heater was $1,356 and I installed it myself. I estimate it would cost $300 to have a licensed plumber install it.
I should mention Iâ€™m a Florida State electrical contractor, active RESNET Class 1 HERS Rater, and I installed this unit myself. However, that didnâ€™t mean I knew how to install one of these or knew all the answers on efficiency. I found several YouTube videos on how to install one of these and read the installation instructions front to back, picked up the material I would need to do the job and installed it without any problems. I think it took me longer to take that old LP Gas water heater out and clean and paint the area prior to installing the new heater.
I should also mention it works great. My wife is happy with plenty of hot water, no complaints, plus we have a garden Jacuzzi tub and it filled it up with plenty of hot water. I keep the setting in the eHeat (most efficient EF 2.55) mode most of the year and in the Hybrid (EF 2.35) mode in the winter months in Florida.

Your mileage may vary
Please do your own research. I live in Florida where the Geo Spring Hybrid will work great because itâ€™s warm most of the year and the incoming ground water temperature is around 75 degrees.
However, if I lived in Ohio I would never install one of these because the temperature split is too high. The incoming ground water temperature there would be around 55 degrees. Most people would require LP Gas or Natural Gas fuel to heat more efficiently in that climate.
What should you check prior to installing a Geo-Spring water heater?
Location: The GeoSpring gives off 56-db of noise which is less than a box type fan running. If installing indoors fan noise, space required, and condensation drain will have to be considered. If installing in a closet the door will have to be vented to allow air to circulate around Heat-Pump. This unit works best with 700 cubic feet of air around unit for proper air circulation. I installed mine in the garage where itâ€™s warmer and has space around it to evaporate the warm air to heat the water more efficiently.

Climate: Southern states in my opinion would be the best option on increased energy savings.

Cost: Check around, I purchased mine at Lowe's and extended the warranty up to 10 years for $80 dollars after the one year warranty runs out.

Contractor: Are they licensed? Did they pull a permit?

Needs: Do I need a 40 gallon, 50 or an 80? Geo-Spring only comes in a 50 gallon at this time. However we have a garden Jacuzzi tub and it fills it up just fine with plenty of hot water.

Full article: http://greenhomeguide.com/how-i-cut-my-energy-bill-for-water-heating-by-76

product_title: Culligaan Filtered Shower Head with Massage, Chrome Finish
review_headline: Great value - good for low pressure....well water.
review_body:
We live in a home that has well water, which at times can get really hard...especially during the winter months in the north east. My wife has been asking for a simplistic solution to bring some sort of filtration to our shower and this product fit the bill. Installation was easy....but I did have to pull out the channel locks to get it done. Recommendation...when using channel lock pliers with this, simply wrap a paper towel or small towel around the area where you will use the pliers...it will avoid unsightly scratches.

With well water comes low pressure - which is a problem for us using any shower head. However, I was quite impressed with this shower head. I simply removed the water saving restrictor - as per the instructions - and installed the shower head. While its not the BEST shower I have had...it is adequate for most low pressure situations.....especially because the shower head has an easy to turn dial with multiple spray/massage configurations.

Great value, great filtration, and excellent settings.

product_title: Zenna Home 600W Shower Rod Cover, 60" x 1" x 1"
review_headline: Such a simple thing so helpful
review_body:
I am SO GLAD I found this on Amazon as you can't find them much or at all in stores locally it seems.

This simple little inexpensive and uncomplicated invention makes a big difference in one of those little ways that matter.

How many times and ways do we experience \\"little\\" annoyances that happen all too often. Nothing major but a source of irritation. Like, for instance, taking a nice shower after working outside getting ready to relax and chill but its always annoying hitting that little bump in the middle of the shower rod that sometimes leaves the curtain coming off one or two of the hooks which have to be put back eventually before the hooks fall off. Or the fact that it just looks messy. But mostly for me its that \\"struggle\\" every time I shower.

This hasn't revolutionized my world, I haven't experienced any huge financial changes one way or the other on account of it. It just makes my life a little smoother and that's nice.

Everytime I get out of the shower now I am reminded of what's missing, that annoying tug. And I admit I feel a little smug because I found an answer to something that's no big deal. It is, however, something I think a lot of people have just learned to live with. How can something so small be so nice and make me so glad I found, for this one \\"issue\\" in my life - an answer.

The only thing I would say as advice as to \\"how to\\" install it is that you will probably have to cut off a few inches from one end or the other. That's what I did which was no big deal. Thing is, though, there is a sticker on one end (manufacturers seem to LOVE STICKERS that you can't UN-STICK to save yourself) that is aesthetically a small blemish detracting from the \\"tidiness\\" I like. If I had noticed ahead of time there was this sticker which is about an inch and a half long that is the end I would have cut off but as luck happens so often, if there is a 50-50 chance of getting it \\"right\\" I got it wrong. So I had to try to scratch off this sticker thing which I wasn't totally successful at but \\"enough\\" to get by. It's not a huge thing but nice if you get it right and cut off the sticker end instead of the unblemished part. That's the only thing that could have made this nicer. I HATE STICKERS. What is the love affair anyway with stickers that defy removing? I don't notice it much or at all, I just know its there and it would have been better without it.

Anyway, with or without the sticker this has made my life more pleasant in one of those little simple ways that makes me a happier person. Who knew happiness comes in such small ways? A NICE, SMOOTH addition to an otherwise \\"rough\\" world - and it doesn't cost a fortune, the shipping was SUPER FAST, actually delivered by a carrier service within a couple of days which was a nice surprise too. I highly recommend it so you too, can be among the smugly self-satisfied who don't have to tug at the shower curtain AGAIN, a solution easy, fast and cheap. What could be better?

I'm glad they had an option here on Amazon to buy JUST ONE because I don't need a box of 20. The option I found for one combined with the shipping fee was still probably cheaper than if I had found one locally. product_title: Tiger Brand Jack Post JS-36 1'7-3' 15GA Jack Post
review_headline: This jack post jacks...or posts (however you want to look at it)
review_body: We installed a wood stove. The floor joists below were suspended by Teco hangers. Yeah, yeah, I know that they are really strong...but I was paranoid about having a 400 pound red hot inferno load suspended by some folded up sheet metal...so I used a 4x4 to span the joists and snugged it using these jack posts. Did I accomplish anything? Heck, I don't know. But I sleep better at night. So for that, I give these jack posts 5 stars. If you buy them, you just might sleep better too.

product_title: Zoeller 30-0181 1-1/2" PVC Check Valve with Slip Unions,
review_body:
This review is being written 6/9/2013 for the Zoeller 30-0181 Check Valve, 1-1/2 Inch, sold and shipped by third party vendors who advertise on the Amazon website.

The precursor to this model had a slightly different design where the valve came apart in the middle with four bolts, and the flapper was a replaceable item. This model is sealed and the flapper is not replaceable. This valve has the same rugged flapper design (reinforced with a metal disk) as the previous design. The flapper opens completely, unlike many cheaper valves, hence the \\"full-flow\\" claim. However, do note that this check valve is a 1 1/4\\" design with universal rubber couplings that connect it to either 1 1/4\\" or 1 1/2\\" PVC pipe. Therefore, if you use 1 1/2\\" PVC piping, you will not get the same amount of flow through this valve as you would with a model that has a 1 1/2\\" minimum diameter. This design allows Zoeller to sell one product with a single set of rubber couplers for both applications. Turn the rubber couplings one way or the other to accommodate the correct PVC pipe diameter for your application. Also note that this check valve does \\"klunk\\" with a loud snap. If you are concerned about the noise, you may want to consider another model with a different design. Otherwise, if you want a reliable, high quality check valve, this is a good choice.

I've uploaded some pictures to show the full flow design and the orientation of the rubber couplers.

review_body: I attached it to a Craftmade Model P152 fan. It fit perfectly. Should work on any fan that accommodates a universal light fixture with threaded nipple. The picture does not show it, but there is a threaded nipple protruding from the top of the fixture for installation to the fan. For the Craftmade, I had to remove the plastic button in the bottom center of the fan control housing (where the fan switches are). This light fixture then threads right in. My fan already had wires in the housing for a light fixture, so I just had to attach the two wires from this fixture to those wires. The brass on the fixture is bright brass, but it does have a more buffed look than the mirror-like finish of the fan I attached it to. I can't imagine anyone noticing the difference unless it is pointed out to them. Note that this fixture does not come with shades for the light bulbs. It uses shades with a standard 2 1/4" base, which you can get from a home supply store or here from Amazon.

product_title: Restore Deck Restore Kit
review_headline: Finished about 1/3 of my 560 sqft deck...
review_body:
This is a review of my experience in using Restore. I am still in the process of finishing the deck so obviously I do not have any long term results. What I can offer is how easy/difficult it was to apply, texture, coverage, too hot? etc.

Coverage: Their website states that 1-4 gallon container will cover a 100 sq-ft area with 2 coats. I used just over 2-4 gallon containers to cover a 14x15 area (or 210 sq-ft) with 2 coats. I also did all the top rails and a few stairs with 2 coats. So, the coverage was spot on (if not better). Why was it spot on for me but poor for others? One possible explanation is that the weather has been relatively cool for this time of the year.

Texture: I am specifically looking for the textured feel as we have kids and have friends and family over often for the pool. The texture turned out exactly how I was hoping and am extremely happy. We are not having any issues with it being way too rough to walk on or as others have described, \\"like walking on rocks\\". Why did the texture turn out ok for us? Possible explanations can be read below...

How easy/difficult to apply (and prep): Use their rollers. Do all the necessary prep work - power wash (sand if necessary), mask off any areas (like you house). Their website talks about applying extra material to nail holes and larger cracks before you do the 2nd coat. I took the extra step to fill in any larger cracks and deep nail holes with caulk before I did the first coat (their website also talks about using caulk if necessary). I did this before the first coat because I wanted to eliminate filling in b/t the 1st and 2nd coat. It worked. Filling in the larger nail holes and cracks took some time but not as long as you think - quick bead then swipe with putty knife. I think it saved me time in the long run - plus you don't have to constantly stop and fill stuff in while you're just trying to focus on using the roller. Its just roll and go (in onedirection). I also brushed a light coat of the Restore solid stain in between the deck boards before I applied the thick stuff. This will greatly improve the visual appearance once the thick stuff is applied. I suggest using both the smaller and larger rollers - the smaller works great in the tighter areas. It will be somewhat weird when first applying but just like with anything new you'll find your rhythm. The first coat will be blotchy but the 2nd coat will fill it in nicely. First coat dry time was quick - 3 or 4 hours but I waited til the next day to put the 2nd coat on. I learned that the thicker you put the 2nd coat on AND the less you roll and re-roll over it the better the texture will turn out (less \\"rocky\\"). The material will start to lay down as it dries - rolling over it too much causes it to lay less and get \\"rocky\\", IMO. About it being too hot to walk on - I can't really say much on that yet b/c it has been relatively cool in our area for this time of the year. What I can say is this - we have 2 decks - the pool deck is composite and the larger deck is PT. Before Restore both decking materials got extremely hot in the direct sun (with the composite being the worst). We put a few outdoor rugs down and problem solved. So, will the Restore get hot? I would imagine.

TIPS: I used a roller grid that went right in the bucket vs a pan. Much easier IMO. I bought a $6 mixer and just left it in the bucket behind the roller grid - this allowed me to quickly attach the drill and mix if necessary (I did not have to mix that much - maybe twice per coat). I used a putty knife to scrape out the excess product that oozed in b/t the boards and scraped this on the next board I was going to do - no need to waste the product. Lightly re-roll to knock down where you scraped in b/t the boards - done.

I've finished @ 1/3 of my deck (@200 sq-ft) with 2 coats - took me 6 hours to apply the thick stuff. So, I'm looking at another 12 tofinish the deck - but won't be surprised if it takes less time. The majority of my time invested in this project has been the prep work. Sure, putting the thick stuff down takes a little extra time but, if I'm being honest, once you find your rhythm it's easy to put down. So, if you're considering doing the Restore - don't let the negative reviews steer you away - just make sure you prep, follow the instructions and take your time. After all, if you're supposed to get 8-10 yrs out of it (gimme 5 years and I'll take it) - don't you think it might take a little longer to put down? Oh, and I never added any water. Good luck Restoring...

product_title: Honeywell Wi-Fi Smart Thermostat with Voice Control
review_body:
Pros.
Easy to install, Honeywell provides multiple videos to hook this up regardless if you have a C-wire or not they have a video for you.
Easy to connect to with wifi, If you can connect your phone to wifi, or a laptop you will have no problems connecting this.
Provides outdoor weather update pulled from internet.
Full color gradient.

Cons.
Voice recognition is not as great as I like. I need to be within about 20 feet and can not have high amount of ambient noise.
The wire inputs are split to each side making it a little more difficult to get wires in, and tucked away.
The screws should have came with washers, the head of the provided screw will almost go through the screw slots. Especially if you over-tighten attempting to get flush against wall.

Note:
The Item is smaller than it appears, double check dimensions. I would also advise buyer to check their C-wire condition. (Do you have one? If no do you have the tools and means to add one, or use an existing wire if needed.)

product_title: Intermatic TN311 15 Amp Timer for Indoor Lights and Decorations, Grounded
review_body: Like others have stated, it may or may not turn on or off at the time selected. I set it to turn on and turn off three hours later. I was not around when it turned on, but I assume that it did so correctly. I returned six hours later and it was still running. It did not turn off in three hours as programed. The "off" pin did move the switch about 3/4 of the way to the "off" position, but not far enough to turn the connected device off. Unfortunately I waited too long to return the item. It seemed to work the first time I used it, but failed the next usage after the return period.

Didn't get full stars ONLY because of the stress it caused before we figured out WHY it was going off. Other than that small issue, it seems to do it's job extremely well.

product_title: SentrySafe H4300 Fire-Safe Waterproof Security File, 0.7 Cubic Feet, Silver Gray
review_body: I have a number of Sentry Safes, they are fireproof for a length of time and this is the first one I've bought that is also waterproof, another nice feature. Their locks are make for locking, they're not real tamperproof, as I found when I lost the keys for my 1170 model and we were able to pick the lock within several minutes. In case you happen to have an 1170, this one opens a bit differently. With the 1170, you put the key in, turn it and can pick up the lid. With the H4300SG, after you unlock it, you have to press down on the lid while gripping and pulling up the lid at the same time. This probably serves the purpose whereas if the safe is unlocked and knocked over, the lid won't flop pen and possibly let items fall out. If you deal with something like bad arthritis in your hands, you might find opening the H4300SG a bit difficult. The Sentry safes do serve their purpose at a reasonable price; they don't take the place of a safe deposit box. The one I bought from Amazon was in \\"used - like new\\" condition, I saved money on it going this route. The condition was as advertised and I'm happy with the purchase.

Even the tag on the lamp describes the color as orange so I'm not sure why Amazon has Blood Orange written on their website description. I've had great experience with Amazon so I figured no big deal, I'll return them. I can't return the lamps! Amazon is telling me they are not eligible for a return. No where was that stated on the website when I initially placed my order. I even went ahead and placed the lamps in my cart again to see if I missed some fine print. (Which it shouldn't be in fine print anyways) and I was correct. No where does it say that the item cannot be returned. I am hoping they can fix this situation as I wait on hold....

product_title: Ivation 2-LED Super Bright (46 Lumens) Automatic Motion & Light Sensing Nightlight - Battery Powered & Stick-Anywhere Design - Wall Mounts Included
review_headline: Turns ON During A Power Outage!
review_body:
The power goes off in the middle of the night and you are left to fumble for a flashlight in a drawer - if you have one. Or, you need to get up and walk to the bathroom or anywhere and need a readily available flashlight. This is HIPE's newest multi-function light and it's so easy to use.

The unit is a tray that plugs into the wall socket and the flashlight sits in the well - charging (simple induction). It has a three-prong plug, but this can be rotated at 90-degrees to fit the situation. The tray has a Â½\\" thick LED blue light that stays on for a permanent nightlight. You can set the unit to ON, OFF or AUTO. The bottom switch is not labeled well, so you need to experiment a bit.

In the middle of the night, if the power goes off, the Light automatically lights up. The six (6) bluish LED lights are very bright and will illuminate the room easily. The button on the side will light the flashlight with one press. A second press will put it into strobe mode. A third press turns it off. I would suggest placing this near your bed for convenience.

When there is a black-out, the HIPE light will stay on until power is restored. I have not experienced this yet with my unit, but the idea of it not turning off means it will drain down. When you are done, simply switch the button to OFF. This will start to recharge when power goes back on. Because it is powered by an internal Lithium Ion battery, you never need replacement batteries. Remember those heavy flashlights with the Size 'D' batteries? Those are history and when you compare the price of this light to any ordinary flashlight, you'll wonder what took this invention so long to arrive.

Like all of HIPE products, they are environmentally friendly. This unit was generously supplied to me for an honest review.

product_title: SkyBell SkyBell Wi-Fi Video Doorbell with Motion Sensor - Version 2.0
review_headline: Skybell Wi-Fi Video Doorbell 2.0 - I like it
review_body: I want to say up front that I had a marvelous experience with tech support. Rosemary V. was very attentiveness and had a genuine desire to assist the customer. I am happy with my new Skybell wi-fi video doorbell 2.0. The security/mounting screw on the bottom of the device took a little work (the screw was the only sticking point), and I had to switch my Linksys 5 ghz router to a dual-band (2.4 ghz & 5ghz), because skybell would only function with the 2.4 ghz band. As I was resolving the band issue, my doorbell chime still worked with Skybell mounted and before it was fully functional. Skybell works well with my Samsung Galaxy s6 Edge. I am now enjoying the functionality I read about as I researched online before my purchase. Rosemary V, thanks for your expertise and professional demeanor.

product_title: 7876400 Alloy 42-Inch Gun Metal Indoor Ceiling Fan, Light Kit with Opal Frosted Glass
review_headline: Fan is nice, however, original Westinghouse remote DOES work for light controls
review_body:
Update: customer service from Westinghouse is great. I wrote to them and someone actually called to troubleshoot the problem I was having. After going back and forth the tech finally determined that the receiver unit is defective... And he was right. Fan and remote both work flawlessly now. I'm a happy camper and westinghouse won another customer over with their service!

------------------------------------
Fan is a little smaller than expected but it looks great and works without any issues.

Originally I ordered a generic ceiling fan remote for this fan and that works without any issues. However, the original Westinghouse remote control is more attractive (I have another fan that came with the remote) so I went ahead and ordered another one for this. However, after connecting all the wires, the fan works but the light doesn't. It does not turn the light on nor does it dim the light.

It's frustrating that a generic and much cheaper remote control works without any issues but the genuine Westinghouse remote that I paid more than twice for doesn't control all the functions on a Westinghouse fan.
