product_title: TurboTax Basic 2003
review_body: I was hesitant to buy Turbo this year after having left to buy TaxCut last year when Intuit had the arrogance to put spyware into their product and add a disturbing activation process. I had always been a Turbo user but was so incensed at last years shenanigans by Intuit that I switched to TaxCut (and would do so again, should they initiate the same nonsense as they did in 2002). In any case, TaxCut in not even remotely as user friendly or robust as Turbo and given the opportunity to have Turbo as it was in 2001 and prior I have gladly come back. After reading the reviews on Amazon I hesitated, but am glad I gave it a try. The installation (on a Win 98 machine)was flawless (except for a minor glitch of it crashing my system when updating the software the first time). Useability is as good as always, in my opinion, which as I've said is light years ahead of TaxCut. In light of the options available on the market, Turbo is the clear choice (unless you want to suffer with a lesser product like TaxCut -- which I will grudgingly do again if Intuit plays games like they did in 2002!)

product_title: Microsoft Windows 7 Home Premium Upgrade Family Pack (3-User) [Old Version]
review_body:
Great price on an awesome OS. When installing on your second and 3rd PC make sure to answer and you call the MS helpline make sure to answer no to installed on multiple PC's and talk to the MS rep, let them know your using the family pack and you should be good to go. I cant say enough good things about Windows 7. Using it on 3 PC's, networking and security is a breeze using home group and related permissions. Can use media center for free OTA DVR recording, and share out recorded TV and family videos for the whole house. I have done a ton of Win7 Installs for friends and family and the great majority of hardware is detected right off the bat. Occasionally you may need to tweak a setting but by far this is the best MS OS to date. Its fun to use and easy to manage and works with alot of software. Pro edition adds Domain logons and XP mode, however most shouldnt need these features and can still use MS Virtual PC or VMware for similar functionality. Media Center is fun to tweak, if you do this with a 15 IR remote you can use your PC isntead of Tivio or other similar PVR/DVR solutions. For most this will save 60-80$ a month on TV costs and when coupled with netflix and Hulu offers up some great programming. We get 60 stations in my city over the air which is more than enough. My kids havent complained one bit and have many new programs they love to watch on PBS and Qubo.

Detection of network devices and hardware is a snap. Any Dual core 2Ghz plus machine with 2GB ram runs great, but for the record I have even tested on a 5yr old Latitude D610 with 1.5GB ram and even that system runs fine. Bottom line is this OS is simple enough for a novice and loaded with features for anyone who wants to take advantage of them. Drives a little closer to a Mac but with tons more software applications and flexability. I love runing virtual PC sessions for work and fun and how well it all integrated between Win7 PC's.

product_title: ZoneAlarm Internet Security Suite 2008 - 3 User Pack
review_headline: It had bugs, but they have been fixed
review_body: Well, I have had this software installed on an old Dell Windows 2000 machine and on a new home-built Win XP machine based on an Intel motherboard for less than a year. I can not say that I have been too happy with the overall performance of this product, but it seems to be working well now that it has the latest patches. By the way, they don't tell you that their version 8 and higher software does not work with Windows 2000. So if you want to run an old Win 2K matchine, don't go for this software unless you can get the last of the Version 7 software - version 7.0.483.000. I had the same negative experiences that the above reviewers had, but again, they are now corrected. My XP machine does run the latest version 8 software and it seems to be working great. My Win 2K machine has to run version 7.0.483.000. and it does OK. Can't really complain about the Win2K machine as it is so slow anyway and is no longer supported by Microsoft anyway. Regarding the reviewers that gave this software a 5 star rating. I find it hard to believe that these are legitimate reviews. I would actually suspect these reviews as being sales pitches from the Zone Alarm folks. I find that this company is a little questionable in how they deal with their customers and their customer service. I have seen them delete negative comments on their software from their user forums. They have never lied (that I am aware of), but I simply felt that they do their best to put a rosey picture on their product. As one reviewer above noted, their Tech Support put the blame on my other programs when ZA practically brought my XP machine to its knees. I also was told to disable my other programs until I found \\"the culprit\\". Well I didn't do that. I have those programs on my computer because I want them there. Better that ZA should fix their product, which they eventually did. However, they never simply came out and took the blame for a defective product update. I used to love their freefirewall and this was why I decided to try their full service product. Hopefully these bad experiences were just growing pains that ZA is getting past, but they have damaged their reputation by failing to be completely forthcoming with their customers. The unwritten rule of bad publicity: tell the customer about your mistake, take responsibility for your mistake (with a sincere apology) and then take corrective action.

product_title: MacSpeech Dictate [Old Version]
review_body: I bought this software for transcribing handwritten documents and interviews (I listened to the interviews and repeated the words into the microphone). Unfortunately, it was almost always faster for me to type because the program makes a LOT of mistakes. My interviews and documents have tons of proper names and uncommon older words in them though, so I think MacSpeech might work better for other kinds of dictations or transcriptions. I also find this program to be extremely buggy. It usually crashes at least once per day, even after I installed the updated version. I used MacSpeech quite a bit because my wrists were getting strain injuries from typing, but I usually just ended up getting really frustrated. Maybe with a lot of effort, I could train MacSpeech to better recognize my voice, but I'm not willing to invest more time than it would take me just to type the transcription in the first place. I admire what this program can do, but I don't think I would buy it again.

product_title: Bulletstorm: Limited Edition
review_body: I like this game and I'm sorry to hear that a 2nd edition won't be forthcoming. I would like to see them simply change the rating system or find away to make sequels available. Yeah, it glorifies creative ways to dispatch enemies, but many FPS do. They just don't always rate the creativity.

product_title: Microsoft Office Home and Business 2013Â (1PC/1User)
review_headline: worst software and really worse product I've ever used
review_body: worst software and really worse product I've ever used. Virtually unworkable , slow, prone to locking, up bizarre malfunctions, failure of outside software, (Neat receipts, Firefox) are routine. Loaded with features You will neither want or need. It's also slow so be prepared to look at the spinning blue circle more than you have since 1995.

product_title: Kaspersky Anti-Virus 2011 3-User [Old Version]
review_body: AOK

product_title: Windows Vista Home Premium with SP1 [OLD VERSION]
review_body: Installed about a year ago without any problem on Vista certified hardware. It was running ok with one annoying problem - it was constantly loosing the video settings every time I reboot. Then these wave of security patch start to roll in. I only use the PC for watching blu-ray movies and after installing 100+ security patches, the system is so slow that I cannot finish 90 minutes movies without rebooting the operating system. Microsoft eventually did fix the video resetting problem (one of those 100+ patch fixed it), but OS is pretty much useless for doing what it is design to do. Now I have to make a decision to add additional memory to satisfy this memory starving OS (I am currently running with 2 GB) or wipe it clean and install Windows XP.

product_title: Block Financial H&R Block Tax Software 14 Deluxe + State
review_headline: H&R Block Worked Great - Bye Bye TurboTax
review_body: Said Goodbye to turbotax in 2015. Had no problems installing H&R Block , updating, importing the 2013 TT data from the TT file, and had no problems adding 2014 itemizations and filing. I appreciated the lower cost than TurboTax. I appreciate the absence of nag and marketing screens and pop-ups that TurboTax inundated me with. I would have zero reservations to use H&R again, but might try Tax Act in 2016 if it is a better price. Goodbye forever Intuit!

product_title: Pro Music Composer
review_body: It seemed like a good program for the money but it is worthless without an authorization code which you will never get They have no email and no Web site. Save your money and buy a good program

product_title: Microsoft Office 2010 Home & Student 3PC /1 User [OLD VERSION]
review_body: I don't think anyone would complain about Microsoft Office. The 2010 version is definitely different from my old 2003 version, but it does have more fancy functions and icons to do the work. Amazon got a great price that I was able to purchase below the price offered in other electronic stores.

product_title: H&R Block At Home 2013 Premium + State
review_headline: Tax support did not support a form I had to file
review_body:
I have used this program for about 15 years. This year I was very disappointed. I was an enrolled agent some years ago, so I believe I have a better than average knowledge of income taxes. I needed to use a form not used commonly, Form 982, while preparing my son's taxes. When I clicked on help, it said the program does not support this form. It said to open the form, fill in the figures and close the form. I researched on the IRS website.

Next morning, I called H & R Block support. It is only technical support, not tax support. The only way you can get tax support is by live chat. I put live chat in the search bar and it kept telling me their live chat did not support my web browsers. I have a new computer with the latest versions of Google chrome, Internet Explorer and Mozilla Firefox. Back to researching the IRS website. The support technician told me to call the IRS. If I have to do that, why did I buy a tax program that is supposed to have unlimited tax support?

product_title: Parallels Desktop 9 for Mac
review_headline: Parallels Update Installs Unrelated Daemon Without Permission
review_body: I will NOT upgrade to Parallels 9 until this is removed: \\"When a user upgrades Parallels Desktop, he is asked if he wants a free six-month subscription to Parallels Access. Even if he says no, the product is installed on his system and the application is started each time the system is rebooted.\\" [...]

product_title: Intuit Quicken Deluxe 2009
review_body: I have used Intuit's Quicken for many years and have considered Intuit to be one of the best software companies around. However, I was not completely satisfied with my Quicken Deluxe 2009 experience. First of all, since 2007, Quicken has not had a Basic Edition for around $30. I don't need a Deluxe Edition for around $50. That is why I didn't upgrade in 2008, but had no choice in 2009 if I was going to upgrade at all. When I installed Quicken 2009, the program would not run. The Quicken logo flashed on the screen and disappeared. I restarted and reinstalled Quicken. I had the same problem, so I checked what support options I had, as I had never had to contact Intuit support before. I was disappointed, to say the least, that Intuit does not offer free telephone support, but warns of a $25.00 fee. Moreover, Intuit calls you back; you cannot call in directly to get a support agent. So I had to settle for Chat support. I did get the problem resolved, but it took thirty minutes, whereas it would have taken about ten minutes if I had been able to talk to a live person on the phone. It turned out that I did not have the right mapi32.dll. The Chat support agent did pick up this problem pretty quickly, and once the new DLL was installed, Quicken worked. The mapi32.dll problem may not have been Quicken's fault, but I first spent five minutes trying to find troubleshooting help on the Intuit web site, and this solution never came up. I had previously thought that Intuit's help information was the best in the industry. My opinion of Intuit has moderated from 5 stars to 3 stars. Quicken is still probably the best such program around, but 2009 may not be as trouble free as it has been for me over the last ten-plus years.

product_title: SMARTSUITE MIL ED 9.8.2
review_headline: A great suite of programs - I LOVE that I can use Organizer again!!!!!
review_body:
About six months ago, my trusty XP computer that I had used for many years quit working. I knew I didn't want to move to Windows 8 with all the complaints about it not running half the programs I have come to love over the years, so I bought one with Windows 7. I was able to load most of my older and well-liked programs, but was VERY sad that one of my favorite programs of all time wouldn't load - Lotus Organizer. It is, by far, the best program of it's kind ever made!!! I loaded it on my laptop running Vista just so I wouldn't lose all of my contacts or my Christmas Card list, and quit using the daily calendar and to-do functions all together, and started using the crappy alternative in Office. Well, I'm happy to report that I found a version of Organizer that works perfectly in Windows 7 in this suite of programs, and I couldn't be happier!

There are a couple of things I wanted to mention for those who have been trying to do the same thing. First, this entire suite loaded on my Acer running 64 bit Windows 7 flawlessly. Word Pro is almost the same as I remember AmiPro from years ago, and Lotus 1-2-3 is SO much better than Excel. However, if you try to upgrade (convert) your .or2 file from Lotus Organizer release 2 like I did, you'll be disappointed that it won't convert, even if you compact it first. I'm not sure why this version 5 won't convert it because it says it should. But, don't give up like I almost did. The way I worked around this was to export the contacts, anniversaries and any other categories in the older version of Organizer as either ansi or ascii text files and then imported them into the respective categories in this newer version. Every file came through flawlessly doing it that way. After a number of months missing my trusty old Organizer, it's back - and just as good as ever!!!

product_title: Windows 7 Professional SP1 64bit (OEM) System Builder DVD 1 Pack (New Packaging)
review_body: Good

product_title: Norton Internet Security 2005 - Single User
review_headline: NIS - has the most features - but NO backup!!! - and a UI from Hell
review_body:
(this review is of the Spyware edition)
NIS takes 25Megs of ram - ok for an all-in-one (if you have <256Megs your lightweight CPU can't carry enough armor to make Windows really Zero-day Net safe IMHO)

NIS has most of the features I look for in a firewall/spyware/virus scanner/intrusion detector, BUT
half don't work right, and some that do seem to fight every attempt to make them work.

Even after LiveUpdate this week,
One buggy automatic firewall rule autoloaded, and port 80 was open listening half 'naked' on the Internet.
I replaced it, and at the first passing probe my rule was erased, autoreplaced, naked again.
Only after I stumbled onto the secret trick (add a block all rule after the pass rules) did it close it.
It took 11 clicks (!) just to add the block all rule - miserable!
The log is a nightmare - pages of long sentences explaining \\"permitted once\\" 200 times, no actual info
until I click on one of them. What's worse is, none of them I checked WERE \\"permitted once\\" IIRC.

NIS detected 2 trojan/spywares, but could not remove either.

Enabling program component monitoring started an avalanche of popups, all suggesting I block access, but I actually DO want IE to access the internet.
Running Windows update brought a popup asking if 100's more dll's are ok. How would I know? I do want Windows updated.
Great feature in theory, totally useless even if you know the names of every evil dll not yet invented.

If you have more than 1 or 2 programs not in the automatic ruleset, plan to either \\"permit all\\" or spend many hours actually writing the same set of 3 rules over and over for every autoupdating program you use - assuming you understand TCP vs UDP etc. Why no \\"permit all local + DNS + outbound port 80\\" choice? That would mean 1/10 the work! Jetico lets me pick \\"web browser\\" ruleset, so its UI from Hell gets used once per category.

After spending all day and half the night getting it working, I discover that it is not possible to save my precious rules - or to reload them. I would be less furious if I had a fresh install of windows, but not much.

All good, until a program autoupdates, and 3 more rules to write. Too angry for words.
Jetico lets me clone the old rules or edit them to update the program sig.

I would not use NIS if you paid me 10 times its price.

product_title: Microsoft Windows 8 Pro - Upgrade [Old Version]
review_body: If you are PC user get ready to get frustrated.. Windows 8 is not user friendly at all.. everything I could do in Windows 7 now it takes me several more steps to do in W8... Some key features from Windows 7 were simply removed, like start button and integrated search. I'm very unhappy with Windows 8 and I'm actually going back to Windows 7..

product_title: PHP With MYSQL Essential Training
review_headline: Excellent way to learn dynamic web development
review_body: Could you imagine being able to write a site like Amazon.com from scratch? Well if you master everything in this title you will have the basic knowledge toward that end. Even though he creates a real contact management system, the theory is similar and you can continue from there. I taught Math and Computer Science professionally, and I bought this tutorial to learn the specifics of putting together a dynamic website using PHP (I'm a Java, VB, SQL, and C/C++ programmer). I may be a bit biased with my background, but this guy is a top notch instructor and speaker. I sat thru the entire course, even though what I was really interested in was the very practical website he sets up at the end. Many of the concepts in php are built on C and Java. Although its not a language that would win any awards from the Computer Science community (extremely loose typing for example), it is EXTREMELY powerful and will make writing web applications faster and easier. The array and string processing functions are nothing short of remarkable, and make it SO much easier for a new programmer to write effective programs. One line of code turns a delimited string into an array, or vice versa. Sure you can do many of those things in C++, but you would have to be an expert programmer. PHP is wonderful. There is also considerable background on SQL/databases. This title is well worth the money, this course in a private college would be well over a grand. He takes you from installing the necessary software to finalizing a website that can be developed into something much larger. If you have even the slightest background in programming you should be fine. I would give this 4 1/2 stars if I could, because it may require some extra effort for the absolute beginner. If your computer experience consists of web surfing and MS office, depending on your aptitudes you may find it a bit difficult, the same way some people find foreign language or music difficult. Others can start speaking Chinese from a web tutorial. Again it depends on you. I would strongly suggest a pre-requsite of Basic HTML and CSS from free sites such as w3schools (google for others), maybe even a programming tutorial from there. However, the title is very good because many \\"easier\\" tutorials will leave you feeling dry at the end and you won't really have anything to show for it. With my experience in teaching programming languages to newbies, you may have to devote many hours, pause the video and do some googling to solidify these concepts. Becoming a great programmer needs time, patience, and dedication. Do not expect to simply watch the videos and become and expert. Bring a notebook and take notes, type each example into the text editor. Sometimes he will ask you to complete something that he started, and I would be a bit intimidated if I were totally new to programming. I suggest going through those exercises two or even three times until you completely understand it. Again, consider spending a few hours a day for a month to master this material if you are COMPLETELY new to programming. A professional programmer may pick up php fluency in less than a week. This video would be great in a corporate setting to cross train front end web personnel into programming if they are working on a project. Also, considering how web-centric the world is today, even management and non-technical types would benefit from the intimate understanding of what goes into a dynamic-data driven website(he gets into business analysis of the programming situation). Even if you aren't going to do the programming, understanding this title can help you leverage other resources and help you get the best result. Mr. Skoglund also has an advanced PHP video published[...], I will probably be purchasing that too in the near future. http://www.amazon.com/MySQL-Beyond-Basics-Kevin-Skoglund/dp/1596715413/ref=sr_1_3?ie=UTF8&s=books&qid=1253132473&sr=1-3

product_title: QuickBooks Pro 2011 - [Old Version]
review_body: Last year I was Forced to buy Quickbooks 2010 as many things like sending PO's to customers was no longer available. There are things that I do like, the Company Snapshot but the ad's and the constant barrage of \\"Pay for this service\\" and it's built in obsolesces have show me not to trust Intuit. When they start to remove services so that they can sell me the next version I would prefer moving my company to a ledger book and buying a bunch of pencils at Staples! I will not buy from this company again as they are not trustworthy and will be looking for alternatives over the next 2 years.

product_title: Family Tree Maker Deluxe
review_body: Great software.

product_title: Adobe Premiere Elements 12
review_headline: Very hard to understand program, plus they want me to purchase another add on to go with it.
review_body: Very hard to understand program, plus they want me to purchase another add on to go with it. This program might be good for a master, will take for ever to understand it.

product_title: MacFonts Series 3
review_body: Nice, received like new! I would recommend buying. It has a lot of fonts to use on my Mac computer

product_title: Bryce 5
review_body: If your on any kind of budget and start choking when you see $500 or $1,000 for 3D software this is an excellent product. Bryce 5 has an easy to learn interface that allows you to move and alter objects, change atmosphere, and change camera views without having to beat it with a stick. The program lets you save objects, textures, and atmospheres you've created into the program so that they're always there when you come back. It also comes with alot of preset object and textures you can use, so you can create an image the first time you open the program. This isn't the program you want if your trying to do complex character animation, but it's really good for landscapes, architecture, and background. If your not sure this product is for you go to a few 3D sites and look at images people have made with Bryce 5. I've been using it for a year and I'm really happy with it.

product_title: Microsoft Windows 8 Pro - Upgrade [Old Version]
review_body: Bought this upgrade to install over Windows XP on an older computer with 3 gigs RAM. Installation went smoothly. I don't have a touch screen monitor, but you can easily get to the more recognizable desktop with one click. My main complaint is that several of my old programs don't work with this OS. Those that do work seem to be just fine, It's a new OS so will take some getting used to. It seems like it was designed to try to make the desktop interface match that of the Smart phone and tablet computer.

product_title: Professor Teaches Office 2013
review_body: Any big-name personal software product, there's probably a "Professor Teaches" for it. These series are well-designed. You can learn in short segments, just a few minutes a day if you like. You can learn basics, or you can go deeper into more advanced features. Nice combination of typical screen demonstrations, having you rehearse manipulating how to do things, and an audio track explaining the thing as you go along. Other helpful features include choosing the location of installation if you like, choosing whether to download all of it or just key parts if space is limited, and picking up where you left off last session. If you want to understand Office 2013, this is a handy product--and the prices for their products have been dropping over the years too.

product_title: Kaspersky Anti-Virus 2012 - 1 User [Old Version]
review_body: I orginally used Norton for years but after purchasing a new computer at Best Buy over a year ago, Kaspersky was installed on it. I have liked it better than Norton and have become a Kaspersky customer. When my 2011 ran out I searched for the Cheapest buy and found the 2012 here on Amazon.

product_title: Norton AntiSpam 2004
review_body: Symantec tech support helped me to tweak my Outlook Express and get Norton AntiSpam to work as advertised. I gave it 4 stars instead of 5 because it didn't work on my system right out of the box.

product_title: Kaspersky Internet Security 7.0 3-user [OLD VERSION]
review_body: This program slowed my computer and had a lot of irritating popups that were asking \\"do you want to . . . \\" In addition I had a re direct virus that it did not get rid of. I had to download a pc tools anti spy program to get rid of it.

product_title: Learn French: Fluenz French 1+2 for Mac, PC, iPhone, iPad & Android Phones, Version 3
review_body: I purchased french 1+2 about 2 months ago after I tried the demo session on their website. I love how the material is arranged and I always feel I am learning gradually at a nice pace every session. I just finished the french level 1 today and I am going to continue to level 2 immediately. I already got 3+4+5 after it's released before thanksgiving, and I am sure I will continue to learn with the program and will not give up. thanks Fluenz team for putting this wonderful program together, you are really really helping me learn something i never thought i can :)

product_title: H&R Block At Home Deluxe + State 2012
review_body: Easy to install and easy to use. I like the interview format. I would recommend this to a friend without hesitation.

product_title: TurboTax Premier Federal + E-file + State 2011 [Old Version]
review_body: I've used Turbo Tax for many years now and never had a problem. It goes well with my Fidelity Account, Bank accounts and my Quicken software. Combination keeps home accounting organized and accessible.

product_title: Windows 7 Professional SP1 64bit (OEM) System Builder DVD 1 Pack (New Packaging)
review_headline: WIN7 was a great OS. I would keep it but WIN10 will be necessary for implementing some of the of the many changes coming now.
review_body:
I used XP until win7 was released. I still maintain two XP PCs for things that were never upgraded. I liked it a lot, matched my style and was stable. WIN7 was flexible, handled new hardware well and was a real workhorse. Easy to master, once mastered, never had to do any head scratching. I just looked on the internet if I was stumped and there were many good answers.

I am not real thrilled with the changing of WIN PC OSs, but one has to change to keep up with changes in hardware and software.

product_title: Microsoft Windows Small Business Server Standard 2003 (5 Client) [Old Version]
review_body:
I just took on setting up my first small office network. We have four computers and a desktop that someone set up to run as a server. The 6 gig harddrive had long seen its time and needed to be replaced. I bought a Dell PowerEdge SC420, 4 Windows XP Professional upgrades (from Amazon at an amazing price and current rebate) and Windows Small Business Server 2003 (also at a great price). I've worked on PC's for years but never set up a office network with a server. I was very apprehensive and questioned my skill but this software honestly was ridiculously simple to install and deploy.

It guides you through the entire process step by step and I recommend it highly to anyone looking for their first server software. Of course it does have some very technical aspects that left me scratching my head but that's because I don't know what I'm doing. Setting up Sharepoint and Exchange will require some further reading on my part but shouldn't be that difficult to deploy.

I recommend this product very highly and didn't give it 5 stars because of my own inexperience and not being able to see what it can fully do. It also takes hours to install which is pretty typical for any Microsoft product. I did have the whole thing done in one Saturday though and it took about 8 hours altogether.

product_title: The Witcher Limited Edition (Large Box)
review_body:
Were I a member of the gaming Industry right now, I would be shamed to be taught what gaming should look and feel like and how it should be marketed by a small Eastern European company. Who of the multi-billion gaming \\"giants\\" ever went back to improve a released game? Yet, there you have it: thanks to CDPROJECT gaming as an art-form is still alive and kicking!

This was the most awaited fantasy cRPG in the past 3 years. Not only did the original deliver, but even more work has gone into truly improving it.
THIS WAS ONE OF THE MOST BEAUTIFUL cRPG GAMES I HAD EVER PLAYED - AND NOW IT IS GORGEOUS!

The environments are detailed, realistic, and can be experienced from up close. Grass, flowers and tree branches moved in both FABLE and TITAN QUEST as well; these, however, seem so true I caught myself reaching for my...antihistamines! Weather affects and day-night alterations (you have to see the elongating shadows to believe them!) are just gorgeous! More importantly, these are not just eye-candy: certain NPCs and monsters appear only when the correct combination of time-of-day and weather coincide...The horizon is far and the clouds move in endless variations. It reminded me of the sky of the original UNREAL, another visually ground-breaking game at its time. PURE VISUAL MAGIC!

The character (Geralt) can master both sword-fighting and magic spells (what is known as a Warlock). To some die-hard RPG fans this may seem like heresy, nevertheless, keep in mind that multi-classing is not unheard off. The movement repertoire for both practices are impressively designed. Especially the sword-fighting, it is at par to any console action game. And the spells (both offensive and defensive ones) are not less impressive.

Free roaming? Yes and no. One can decide which parts of the map he will visit but loading is still needed to travel even annoyingly short distances. And since quests and side-quest still have to be completed, yes, eventually a subtle, yet ever present, directionality is present.
Looting and bartering? Aaah...yes, sort of. You practically never change the sword you start off with (although you do get to improve its abilities), whereas good armor is only a little easier to come by compared to PLANESCAPE. On the upside, you get to gamble, have romantic relationships (FABLE was full of great ideas after all!) and bribe for information, so trinkets have other uses as well.
Detailed character modifiers? Nothing like the AD&D rules. You gain talents (gold, silver & bronze) which you can spend to improve your fighting or magical abilities. Pretty much like the DIABLO or the TITAN QUEST abilities systems.

So, apart for the slight action-cRPG handicap, I have only two other objections. First, the...camera placement. Once more the atrocious Aurora Engine (remember NWN2...?) will keep auto-placing it where it is bound to get on your nerves - as it targets your character even if that is not the most logical option. Yes, this has indeed improved compared to the original but one cannot teach an old dog new tricks.
Second, the controls. They need getting used to as the fighting combos are still easily ruined by clicking out of sync. You do eventually get the hold of it, however it keeps glitching.

Nevertheless, its shortcomings are not enough to diminish the breath of fresh air this release brings to the scene. The Enhanced edition not only is a truly reworked game but it also comes full with detailed Manuals, beautiful Maps and all the extras that games used to come with in the good old days...

Whereas the BALDUR's GATES saga was story-heavy but (by today standards) visually wanting and the NEVERWINTER NIGHTS series was found, well, wanting in all aspects, THE WITCHER is the dream cRPG that BIOWARE was supposed to be capable of releasing all along but never did - and its current EA bedfellows surely put a stop to such aspirations now. That game, however, is finally here - and not from whom you would expect.
A tip of my hat to CDPROJECT for keeping the ART-FORM of Gaming alive. Well done indeed!

HIGHLY RECOMMENDED!y hat to CDPROJECT for keeping the ART-FORM of Gaming alive. Well done indeed! HIGHLY RECOMMENDED!

product_title: Roxio Easy VHS to DVD 3 Plus
review_body: Good Job.

After several hours of learning and drawing walls, windows, doors, outlets, bathroom fixtures, and smoke detectors. I went to save it and I get a fault that says â€œUnable to access the requested document. The file may be in use or you may not have sufficient access rights. ()â€ Tried to find anything about it in the help section to no avail. Went to the website hoping to find a support section, well I canâ€™t find it. product_title: Parallels Desktop 8 for Mac
review_headline: Have the Best of Both Worlds
review_body:
I switched to Mac over 7 years ago. Many business programs, such as Quickbooks and tax software run on a Windows platform. The Mac version of Quickbooks is a shadow of the Windows version. Other programs such as Corel Draw are also Windows based.

Rather than switching between Boot Camp or having a separate PC for these programs, Parallels makes it possible to run the business and graphics software from the same machine and very conveniently. It's only a click of a window to switch between operating systems and programs. The more RAM you have, the better everything works. I can have many programs open simultaneously and switch back and forth easily.

I can print from Windows, through Parallels with the Mac printers. Parallels will recognize the printers, even when their IP addresses change after a restart. Very convenient.

Mac offers a much more stable operating system than Windows. Windows based programs offer more productivity and efficiency. I am really grateful to have the benefit of both worlds.

product_title: Norton Internet Security 2010 1-User 3PCs
review_body: My computer got infected from the internet. I bought this product and it cleaned up my computer in no time.

product_title: Dragon NaturallySpeaking Premium 11 [Old Version]
review_headline: An overrated program with a lot of potential but a lot of rough edges too
review_body:
Pros:

1) capable of decent accuracy with modest training, and very good accuracy with more extended training
2) can keep up with relatively fast speaking meaning overall excellent speed of text generation
3) capacity to train multiple users and work within multiple dialects

Cons:

1) unreliable, crash prone, and buggy - this program needs major work
2) poorly sorted out Windows 7 correction dialog operations (ultra-slow)
3) program becomes unstable when microphone is turned off for protracted periods of time, requiring reinitialization and reloading.
4) program support is a joke - Nuance has to be the most arrogant software company in the world despite some hard working staffers (yup - worse than Microsoft!)

It's almost impossible to be on the Internet or working with the computer and not be aware of Dragon's NaturallySpeaking 11.0. You would think from the relentless advertisement by Nuance that the program never makes a mistake, and allows seamless control of your computer while allowing you to dictate virtually everything. Unfortunately, the hype and promise fall well short of the program's actual functioning.

Although quite good accuracy is possible with modest levels of training, and very good accuracy is possible in technical fields with training of technical vocabulary, the program's buggy operation, recurrent vulnerability to crashing, humongous speech files and subsequent painfully slow loading, and very slow correction interface (much lower for some reason on Windows 7 than on Windows XP) spoil an otherwise enjoyable experience badly.

Although I am almost totally dependent on the program for professional writing (cranking out roughly 20 single spaced pages a day in a scientific area), I am continually amazed with how many rough edges the program has that Nuance seems to be oblivious to, because they recur from edition to edition. As but a small example of lack of attention to relevant details, the program within Microsoft Word does not use the specialized characters for quotation marks, but uses a generic and plainer character set, instead of the one generated within Microsoft Word. This means that if you want professional looking final product, you have to run a macro to replace their generic quotation marks with the proper special character. Although this is a small issue, it's just an example of so many ways in which the program falls down, and displays its lack of polish. It is amazing that despite five editions of the product which I have used that this issue continues, despite feedback from multiple users.

Then there is the issue of loading and speed of operation. With a solid-state drive that gets to the Windows 7 desktop in 20 seconds, it takes 25 seconds to load speech files on NaturallySpeaking 11.0. In other words, an extremely fast hard drive loads a bloated operating system faster than it loads NaturallySpeaking 11.0. I hesitate to think how long it would take somebody to load speech files on the average 250 GB 5400 RPM hard drive. You could go out, mow your lawn, calculate your taxes, then do your email, and come back just in time to start dictating.

Well, so what? Once the program is loaded, things should be okay, right? Well this is where again the program falls down. First of all, actually correcting things reveals a major bug in their Windows 7 code around keyboard input within the corrections dialog box. When you bring up the correction dialog box, you can't type characters without generating a long delay before the program somehow incorporates your keyboard input (roughly 10-12 seconds) - this is unacceptable waiting time for entering a couple of characters. Dictating or spelling out words within the correction dialog box produces somewhat snappier results, but is still amazingly slow, (again running this program on an extremely fast processor, with 6 GB of RAM, and one of the fastest 250 GB solid-state drives). It's scary to imagine how slow this program would be on the average system. In fairness, some of it appears to be a Windows 7 incompatibility, because I use the same speech files and the same 11.0 version on a Windows XP system, and had much snappier response from within the corrections dialog box. Of course Nuance advertises that their code is Windows 7 compatible - something got lost in the translation. But again, this suggests that Nuance is more concerned with their advertising than with the program's actual performance. This is a continuing theme - Nuance's grandiosity gets continually in the way of their ability to see any problems with the program (or their support - which is clearly an industry low-water mark).

The biggest problem though is what happens when you put the program (at least 11.0 - corrected in 11.5) into Suspend by turning off the microphone- and by the way, you are forced to do this because if you simply tell the program to \\"go to sleep\\" any sound into the microphone will cause the page to scroll back to where the cursor is (in other words any kind of sound acts as a reinitialization command to the cursor - the logic behind that completely escapes me! So essentially you are forced to suspend microphone input if you want to scroll through your text instead of the program intrusively interfering with this. This is where things get really interesting (after you turn the microphone off). After about 5 min., the program will malfunction (again only in Windows 7 and not in Windows XP for some strange reason) and give you an error code which the program cannot recover from, and thus all this nonsense requires that you basically start from scratch all over again. This means not simply reloading the program, because the program actually doesn't pull itself out of memory reliably and oftentimes leaves a huge executable sitting in the background (taking up over 300 MB of RAM) - - if you don't kill the program this way, when you try to reinitialize it, you will immediately get the same error code. This means you have to bring up Task manager, find the program, and manually terminate it, and then start from scratch and reload your speech files. This will again take a long period of time - close to 30 seconds with a solid-state drive, A minute and a half with a slow conventional hard drive. All of this nonsense of course significantly deteriorates the productivity advantage associated with dictating versus typing. Indeed, for short pieces of text, all these hassles mean that it is almost always faster to simply type out a couple of paragraphs then it is to struggle with the program. For longer text generation, and assuming that you dictate continuously and don't risk putting the microphone into the off position for any extended period, the program is more productive and faster than typing.

This process of recurrent shutdown and reinitializing (due to fatal program errors) can be very frustrating, and oftentimes has to be repeated multiple times, because if you leave the program on (by not turning off the microphone), and there is any background noise you'll get endless junk words into your dictation space. This brings up another striking failure of the program - its total inability to discriminate speech from background sounds and non-speech noises. The program seems to believe that every conceivable sound must translate into a word, and therefore, any kind of background noise makes it impossible to use the program particularly if you are not using a noise canceling microphone, and instead are dictating on a laptop that has a standard integrated microphone. You would think that the program, which runs on an enormous number of laptops, would be optimized for the standard integrated microphones on laptops. Unfortunately, it is not. You have to use Dragon's headphone microphone gear or some equivalent. Curiously, a much earlier version of the program NaturallySpeaking 8.0seem to work much better with laptop microphone arrays. Why this might be is beyond me.

Because the program code is buggy and unreliable and subsequently the program locks up, you will find that occasionally your speech files are completely trashed and cannot be repaired through Nuance's repair algorithms (there is a speech file Restore function from within the program). This means you had better make a backup copy of your speech files (make that several backup copies), or you will find yourself having to retrain your user identity all over again, from scratch. Additionally, you will find that their optimization program (which gives you the chance to optimize speech files that have had numerous corrections made to them) is not reliable and also locks up regularly. And BTW, its continual crashing will occasionally damage programs with which it is linked, such as Word and Outlook, requiring re-installation of those as well. In other words, this program does not play nice with your system.

In case you're suspicious that these difficulties are unique to my machine, or are a function of viruses, spyware, or other hardware problems, rest assured that none of these issues are remotely responsible for the Programs buggy and unreliable operation. I run two spyware and antivirus programs concurrently, my system is about as fast as a window 7 system can be (Windows experience index 6.7 overall), and I always keep the machine in good working order. Just to clarify, I do tech support for most of my friends on their Windows 7 and Windows XP systems - so the problem isn't that I have a damaged Windows installation that is to blame for these issues.

All of these operational headaches spoil what otherwise might be a useful program. I believe that all of this emerges from Nuance having a very grandiose notion about their software, and not really listening very much to end-users. It's a shame that there is no real competition in the PC marketplace when it comes to dictation software. If there was, I suspect Nuance would have to get their act together because they would quickly lose market share. Given all these issues, 2/5 stars is actually generous. I wish I could make do without the program, or transition to another speech recognition platform, but unfortunately I can't.

Oh, I almost forget the best part: don't expect Nuance to know anything about any of these issues. They have some of the worst technical support I have ever seen in the industry. They blame your system and your computer and claim there are no deficiencies in their program(!).

ADDENDUM:

Dragon 11.5 has just been released and after several weeks - I can see that Nuance has fixed some things, but not touched many others. It no longer crashes as frequently, or generates bizarre error codes as frequently, requiring that it has to be re-initialized regularly - although that still happens. It loads somewhat more quickly. However, it continues to interpret every sound as speech, has a painfully slow corrections dialog, and as per the norm, reaching technical support is like trying to call the Dept. of Defense and you don't have technical support past 90 days. It is painfully obvious that Nuance has no real handle on the program's deficiencies, and therefore it is a 2/5 star program. I can't recommend it.up Task manager, find the program, and manually terminate it, and then start from scratch and reload your speech files. This will again take a long period of time - close to 30 seconds with a solid-state drive, A minute and a half with a slow conventional hard drive. All of this nonsense of course significantly deteriorates the productivity advantage associated with dictating versus typing. Why this might be is beyond me. This means you had better make a backup copy of your speech files (make that several backup copies), or you will find yourself having to retrain your user identity all over again, from scratch. Additionally, you will find that their optimization program (which gives you the chance to optimize speech files that have had numerous corrections made to them) is not reliable and also locks up regularly. And BTW, its continual crashing will occasionally damage programs with which it is linked, such as Word and Outlook, requiring re-installation of those as well. In other words, this program does not play nice with your system. review_body: Got this in the mail today and so far, I love it :) The seller sent it rly fast and I was surprised how accurate the description was :) I am a huge Xenosaga fan and I can't say thank u enough :) This was the highlight of my day :)

review_body: I own a small business, I can't afford an accountant and this easy to use software makes up for it. Anyone can use it, extremely user friendly, keeps everything organized for you. Will save you all the time and money you put into it when taxes time come. You will be able to track invoices, expenses, etc...easily.

review_body:
It is great. Had no problems and I got the download/activation minutes after the purchase!

review_headline: Love the software but i am unwilling to pay a ...
review_body: I purchased the smilebox software thinking it was a permanent use on my computer,little did I know it was actually a trial subscription.Love the software but i am unwilling to pay a monthly fee for its use.

product_title: Photoshop Elements 13
review_body: I'd give this 0 starts if I could. I installed this on my computer and when I tried running it, it kept saying put in the code to access it. I already did that. I contacted Adobe and spent 35 minutes with them only to have them say uninstall it and then reinstall it. Did that same results. I'd like my money back. DON'T waste your money on this. We have purchased several of the previous versions and have been really pleased, but this one really isn't worth the time and energy. Adobe support isn't good either. They ship it over to India and it's difficult to understand the directions they give you. Update: After getting a message to tell Adobe what they had to do in order to correct the problem, after explaining to them I had not a total grasp as the "technical support" did it. Brett then stated I was too vague and that was it. My wife has since then tried use the program and it's not as user friendly as previous versions---can't do as much with putting things side by side to organize files as with previous versions. I wish I didn't waste my money on this product---BUYER BEWARE!!!!! Customer service is horrible as is the product. I wouldn't recommend this version to anyone!!! Go with a previous version if you want adobe---we have 8 and it works a lot better

product_title: Circus Ponies Notebook 3.0
review_body: Sorry, but I could never get the hang of this software, was a bit too complicated for what I wanted to do and not very intuitive. I wanted a simple place to store my lists, copy/paste info from other sources, keep recipes, memos, info that interests me. I thought that a this notebook would work for me but realized that I just didn't choose the correct software. Ended up with \\"Notepad\\" which fit my needs better.

product_title: Mango PassportÂ® French
review_headline: The best language learning program for me
review_body: Mango Passport French was the best language learning program for me. Showing how sentences are structured and covering crammer is a lot more useful in the long run than just looking at pictures and knowing the word. If you dont want to just speek a language but LEARN a language, Mango is the way to go. Another great plus is that the company and support are great. From my experience, they are all very nice.

product_title: Star Trek Classics: Captains Chair
review_body: captians chair allows you to actully take a tour or even go in direct battle it is grEAT YOU HAVE GOT TO BUY IT IF you are treky

product_title: Powerquest Drive Image 7
review_body:
Works as advertised. I took me 14 mins to create a image of my harddrive to an external firewire drive. The drive had 15 GB of data, and the compressed image was 8.5GB. I wanted to test it to make sure that the product actually works, so I've booted off the included recovery CD, all my controllers were recognized even thou my C: drive is all SCSI and mad up of 3 drives in RAID 0, while the D: drive is a IDE RAID 0 too. The firewire drive was recognized too, so I was able to select the backup image and strat the restore. After 20 min I was able to reboot my newly recovered drive.
The only issue I had is that I use a new motherboard that includes the Intel 1000/100BaseT network chip-set, and the PowerQuest recovery disk did not recognize it, so would've not been able to do a restore by using a network stored image. However this should not be a issue since in the online manual there is information on how to load drivers at boot time, I haven't used the procedure for now.
On more thing, this product is extremlly easy to use. All functions, including the recovery disk use the WindowsXP intreface, not DOS.

product_title: Alsoft DiskWarrior 4.0 for Intel & PowerPC Macs
review_headline: succeeds when Mac's Disk Utility fails
review_body:
I have used each version of this product for close to 10 years now to recover files that would otherwise be lost. Most recently, Mac 10.8 Disk Utility could not repair my system drive after it failed to boot. It even indicated that the disk had to be reformatted (erased). So I booted from an external hard drive loaded with the Mac OS and ran Disk Warrior from there. DW also indicated that it could not replace my directory with the one it had rebuilt. However (this is where the magic happens) the Preview feature was able to mount (make visible) my iMac's internal drive even though Mac Disk Utility couldn't.

From there, I could copy my entire user directory from the iMac over to the external drive, erase the corrupted iMac drive, and start fresh with a new OS. Now I just have to copy my home directory back. I prefer running DW from an external drive because any DVD boot disc such as DW is going to be painfully slow. I recovered 15 GB of data in less than an hour with the external drive. I have dozens of such stories with this software, having used it with Mac friends and colleagues over the years, and thought it was time to give testimony.

product_title: Quicken Deluxe 20
review_headline: Goodbye to Quicken, long time user has jumped ship
review_body:
I am a long time user of Quicken who has decided to jump ship. I am very frustrated with this once-loved program and the level of non-support they currently provide. I AM DONE. Here is my story:

FEB 2, 2015:
Quicken has abolished phone support! I just spent over an hour trying to CHAT my way to resolution on a very basic problem that is inexplicably gob-smacking for them. Here is what happened: My bank changed their log in system and made me select a new username and password. Once I did that, I attempted to update Quicken, but now it won't connect to that bank. Something in the Quicken software doesn't like the change and though I can log in to the bank through a web browser just fine, in Quicken it won't work. Now I have to wait 3-5 days for some advanced department to review my log files and get back to me. Something like this happened last year and back then they fixed in in an hour while I talked to them on the phone. Not having phone support sucks!

FEB 2, 2015: Email from Quicken. This is verbatim and the English is extremely poor.
Hi XXX,
Here is the incident number of our chat session: xxxxxx-xxxxxx. Please expect with in 3-5 business days from our EWC team about your the updates of your issue. Please feel free to contact us again if you still have the same issue after the email has been sent to your email address.
Regards,
Quicken Customer Care

FEB 3, 2015: Email from Quicken
Dear XXX,
We sincerely apologize for any inconvenience that this issue may have caused you. We take great pride at Intuit in providing you with the best possible service and support. It is our goal to make your Quicken experience as enjoyable as possible.
We receive the case that was escalated to our team â€“ Upon checking the Log files associated to your case we found out that your issue will have to be submitted to our scripts team.
To set proper expectations, please be informed that our scripts team will work on your case approximately within 3 â€“ 5 business days.
We will let you know for any progress/resolution of the case once we got feedback from our scripts team.
We appreciate your patience and cooperation towards the resolution of this issue.
Please let me know for any progress/updates on your end.
If you need additional information, please reply to this email with your questions. Be as explicit as possible and I will be happy to assist you further.
Thanks and Regards,
Quicken Customer Care

FEB 10, 2015: Email from me to Quicken
Hello,
It has been 5 business days and I have heard nothing. Are you going to fix this problem? Right now it is a manual process for me, which is painstaking and not worth it.
Thank you,
XXX

FEB 13, 2015: Email from me to Quicken
It has been 8 business days and I have heard nothing. Please respond back with a resolution.

FEB 13, 2015:
I initiated a new chat session to ask for an update. First I was told that work on my issue had halted because I had deactivated my account and that they were waiting for me to reactivate it. This is complete rubbish! Moreover, no one tried to contact me about anything like that - which would have been a requirement. After I said all of this, they quickly recanted and then said they were still working on it and that I would hear back in 2 days.

FEB 17, 2015: Email from Quicken
Dear Quicken User,
Thank you for contacting Quicken Customer Care
We sincerely apologize for any inconvenience that this issue may have caused you. We take great pride at Intuit in providing you with the best possible service and support. It is our goal to make your Quicken experience as enjoyable as possible.
We fully understand that trouble on your end. Our Technical Team and Script Team are currently working on this case. There was an earlier investigation made yet they need more time for this. Please bear with us. We appreciate your patience with this concern.
Rest assured that once the resolution will be available we will immediately notify you.
If you need additional information, please reply to this email with your questions. Be as explicit as possible and I will be happy to assist you further.
Thanks and Regards,
Quicken Customer Care

FEB 18, 2015:
I am FINISHED with QUICKEN. All I did was change a user name and password and they still can't figure it out 16 days later??? No thanks!

product_title: Roxio Easy Media Creator 7 [OLD VERSION]
review_headline: Lives up to all the great reviews
review_body: I agree with most of the other reviewers here, Easy Media Creator 7 is a great product. It installed fine - albeit slowly - and has performed without a problem since day one. Over the first couple of months of use, I had a couple of questions that I emailed to Roxio's customer support and they were quick to get back to me with answers. Overall it was easy to learn; even my wife and kids use it regularly. We use all aspects of the product and give it a big \\"thumbs up\\" rating and recommend it to everyone. We even bought another copy of it and gave it away as a present to my brother and his family out on the west coast. Now we can easily create and share family pictures, movies and projects with one another. It's actually turned into a little sibling rivalry as to who can outdo the other.

product_title: QuickBooks Pro 2015
review_body: Good product!

product_title: Bitdefender AntiVirus Plus 2012 Standard M2 - 3Pc/1 Year [Old Version]
review_body:
I thought an inexpensive A/V with the great ratings BD had received would be a good move. I was terribly disappointed. After installing on 3 machines, all suffered significant slowdowns. The laptops would hang when coming out of suspend, program completely blocked my wireless NIC, took special firewall exceptions and multiple reboots to get it to function. Update is intrusive and timing is poor, browser is noticeably slow with BD running. Product is only suitable for use on a machine that has a constant high bandwidth internet connection. Completely unsuitable for portable machines.

No less than 3 requests for support went unanswered. The 1st couple of \\"we're sorry you're having a negative experience, visit our website and fix it yourself\\" replies were prompt, but once I asked for specific solutions to problems, silence. I asked for a refund... silence. I will have my credit card provider do a chargeback based on the non-response to support requests.

I have removed the program from all my machines, and went back to ESET Nod32, more expensive, but won't screw up my machines, and good protection.

Can't rate it with \\"no stars\\" but would give it negative stars if possible! Simply terrible!!

product_title: Adobe Photoshop Elements & Premiere Elements 12
review_body: I always wanted to get the full Photoshop software, but it is very expensive and very complicated to learn. I originally wanted to purchase just the Photoshop Elements software, but then I saw this package that also included the Premiere video editing software. I figured that I could really use some video editing software that offered more than the software that came with my Canon HD Video Camcorder. I was very happy with the purchase. The Elements picture editing software is great and it will challenge me with features yet to be understood for some time. While I have just started using the Premiere video editing software, it seems to be great too. It has reinvigorated my son's use of his GoPro HD video camera as he finds it easy to trim video clips, enter transitions, transition to slow and fast motion and add music. It also allows him to upload his videos to YouTube right from the software.

product_title: Norton Personal Firewall 2002
review_headline: norton personal firewall 2001 was a lot better.
review_body:
If you're just a plain home user who do not want to bother customizing your personal firewall's policy, this is the firewall for you.
On the other hand, if you would rather have a mix of a smart firewall that also gives you the flexibility of fine tuning rules to your needs.... open certain ports (tcp or udp), let certain applications access the internet,... this software can be a bit confusing.
Though the 2002 version lets you do it, it takes a lot more extra steps for one to customize the packet filtering which is a total pain. The 2001 version is a lot more flexible and geared towards the more "savvy" user.
This is one of the few products that pretty much isn't worth an upgrade if you have an earlier version.
On the plus side, functionality is great, it provides good protection and a simple interface.

product_title: RCA Coaxial Cable Stripper for RG6, RG59/62 and RG58
review_body: Works fine.

product_title: Trend Micro Titanium Internet Security 2013 3-Users [Old Version]
review_body:
Decided to give the software a try. Bundled in with a computer purchase. Machine is a middle-shelf 64 bit Windows 8 laptop from a big box outlet. (Purchased specifically for low level college lab work.) Saw all low threat research related web browsing (absolutely no social media, porn, gaming etc). Attributed poor computer performance out of the box to hardware shortcomings.
Upon expiration of the six month Trend Micro license the software was replaced and a complete scan was performed with a new product. Numerous malware found by the new product that had been missed by Trend Micro Titanium.
In fairness, the software was not able to scan the laptop that frequently. It was rarely left on when not in use. It may have performed 6-8 full system scans during the period.
More significant, I noticed that the Trend Micro add in for the two different web browsers I tried to use created instabilities when accessing content on my college websites. The browser would \\"lock up\\" or the homework site would freeze/time out. Flash videos and other media objects were not always accessible. Again, I attributed this to a discount laptop purchase. But this problem has been remedied by the removal of Trend Micro Titanium from this machine. The change was compelling enough to prompt me to write this review.

product_title: American English Pronunciation Patterns Network 8.0 with 1 Year Text to Speech License: Perfect English Pronunciation Software to Help You Improve Pronunciation, Speaking, Vocabulary, Spelling, Listening, and Reading, and Reduce Accent.
review_body: Since I have the program my English Pronunciation has improved a lot! It has given me the opportunity to practice at my own pace. The program is very complete and easy to use I was taking English classes at a Community College and Pronunciation Patterns was better than the class itself! I highly recommend it!!!!!!

product_title: Norton Ghost 14.0 [OLD VERSION]
review_body: The only reason I gave Ghost 14 four stars is because during the backup screens you do not see all the partitions on your hard drive in the default configuration. A novice user would not know that other hidden partitions exist on their computer and would probably not backup them. If the purpose of Ghost 14 is to backup an entire computer then the user should see all partitions that exist on their hard disks as the default configuration. Let the user hide any partition as an option since I know hidden partitions are important too. If your hard disk fails you do want everything back including the hidden partitions. In my opinion the menu configurations of Ghost 14 are more complicated than what it needs to be for the average user. Gone are the days of Ghost 2003 when Symantec would allow a home user to backup all his computers at home with a single copy of Ghost. Now we must all purchase one license of Ghost per PC. The only Reason I purchased Ghost 14 was because DELL messed up their bios on my new laptop so Ghost 2003 would not work with their USB ports. Ghost 2003 would allow you to create your own boot CD disks if you knew how to create boot CD disks with Nero and knew how to modify batch files. You were able to boot Ghost from a CD and backup your entire computer to an external/internal drive or burn a CD or DVD backup. Ghost 2003 is still able to backup all my other computers with Windows Vista and Windows XP (32bit and 64bit versions). The Ghost 14 bootable CD only restores images and does not have any backup software available so it behaves like a rescue CD. All backups in Ghosts 14 are conveniently done when logged in to a Windows XP or Windows Vista account unlike Ghost 2003 which requires you to use a bootable CD, USB Drive, or floppy disks.

product_title: Microsoft Office Home & Student 2010, 3-Users
review_body: I wanted the MS office Home & Student 2010 with 3 PC because of the 3 PC and one price is nice too. Just can't beat that!!

product_title: McAfee Internet Security Suite 2004 V6.0
review_headline: Worse than any virus ever created!
review_body:
This product nearly destroyed my computer. Even basic desktop functions disappeared--no icons, no taskbar. Blue screens...name your worst nightmare...this product is it.
McAfee website Help is No Help. I tried the $2.95 a minute route, and couldn't get through.
McAfee's Uninstall program failed mid-way, and wouldn't re-run.
Ultimately, I paid a computer consultant $270 to remove this trash from my computer.
I was testing this crashware because I approve software purchases for my company. Believe me, no McAfee product will EVER be purchased by my company again.

product_title: Kaspersky Anti-Virus 2014
review_body: Overall the software has been good. But it seems to have slowed my computers performance a bit. But it does the job.

product_title: Parallels Desktop 4.0 for Mac [OLD VERSION]
review_headline: Paralles 4.0 over Fusion, Virtual Box, and Crossover
review_body: First off, I am here to testify that Parallels 4.0 is the best solution to running Windows apps on Mac OS X. I have tried Crossover (Crossover Games too), VMWare Fusion 2.0, and Sun's Virtual Box. Crossover([...]) is a good solution if you just want to run one windows app but anymore and it becomes a really big headache (if are not a computer engineer/programer). Virtual Box ([...]) is great if you like free stuff but again same thing with Crossover, if you are not a computer engineer/programmer it's a very difficult application. VMWare Fusion 2.0 (http://www.amazon.com/Smith-Micro-Software-Inc-VMFM20BX2/dp/B001F5VBRU/ref=sr_1_1?ie=UTF8&s=software&qid=1252022776&sr=8-1)is great to run Windows apps but can be slow at times. I first bought Fusion about a month ago. I have been reviewing all of these products since I bought my Macbook Air, yes I said Air, in January 2009: these are my results. I tried VMWare first because at that time it had the best reviews. These are the operating systems I have used on VMWare Fusion 2.0 and Virtual Box: Linux Ubuntu 9.04, Windows XP Professional, Windows 7 Ultimate (32-bit RC), and Sun Open Solaris 10. VMWare doesn't work with Open Solaris very well (I haven't tried Open Solaris with Paralles yet), in Virtual Box Open Solaris worked pretty good. I say this up front Windows XP works great with all three virtual machines, not a problem. Windows 7 does not work in Virtual Box, period but works in VMWare Fusion 2.0 very slow. Windows 7 runs great under Paralles. Crossover doesn't even support anything past Windows XP. Ubuntu 9.04 worked pretty well with VMWare Fusion and Virtual Box (again, haven't tried Paralles yet). The biggest issue I found with Virtual Box is the fact that wireless internet is not useable in the guest machine nor does shared folders work at all (on any of the OS's). The biggest issue with VMWare Fusion is friendliness, Paralles just looks much better and again just works without issues. Overall, I rate this product to be the best of the best virtual machines out there to date. NOTE: IF YOU WANT A PRODUCT THAT JUST WORKS GO WITH PARALLES 4.0. PERIOD.to be the best of the best virtual machines out there to date. NOTE: IF YOU WANT A PRODUCT THAT JUST WORKS GO WITH PARALLES 4.0. PERIOD.

product_title: Better Homes and Gardens Home Designer Suite 7.0 [OLD VERSION]
review_headline: Know What the Program is NOT Before You Buy
review_body:
I think this can be a fun suite of programs if you like to speculate about how a new project in your house or yard might turn out. A reasonable library of materials and a relatively simple design process allow you to create rough approximations.

There are software limitations, however, that will frustrate perfectionists. Design angles are limited to 7.5 degree increments, for instance, so getting the exact angle of your hedge, angled sidewalk, or slanted driveway may not be possible if that angle isn't divisible by 7.5 degrees.

Another example of limitations is that the roofing application makes no provision for certain circumstances in which two sections of roof have different slopes. The result is that you can't really recreate the roof on an L-shaped house unless the two branches of the L are the same width. I thought this was a user error until I found that the tech support solution was to widen the thinner section of the house to get the roof to line up right.

In short, the program is not going to provide architectural specs for a house or a reliable blueprint for landscaping your yard. Perfectionists will have to just \\"let it go\\" after a certain point. That having been said, the software IS fun if you are the sort of person who enjoys design software.

product_title: TurboTax Deluxe Fed + Efile
review_headline: Filing taxes is just as easy as in previous years
review_body:
Update was done automatically after program installation. Filing taxes is just as easy as in previous years. I don't get the state option anymore since it's just a few more questions to answer. Also, e-filing state taxes costs $25 per return.

The amazon card rebate bonus is the main incentive for this version. Instructions aren't very clear but the entire refund to your bank account option must be selected for you to see the amazon gift card slider. If you choose to split your refund or get savings bonds, the amazon card option is not shown.

product_title: Cook'n Recipe Organizer Version 10
review_headline: Looking for Impeccable Service after the Sale?
review_body:
If you're looking for service after your purchase, look no further than Cook'n 10, by DVO Enterprizes. I returned to the Cook'n arena after being away for several years. Not wanting to discard my old Cook'n DVD purchases without exploring the possibilities of using them with the current version of Cook'n, I contacted Cook'n Tech Support. Their rapid response - same day - assured me I could. An entire page of my previous purchases, with downloadable links followed for me to install and use. I was elated with that level of customer service

Upgrades are frequent; Tech Staff is available to address individual issues while it pursues the \\"neat stuff\\" and the \\"wouldn't it be great if... stuff\\" for future releases. I recently had a \\"crash\\" and simply could not recover my Cook'n program. Tech Support had me up and running - with upgrades on day 2 along with Cook'n Cloud. Yep they have the Cloud now and it works beautifully. I understand the Cloud will be available for the iPhone, ipad and Galaxy in the not too distant future. Frequent new books are available which keeps the Cook'n concept fresh and in my opinion ahead of its competitors.

I share all of this because every word has applied to me and my experiences since last November and I simply would like others contemplating the purchase of Cook'n Recipe Organizer, v.10 know what's ahead as it relates to \\"service after the sale'. DVO cares about its people and its customers.

review_body: Our sons love this course. Our 8 year old loves everything Minecraft so this was a win-win for us. I sit through the lessons and take notes just in case but they haven't need me or the notes. They enjoy the quizzes and troubleshooting mods just as much as the lessons. We are all always excited to see the items they have designed in the actual game. I appreciate the way that Justin explains it on a level that is easy to understand but continues to use the technical terms so the kids actually learn the coding language!!
