review_body: I wasted my money on this software - don't make the same mistake. It's non-intuitive, inflexible, cumbersome, and does nothing that you can't do yourself in 15 minutes with a pencil and paper. Does not allow you to design a custom patio - only provides a very few options of pavers and patterns, and creating anything other than a rectangular patio is almost impossible. Big Hammer support admitted the problems, but offered no solution or help.

product_title: DK My First Amazing World Explorer 2.1
review_body: Played this on Windows 95 as a kid and wanted to find an updated version for my siblings to enjoy. I forgot my OS was Windows 7 when I bought this (up to Vista), but it still worked on my computer, albeit slightly jerky at first. Great nostalgia and looking forward to their reactions at Christmas!

product_title: IMSI INSTANT ARCHITECT V14 ( 00DIAX14CC )
review_body:
Not for beginners at all, no instructions.
Online assistance is completely worthless. Not impressed at all. Uninstalled it and threw it away.

product_title: Pacific General
review_body: I have Panzer General and Allied General and this game is a disappointment. When playing against AI the game freezes after several turns.

product_title: Ultimate Boot CD - Repair Windows 8, 7, Vista, XP, 2000 - Recover lost data
review_headline: Worked well. Needed to add software, but the load worked okay.
review_body: I'm giving the computer to a granddaughter. She'll need to change the OS, but the UBCD will help her get it running again.

product_title: Trend Micro Titanium Maximum Security Premium 2013 (5-Devices) [Old Version]
review_body: I'm not a skilled technical person but do ok with most technical projects. I've used Trend Micro products in the past without problems. I found this product used up most of my cpu for several minutes when starting up my computers. I loaded it on 3 different home computers with the same results. I tried downloading a fix for an older version of trend software and that seemed to help but still ate up a lot of cpu mem. It appeared to me that it was using most of the cpu mem on start up to run system scans. This might work well on some of the newer computers with a lot of cpu mem but not on on mine. I removed all from my computers and now I'm using Norton 360 which works just fine for me.

product_title: True Image Home 2012 PC Backup and Recovery [Old Version]
review_headline: Updated my old Acronis via Download
review_body:
They give you license for three PCs (two \\"Full Install\\" & one \\"Update\\"). They send you three \\"keys,\\" but don't tell you which is the \\"Update-Only\\" key. Well--I of course used the wrong-key on my desktop, which was the one with the original Acronis install from years back. I contacted the Acronis TI people--and they merely re-sent me the same three keys--again with no notation as to which was the \\"Update.\\" I tried straightening it out myself--but you can't go-back to the old Acronis; and you can't uninstall the newer completely enough. The only resort you have is--guess what--a reinstall of Windows! So Acronis defeated it's own purpose--and their Customer Service is non-existent.

Avoid. With prejudice.

product_title: Roxio Easy Media Creator Suite 9 [OLD VERSION]
review_body: Roxio Easy Media Creator would not retain closed captions from any MS-DVR (Microsoft XP Media Center) to DVD. Roxio/Sonic Solutions failed to recognize the needs of Deaf and Hard of Hearing customers.

product_title: Quicken WillMaker Premium 2012
review_body: The will maker disks wouldn't down load to my computer using window 7, e- mailed the company for assistance no response to my request, have to wait now before I can return it to get NOLO approval or for them to help me find the problem . Not a happy camper

product_title: Parallels Desktop 9 for Mac
review_headline: Great way to run windows, but...
review_body: I've been using Parallels for a good number of years. In the middle, I decided to give another solution a try, but I came back to Parallels. I like the software, but there are A LOT of updates. Don't get me wrong... I like that they're staying on top of things. But, that just gives the impression that they missed a lot in prior releases. With each release comes a new install of Parallels Tools, which sometimes can cause headaches, but often goes smoothly. Overall, I recommend the product.

product_title: McAfee 2015 Total Protection 3 PC (3-Users)
review_headline: Don't buy this and change your mind and try to ...
review_body: Don't buy this and change your mind and try to remove. When I removed it it slowed my machine to the point I reformatted the hard drive. Avast is from (from Amazon) and works really well on Windows 7.

product_title: Photo Expressions Platinum 5
review_headline: Easy to use but very basic
review_body: Photo Expressions is like the photo organizer For Dummies. It is very simplified and does not require any deep understanding of Photoshop-like tools such as layering and masks. It is extremely simplified. I personally am one of those dummies, and don't like to spend a whole lot of time enhancing. I just crop and maybe adjust exposure and lighting effects. The software itself was easy to install, but now with iPhoto and Picasa from Google I want to simplify my options. There isn't enough features that would warrant me to use this any more than the stuff I can get for free. If you re the creative type and like to print your own CD labels, greeting cards, scrapbooking, then this might be for you. It reminds of the original Print Shop software. I would probably recommend this for the beginner as the interface makes it easy to use, and once you get more comfortable, you could upgrade to a more powerful program for editing and use the freeware for online albums.

product_title: Palo Alto Business Plan Pro 2007 [OLD VERSION]
review_headline: What good is a business plan if it looks like garbage?
review_body:
This is the second or third business plan builder I have used, and it may be the best I've seen for putting together a plan in a logical, cohesive process. But it is by far the WORST piece of software I have ever used for formatting output and ending up with a polished, professional-looking finished product. This application is diseased with problems in spacing, indentation, tabs, bullets, numbering, and anything else that may be imported from Word or applied within this program. The MS Word export function flat-out CRASHED my MSWord XP Professional, and anything imported from Word ended up with a mind of its own once it hit Business Plan Pro. So here I am with a nice, tidy little business plan -- but I have to completely re-do it in Word and Excel or look like an idiot when I hand it out in presentations.

As much as I appreciate this product's ability to walk one through a business plan, what good is the plan if it is irreversibly locked into an ugly, inconsistent, un-fixable format for printing?

product_title: Dr. Seuss ABC (Jewel Case) - PC/Mac
review_body: My son loved this game, and learned ALL of his letters before he was two years old. This was his first computer game, and paved the way for a love of computers and letters.

product_title: PaperPort 14
review_body: I had read some negative reviews of Paperport version 14 and as a user of previous versions of Paperport I was concerned. So far I have been happy with this latest version of Paperport with one exception. It crashes when I attempt to rename an item. There is a workaround by right clicking, bringing up Properties, and changing the item name in the Properties window. However, it seems reasonable to expect the Item/Rename function to work properly since this is such a common operation. Also, in my case although the Scan button was not grayed out, it was inoperable. A Web search suggested this may be due to improper registration of the application in Windows 8 and that execution of the Nuance scanner connection tool might resolve the problem. In fact it did. I think a note in an online Readme file would have been helpful. Import of previous Paperport files (.MAX) went smoothly.

product_title: Family Tree Maker 2009 Essentials [OLD VERSION]
review_body: I have used an older version of Family Tree Maker for several years. The 2009 version provides great tools for researching the entered data. It adds great value to genealogy searches.

product_title: Norton Internet Security 2011 - 1 User/3 PC
review_body: Everything having to do with the product and transaction went just as I had hoped for and expected. Arrived on time, in perfect shape, and worked as it is supposed to. Very satisfied.

product_title: Windows 7 Home Premium SP1 32bit (Full) System Builder DVD 1 Pack
review_body: it fixed my computer. i didn't try anything else so i have no comparison. i have used windows 7 now for 2 weeks

product_title: Trend Micro Titanium Internet Security 2011 - 3 User
review_body: I have used Trent internet security for years without any problem. I installed Titanium on a new computer with windows 7 and it is running fine.

product_title: Adobe Photoshop Lightroom 4
review_headline: Lighroom 4 will make you look like a Pro, and great noise reduction.
review_body:
I had avoided buying Lightroom (LR) for many reasons before, mainly because I have a full blown version of Photoshop 5.5 extended (PS) and also the Nikon ViewNX (RAW converter) was free and pretty good. So if you are a person looking for reason to upgrade from Lightroom 3 to 4, then this review is not for you. I have no clue what Lightroom 3 has missing or what is new compare to this. I will review this base on first timers for Lightroom and people with experience with PS and ViewNX and some corel paint 8 (which I own too). I also use RAW, not jpeg editing.

Wow is the first thing I got to say after 2 weeks of usage. Actually, after one day I was ready to return it since I can do everything on here between ViewNX and PS. What I didn't realized later is how much faster I can do adjust things in LR rather than convert it in ViewNX raw to jpeg and then edit it in PS (either jpeg or through Adobe Bridge, ACR). Here are the plus and minus of Lightroom 4 version the other photo editors:

Pluses:
+work flow is fast. View NX is now 64bit like lightroom 4, but LR is a tad faster in term of editing and converting raw to jpg. Editing is not as fast as PS, but PS only open up one photo at the time and that is actually done in another software call Adobe Bridge. I learned from ViewNX not to put more than 100 raw files in one folder, or it will crash. So far no crashes on LR4.
+I always found Adobe converter Raw (ACR) clunky to use. LR4 adjustments are easy and fun to use. I can open a before and after views side by side and see how things changed, and not from memory.
+Noise reduction is amazing, why buy noise ninja, when LR4 does a great job. I don't shoot over 6400iso that much so, I not talking about that level of noise, just small touch up to clean a portrait skin on the fly. ViewNX has no noise reduction or softener. PS5.5 does, but you can do that in a few ways using filter: de-noise and blurring, there might be other ways too.
+Saving presets is something I love. ViewNX comes and can read the Camera raw presets (on camera picture profile), but you can't save any of your own. You can do this in PS as action.
+I can do about 90% of editing on LR4 compare to what I can do on PS 5.5e. ViewNX can do about 30-40% of what I can do in LR4. I also have a Sony nex so it raw software is even less useful. More in line with opening files from Adobe Bridge and then editing one by one to ACR, but with the level of option of ViewNX (not as much).
+No layering (a good and bad thing) here, to do the same option in Photoshop, I can do in LR4 in 25% of the time. To doge and burn I use the paintbrush and adjust the brightness or whatever and it is done and another one for darkness. In PS you have to create 2 other layers, then name them and turn them into overlay. TO adjust the brushes later, you just touch on the dot. Creating mono/duotone is also easier and quicker. Ex: the slider on the right side you can adjust hue, saturation, luminance, buy just looking and siding the bar. In PS those are separate window you pull from the tab, or you can open those tab to the right, basically it is just easier to use on LR.

Minuses:
-Won't let me save my catalog library on my network server, it must be saved on the computer HD. You can work with raw files on the network server fine. While having the library running off the computer hard-drive is faster, but I used 2 computer at home and sometime I do editing on either one, so the ability of using the file library on 2 computers with lightroom is not an option.
-To edit a photo you must bring it into your library also. You don't have to do this with ViewNX or Adobe Bridge to PS. You can open any file anywhere and start editing.
-No layering means no HDR or photo merge. Last I checked HDR and panorama are type of photography, well you can't do it here like you can on PS. Also without layering you can't cut and paste and do motion blur. People who do heavy portrait will still use PS for heavy photo adjustment. The Paintbrush on LR4 only adjusts color, hue, etc, but you can't paint color, line on it like in PS.
-Lightroom catalog takes quite a bit of space on the computer hard-drive itself (already 2gigs and I had this for like 2 weeks), something ViewNX or Photoshop doesn't really do.

Neutrals:
*LR4 was touting its highlight and shadow is improved, I think it is good, but I have been doing this on ViewNX and also PS for a while.
*can't read Nikon color profile. I adjust my RAW setting on my [[ASIN:B0042X9LC4 Nikon D7000]] and ViewNX will read those adjustments and when I convert to jpeg it is fast. I don't need to look and edit every files.
*Book, Slide show, Print tabs are features I wouldn't use that much and don't care too much. I might be interested in the web tab as I might create my own photography website and do have dreamweaver, so this LR4 features might be useful later on.
*there are only 4 tools, but they are more powerful then you thing.

Is LR a better RAW converter then Nikon own ViewNX? I would say yes and no. Since LR can do a lot more the potential of a greater picture is there. ViewNX does more natural looking image that I haven't created presents to match yet in LR. It can't do noise reduction, which I am using a lot now on LR. ViewNX still does great straight from the camera shoots better, since it read my in-camera raw presents.

I am PC person since I own too many software that don't run on Mac, mostly 3d and CAD software for architecture are PC only. But I got to thank [[ASIN:B002I0JKSS Aperture 3]] pricing; no way on earth is LR worth 300 bucks. It is not a full feature software like PS, even if it is faster for workflow. I wanted LR so long and now the price is about right I would recommend it for all the serious photographers. The only true other option might be [[ASIN:B005MMMT6E Adobe Photoshop Elements 10]] which is a gimp version (most features most users won't even notices) of PS and is relatively cheap. I do love the creations I am now getting from LR4. I will link to some sample later in the comment line.

For speed reference I am using a [[ASIN:B001MEHXJY Lenovo ThinkPad W500 Mobile Workstation - Intel Core 2 Duo T9400 2.53GHz - 15.4\\" WSXGA - 4GB DDR3 SDRAM - 160GB HDD - Windows 7 pro]] which is like 3 years old and it works fine.d paste and do motion blur. People who do heavy portrait will still use PS for heavy photo adjustment. The Paintbrush on LR4 only adjusts color, hue, etc, but you can't paint color, line on it like in PS.
-Lightroom catalog takes quite a bit of space on the computer hard-drive itself (already 2gigs and I had this for like 2 weeks), something ViewNX or Photoshop doesn't really do.

Neutrals:
*LR4 was touting its highlight and shadow is improved, I think it is good, but I have been doing this on ViewNX and also PS for a while.
*can't read Nikon color profile. I adjust my RAW setting on my [[ASIN:B0042X9LC4 Nikon D7000]] and ViewNX will read those adjustments and when I convert to jpeg it is fast. I don't need to look and edit every files.
*Book, Slide show, Print tabs are features I wouldn't use that much and don't care too much. I might be interested in the web tab as I might create my own photography website and do have dreamweaver, so this LR4 features might be useful later on.
*there are only 4 tools, but they are more powerful then you thing.

Is LR a better RAW converter then Nikon own ViewNX? I would say yes and no. Since LR can do a lot more the potential of a greater picture is there. ViewNX does more natural looking image that I haven't created presents to match yet in LR. It can't do noise reduction, which I am using a lot now on LR. ViewNX still does great straight from the camera shoots better, since it read my in-camera raw presents.

I am PC person since I own too many software that don't run on Mac, mostly 3d and CAD software for architecture are PC only. But I got to thank [[ASIN:B002I0JKSS Aperture 3]] pricing; no way on earth is LR worth 300 bucks. It is not a full feature software like PS, even if it is faster for workflow. I wanted LR so long and now the price is about right I would recommend it for all the serious photographers. The only true other option might be [[ASIN:B005MMMT6E Adobe Photoshop Elements 10]] which is a gimp version (most features most users won't even notices) of PS and is relatively cheap. I do love the creations I am now getting from LR4. I will link to some sample later in the comment line.

For speed reference I am using a [[ASIN:B001MEHXJY Lenovo ThinkPad W500 Mobile Workstation - Intel Core 2 Duo T9400 2.53GHz - 15.4\\" WSXGA - 4GB DDR3 SDRAM - 160GB HDD - Windows 7 pro]] which is like 3 years old and it works fine.

product_title: Norton SystemWorks 2005 [AntiVirus, Utilities, GoBack, Check IT]
review_body:
I've had home computers since the Timex Sinclair in 1982. The only time I've been forced to reformat my hard drive was a couple years ago after install problems with System Works 2002. I bought 2005 from buy.com because it was $64 with $64 rebates for upgrading. Free but not worth it.

I installed 2005 over 2005 that came installed on a new desktop. The pre-installed version had a virus update subscription that was to expire 12/5/05. After installing from the CD and registering I could not update my virus definitions as my \\"subscription\\" had expired instead of being extended 12 months as it should have been.

Now after a few attempts at uninstalling and re-installing, using the advice and programs from Symantec's web site the program is installed but won't run. At times it has seemed to keep unrelated programs from running.

If you do try to install this software be sure to have the backups and recovery points ready.

product_title: PC-cillin Internet Security 2004 [Old Box]
review_headline: PC-cillin outshines the rest - the real terminator !
review_body:
PC-cillin has performed an amazing virus surgery on my computer that Norton Anti-virus and the
others could not do. PC-cillin got rid of the most deadly virus immediately after it was installed
on my computer, and without even waiting to update its anti-virus database - simply amazing!
For about six months my computer was getting sluggish. I suspected it was troubled by virus but,
although I updated my Norton Anti-Virus everyday and scanned the entire computer many times over,
Norton declared that it found no virus.
Then, one day I started using the Bluetooth wireless dial-up modem kit, but the internet connection
got disconnected repeatedly. Each time a note would appear on the screen warning that the computer
would restart in 60 seconds. I finally contacted the Zoom modem tech support, and the technician
immediately identified the problem; my computer was plagued by the Blaster.Worm virus. Now, I was
prepared to forgo using the bluetooth gadgets, but to be plagued by the deadly Blaster.Worm got me
very concerned.
I re-installed Norton, updated it, and rescanned the entire computer many times, thinking that with
this fine-tooth comb scanning, NAV might get rid of the Blaster.Worm. Not only Norton Anti Virus
couldn't do anything, but Norton publish a big splash on the website with a long lecture on how
deadly the Blaster.Worm is. Also, from then on, every time I scanned, a Norton note would appear
on my screen, proclaiming that:
1. It cannot delete the Blaster
2. It cannot quarantine it.
3. It cannot repair it.
Now, what use is an anti-virus software that boasts of its superiority but is unable to help you
when you need help desparately?
I also tried two other anti-virus software but to no avail.
Then, thanks to Amazon for this customer review feature, I chanced upon this web page on PC-cillin
and read some encouraging reviews.
I immediately ordered the PC-cilling from Amazon, and it arrived at my door step in less than 48
hours! The amazing Amazon! I had opted for free delivery, which was estimated at 7 days, but the
quick free delivery was a pleasant surprise.
PC-cillin detected and killed the Blaster.Worm plus a few other viruses the moment it was
installed. Obviously, I am now a new ardent convert to PC-cillin, and I want to thank the users
who took time to share their experience by writing their reviews on this Amazon review page.
PC-cillin - keep up the good work!
Amazon, your efficiency is simply amazing.
HY
California

product_title: Greeting Card Factory Deluxe 4.0 [Old Version]
review_headline: Greeting Cards without having to go to the store.
review_body: I love being able to make my own cards. I've gotten pretty creative with pictures and this program makes it east to do. If you buy nice paper, they look just like a Hallmark Card and there is a lot of variety in styles.The only thing I don't like is that there is no choice for size, you have to use what the design says and sometimes I pick a design that I like but I think it would look nicer if I could do a regular 1/2 page card instead of the 1/4 size.

product_title: QuickBooks Pro 2015
review_body:
I was a little reluctant to move to QB Pro2015 because I had received conflicting info as to whether it would be able to convert my QB Pro2003 data without intervention from tech support at QuickBooks. I had to upgrade my computer from a Windows XP to a Wndows 7 Professional and my QB Pro2003 wouldn't run on Windows 7, so I had to do SOMETHING.
I am happy to say that the Pro2015 shipped promptly, installed easily and converted all my QB Pro2003 data without a single issue.
I'm still getting used to the new interface and some of the changes (like having to save an invoice before printing it and losing the "Remarks" option when posting payments), but all in all, I am relieved that I was able to make this upgrade without a major upheaval. It has all the features I am accustomed to, though the not-so-familiar (yet) interface IS taking some getting used to. I find that I am getting used to the QB Pro2015 quicker than I am getting used to Windows 7.
I am also VERY glad I didn't take the leap to the online QB.

This will surly decrease the market demand, it will give a \\"boom\\" to competitors in this condition, specially there are new regulations against Microsoft OS market policy. I suggest a small fee can be represented in activation for a whole new platform, something like that. Thank you.

No work phone or any other option. There is ONE field for a \\"significant date\\", no separate fields for birthday, anniversary, etc.!! No fields for children, no more addresses than the one primary address, and lots more missing info. Totally useless program! I sent it back immediately.

I have to close some windows before I use Quicken or I end up with Window stopping and error messages from Norton saying not enough graphics available or too high disk usage. I never had these problems when using Quicken 2012. I'm running Win 7 Home Premium 32 Bit, AMD Vision CPU and 4 Mb RAM with on board graphics on ECS desktop and 320 Mb HDD. product_title: CorelDRAW Premium Suite X5 [OLD VERSION]
review_headline: If you don't want or can't afford an Adobe Suite, get this!
review_body:
Very powerful and capable software that runs a close second to Adobe's various Creative Suites. If you don't want to pay hundreds more for an Adobe Creative Suite or you don't need to share files with other professional digital graphic or video artists, then CorelDRAW Premium Suite X5 is the way to go.

Since the early days of computer software, Adobe and CorelDRAW ran neck and neck for the top graphic design and image editing programs. Since the turn of the millenium, Adobe edged forward and has since sat atop all design, photo, and video software programs. With more acceptance and praise also came a higher price tag.... much higher.... 3-5x times higher.

For all of us coveting an Adobe Creative Suite, there is an alternative that works just as well and has many faithful devotees - it's CorelDRAW Premium Suite X5. In CorelDRAW Premium Suite X5 you can do nearly everything that Adobe CS can do and in most cases just as well or better. The capabilities of both software programs are nearly identical - the important difference being the restricted access to file types. Adobe's video and graphic file types have become the professional design industry standard over the years. This is the biggest thorn in the side for CorelDRAW users. To avoid downtime and technical setbacks, it is vital that designers sharing files use the same software and version. Since Abode is the industry standard, a CorelDRAW user will be the odd man out, even though his software is not inferior.

So if you want the most capable software, but don't want invest a year of car payments on a computer program, then CorelDRAW is the way to go.

product_title: Pumpedforlife Level 1 Win/Mac
review_headline: Great idea and a working product to back the idea
review_body: This was a Christmas present, I just love it. I have been going to gyms for years and always wanted a way to introduce new routines to my workouts. I always find it hard to remember the new routines I read in Mens Health magazine or taking cut out pages to the gym. This product simply does all that for me, I use it at home and also when I travel. Basically series of exercise routines that you like to follow with nice clear instructional images are downloaded into your pod. You can exercise and flip through the instructional images while you listen to your music.

product_title: ZoneAlarm Pro 5 Firewall + Privacy Protection
review_body:
I've been a Zone Alarm user for about ten years. This is not because I was completely happy but just too lazy to change. It seemed that every year it didn't work for one reason or another and I'd be asked to delete the old version and reinstate the fixed version. This happened again this year. Suddenly my firewall and anti virus stopped working. I contacted them and was told I had the old version (amazing as I'd only renewed my subscription a few months before). They asked me to delete the old version (just like previous years) and download the upgrade. A list of complicated instructions followed. I was annoyed but agreed. The only thing was the download didn't work. I tried 4 times. Frustrated and several blood pressure pills later I contacted their help people. I wanted a refund but they refused to give me one even though it was their error. I was outside the refund period they said. Their customer care is the worst I have encountered -ever. Now I'm without a firewall and anti virus even though I've paid for it. Disgraceful and their assistant was completely unsympathetic to my predicament. Basically he couldn't have cared less in my view.

Draw your own conclusions from my experience.

product_title: Hoyle Card Games 2008 [OLD VERSION]
review_body: I am extremely happy with this product. I can't figure out what the problems are with some of the ratings. These are exciting games for me. I wanted something that I could play like when I was a kid. We didn't have TV or Computers, so we created our own excitement, with either cards or board games. You select your own profile, and select the players the players that you want to play with. These players are always making comments, and it makes the game more exciting. The games aren't dominated by the computer. Both you and the computer have a chance to win. You just have to use logic, like if you're playing a real game. It certainly has the ability to sharpen your mind, plus enables you to have playing opponents. The excitement is to be able to win some of the games. You don't want to be able to win them all. I rated these games at 5 stars. Everyone has their own opinion. I guess it's like everything else. No one is happy with everything, but these games are just what I wanted.

product_title: Roxio Easy VHS to DVD 3 Plus
review_headline: Corel Roxio Easy VHS to DVD 3 installl failed repeatedly, no support
review_body:
Windows 7 Professional
This Roxio Easy VHS to DVD 3 software failed out of the box to install, Never got to a point where I could test the dongle and connectors.
Begins installation, then un-installs due to a unsubscribed failure
Three attempts are enough
I have purchased and installed over 8 Roxio products over the years, but since Corel took over, any kind of support is made more difficult, next to impossible.
I am returning my package through Amazon.com, mostly because Corel simply does everything it can to prevent the user from gaining access to anything but a FAQ and/or peer customer support, where I found that others have had the same issue with this software
I'll not likely be purchasing any more Corel ware, principally due to the virtually complete lack of support.
Richard

product_title: RCA Coaxial Cable Stripper for RG6, RG59/62 and RG58
review_headline: Good item, fast delivery, worked fine
review_body: Low price, fast & free delivery. Worked fine with most type of RG6 cables. However, no small instruction to change orange insert to different kind of cable like RG58.

product_title: Norton Antivirus 2010 1-User
review_headline: I'm wondering why this item shows up to be reviewed...
review_body:
being as it's worthless after 2010 is past history, as it's only good for one year.

But, I did use it back then, and it worked well. I had no real problems with it. I switched to a competitive product the next year, only because the competitive product had a 2 year lifespan. Also, I didn't like how long it took for updates to come from Norton, nor did I like how they make it sound like you're computer is about to be hacked to death if you don't update it immediately, which happens almost every time you turn on the computer, as they put out updates very frequently.

The good side is they are updating, but the down side is listening to their scare tactics to "do the update NOW". Interestingly, I never got one single virus the entire year, so that made all those scare tactics seem a lot like overkill.

product_title: Microsoft Windows Vista Business FULL VERSION [DVD] [OLD VERSION]
review_body: First off I want to respond to the previous users who have upgraded your pc's from Vista, obviously not a good idea whatsoever, you always want a clean copy of xp or system restore the laptop/desktop if you bought a name brand PC. People who are experiencing freezing, what are you guys talking about? There is obviously something wrong with your pc's. I have a Sony Vaio with 2GB of RAM and a Core 2 Duo T5600 with Business on it, and the thing works very very well. Programs not working? Yea, only some of them if they require specific drivers that aren't developed for Vista. People saying Itunes, Firefox and other programs like that don't work, you've got to be extremely dumb not to realize that everything works perfectly. All the programs work listed above and even more now. Service Pack 1 will be released soon enough to fix any minor issues that haven't yet been fixed. If you don't know how to turn things off in the control panel, like UAC you probably should have someone do it for you. That is there for your protection. Windows Aero, can also be turned off if you don't like its little featuers like the popup windows and flipping. My Background: I have 6 computers running all versions from Home Premium to Ultimate of Vista and I have only had minor driver issues, with my sound card. THATS IT. Every company that I know of has perfectly stable drivers for most devices. People who say they can't find drivers for their printers and or other devices must be something that company doesn't support anymore and or they haven't looked in the correct places. Speed? I haven't noticed anything different, but I guess there obviously would be differences because Aero does take more memory to run the 3D interface. Epilisy? Uhh I suggest you go to a doctor, or stop using computers all together if you have this issue. And by the way its under mouse features.

product_title: Microsoft Office 365 University 4-year Subscription
review_body: I bought this for an online class in Access 2013. Well...read the fine print...Access doesn't work on a Mac unless you purchase and download Windows FIRST. You can download Word, Excel, Power Point yada, yada, just not Access. Needs to state that loud and clear so there will be no confusion. Fortunately I didn't open it and could return it, but only after calling Microsoft and double checking.

product_title: H&R Block At Home Deluxe + State 2012
review_body: I order the same tax program every year! The interview style is very user-friendly. I also appreciate the ability to switch to forms, if I need to look at or change specific line item. Filing online is quick and easy.

product_title: QuickBooks Online Simple Start [OLD VERSION]
review_body:
I am extremely satisfied with the online Quickbook operations, and when I have a problem they always have a very dedicated customer service department that cares that your problem gets fixed. They do their maintenance after hours so you are inconveniently interrupted. Plus they always give you adequate notice of when they will be down. I highly recommend online Quickbooks to anyone and the price is great. I favor the online because they take care of the backups, and you always get the latest features.

Charlott H.

product_title: Kaspersky Internet Security 2014
review_body: Protected my PCs 100%. Great product!!!

product_title: Microsoft Windows 8 Pro - Upgrade [Old Version]
review_headline: Now costs extra for media player
review_body:
About a year ago I cancelled my cable tv and bought a tuner that was designed to use with windows media center that came with the Windows 7 software on my computer. While I had a bit of trouble getting the digital over the air signal, a new outside antenna fixed that problem and between my Amazon Prime and Hulu Plus, I've been a very happy camper!

The other day I bought a new laptop so that my mother in law could watch tv in her room and it came with Windows 8. I read up on this new program and NOWHERE did I see that they were doing away with Windows Media Player! So, I go to set it up and it's not there!

I called Microsoft to see where it was and was informed that it would now cost me an extra $99.00 to upgrade so that I could have the media player. I griped and they then told me that I could upgrade to Windows 8 \\"Pro\\" for $39,99. I didn't see where I should have to pay more for a lessor program, so I requested that they swap the windows 8 out for windows 7 and then we could call it a day.

Nope, can't do that! They told me that I would have to contact Toshiba.

Maybe I'm wrong, but watching tv was the specific reason that we bought that computer and I don't see why I should have to \\"upgrade\\" in order to get the same functionality that the older program had...aren't we supposed to be moving forward???

I've now been waiting for a couple of hours for a supervisor from Microsoft to call me back and am two thirds towards running over to the Apple store and buying a Mac (which I've confirmed can be used to watch over the air tv with the purchase of a usb turner.)

To say that I'm disappointed in Microsoft would be an understatement. VERY POOR CUSTOMER SERVICE!

Update...I still haven't heard back from the supervisor, so I called Microsoft's corporate number (425-882-8080) and asked to speak with the executive resolution group (or at least someone without a headset on) and was told that I would have to email them after giving them my personal information. I then asked if I could speak with the VP in charge of customer service and they refused to tell me who that was...so, I googled it and found an Blog post by a lady named Barbara Gordon where she slams google's customer service and compliments Microsoft's.

I called the corporate office back and asked for Ms. Gordon's office and was told that I would have to initiate my correspondence via the US mail (really?? One of the world's largest technology companies and I have to send them a letter??? Seems like a stiff arm to me!

product_title: H&R Block At Home Premium + State 2012
review_headline: I like TaxCut. What more can I say
review_body: I like TaxCut. What more can I say. Been using them for a long time. I am used to the things that are missing or may not work so well but each software has its own glitches. I am used to theirs.

product_title: Microsoft Money Standard 2005 [OLD VERSION]
review_body:
I've wasted two hours so far trying to organize my investments. When I called my broker for help, they said \\"yeah, Microsoft Money is pretty notorious for being complicated. We recommend Quicken.\\" I guess I should have called them first.

I bought this product new, but there are absolutely no instructions so I'm flying blind. It's pretty ironic that software I buy to uncomplicate my finances is too complicated to set up.

I \\"only\\" wasted $10.99 on this, fortunately. Unless you're well-acquainted with this software before you buy, I'd avoid it.

product_title: Microsoft Word 2002 Upgrade [Old Version]
review_headline: The gold standard in word processing
review_body: I don't write many reviews, but the misleading reviews below forced my hand. In one, Word 2002 is dinged because it doesn't open quickly on that person's outdated computer. In the other, it's dismissed as being crash-prone. I have found neither to be true. Running Word 2002 on a desktop (1.5 P4, 52 MB RAM, Windows XP), I find the program to be fast, stable, and able to help me in any document-related task I need to get done. I'm not a fan of Microsoft, but I have to give them props for a terrific WP program and a great new OS to run it on.

product_title: Roxio Easy VHS to DVD [Old Version]
review_body: After moving from a 32-bit desktop computer to 64-bit laptop running Windows 7, I also needed to update my Roxio Easy VHS-DVD program. I wanted to stick with Roxio because I had used the previous version for years and was was very happy with it. This version, however, is an awful step backward. 1) Video produced by this program is only fair at best. 2) Video can be saved to hard drive in only one format (.mpg). 3) Disk burning is very slow (burning time for a 1.5 hour video was 2 hours). All in all, I am very disappointed with this product and would have been very pleased if it did no more than previous versions. Sadly, Roxio took a huge step backward.

product_title: Anime Studio Debut 9 Hybrid Rose Agent
review_body: extremely limited. No real instruction. Not very useful. They should fotget the debut and go right to the real product if ththey aren't going to give you a chance to use it.

product_title: MP3-Wolf
review_body:
When [a music website] went offline because of legal issues I found myself missing it, and contented myself with using search engines to find tunes I wanted. This program, unlike [music website] which was a peer-to-peer music exchange, seeks out music titles that may be hiding on the Internet. WHile it lacks the convenience I enjoyed, it does a pretty good job of ferreting out files I'm seeking and also has some surprisingly nice features that aren't available from a search engine, such as:
- ability to preview music before you download it
- will not display deal links (search engines hold a lot of dead links in their cache, which you don't find out about until you try to download and get the dreaded File Not Found error)
- maintains a list of sites where you previously found files
You can narrow your search to any of the following file types: Windows media, Real Audio Media, MPEG 2, MPEG 3, MP3, WAV or MIDI, or you can have the program search for any media type. No, it's not [music website], but it's better than anything else I've tried since that system went offline.

product_title: Microsoft Windows 7 Professional [Old Version]
review_headline: Windows 7 is Windows Vista done right
review_body:
I've been using Windows 7 since its beta release, but my laptop's been running the final version for weeks now. I really disliked Vista and preferred XP still, but Windows 7 has tipped the scales...finally. Windows 7 has been reliable and it's snappier than Vista. Windows 7 sips laptop battery power so my 1-year-old Dell XPS M1530 runs longer under Win7 than it did under Vista. But what I really like about Windows 7 are the new or improved features it offers. Here's a list of my favorites:

#1 VIRTUAL LIBRARIES
With virtual libraries, the special folders like Documents, Pictures, Music and Videos have all become libraries. Instead of being a physical storage location, they're indexes that point to one or many locations on the computer you're using, as well as other computers you're networked with. In a home setting, where you're running Windows Home Server, you can now easily direct file stores to your server. When coupled with Offline Files & Folders (a features that the non-Home editions of Windows offers since XP), you can easily take your server data with you, even when you're in a disconnected state. Also in the home, housemates can easily see each others' data by including their respective folders in one another's libraries. When you search a library, you're searching your computer and any other computer that has folders you've added to your library. This is, for me, the single best feature of Windows 7, and is an excellent reason to upgrade.

#2 START SEARCH
The Start Search has been improved in Windows 7 so results appear instantly as soon as you click the Start button, and then either type the name of a program on your computer, or a task you'd like to perform (like, \\"change my display settings\\"). No more hunting folder hierarchies to find that elusive program, or spend time figuring out where Microsoft has placed something in the Control Panel. This is a tremendous time-saver.

#3 AERO SNAP
The Aero user interface has three new tricks -- Shake, Peek, and Snap -- but only Aero Snap is a major leap forward. Have you ever tried comparing the contents of two windows together, side-by-side? It's painful to do because you have to fiddle with resizing the two windows. With Aero Snap, now all you do is grab the title bar of one window, sling it to the left, and Windows 7 will automatically resize the window to fill-up one-half of your screen display. Do the same with a 2nd window by slinging it to the right, and it'll fill-up the right-side of your display. You can start comparing two windows in...an Aero Snap. Aero Shake and Peek are cute, but not nearly so helpful.

#4 TASKBAR
Gone is the Quick Launch bar that too many people didn't know existed. Now, the whole Taskbar is a quick launch bar -- drag and drop any program icon onto the bar, and you're one click away from starting the program. Also, it's so easy to move the taskbar around now. I keep it on the left vertical on my computer. Gone is the system tray, too -- Notification Area takes its place. The Action Center alerts you to anything you need to do to keep your computer working smoothly.

#5 PROGRAM COMPATIBILITY (including XP Mode)
Any program can be run in one of many compatibility modes now. Windows 7 has a wizard that will help you pick the right, earlier version of Windows under which to run an older program. You can do the same thing more quickly by right-clicking on a program icon, click the Compatibility tab, enable Compatibility mode, and select the earlier version of Windows you want. For truly stubborn XP programs, the Professional edition offers XP Mode -- a fully licensed, virtualized copy of Windows XP. Note that your hardware must support virtualization for this to work.

#6 STICKY NOTES
Less functional that the Vista Sticky Notes -- which nobody used -- but now I actually use Sticky Notes to put reminders on my Desktop. They're quick, easy, and work just like a regular Post-It note only you don't get fingerprints on your screen!

#7 JUMP LISTS
There are two kinds -- Jump lists that let you quickly pick a task to perform, and Jump lists to quickly select a document to open and edit in the associated program. These are nice time-savers.

#8 SAVED SEARCHES
In Windows Explorer, you can create filtered searches and then save them in your Favorites for later use. This is handy to find filtered data in the future. When you re-execute the search, it creates a dynamic results set (so your search is never stale).

#9 CONTENT VIEW & ARRANGING
Also in Windows Explorer, two new features. Now you can arrange a folder into subdivisions by date (great for your pictures folders!). You can use the Content view to combine thumbnails of files along with details that usually are found only in the Details view.

#10 USER ACCOUNT CONTROL
Most everyone hated UAC in Vista (even though it helped to keep your computer safe). In Windows 7, Microsoft tamped down the annoyance factor of UAC. You can change your date and time without setting off UAC, for example. You can also decide whether UAC should go into secured Desktop mode whenever it does get triggered (secured Desktop is when your screen darkens and you're forced to respond to UAC's dialog box asking permission to run a program or make a change to your system). You can easily turn-off UAC, too.

#11 PAINT, WORDPAD, CALCULATOR
All three of these utilities got updated. Wordpad and Paint have the Office-like \\"ribbon\\" now, and Calculator has a few new memory keys, touch sensitivity, and a Programmer view for those dealing with hexidecimals and binaries.

#12 HOMEGROUP SHARING
This is the easiest way to share data with others in your (home) network. HomeGroup creates a password that is shared among computers, and that takes care of all the issues with user accounts, file permissions and \\"access denied\\" problems. While not appropriate for corporate use, this is great for the home. I made this feature last because I'm not using it -- I just think it's a great idea for inexperienced users. Note: all the networked computers need to be running Windows 7 to make HomeGroup sharing work.

In short, think of Windows 7 as Windows Vista done right.e a regular Post-It note only you don't get fingerprints on your screen!

#7 JUMP LISTS
There are two kinds -- Jump lists that let you quickly pick a task to perform, and Jump lists to quickly select a document to open and edit in the associated program. These are nice time-savers.

#8 SAVED SEARCHES
In Windows Explorer, you can create filtered searches and then save them in your Favorites for later use. This is handy to find filtered data in the future. When you re-execute the search, it creates a dynamic results set (so your search is never stale).

#9 CONTENT VIEW & ARRANGING
Also in Windows Explorer, two new features. Now you can arrange a folder into subdivisions by date (great for your pictures folders!). You can use the Content view to combine thumbnails of files along with details that usually are found only in the Details view.

#10 USER ACCOUNT CONTROL
Most everyone hated UAC in Vista (even though it helped to keep your computer safe). In Windows 7, Microsoft tamped down the annoyance factor of UAC. You can change your date and time without setting off UAC, for example. You can also decide whether UAC should go into secured Desktop mode whenever it does get triggered (secured Desktop is when your screen darkens and you're forced to respond to UAC's dialog box asking permission to run a program or make a change to your system). You can easily turn-off UAC, too.

#11 PAINT, WORDPAD, CALCULATOR
All three of these utilities got updated. Wordpad and Paint have the Office-like \\"ribbon\\" now, and Calculator has a few new memory keys, touch sensitivity, and a Programmer view for those dealing with hexidecimals and binaries.

#12 HOMEGROUP SHARING
This is the easiest way to share data with others in your (home) network. HomeGroup creates a password that is shared among computers, and that takes care of all the issues with user accounts, file permissions and \\"access denied\\" problems. While not appropriate for corporate use, this is great for the home. I made this feature last because I'm not using it -- I just think it's a great idea for inexperienced users. Note: all the networked computers need to be running Windows 7 to make HomeGroup sharing work.

In short, think of Windows 7 as Windows Vista done right.

review_body:
The reviews here are at least a decade old.

This software no longer works. At least not on my iMac since I upgraded to Snow Leopard several years ago now. If you run the Starry Night Widget all you get is a report \\"Cannot connect to server\\".

May I humbly suggest that you look elsewhere.

product_title: Adobe CS5.5 Design Standard
review_body: Product arrived at my house a few days earlier than expected, and everything worked perfectly! No trouble at all with the download.

product_title: Rosetta Stone V3: German Level 1-3 Set with Audio Companion [OLD VERSION]
review_headline: Rosetta Stone is just a rip off
review_body: I got the full course of Rosetta. It basically tries to teach you as you were a baby. There is nothing immersion about it. you have to guess what a picture is trying to say. Remember the old saying \\"A picture is worth a thousand words\\". Basically what Rosetta Stone's pictures are. You cannot always guess what a word is by a picture. Sure the simple stuff. But nothing complex. German is a complex language. Has different case systems nominative, dative, genitive, accusative. There are different ways of expressing \\"the\\" like das, die, der, des, dem. How are you suppose to know which one is which by looking at pictures and predefined combo boxes? Rosetta Stone just teaches you how to match pictures with words and simple fill in the space. It doesn't teach you grammar at all. Doesn't tell you how to write sentences and surely doesn't tell you how to express a feeling. It's an expensive flash card programme. You are better off learning from books than Rosetta Stone. It's just a media/promotion hype. You will never learn a language just from this program. I learned move from \\"Living Language Ultimate German Beginner Intermediate\\" and Assimil German with Ease than I did from Rosetta in 2 months. I know more than 300 words and how to carry basic conversations. I wouldn't recommend this product to any one.

review_headline: Would not upgrade my CS3 Photoshop.
review_body: I'm sure it is of no fault to Adobe or Amazon, but I was not able to use this serial number to upgrade from the CS3 version on my computer. I probably have a wonky serial number. I will probably have to dump my version and buy a completely new CS5 Photoshop. Rats!!!! I ended up giving it away to a friend who had a good serial number.

product_title: SketchBook Pro 2010 - Old Version
review_headline: The ONLY program I'll draw in!
review_body: I've been a comics artist / Illustrator for over 25 years and Sketchbook Pro is the ONLY program I'll draw in. Sure I use Photoshop and others for some tweaking / coloring, but when it comes to laying your ideas out on the screen, NOTHING beats the ease and smooth response of Sketchbook Pro. It's fast, a joy to work in and never lets me down or gets in my way. Can't recommend it highly enough.

product_title: Secure IT File Compression and Encryption Software
review_body:
This program seems to work better than I expected. It is well-conceived and easy to use. One of the surprises was that it encrypts and stores files faster than just copying them to a backup. How? I don't know. Is it really military-grade and unbreakable for a 100,000 years? I'll take their word for it, but the whole idea of encryption has a weak link that everyone seems to ignore. The security of one's data is only as secure as one's password. Since my password is hardly military-grade secure, neither is the data I've encrypted. If someone really wants to attack my data, he would hardly try to break the encryption itself; instead, he'd break my password and decrypt the material without any effort whatever.
All that being said, I'm glad I bought the program and I kid myself that my backed-up data is safe when I take it mobile, despite understanding the weak link in the process. And,heck, it's so cheap, how can one complain? I'd buy it again.

review_body: We originally saw this CD at Best Buy, and it was $20. My 7YO son immediately wanted it. I told him at that price, we would come home and check the Internet. Low and behold, Amazon had the lowest price on the web (after a quick Google search)! We ordered the CD, and it arrived quickly. We immediately installed it, and my son played it ALL DAY! Then, when my husband came home from work, my son told him about it, and they both played it all night. It is a great little software program that teaches kids to type and does it with one of their favorite cartoon characters! Thumbs up for this software!

product_title: Jewel Quest Solitaire 2 & 3
review_body: LOVE IT

product_title: The Print Shop Design Suite Professional Edition [Old Version]
review_headline: I bought this 6 years ago and I still use every now and then...
review_body: but it's not the greatest piece of software. On the upside, it is fairly easy to use. After six years, I think I've gotten my money's worth.

product_title: TurboTax Deluxe 2002
review_body:
After using TurboTax for the past 6 years, I confidently installed it on my Windows 2000 machine, expecting the same comfortable interface I'd grown to, well, like. I was quite surprised when I received a popup stating that critical Windows 2000 files had been modified, and that I needed to restore them from my Win 2K installation disk! I dutifully did so, and then finished with the TurboTax installation.
I was disturbed to find 3 URL shortcut icons on my desktop, which I hadn't requested, each marketing some service that somebody thought I needed to know about. They were wrong and, in my estimation by so doing, arrogant, so I spent some time deleting them and their associated files and icons - a bad start, but just a taste of what was to come.
I then attempted the magic of the \\"One Step Update\\", which (you'll see) wasn't and which didn't. So, I traveled to their website for the manual download. I then attempted to follow the update instructions which, like the initial instructions for Windows 2000, could not be followed as written. I tried anyway, and upon launching TurboTax, was pleased to discover that it had detected the existence of the update file and politely asked if I'd like to apply it. I answered a polite \\"Yes\\", and watched as it failed in its task, giving a cryptic message which prompted another trip to the web site.
I discovered that the web site's translation of the cryptic error message was of no value in resolving the problem, so I launched the \\"Live Chat\\" option. I'd have preferred the \\"Live Tech Rep\\" option, but that privilege is reserved for those with ...[money] to spare for each call; not wanting to throw good money after bad, I connected with \\"E\\", the Live Chat entity. I described my travails to \\"E\\", who disappeared (dis-something, anyway - never really saw anything of him but characters). After a brief (actually the briefest of) conversations in which I think I failed to adequately convey my plight, he recommended the industry-standard \\"uninstall and reinstall\\", the first tactic taught in Tech Support 101 and one which automatically presumes all customers are novices and haven't a clue.
In the process of following those \\"instructions\\" to effectively disprove its validity, I discovered the heretofore unknown background C-Dilla installation, which took another half hour of research and downloading and run time to get rid of. By this time, I'd had enough...
The end result? I'm switching to TaxCut. This is certainly not what I've come to expect from Intuit, and I'd heartily recommend that you avoid this product like the West Nile virus.

review_body: it is really a genuine software, no tricks & no troubles at all after i downloaded it...& also i got it cheap compare to wal-mart. thanks for the amazon.com website...you help people a lot to save money..that is the most important facts that people would know...

review_body: Adobe Photoshop Lightroom 4 Student and Teacher Edition stopped downloading the pictures after a month and when my daughter tried to contact yesterday Technical Support she was on hold for over a hour and still there was none available to help her.

product_title: Linux Mandrake 7.1 Complete
review_headline: An excellent distribution for the the new user
review_body: After having tested the Red Hat, Caldera, and SuSE versions of Linux, I settled on Mandrake 7.1 and have been using it for several months. The other distros are good in their own ways, but I highly recommend Mandrake for newbies. It has an extremely useful configuration tool, it supports much of the available hardware, and it offers a stable, Pentium-optimized kernel. The last poster seemed very frustrated, which is the reaction of some people who come to Linux for the first time. I'd like to offer some helpful pointers so people will try this OS and not get discouraged: 1. Most distros now have intuitive and very simple installation programs now. 2. The complaint that many internal modems won't work with Linux needs to be clarified-- software-enabled modems, Winmodems, are the standard today because they are cheap to produce. Yet they are truly not modems, because they have no on-board processor and instead use the main CPU. If you plan on using Linux with a modem, and you have no modem or you have a Winmodem, you need to purchase a real modem. These will generally be more expensive ($60-$80) but they are worth it because they don't slow your CPU down and you migrate to other operating systems without worrying about compatibility. 3. Any time you plan on using new software, you should read an instruction manual. This includes operating systems, and there are many books on Linux. 4. Supporting Linux, despite initial frustrations, will foster the already sizable Linux community and result in easier and more compatible versions, as well as showing your support for free software. 5. Use the Linux support community, which you link to from any of the distros' websites. Any possible difficulties you might encounter have been seen before, and the answers are everywhere. Have fun with it.

product_title: Windows 7 Home Premium SP1 64bit, System Builder OEM DVD 1 Pack (For Refurbished PC Installation)

review_body: I purchased the Singing Coach just after Christmas....decided to give myself a present. I have found it to be very useful in helping me focus on note accuracy as well as timing. I was a little concerned about ordering after reading a few of the reviews with their problems but now I realize they were probably the operators fault,ie: 1)does not always record a line on the graph when you sing.....make sure the earphone/mouthpiece plugs are all the way plugged into the computer,etc. I do agree that a few more pieces of music would have been nice but overall, it has a lot of options to try different things. I would recommend this product to anyone - even those that have sung for years can have fun with it.

review_body:
Here is my original review: I'm sure this is a good program. It has too many glowing reviews to be otherwise, but I find it cumbersome and counter-intuitive to the point that I'm finally giving up on it.

Not wanting to be defeatist, I went back to the program and tried again. The cropping tool is a pain, and I haven't gone into the more complicated stuff, but it's better. More time may bring me completely around.

product_title: Hoyle Card Puzzle & Board Games
review_headline: Very disappointed, it did not include some of the games ...
review_body: I expected to get an updated version of the Hoyles Games 2008 that I have. Very disappointed, it did not include some of the games I have on the 2008 version.

product_title: TaxCut Platinum 2002
review_body:
I had been a user of TurboTax for several years and was very satisfied with the results and ease of use. I had logged on one day to pick up a copy of Turbotax but based upon some of the reviews here I decided to get Taxcut. Big mistake. Taxcut is very buggy and it even locked up when I was first trying to register it online.
I had already calculated my taxes based using my tax info from 2002 and Turbotax deluxe 2001. I figured it should give me a ball park figure since tax laws can't change that much in one year.
At any rate TT estimated I should pay in a small amount. When I entered all the numbers in with Taxcut platinum it showed me as having in pay in almost tens times as much. I re-entered the data several times and it would give me different results but always on the high side. I even completed a brand new form and made sure I had the latest sotware update. It said I had the latest update but still yielded very high info on taxes and it wasn't a consistant number even though my tax info was constant.
Finally after messing around with this for about ten hours I decided I would just uninstall everything and throw the software disk and everything associated with Taxcut in the trash. Hopefully I can wipe this nightmare completely from my memory.
I ordered Turbotax today and I will used that program this year.
Taxcut is not a very user friendly program and in some of the interview questions it was mising a specific line number to get info from. Also, the look and feel of this program is a bit on the edge of being amateur/professional. Very similar to some of the shareware programs you can find where somebody wrote the program from their basement. It may be just a cut above that.
Looking back on some of the reviews of TT the negative on the product had more to do with the activation process rather than how the program performed.
If Taxcut has worked fine for you for years than stick with it but I am never going totouch this program again. I should have know better than to change something that was working fine for me.

product_title: Block Financial H&R Block Tax Software 14 Deluxe + State
review_body: Although I couldn't get last year's info imported and had to manually reenter it (the first year I had this problem), the rest of the session went smoothly. The Q&A format is easy to follow and very thorough, and you are shown a current refund or amt. owed, which changes as you go according to your answers. Filing is easy. You can print and mail a form or easily file on line by filing directions. Your form is filed, and you will receive an email when your return is accepted. What could be easier?

product_title: Autodesk Sketchbook Pro 7
review_body: We have three generations of artists in our household so this product generated a lot of excitement. My granddaughter jumped right in on this and figured out a whole lot of things really fast. She was enthusing over it and told me, "give them 5 stars grandma!" and so I did. She loves that she can fix something on one layer without affecting the other layers. She loves the mirror image feature and bringing a picture from the internet to underlay her work. She loves that you can turn the lines up where you can see them or turn them down so they don't show on your picture. And a whole bunch of other things that I don't understand yet. Me being the oldest generation in the equation, I haven't figured a whole lot out yet but I love what I have seen so far. The wonderful thing is that everything is easy to use and the company has provided detailed instructions that are easy to follow. This product has already brought great joy to our household and I know that it will be even more wonderful the more we use it and learn all the bells and whistles.

product_title: Learn French with OUINO: The 5-in-1 Complete Collection (for PC, Mac, iPad, Android, Chromebook)
review_body: I will only use two words to review the Ouino French program....Tres Bien! This program is so much fun to use that I don't want to leave the computer. Try the free sample and you will see what I mean. Au revoir.

product_title: Rosetta Stone Filipino (Tagalog) Level 1-2 Set
review_headline: My Filipino husband born/raised in Phils, doesn't know the words!
review_body:
This is really difficult to use, because I don't know what they are trying to show you in some of the pictures. The software doesn't explain how to form sentences either. It just shows a picture then tells you what it is in Tagalog and you have to guess as to what they are trying to show you in the picture!

It's confusing. There are NO lesson plans or guidance. Just figure it out.. good luck. I have never made it pass the 4th chapter.

My husband who was born and raised in the Philippines till the age of 18, and he doesn't know what some of the translations of these words are. Also, there are so many different dialects in the Philippines, it's hard to speak to other filipinos. I have had this software since 2008 and have restarted the lessons at least 4 times. I'm trying to start over again and trying to find help on the internet but no luck so far.

I wish this program had a sylabus, a schedule to follow and a way to see the answer in English to make sure I am learning the right term for the right picture and some background on their verbs and sentence structure!!

product_title: Investment Account Manager, v3
review_body: I have used more of these programs than I probably should have. This is by far the easiest, most intuitive and most complete program for keeping track of all your investments, for seeing how well your buy sell decisions were and for tallying necessary figures for tax time. Plus cost of program is quite reasonable; however, you should me aware that there is a annual maintenance fee of $39. This is quite reasonable also as it gives you access to program improvements and access to the program developer. I have had occasion to need help on three problems. Each time I sent an email to tech support I had an answer by close of business that day. Good luck on getting that on a regular day. The maintenance fee includes fundamental data on all your stocks and watch list imported in on a monthly basis. Also one of the program partners (I think they are brothers) is an attorney and has just started a blog that adds general financial advice on investing and using the program. It's pretty vanilla right now but, if past history is any indicator, it will improve quite a bit.

product_title: Web Easy 7.0 Professional
review_body: WebEasy was easy for me to use (even without any programming knowledge) and helped me get a great website up very quickly. The templates are another great addition for the beginner as it had all the structure set up and all I had to do was eneter in the content. A great product for anybody trying to get up thier first website.

product_title: Roxio Easy VHS to DVD [Old Version]
review_body:
My dad brought this home to me in hopes of converting our cassettes and vhs-c's to dvd or at least put them on the hard-drive. This piece of junk had me rolling over trying to get good video display. I tried direct s-video connection, didn't work, so I bought a s-video male to male cord, that didn't work, and I tried about 5 different possible scenario connections, but they all yielded same results. I guess it works for some people, but I want the quality to be very close to what I am copying.

Do not buy this product point blank - too much run around. Even for the money it should at least work decently, and for those who had problems even installing I say just give up while you are ahead and return this product to Roxio for them to make improvements on their sorry attempt of vhs-to-dvd, and then release it again once its working. Seems this was nothing but a beta release!

Now let me go return this piece of $50 dollar trash to the store. Wish I could rate it zero!

product_title: QuickBooks Basic Payroll 1-3 Employees 2010 [OLD VERSION]
review_body: For a small business, the basic payroll works great. It is easy to set up and maintain. It is also scalable and can expand with my company.

product_title: TurboTax Deluxe Federal + E-file + State 2011 [Old Version]
review_body:

It asks questions, walkes you through the process and does a review
check at the end in case there are any blank spaces that need filled
or changed, etc.
Will continue purchasing this item each year. Best way I found to
do my taxes. Really easy with e-file too.

product_title: Data Rescue PC, Hard Drive Recovery Software for Windows
review_headline: Great Support - real people that care
review_body:
Have used Data Rescue PC 3 to recover data from two PCs - one with a failed Windows XP operating system (but intact files), and one that someone accidentally re-installed the factory configuration (and corrupted the files). Data Rescue PC 3 was able to recover the files in both cases and I would recommend it to a friend.
Good News:
Software was able to boot a PC with failed Windows XP operating system
Flawlessly Recovered data from PC with dead operating system and most data from PC with reformatted PC drive
Great support from Jeremy
Not so Good News:
Slow - took hours with ~100 GB of data
Did not recognize the external USB drive attached to save the recovered data (in both cases) unless the drive was connected after Data Rescue PC 3 booted the PC (thank you Jeremy).

product_title: Windows 7, ANY VERSION, 64 Bit, Service Pack 1, x64, SP1, Home Basic, Home Premium, Professional, or Ultimate, Repair, Recovery, Restore, Re Install, Reinstall, Fix, Boot Disk, DVD, [DVD-ROM],Operating System Recovery
review_headline: so if you get all that the this might be for you as I am not that good I need a recovery disc for my desk top ...
review_body:
this is not for someone who does ot know Computers.

when it comes it will have paper work that will say

BEFORE YOU RE INSTALL WITH THIS RECOVERY MEDIA....READ THIS FIRST

This recovery media contains the regular version of windows 7 and a version of window 7 known as " windows 7 N'
This N editions of windows 7 have all the features that normally come with each indivividual windows 7 edition, except
for windows Media player 12 and related programs, such as windows media center or windows dvd maker.
You'll need to install a media player or other software to play or create audio cds,to digital media files and artist and title information of digital media files; veiw albums rt music files; tranfer music to personal music players; or record and play back tv broadcasts.

The N editions of windows 7 allow you to choose your own media player and software required to mange and play cds ,dvds, and other digital meia files. if you choose to use windows media 12. downloading it ' along with related software is free.

DO NOT INSTALL ANY VERSOIN OF "WINDOWS 7 N " UNLESS YOU UNDERSTAND YOU WILL BE WITHOUT ANY MEDIA PLAYER AND WILL NEED TO ADD ONE TO YOUR PC YOURSELF.

tHEN IT GOES ON ON HOW IT HAS A 30 LICENSE AND YOU HAVE TO FIND THE LICENSE ON YOUR LAPTOP OR DESK TOP AND PUT IT IN TO MAKE IT GENUINE.

so if you get all that the this might be for you as I am not that good I need a recovery disc for my desk top or buy a new one as I am not that smart about computers if some of this was put down some where I would have realize it was not something for me. Not saying it is a bad disc just saying it is for someone who knows computers. So this is why 2 stars cause have not used it to know how well it works.

product_title: Roxio Easy Media Creator Suite 9 [OLD VERSION]
review_body: I was having so many problems playing media, finding the right codecs for devices, and burning certain dvd formats. Roxio Easy Media has the solutions and they are all in one place. Perhaps my old disc player program didn't have certain formats, I'm not sure but some rental dvds didn't play. The rental store tested the disks and found they played on a regular dvd player but not a pc dvd. CinePlayer shows everything so far. I have a PSP and I could only find Sony's software which was expensive for dealing with only one format. I decided to try the Roxio suite since you get many more programs than just the PSP one. Now when I attach the PSP to my PC the program identifies the PSP and will choose the right codecs. I hear Sony willl have direct downloading to the PSP, but until then I can take the video and music from my pc and do a simple transfer. Before when I burned dvds they wouldn't play on my dvd player. It turns out that there is a separate format and the roxio program has that choice. I can make menus too that will work with my dvd player remote control. I can't say the program is perfect since it did have some types of warning popups. The programs still works but I have to click on the popups and they come more frequently they I would like. I can't figure out if it is coming from Vista or the roxio program though. Still I have all the features I needed for a low price.

product_title: TurboTax Basic 2002
review_body:
The 2003 version of Turbo Tax requires you to register with Intuit. If you upgrade your computer you need to re-register with them and so on and so on.
Also the program installs C-Dilla spyware that monitors all CD activity on your PC; it continues to spy on you even if you uninstall Turbo Tax.
Thoroughly UNRECOMMENDED.

product_title: Movie Studio Platinum Suite
review_headline: Zero stars for a reason... it wouldn't install
review_body: Movie Studio 10, great. Movie Studio 12, so far almost ZERO. After a couple of years of using Vegas Movie Studio Suite 10, I decided to buy Version 12, primarily for the faster processing with the video card in my $2000 Toshiba Qosmio X500 notebook, running Windows 7 Pro 64-bit. Since buying Sony Vegas Movie Studio Platinum Suite 12 from Amazon in late Dec 12, I've asked two questions of Sony Vegas tech support online, and returned one box to Amazon for replacement. Sony has taken almost two weeks each to respond to my two questions, and I had to goose them twice with updates to the questions before I got a reply. The product as sold would not install on my computer, nor would large downloaded files for the three major parts [Movie Studio, Sonic Forge, DVD Architect]. I could READ and copy the installation DVD to hard disk, but I couldn't INSTALL any of the three parts from the DVD nor hard disk nor from downloaded files. As an aside, many other programs installed with ease during January, either from internal/external optical drives, or from hard drives or USB. Finally on 30 Jan 2013, Sony tech support sent a solution that partially worked. Between the *****s below. They sent: An update for Movie Studio Platinum 12 was released today which resolves some issues related to this incident. You may download the new update here. [...] My same-day reply to tech support, and you shouldn't settle for less: ***** \\"V 12.0.756 downloaded and it installed. However, I still can't install newer versions of Sound Forge or DVD Architect later than the ones that came with Version 10, either from the Sony-supplied disk or from recent downloads, [nor all the rest of the DVD that should automatically be on my hard drive]. If you notify me when you have such updates for those two programs, I will download and try to install them, and let you know whether they work. However, when I bought the product over a month ago, I did not agree to be an unpaidBeta-tester for Sony. After I have done your work for you, I expect you to supply me with a factory printed disk that will reinstall in the future with all three programs and supporting features. I intend to post a negative review on Amazon with the problems I've had and will recommend that no one buy the product until my problems are fixed. I will revise it once I am satisfied, with a caveat about buying only the latest production date software. Keep this incident open until you have supplied me with the product I paid for. ***** So my recommendation is to wait to buy this product until Sony fixes it unless you too want to have endless frustration and get a product that wasn't properly tested before release. Keep watching this space. Sure, lots of buyers will have no problems with the original version, but do you also want to take the chance on becoming an unpaid Beta-tester with all the hassles that entails, or do you just want to edit video? Sony Vegas 10 great, but no support any more. Sony Vegas 12, support can take weeks for a reply; not ready for prime-time. And that's before I've had a chance to try the new version which I should have been using a month ago.
