product_title: Movie Studio Platinum Suite
review_headline: I expect to like it! Then, and Now...
review_body:
UPDATE:
Back when there was only 5 reviews of version 12, 2 reviewers gave this product 1 star, thus giving the impression of \\"Buyer Beware!\\"
This was quite puzzling after I had done research on this as a quality product.
Thus, I purchased the product, and wrote the following \\"review\\", which I later updated, below the original.
If someone was researching what Amazon reviews said about the product, and thus read the negative reviews,
I wanted to reassure them I was ordering this without hesitation!
Also, there was a lot of strong evidence, it was a superior product, at a comparitively low price!
( No I don't work for Sony. see my other reviews.)
Thus my original review:

OK, don't be put off by the low scores. Perhaps because, so far, there are few reviews?
I researched and have purchased this from Amazon. I think my decision is reasonable.
I have yet to receive it by mail. Am I taking a chance? Sure, but the evidence shines through to the positive.
Of course I will update my 4 star rating up or down, once I recieve it and use it a bit.
I rated 4 stars because, I didn't want to put more people off, from seriously considering this product.

Here's the logic;
1.) This software is exactly the same as version 11, with the exception of being 64 bit and it can be adjusted to use popular brand GPUs.
In other words, some one familiar with version 11 sees very little difference in the layout except some additional plugins.
Version 11 has a nice user base, and a good rating from people who use it.
Users of lower versions of this product, who have upgraded to this 64 bit version have reported a huge difference in speed. Look for yourself.

2.) Version 12 \\"stand alone\\", has a good rating right here on Amazon. This suite IS version 12 stand alone, with additional programs included!
Judge the ratings by viewing Music Studio Platinum 12. But also check out version 11's reviews. Look elsewhere besides Amazon for more reviews.

3.) Included with the \\"stand alone\\" version of \\"Music Studio Platinum 12\\", is \\"Sound Forge Audio 10\\".
This also is a stand-alone program that seemlessly melds into the video program.
The 2 combined stand alone prices, are well above the Suite price. Check it out.
I already own and use Sony's Acid Pro 7, and the layout of both Sony products in Movie Studio PL 12 have the same work flow.

4.) I have asked questions about this product from a certain person who makes instuctional videos on how to use this and other \\"Sony Vegas\\" incarnations.
His videos are easily found on the internet.
I asked him about the compatability between the suites 64 bit Movie Studio, and the 32 bit Sound forge.( I bet you never thought of that! )
He explained, Both programs are working with manipulating files. And they work together very well.
A 64 bit program or a 32 bit program, do not change an MP3 file into 32 bit or 64 bit! Video files are the same!
He explained that it has to do with speed. Music files are small. So a 32 bits is fast for rendering music.
Rendering even complex music files, is nothing compared to rendering video. Especially the video Movie Studio is capable of producing. Thus 64 bit is an upgrade!

Yes this is \\"Sony VEGAS Music Studio HD Platinum Production Suite 12\\". Sony just decided to remove the words \\"Vegas\\", \\"HD\\", and \\"Production\\".
I will update my opinion, as soon as I receive and use the product. I may have to eat Humble Pie, but I don't let that deter me from what I expect to be a good upgrade
after mastering Windows Movie Maker. LOL!
Let's Face it, most people examining this product are looking to upgrade from something simpler, but they're not looking for something as complex as \\"full on\\" Premier or Vegas.

Secondary review: I was not surprised when I recieved Sony Movie StudioPlatinum 12 Suite, that it was what I expected, and more.
The main disk includes 3 Sony stand alone programs, that can be purchased separately at a higher cost.
1.) Movie Studio Platinum 12
2.) DVD Architech Studio 5
3.) Sound Forge Audio 10

The bonus content disk contains:
1.)NewBlueFX 3D titling and Video effects
2.)iZotope Vocal Eraser
3.)Red Giant Magic Bullet Quick looks

Each of these disks are accompanied by a corresponding pamphlet, that contains all the serial numbers for your programs. Very nice!
Besides the extras on the bonus disks, the main program contains many many different video transitions, video effects, as well as the same for audio.
You really don't need any of the things on the extras disk. But they are powerful tools, that allow for creative freedom.
But, if you dig deeper on the original program disk, after you have installed, you can open and explore the folders, and find 50 royalty free Sony music tracks.
And something I didn't see advertised; 1001 high quality sound effects.

The main program is easy to use, if you have an interest in video editing. But just like buying a guitar will not make you know how to play it, you have to want to edit your videos!
Sony provides at a cost, many instructional DVDs use can buy and learn how to use this. BUT, Sony sent me an email providing a link to many free official videos they post on YouTube!
This support is what I've already experienced with Sony's Acid Pro 7. It fulfilled my expectations.

So, if I want to know how to add a title, I watch a video, then implement. EZ! How to fuzz out a license plate? Same.
I don't try to learn the whole thing. I just learn new things as I go. If I wonder how to do something, I look it up.
The program itself is professional grade. It works fast and smooth. Renders are very tight and sharp. It is a good choice.
I give it a \\"Nigel Tufnel\\" ELEVEN!Platinum 12 Suite, that it was what I expected, and more.
The main disk includes 3 Sony stand alone programs, that can be purchased separately at a higher cost.
1.) Movie Studio Platinum 12
2.) DVD Architech Studio 5
3.) Sound Forge Audio 10

The bonus content disk contains:
1.)NewBlueFX 3D titling and Video effects
2.)iZotope Vocal Eraser
3.)Red Giant Magic Bullet Quick looks

Each of these disks are accompanied by a corresponding pamphlet, that contains all the serial numbers for your programs. Very nice!
Besides the extras on the bonus disks, the main program contains many many different video transitions, video effects, as well as the same for audio.
You really don't need any of the things on the extras disk. But they are powerful tools, that allow for creative freedom.
But, if you dig deeper on the original program disk, after you have installed, you can open and explore the folders, and find 50 royalty free Sony music tracks.
And something I didn't see advertised; 1001 high quality sound effects.

The main program is easy to use, if you have an interest in video editing. But just like buying a guitar will not make you know how to play it, you have to want to edit your videos!
Sony provides at a cost, many instructional DVDs use can buy and learn how to use this. BUT, Sony sent me an email providing a link to many free official videos they post on YouTube!
This support is what I've already experienced with Sony's Acid Pro 7. It fulfilled my expectations.

So, if I want to know how to add a title, I watch a video, then implement. EZ! How to fuzz out a license plate? Same.
I don't try to learn the whole thing. I just learn new things as I go. If I wonder how to do something, I look it up.
The program itself is professional grade. It works fast and smooth. Renders are very tight and sharp. It is a good choice.
I give it a \\"Nigel Tufnel\\" ELEVEN!

product_title: BitDefender Total Security 2011 Value Edition - 3 PC/2 year
review_body: This product is not accurately represented by the manufacturer. It is nearly impossible to contact their 24/7 customer support. You CANNOT contact support through the process of loading software. There is no telephone number listed any where in their loading process or site-map nor is there a way to engage in a 'chat' because when the software doesn't load properly you don't have that option. One must get online (without antivirus protection) to attempt to locate contact information and once you finally find the number through a separate website and call, you will be put on terminal 'hold'. Upon loading the software my compter immediately locked up. The CD could not be removed. Afer several reboots I was able to finally remove the CD. I would never recommend this product no matter what reveiws it has gotten. I returned the software the next day for a refund.

product_title: Art Explosion 750,000
review_body: Was extremely disappointed. Disks did not work in my Mac computer and I even ordered set for Mac. I am used to Clipart program through internet and it is so easy to work with but have to pay $125.00 per year. Was looking to save some $ but have decided to renew my subscription to Clipart.

product_title: Microsoft Windows Vista Ultimate UPGRADE DVD (OLD VERSION)
review_body:
Having bought and installed every version of Windows this installation and upgrade (from Windows Home XP) was the smoothest. Microsoft's Beta testing appears to have been very successful. By the way, I am just an average home computer user.

Vista first inventories the software and hardware and indexes whatever files are needed for the transfer. Then it installs, which took about an hour in my case on a Celeron D CPU at 2.13 Megahertz and a little over 1G of memory, with the standard Dell-Intel graphics chips (not exactly a high-end computer).

The look and feel and the interfaces and integration of Vista with other software is awesome. The software has killer diagnostic tools that are a cut above the usual third party software algorithms--for example, Vista remembers what has been tried and tells you so if you try to repeat a recommended \\"fix\\". I liked, and installed two \\"gadgets\\" in the left sidebar--a floating office--style clock and a calendar.

All the software on my machine functioned after the install and reboot, even software Vista identified as possibly not working--in my case, the Intellipoint mouse software. It did work just fine.

The install did kill my broadband internet connection for a brief time; and after going 'round and 'round with the idiots at Adelphia/Comcast customer service--who stated that company modems did not work with Vista, and that they are not ready to offer help for their customer running Vista (do not believe them)--I fixed the connection after discovering (through a Vista diagnostic tool) that competing firewalls from Windows Security Center and Windows Live One Care were blocking inbound streams.

In fact, Vista has a very nice feature in its Windows Security Center (that helped me fix my broadband connectivity) which tells you when you have competing security features enabled. In my case, it was two firewalls, one of which (Windows Live One Care), wasset to \\"restricted\\". When I removed this firewall, and left the Security Center firewall enabled everything worked perfectly.

By the way, despite what I read elsewhere, my iTunes runs smoothly. I also have lots of third party software (defraggers, spy removal software, password software, etc.) on my computer, and all of it, except the well-known buggy and unstable System Mechanic 7, operates without problems, and did so without having to download \\"patches\\".

I believe Microsoft did a great job on producing and testing Vista. I highly recommend it to anyone that wants to move beyond XP.

product_title: Adobe Photoshop Elements 11
review_body: We got this for my 11 year-old for Christmas. We the option for him to use 3 different options from basic options to expert options he is able to use it easily. As he gets older he can learn more advanced things in the program. It was a wonderful option to get him away from video games!

product_title: Norton AntiVirus 2005 [OLD VERSION]
review_headline: DON'T MAKE MY MISTAKE - DO NOT PURCHASE
review_body:
Man what a problem this software created. Upon installation it deleted my very well running copy of Norton's Antivirus 2004. My system was slowed down so much it was like having an old 286 processor again. The crashes were mounting and \\"customer no support\\" if you can find it on the site was absolutely no help at all. Had to uninstall the product which is when I found the Antivirus Ver 4. was gone and I had no virus protection. Then to top everything off I dug out the AV 4. disk and found it had been cracked. Naturally Symantec refused to help resolve the problem I would not have had if I had not installed AV 2005. Every time I tried to tell the software that an email was not spam it would lock up the system requiring a re-boot.

AV 2005 is gone and is my AV ver.4 Still waiting on credit from them on my credit card. Purchasing a competitors product even though I have used Norton's since they first came out.

THIS SOFTWARE IS GARBAGE........ DO NOT BUY IT AND IF YOU DID DO NOT INSTALL IT. Much better off keeping ver. 4 and keeping your subscription unless like me you cannot replace AV Ver. 4. and you are simply screwed.

product_title: LAPLINK GOLD HOST/REMOTE ( FG-LGD000-RT-US )
review_body:
The key value of this product is the ability to sync large or many files across machines. I travel a lot, so being able to synchronize my laptop files with my office and home workstation is the whole point of Laplink Gold. You can imagine, then, my horror at finding that this product does not work with my laptop: Dell Latitude CS 400XT. Plug in the USB cable, and the system hard resets! Very nasty.
Back in November 2000, the online support admitted that \\"other problems with laptops have been reported\\", and they would contact me with details of a patch as soon as one is available. I have heard nothing to date. Furthermore, their website makes no mention of laptops that do or don't work with this product. No mind for the customer. They just take your money, and fob you off.
When added to the USB cable price, the entire package costs around $200, but provides no value at all. To all prospective purchasers: BE CAREFUL (or be ready to demand your money back).

product_title: QuickBooks Payroll Enhanced 2014
review_body: I am fairly new to bookkeeping and completely new to QB. I am the office personnel for a rural church. Our needs differ from most businesses. Our purpose and our tax regulations don't fit the mold of a typical non-profit foundation either. These unique differences make the bulk of the training videos and manuals very tedious and confusing to adapt in a practical way. I could not have deciphered and used the product without the amazing techs that are available, patient, kind, enjoyable, and efficient. They have taught me the best way to accomplish my goals. I did watch the videos and have a manual and they have been very helpful, but the final breakthroughs usually come with the help of a tech.

product_title: PowerFinder Commercial 2001
review_body: This is another terrible product by InfoUsa. For a small business trying to extract information for mailing lists it's a waste of time and money. It's even worse than SelectPhone, which used to be a terrific software package. You can't extract more than 1000 names at a time, it's hard to use, nothing is co-ordinated for the user. They lie on their promotion and packaging. Nothing works. Don't waste money on ProCD either. I'm trying to find a software program like this that actually works

product_title: TurboTax Deluxe 2005 with State Win/Mac [Old Version]
review_headline: Cheap Alternative to an Accountant But Submit Only Once
review_body: My friends persuaded me that I didn't need to spend $ on my accountant for basic deductions (mortgage, second home loan, charities, work expenses, etc.) and that TurboTax was user- friendly and just as effective. For the most part, TurboTax lived up to my expectations. However, as a first-time user, I made a few mistakes (didn't have all of my wife's documentation and I lost a charity receipt that I had recorded in my computer records) so I had to resubmit. I hoped that, since I found these errors just minutes after submitting my TurboTax for direct bank deposit, that I could start all over again without amending my taxes and having to print out the amendment and having to send it snail mail to the IRS and state. I was wrong. Once you submit your results, you have to amend any caught mistakes no matter how soon after, which can put a red flag on your finances and catch the attention of the IRS and state. I've never been audited and the very thought is troubling indeed. Next year I will use TurboTax again but I will make sure I have dotted every \\"i\\" and crossed every \\"t\\" before I submit my final results. I hope my lesson can be of value to others and spare them unnecessary anxieties.

product_title: Microsoft Office for Mac Home and Student - 1 User [OLD VERSION]
review_body: Can't do without it. It used to support 3 users, but now just one. Oh well. I can't do without WORD anymore. I can do without Microsoft, but not without WORD, and this actually works better - inserting images that is..

product_title: McAfee 2015 Internet Security 3 PC (3-Users)
review_body: interesting but no disk

product_title: Windows 8.1 System Builder OEM DVD 64-Bit
review_body: Not as good as windows '98 but it does what I need it to 11/10 would recommended

product_title: Roxio Easy Media Creator 7 [OLD VERSION]
review_headline: This also works well for business slideshows
review_body: I recently discovered that this great consumer software - Easy Media Creator 7 - that I use for my own personal and family fun could also be used for some of my work projects. Not everyone in the world has PowerPoint, and if they do, they may not have the same fonts installed on their PC as the slideshow you are trying to share with them, etc. So creating and sharing slideshows that everyone can view can be a challenge. I just got back from attending a conference and trade show last week where I took a bunch of pictures. In no time I downloaded them and turned them into an annotated and audio narrated slideshow using Creator 7. I then had our Webmaster post it on our Intranet site and now co-workers from around the world can watch a quick summary of my show observations. It made me look like a star at work!

product_title: Norton 360 Version 4.0 1 User-3 PC
review_body: No problems with software installation and my computer runs smoothe. The 360 Program did not slow-up my computer.

product_title: QuickBooks Pro 2011 - [Old Version]
review_body: As with all of my Amazon purchases to date, overall service is 5 stars. I start the review with this, because I purchased the product as an unwilling participant. I've been a QB user for at least twelve years and have upgraded the product based on a willingness to upgrade and improve my accounting systems. This upgrade has me a little more than annoyed as it was an unwilling upgrade. As many have felt, the current economy has all businesses scrambling to save themselves financially. QB decided their current subscribers needed to upgrade their entire accounting system in order to cure a systems security issue with their online mail and credit card processing, in-lieu-of a security patch. The minimum cost to upgrade is appx. $230.00+++. While $230.00 may not seem like a lot of money when spread over the years, when times are tight $20.00 seems to have value again. Without the upgrade, my business would have come to a creep with the discontinued abilities to electronically bill or send e-mails. Since the QB system is all proprietary, a user cannot cut-n-paste an invoice to send over their own private e-mail systems with the older versions, it requires the use of QB to accomplish this through the QB servers. That's the bad side. The good side is, QB now allows the use of private e-mail v. going through the QB servers to e-mail invoices, with a small hitch, QB asks for the e-mail password every time an e-mail billing or statement is sent through private e-mail. If there is a \\"remember me\\" command, I cannot find it in the set-up or help links. The new QB look and feel is better than ever, just as easy to use as before, with the added benefit of not having to use their server to electronically send invoices. Overall I'm pleased with the product, the timing was very bad and didn't allow for a planned purchase. Less than a months warning was given that the older version would expire and rendered useless for what I required. Amazon receives even more credit for hosting a great price, 1/3 the cost elsewhere, as well as delivering as promised.

product_title: Turbo Tax Parent V2
review_body: Product was priced well, it was delivered on time and works as well or better than the Turbo Tax soft ware I have used in the past.

product_title: Generic USB to Apple Sync & Charge Extension Cable for iPad, iPhone, or iPod - Black
review_body: This cord worked well for the first few months but then developed a loose connection and broke. Poor quality it seems.

product_title: Big Fish Fames 2 Game Pack. Curse of the Pharaoh The Quest for Nefertiti and Curse of the Pharaoh Napoleon's Secret
review_body: Product was as advertised and arrived on time.

product_title: TurboTax Deluxe Fed, Efile and State 2013
review_body: overpriced but easy to obtain & use

product_title: DVO Enterprises Cook'n Recipe Organizer, Version 12
review_body: I reviewed several programs and finally settled on Cook'n. It is easy to use and the updates just keep making it better. I have used their technical services several times and they have always been quick to respond and answered every question I had. They helped me resolve several issues with the program quickly and easily. I would highly recommend this software to keep your recipes organized and accessible on your smartphones and pads.

product_title: Microsoft Money Deluxe 2005 [Old Version]
review_headline: Way too difficult to be worth it.
review_body: This program is way too difficult to use. To begin with, it never could access my bank accounts in order to merge the information. Unless you have several accounts, investments, tons of debtors and have absolutely no organizational skills, this program is a waste of time and money.

product_title: Camedia Master Pro 4.0
review_body:
I have version 2.0 for Mac and bought 4.0 pro so that my wife could have an easier time e-mailing photos.
The e-mailing utility works great, but it doesn't store mails you've sent for later review and it doesn't allow for easy viewing of pictures you're selecting for mailing.
The print feature also works much better, or at least it did until I treid using it under OS 9.2.2. Under OS X things worked fine, but I had to downgrade for other reasons and have been unable to print to my HP Photosmart ever since. Their tech support was not very supportive. Anyway, when it was working it made much more efficient use of paper and it allowed you to select photos from multiple different directories, unlike the previous version.
However, what I liked about the old version was that it was drag-and-drop friendly. It was easier to transfer files between directories this way, and so it is infinitely harder to organize photos under version 4.0.
Generally, it seems that whoever wrote the software wasn't completely familiar with Macs. A lot of the convenient and powerful shortcuts we Mac folks use are not served by this program.
If I had to do it over again I wouldn't buy it. If they work out the above-mentioned bugs soon, though, then it's worth it.

product_title: I Was An Atomic Mutant! AKA Mutants Attack
review_body: That's right, Uncle Forry was indirectly responsible for this and the developers say so on the box and booklet inside. This has a drive-in 1950's scifi feel to it. You can tell this was a labor of love. You get to play as several huge monsters with different destructive powers, a brain, a 50ft woman, a floating eyeball, a godzilla type lizard etc destroying a city. Each level, the cities get bigger and bigger and pretty soon youre battling big jets dropping bombs on you as well. At one point you're attacking a small desert town with a drive in movie theater!! I'd happily pay [...] for this w/o batting a eyelash and you can get it here for a couple of bucks...do it!! Buy this game, you wont be sorry!! If you love 50's scifi, attack of the 50ft woman, brain from planet arous, godzilla, attack of the crab monsters etc then this is a must buy!!

product_title: Acronis True Image 11 Home [OLD VERSION]
review_body: I've used it to clone two disks -- both system disks, one XP aand one Vista -- with no problems at all. The backups that I do with it go smoothly as well.

product_title: TurboTax Deluxe Fed + Efile + State
review_headline: downloads Turbo Tax files from the previous year and is highly recommended. I've been a Turbo Tax user for seventeen ...
review_body: After reading the reviews on Turbo Tax Deluxe 2014 dropping schedules C & D and charging more, I've decided to switch to H&R Block Deluxe software. Its cheaper, downloads Turbo Tax files from the previous year and is highly recommended. I've been a Turbo Tax user for seventeen years and this was the last straw.

review_body: I use this for school, writing essays and sending them to prof's... and I'm having a heck of a time having word 07 \\"talk\\" to other versions of word, if I attatch an essay and send it to my comp from school, I have problems getting it to send on to another prof.. I wish the bugs were worked out before purchasing. I'm not the only student having issues with word 07 and getting their work to their prof.s..

product_title: Easy CD and DVD Burning
review_body: The software was as advertised and the mail delivery was very quick.

product_title: Norton Antivirus 2012 (3 PC/1 User )
review_body: Every year I do an upgrade and every year I get the Norton Antivirus. Don't have any problems with it.

product_title: Adobe Photoshop Elements 7 [OLD VERSION]
review_body: The delivery of the product was fast and efficient. The software was not a retail copy, but a bundled CD from some other software or hardware that is illegal to be sold separately.

product_title: Encyclopedia Britannica 2002 Expanded Edition (DVD-ROM)
review_headline: Don't forget the content! Program not that bad.
review_body: I run this program on a reasonably powerful computer (1.2 Athlon) with no problems but a slight delay booting up (perhaps this might translate into a freeze on a less powerful computer). Encarta might be more kid friendly, but don't forget the depth and quality of Britannica's content (after all it has been the premier reference for eons and it's all there on the DVD). I know style counts for something when it comes to the software interface, but don't forget the content, particularly if you're over 13!

product_title: Teach Me Blues Guitar
review_body: Great for beginners and intermediates! I purchased this cd-rom for a very fair price. Since downloading it and going through a few of the sections I find this simply amazing! First, I think Keith Wyatt is an excellent teacher, specifically via DVD. He appears throughout the sections of this cd-rom. Second, this cd-rom has EVERYTHING! If you're into the blues and learning how not only to play but where the playing derived from, this is definitely for you. You can go to specific riffs and then click on icons to get the lowdown on scales, modes, etc... It tells you the history, the methods and the uses for everything. Awesome! This program has a virtual fretboard that you can slow/speed as it plays. It loops and sections off whatever parts you feel you need to look at again. It shows actual videos of Wyatt playing or teaching as well as computerized methods. There's too much to list as to what this can do for you. I love it already and I've hardly delved into the meat of it all. What I like so far is that this cd-rom teaches you what the blues is. If you want to pick up a guitar and become a rock and roll god overnight this is not for you. But if you want to learn a little something about the heart and soul of The Blues this is definitely a fantastic tool for your blues education and training. I highly suggest paying the small price for something like this. It's fun and, if you take the time, can really teach you some great things on the guitar.

product_title: PC-Cillin Internet Security 2007 - 3 User [OLD VERSION]
review_body: I have a number of machines that I manage with this product installed. They worked great on previous version of PC-Cillin until I installed pc-cillin Internet Security 2007, then every thing RAN SLOW... It also gobbles up huge amounts of RAM. I have 1GB RAM and all of my systems become progressively slower as the day goes on. After one day of being powered on the computer is useless as it is too slow and idles with ~600MB RAM used when not doing anything. This 2007 program seems to have become some kind of virus itself... DO NOT BUY! I will start moving my machines over to something else.

product_title: Microsoft Office Home and Student 2013 (1PC/1User)

product_title: TurboTax Deluxe 2002
review_headline: Won't run under Win4Lin. Can't file amended returns.
review_body: I bought every year's TurboTax without looking at reviews or features, based on many years of good will from excellent software. Never again. Many reviewers mentioned the problem with product activation that prevents you from filing amended returns if you or the IRS decides you need to. That alone makes TurboTax completely unsuitable for use. A second problem I haven't seen mentioned is that it will not run under Win4Lin (runs Windows applications under Linux) and I don't want to reboot to Windows-only just to run the tax software. But thank goodness I installed TurboTax only under the Win4Lin virtual Windows which I can rebuild fairly easily. If I had installed it on my native PC and C-Dilla had modified my Master Boot Record, who knows if I would ever be able to repair my computer? *DANGER* stay away from this program!

product_title: TurboCAD Pro 20 Platinum Edition - Professional 2D & 3D CAD Design Software
review_headline: I am a 20 year AutoCAD user. I was ...

product_title: QuickBooks Pro 2015
review_headline: I am happy with Quickbooks so far...
review_body: I recently started my own business - my first try at it - and after speaking with many people I know who own small businesses, I went with QuickBooks. Almost everyone I spoke to uses it. I know there are other bookkeeping/accounting software products out there, but I have no point of reference with which to judge them. Than being said, I think QuickBooks has been really good for doing what I need it to do. I have a simple, one-man business with no payroll responsibilities. After some time with Qickbooks, I would be able to offer a more accurate critique, but so far it has been great.

review_body: My son took a course last trimester in High School on Home Design and got into it big time. He was always excited to show us and his relatives his latest house plans he had drawn. He even drew his Uncle's Cabin from memory and gave him a copy of the plans. This last Christmas We bought him a program for his laptop in hopes that he would spend more time doing something constructive instead of playing HALO all the time. The High School had been using the top of the line version of Home Designer but I bought the HGTV version for him for Christmas. It was not very user friendly, hard to use and had an instruction manual about 300 pages thick. We got a refund. Ordered the Hime Designer Suite here on Amazon and now I'm even getting into this! Very easy to use and a lot of fun! Highly recommend it.

review_body: I've used Tubo Tax Delux for several years to prepare my tax return. This years edition was the easiest to use ever. Amazon offered the best price, even better than SAMs and BJ'S.

product_title: The Print Shop Professional 3.5 DSA
review_headline: Redemption! (rescued from my previous 2 star review)
review_body:
Below is my original review (2 STARS). just days after this was posted and after hounding Encore and Broderbund (who make this software) SOMETHING HAPPENED! The tech team at Encore (Broderbund) just created an update to fix a glitch in their VERY big seler Print Shop Professional 3.5. The update is version 3.5.3 and it solves a number of issues including the hateful blurry \\"HEADLINE\\" problem it was having until this latest. I just updated mine and checked it out... IT'S A FIX! So I raised my review to 4 out of 5 (it still has a few minor problems, but really... sort of trivial by comparison.).
_____________________________________________________________________________________________________________________

I was able to do so much with Broderbund's Print Master Platinum 12 and so disappointed when they ran that product line right into the wall.... for scrapbooking (almost exclusively). So much of what that software could do was lost and the newer version of --> [[ASIN:B00EXPSVJK Encore Software The Print Shop Professional 3.5]] was where those features ostensibly were expected to resurface. However...
Nowhere in the documentation either on their own website (where I purchased this product) or as a disclaimer during the order process does it mention a fatal flaw that is present in all PSP 3.5 (Print Shop Pro 3.5) incarnations. EVEN the newest ones on disc - THE HEADLINE FEATURE IS UNUSABLE!! Yes all headlines when using this software are blurred and at times illegible That's right, they are selling an otherwise dandy piece of tech gear, but if you need the Headline Feature, you are S.O.L As a result of this tactical negligence, I spent the better part of today/last night trying to find a cure for the heasdline problem, A cure which, sadly, does not exist at present
Oh, and don't bother with the 3.5.2 \\"update\\" . That too, does NOT work. A fact that has been acknowledged only in their pro user forums, the last words on which are to use another program to design a headline, save it as a JPG file and use it AS A GRAPHIC!... ..Unfortunately, it must be said, The PSP 3.5 is a bona-fide P.O.S.

product_title: Abbyy PDF Transformer 3.0
review_body: I liked this software because in my daily work, there are many times I need to create or revise a pdf doc. This software saved me time in having to retype a doc.

product_title: Better Hunting Journal
review_headline: Great hunting software to track my western hunting expedition.
review_body: I bought this software before my latest hunting expedition to Montana with my son. I brought along my laptop and was able to log every single aspect of the hunt. It allowed me to track the stats and pictures of each days successes, and captured the photos and field notes that will help me forever remember this Elk hunt with my son.

product_title: Family Tree Maker Deluxe [OLD VERSION]
review_body: I was rather concerned when I read some of the reviews about the Family Tree Maker. I called and spoke with their customer service representative who explained it has been updated to fix the message that sometimes came up saying the records were also lost on ancestry.com. She explained when I load the disc into my computer if it is one of the earlier 2012 versions a message will pop up saying you must update. I did that and it downloaded my ancestry family trees beautifully and quickly. (I do have one terabyte of storage.) I made sure to register when prompted and that did grant me the free three month subscription to the U.S. search records. I wanted the family treemaker so I will still be able to view all of the original source documents when my three month subscription is over. I also like the ability to create stories and books utilizing the information in the Family Tree Maker. I am very happy with the automatic sync feature between the records on ancestry.com and family tree! P.S. I love the Ancestry.com phone app!!

product_title: Parallels Desktop 9 for Mac
review_body: I have an iMac running OSX, and a Windows computer, all in one thanks to Parallels Desktop 9. I already had a recently purchased MS Windows Office Suite, and a Quicken upgrade, when I decided to go with iMAC and OSX for my next computer system. I was NOT looking forward to repeating those purchases! Parallels to the rescue! Buying Parallels and Windows 7 was much less expensive than buying those two items for MAC! And Parallels does work seamlessly; I can be using MAC software, and immediately open a Windows file, without giving it another thought. Way to go, Parallels!

product_title: Easy CD and DVD Burning
review_headline: DO NOT BUY- worst dvd buring software
review_body: I have been using nero last 5-6 years wanted to give this a try. Cannot even sense my DVD writer. Cannot even uninstall .. no such facility for windows 7 home premium. Reinstalling windows to clean this out and install nero back No way to give anything below 1 star

product_title: Quicken Deluxe 20
review_body: We have been using quicken for years, it great for recording your investments! We are able to track day to day.

product_title: Adobe Photoshop Elements 3.0 [OLD VERSION]
review_body:
I've been using Photoshop Element and Album since 1.0.

Contrary to what you may think, PE 3 is NOT Album 2.0 bundled with the image editor. It is one huge app with different intrinsic components: editor and browser.

Album 2.0 was good enough for my needs (pics and video clips cataloguing) but lacked a critical feature: watched folders (found in Picasa and ACDSEE). PE 3 has this feature, thus my decision to upgrade.

Below are the major issues I've been having with PE 3 are:
======================================
1- Video clips catalog is busted: only small clips are recognized while Sony 640x480 30fps clips show up as broken thumbnails. This worksd fine with Album 2.0.

2- Because of the above problem, the Browser is extremely slow to the point to appear being frozen. I had no choice but to disable 'Video' as an authorized media type...This alone is a showstopper for me.

3- Sluggish performance: launching and switching between editor and browser is slow (I have a P4 2G, 768MB RAM, nVidia GeForce ti 4200 with 64MB video card, WinXP Pro SP2)

If I wanted to catalog pics only, I'd use Miocrosoft Digital Suite, which is by far the faster app, not to mention the EXIF support wich is awesome (keywords are actually saved in the picture itself!)

Now because I need to tag video clips and pics, I'll be buying ACDSEE v.7.0. My friend ahs it and it is a great product: fast, video, pics and music cataloging. Their keywords is using a tree-like structure which is not as elegant as Adobe's tagging mechanism, but I'll live...

Hope that review helps.
p.s. In case you are wondering, I've purchased PE 3.0 for Windows from the Adobe store ten days ago.

product_title: Adobe Creative Suite 4 Design Premium Student Edition [OLD VERSION]
review_body: I bought this through Amazon. You better be a student because you have to open the box in order to get your product code. There's also a paper that gives you a link to verify student status for adobe software that has NOT been purchased directly through the Adobe website. I scanned and sent my documents and got my approval and new serial number the next day. If you are not yet registered for school, you can still install the software and use it as the trial option for 30 days.

product_title: Acronis True Image Home 2010 [Old Version]
review_body: The backup/retore features of this work grear with Windows 7 64Bit, but the clone feature is another issue. so far they have failed to get the cloning feather to work, perhaps because of the new AFD formate used on the new hard-drives?

product_title: 123 Copy DVD Gold
review_body: A little learning curve but it will back up my data

product_title: Autodesk AutoCAD Revit LT Suite 2014
review_headline: Software is great but the Autodesk Subscription's customer service is not.
review_body: The price was great and I have been happy with AutoCAD LT. However, I have not been able to load Revit LT on my computer. I asked Autodesk if it would run on my machine before my purchase and I was told yes. I tried to resolve this through my Autodesk subscription, which is supposed to provide technical support, but I have not received any help from Autodesk in solving my problem.

product_title: WordPerfect Office X6 Home & Student
review_body: Great price for a great product. Thanks.

product_title: Microsoft Expression Web 3.0 [Old Version]
review_body: I purchased the only book on EW3 that Barnes & Noble had in their local store. It only covered the basics and was no help at all. I returned it and ordered Expression Web 3 in 24 hours. This book is highly informative and provides a \\"hands on\\" learning approach. It is the best EW3 learning resource that you will find.

product_title: Mastering Chess Vol. 1: Learning Chess Openings the Easy Way - Traps & Novelties
review_body: I concur with the initial reviewer. Roman spends enough time so that you have a feel for the openings. An excellent video in comparison with the Polgar videos (which are the only other ones I own).

product_title: Corel Painter X3
review_headline: Top-notch painting program - but no vector support
review_body:
I've been playing around with this app for the last month and have found that it fits solidly in that space between photo-editing software and full-fledged graphics design software.

What I mean by that statement is that this software offers a lot of creative capability - far more than an application like [[ASIN:B00EOQZB0A Adobe Photoshop Elements]]. Having said that, the additional capabilities come at the cost of increased complexity & cost, which means most casual users won't even consider it.

In our case, we were considering using Painter instead of the full-blown [[ASIN:B007USG3OC Adobe Photoshop]]. All-in-all, this is an excellent replacement; but, it turns out that X3 does not support vector graphics. It won't even open existing vector files - which is a deal breaker for us.

Overall, I would say that Painter X3 has a good interface and a lot of potential for people who want to move to the 'next level' when it comes to digital creativity. As long as you don't need vector support, I suspect this will fit the bill perfectly.

product_title: Windows 7 Home Premium SP1 32bit (Full) System Builder DVD 1 Pack
review_headline: Wonderful from the start to the finish
review_body:
Great Price - was able to redeem my discover card cash back to get even more bang for the buck

Free Shipping with Tracking - Nothing beats it

On Time Delivery - Makes it very satisfying to get it on time ( after going through a wait of 2 weeks to receive the same software from another on line merchant, and not hearing from them or being able to contact them that led to canceling the order via my credit card, the importance of on time delivery becomes paramount)

Software - Perfect! that is what I was looking for. Everything went off well - from the installation to the the actual performance. I was able to install it on my 2004 Dell Dimension and thus avoid buying a new computer ( even as some folks from Dell service and one of the local software store guys told me that Windows 7 would not work/ not work very well on my 2004 Dell Dimension)

product_title: Iolo Technologies System Mechanic

review_body: Iolo's System Mechanic is a great software package. I have been using it for years now. My computers have never run so well since I first installed System Mechanic. I highly recommend it to anyone with a Windows PC or laptop. It is a must have item on all my computers. Just give it a try and you will see how it works. ( 5 STARS )!

product_title: Dragon NaturallySpeaking Premium 11 [Old Version]
review_body: I saw so many great commercials about the program I decided to purchase it. The instructions are very intimidating and challenged me a lot. After trying to perform the functions for many hours I had to give up and contact customer support. The technician was very helpful in getting me through the set. Why those instructions could not have been included eludes me. I am up and running and still having glitches here and there but I am not giving up on the program.

product_title: Hoyle Card Games 2008 [Old Version]
review_body: I had a really old version,don't even know the year. This one is much better and the graphics are much better. Husband and I bothe love this version.

product_title: Final Draft 9
review_headline: More bugs than a bag of bugs, with a side of bugs, with an order of bugs to go. (Windows 8)
review_body:
I love the idea of Final Draft, more than I ever actually liked final draft itself. I started in this game using CELTX because it was free, I love the collaboration ability, the online nature of the sharing facility, then the scheduling and the storyboard features, aaaaah the good ole' days.

But, just like the 'Apple' ideology, you just seem to have to have FD if you want to get on in this world. But for the actual tiny program you get it is full of issues, Ver. 9 crashes all the time, older scripts almost NEVER open properly, the workarounds are laughable (seriously, a release version software that needs workarounds??) and the whole "what version is this?" question that professionals have to ask each other now is utterly ridiculous.

The size of this thing should run on a PC from the 90's, let alone on a quad core beast I currently use.

If it wasn't for the fact that the industry almost 'requires' you have this dinosaur, I know most would use something else.

With version 9 they've really hit a Windows Vista moment, they fixed what wasn't broke, I think their time is coming to an end and they have literally shot themselves in the foot.

This morning an older draft of a script froze my work machine for about 30 minutes at which point I had to restart, and whilst typing a moment ago I looked up and the damned thing is about ten words behind (and I'm no speed typist I can tell you!)

Buggy, slow, almost no changes in the latest version that haven't been available for a decade in other FREE utilities, and for the price I think they should have done so much better, they have a massive fanbase that will halve with this new mess.

I think another day or two of this and I'm off back to version 8.

product_title: Kaspersky Anti-Virus 2013 - 3 Users
review_body: The item was new, in good shape. It really protect my computer against viruses, so I'm more than happy! Thanks!

product_title: Pinnacle Studio 16 Ultimate
review_body:
If you've seen this program in use and you know in advance what you will be getting, and that's what you want, then go ahead and buy it. Otherwise, exercise extreme caution. It is very powerful and capable. But it is also a very complex piece of software and not easy to learn. I tried it, decided it was several light-years beyond what I wanted, and chose to uninstall it.

And that's when the fun started.

Pinnacle installs about a dozen different applications when you run its installer. But when you run its uninstaller, it removes only the base application and leaves everything else on your disk--gigabytes worth of software. It took me an entire afternoon with Revo Uninstaller to get my PC back to where it had been beforehand. I had to find all the apps Pinnacle had installed, remove them one by one, and then remove *hundreds* of registry entries and *hundreds* of directories that each app's uninstaller failed to deal with. It was a nightmare and I'm still wondering what I might have missed and what will now fail to work because I deleted something I shouldn't have. It was an unmitigated disaster.

I would recommend that if you decide on installing this, that you first create a Windows Restore point. Then, choose the \\"Custom\\" install and just do the Pinnacle application itself. If you want all the other add-ons and libraries and tools, you can add them later, and if you decide to uninstall, you'll have a much easier time than I did.

product_title: Microsoft Windows 7 Anytime Upgrade [Home Premium to Professional]
review_body: Windows 7 Pro is required to join a computer to a domain, and the \\"anytime upgrade\\" is nothing but a key that unlocks similar funcions that are already built in to Windows 7 Home Premium. A little frustrating that Microsoft holds you to it, but at least Amazon.com has the cheapest price ANYWHERE!

product_title: AutoCAD Freestyle [Old Version]
review_body: The price for the product is probably the reason it lacks so many of the options the autoCAD Lt has and if you're expecting a home version of the Lt you will be disappointed. I sent it back and will save for a Lt version

product_title: Pixelmator [Old Version]
review_body: I love my Mac and while iPhoto is an awesome program there seem to always be some images that need a little more editing. So, I had a choice of 2 products that I liked. I purchased Pixelmator and while it does a lot of things and can get very involved I was not personally pleased with the software. Seems it is more of a creative tool than a photo editing tool - my opinion. So, I have since purchased Aperture 3 and do prefer it to Pixelmator. The flow of Aperture 3 with iPhoto seems a better match as well. So, download the free trial of Pixelmator before buying as well as the free trial of Aperture 3. Yes, I know Aperture 3 is more expensive but it is an Apple product and again - if you are OK with spending a little more I think you will be happier with Aperture 3 than Pixelmator. Also, the support with Pixelmator was less than good. No response to the 2nd email sent after attempting to do something suggested to me by their support.

product_title: Roxio Easy Media Creator 7 [OLD VERSION]
review_body:
I can't believe how many people have written negative reviews of this product. I have had very little difficulty and have not yet downloaded the update. Just to test my premesis, I installed the program on an older HP P3 computer with XP but with less memory and speed than with my new Sony VAIO. It made a huge difference and I suspect that people having ther stated difficulties just don't have a sufficiently powerful machine to deal with this very bulky program. It is working very well for me in producing family history videos with mixed movie clips from captured video, photos (digital and scanned prints), clip art, voice over narration, MP3 overla, sound effects, etc. I'm considering starting a hobby business creating family DVD's.
Good Luck!

product_title: Berlitz English Premier
review_headline: Don't bother if you don't speak Spanish!
review_body: I purchased this for a Russian speaker. No where in the description does it say \\"for Spanish speakers ONLY\\"! What a waste of time and money, simply because they can't accurately describe the product. Simply trying to install the product, your first hint is all the installation dialogues are in Spanish! I'm going to assume somewhere on the box (IN SPANISH) it says for Spanish speakers only. I don't read Spanish, thanks for no help at all with your packaging and description.

product_title: Apple iLife '08 Family Pack [OLD VERSION]
review_body: I was searching for older software for my 1.33 GHz iBook G4, and ran into this family pack (5 users) of iLife 08'. It had a great price at 6.44 overall, and within about 2 hours of ordering the item, I discovered it had already shipped! I had VERY fast shipping, and didn't take even half the estimated time! The software worked flawlessly, not to mention being in absolutely great condition. It even came with a trial version of iWork 08' as well, which was great. Everything was included as advertised. Bottom line: I would definitely recommend this seller to a friend.

product_title: Roxio Easy VHS to DVD [Old Version]
review_body: I installed it on a Windows 7 laptop that is less than a year old. The software install went fine. I plugged in the included USB device and Windows installed the driver. Based on other reviews I asked the software to get updates. There weren't any. I fired up the VHS, selected the edit button because I want to save the videos to a hard drive. I can always burn them to DVD later. I started the capture and saved a 40 minute video to disk. it took about 2.5 gig of disk space. I did stop most other applications and did nothing on the laptop while the recording completed. I read most of the other reviews posted for this product. I have an idea why some folks may have had so much trouble with it. This kind of application can be CPU intensive and if folks were trying to do almost anything else on a typical PC they probably caused enough interrupts that the software just gave up trying to process the incoming tape stream and burn it to DVD at the same time. [[ASIN:B001LQO4P4 Roxio Easy VHS to DVD]]

product_title: Sony Vegas Movie Studio 9 Platinum Pro Pack [OLD VERSION]
review_headline: Want a professional quality editor - Sony Vegas is your choice.
review_body:
I researched movie editors for months, before buying Sony Vegas Movie Studio 9 Platinum Pro Pack. Did I make the right choice? Yes, however this product is only usable if you have good general computer skills, and have the ability to learn through trial and error. I would not recommend this product if you expect to produce a masterpiece in one day.
What do you get in this package?
Vegas Movie Studio Platinum 9 - program to edit digital movie, add soundtracks, voice-overs, and fancy text, rolling credits, etc.
DVD Architect Studio - program to author DVD's, so you end up with professional quality DVD menus with all the bells and whistles
Sound Forge Audio Studio - a music editing program, with the added ability to convert all your L.P.'s and cassettes into digital format, so that you can then make CD's or load them onto your IPod.
Cinescore Studio 1.0 - free music of various genres, to add to your productions to give them a professional sound

There was one major problem with this software when I first loaded it, that I only managed to fix by pure luck. The problem was quite a major one. In the version which comes on CD-ROM, there is a bug which stops the soundtrack from MPEG2 files from loading into the editior program. This is incredible considering that almost every digital camcorder on the market uses the MPEG2 format, including Sony. However!!! Once you have loaded the program and registered, you need to go to the Sony update software web page. Here you will find a download that fixes many bugs in the program, including the MPEG2 problem.
There is another problem with the program if you are going to buying this to upload videos to You Tube. In the last couple of months You Tube has upgraded there video screen to Widescreen (16:9 ratio) format. There is no template in Vegas Movie Studio to handle this. So if you intend on uploading video to You Tube in 16:9, then you will need some advanced computer skills to create your own template. I'm sure Sony will work on this and provide an update to the program in time. At the moment, the program handles traditional 4:3 format for upload to the internet.

There are many cool features hidden within Sony Vegas Movie Studio 9 Platinum Pro Pack. Only the basics are discussed in the instructional booklets that come with the program. If you explore all the alien like buttons and features, through trial and error, you will be more than happy with this software.
6/10 for ease of use
9.5/10 for cool features
All the best with your movie editing and DVD production.
Regards D.

UPDATE AS OF 28th JUNE 2010
GREAT NEWS!!!!
Sony Creative Software has just released a brand new version of the software featured in this review.
The NEW VERSION is called Sony Vegas Movie Studio HD Platinum 10 Production Suite.
All the bugs that I had reported in the above review have now been FIXED! Yeah!!
This is FIVE STAR Software Package now. I give no hesitation in recommending this.
Dex :)ork on this and provide an update to the program in time. At the moment, the program handles traditional 4:3 format for upload to the internet. There are many cool features hidden within Sony Vegas Movie Studio 9 Platinum Pro Pack. Only the basics are discussed in the instructional booklets that come with the program. If you explore all the alien like buttons and features, through trial and error, you will be more than happy with this software. 6/10 for ease of use 9.5/10 for cool features All the best with your movie editing and DVD production. Regards D. UPDATE AS OF 28th JUNE 2010 GREAT NEWS!!!! Sony Creative Software has just released a brand new version of the software featured in this review. The NEW VERSION is called Sony Vegas Movie Studio HD Platinum 10 Production Suite. All the bugs that I had reported in the above review have now been FIXED! Yeah!! This is FIVE STAR Software Package now. I give no hesitation in recommending this. Dex :)

I hope that the results of the "audit" in the software are accurate, as by the time I get through, it has managed to ask questions that make no sense and help is non existent or dumber than the question as to what they are even talking about. I miss Parsons. Just let me fill out the forms and help if needed, thank you. Please make it easier for the 99% of us that have a simple income from one state.

product_title: Acronis True Image Backup 9.0 [OLD VERSION]
review_body:
Well I had a failing disk, but still working and under (Dell) warantee. So how to back up my system so when the Dell man came and put a new disk in? Mayne I could recover in minutes/hours/days (it took days). I delayed the install until I could get an external disk and install Acronis. I backed up twice (maybe 3 times). I used every thing I could including just copy and paste my file (this worked best)over to the external disk.

The great day came and !! Dell installs a naked disk (no os, no nothing) but, hay, I had no worries I had Acronis (you can now read: dog doo).

I restored the total system and got the message \\"Windows could not start because of a disk hardware
> configuration problem. Could not read from selected boot disk. Check
> boot path and disk hardware..
>
And after writing to Acronis i got a long BS message saying I should have had a different product.

NET maybe this is not a really BAD product but what's really unforgivable about a backup product is that they lied about what it could do. BTW their message was signed:

\\"We are always at your service should you have any further questions.

Thank you.
--
Best regards,
Alexander Gladkov

Acronis, Inc.
52 3rd Avenue
Burlington, MA 01803 USA

review_body: Not as good as an instructor class, where you can ask questions, but the next best thing. Very well done.

I would have stayed with Taxact if they had a Mac version. Given this, the product worked flawlessly and did a good job of walking one thru the 2009 return. One flaw was it stated it would import TaxAct from last year - it does not! I guess since TaxAct had no previous version for the Mac they did not think anyone on the Mac would need it - wrong! All in all it did a good job.

product_title: Visual Link Spanish Level 1, V.5 Windows
review_body: OMG I ABSOLUTELY LOVE THIS. My son is in a Spanish immersion school he's 7 so its good for any age . Both of my children as well as myself will be using this program. I plan on buying the entire visual link package. HIGHLY RECOMMEND. I would love if they would create a box of flashcards so my children could use as study aides.BUY THIS.

product_title: Hoyle Puzzle & Board Games 2008 [OLD VERSION]
review_body: Was easy to load on my computer and works well. Has lots of good games. I have a Vista system and had no trouble installing.

product_title: PDF Converter PRO 7.0 Retail [Old Version]
review_body: I have this software installed on my machine, and was somewhat satisfied with it until I started having activation problems. Even bios updates appear to cause failure, and you can spend considerable time apologizing, hat in hand, asking for a new activation for software that you supposedly own. Imagine needing this tool in the middle of a project, and then discovering that it won't work, simply because you swapped out a drive for a larger one. I have the Adobe CS5 Master Suite, and in spite of the fact that it costs about 70 times as much, and is much more likely to be pirated, it does not seem to have these activation problems. I strongly urge you not to buy this product or any other for which the issuing company is far more concerned about theft of their product than they are in making it usable for their paying customers.

product_title: Adobe Photoshop Lightroom 3 Student and Teacher Edition [OLD VERSION]
review_headline: May be best suited for YOUR needs, but not for mine.
review_body:
I found Adobe Photoshop Elements to be much better suited to my needs AND easier to use based on my experience and amateur familiarity with older versions of Photoshop. I needed a newer version of Photoshop to be able to handle the "raw" images from my then new Canon EOS T3i. I read many, many reviews of both Lightroom and Elements written by amateurs and professionals. To be honest, it was difficult for me to understand the difference between the two software packages. My son-in-law is comfortable with Lightroom and uses it well, so I tried it. I found it to be vastly different from previous generations of the full Photoshop software. Even after trying it, I am not certain I understand the differences. The major difference MAY BE that Lightroom allows across the board corrections and modifications over many images at once, whereas Elements allows image by image manipulation. Without extensive reading, study and tutorials, I had difficulty figuring out how to work on a single image at a time with Lightroom. I did use Lightroom successfully to create a slide show fairly easily. But this can be done with several software packages.

In the end, I uninstalled and sold Lightroom and replaced it with Elements 11.

product_title: CyberPatrol Parental Controls 7.7
review_body:
Couldn't even load program... Get an error message \\"product more then 15 months old. Cannot load. Please by update version\\"

Total waste of money!! Going to have a very disappointed little boy tomorrow. Promised him he could have my spare laptop after I put stuff on it to help keep him safe.

product_title: Corel Painter 11 [OLD VERSION]
review_body: Corel Painter 11 (old version) is spot on for what I was looking for. I have an older Powermac G5 and was hoping to get the latest version of Painter that would run well on my system. This fit the need perfect. I was using PhotoShop to digitally paint artwork and was ok with the results even though it was inefficient and tasking, but am now way happier with the results and ease of use Painter has placed at my hands. I strongly recommend it to anyone looking for a digital painting or freehand style drawing program that is responsive and adaptive with high quality features, but can't use or afford the newest version. Amazon gave me the best price and information I needed to make the most logical and cost effective choice when I did my research. Thanks Amazon and thanks Corel for keeping older versions of products available as well as the newest.

product_title: Dragon NaturallySpeaking Home 12.0, English (Old Version)
review_body: Gift for my some who is currently writing his fourth book and enjoying his Dragon Speak

product_title: Fluenz French 1+2+3+4+5 for Mac, PC, iPhone, iPad & Android Phones, Version 3
review_body: Having had the same experience with Rosetta Stone as many of the reviewers here have described, I went in search of an alternative program that would give me the tools to say more than \\"The horse runs\\" and \\"The man eats rice\\" (Rosetta Stone is quite enjoyable, but better for vocab than for anything you can actually utilize in real life). I came across Fluenz, tried out the online demo and was hooked. I was amazed at the amount of info that stuck, even after one lesson. I completed level one in 3 weeks, which is probably faster than recommended, however, I looked forward to working on the lessons each day, and often had to stop myself from doing too many lessons at a time. I'm now in the middle of Level 2 and I'm starting to think in French. I'm often surprised at the number of structures I can put together (OK, some faster than others). The program is structured so that each lesson builds on the last and the explanations during the tutorial sessions are invaluable. Additional practice sessions on the audio CD's and podcasts help to further hammer the information into your brain. There's also a Facebook page that allows you to communicate with other Fluenz users and an additional site called the \\"Fluenz Commons\\", where newly developed flashcards are available. iPhone and iPad apps are on the way. I haven't needed to contact customer service, but based on other reviews, it's great. And no, I don't work for Fluenz. Just a very happy customer. If you're hesitating to purchase this, don't. It's the best $500 I've spent recently. Fluenz is a sleek, effective program, and most importantly, if you have realistic expectations and are willing to put in the time and effort required, it works.

product_title: Norton Internet Security 2012 - 1 User 3PC
review_body: I have been waffling back and force between another major suite and this one for a few years. Always found the other product to be a major resource hog. Norton 2011 and 2012 have been fine on all my systems, from XP through 7 Pro. No issues with installation either. So far, so good!

product_title: Adobe Photoshop Elements 10
review_headline: Rock solid with great tools, but Organizer import still problematic
review_body:
I've used the past few versions of Adobe Photoshop Elements and I really enjoy using it. You can clean up or manipulate your images in a lot of different ways. Photos don't always come out of the camera looking great, but it's fun and rewarding to make them look great using the tools in PSE10. I do wish that some of the effects weren't so cartoon-like, but that's a minor quibble.

A bigger problem with PSE10 is that the Organizer still has problems importing my photos. The import fails the same way PSE9 did. Because I can't use the Organizer at all, I only use Photoshop Elements as a photo editor and use Google's free Picasa program as my organizer. I'm not sure how much I would've liked Organizer, but I'm not that disappointed since Picasa is very, very good.

I've run PSE10 on both a Windows 7 64-bit PC and Mac OS X 10.6.8 without any crashes or performance issues.

product_title: 2006 TurboTax Deluxe Federal + State Deduction Maximizer Win/Mac [OLD VERSION]
review_body: I have been using this program to complete my taxes for 10+ years. It just keeps getting better and easier to use. I highly recommend it.

product_title: Parallels Desktop 8 for Mac
review_body:
I have been using Parallels 8 on my new Macbook Pro (the June 2012 model, dual core i5 processor) for over a month now, and have had exactly zero problems so far. I didn't expect this because I used to run Parallels 6 on an older Intel iMac in the past and that gave me nothing but trouble (horrible performance being problem number 1). Windows XP, Windows 7 and Windows 8 all run on my Macbook Pro as they should. The reason I decided to give Parallels 8 a try is because of its supposed higher speed and stability over VMware 5 and previous versions of Parallels.

Windows 8 is speedy enough on my machine that games from 2003-2005 run effortlessly in a 1600*1200 resolution, as well as various more serious applications. Applications that I frequently run in Parallels are:
- both \\"Star Wars: Knights of the Old Republic\\" games (run great but Parallels GPU emulator doesn't support AA or buffer effects)
- \\"Vampire: the Masquerade - Bloodlines\\" (runs flawlessly with the latest unofficial patch from the Patch Scrolls)
- MS Office Visio 2010
- Several password cracking algorithms (can be quite CPU-intensive)
- Several computer forensics applications, such as ProDiscover.
- Skyrim and Fallout 3 (were playable at a mix of the lowest and medium settings, don't expect to complete a round of Skyrim or Fallout 3 on a virtualized machine)

The Coherence mode works very well, I love using it for running programs with smaller user interfaces like ProDiscover. While in Coherence, you can run individual Windows programs in full-screen, which gives them their own Mac OS Desktop (accessible through \\"CTRL\\" + \\"up arrow\\"), and which also enables you to flick through your Windows apps with a three-fingered swipe like you would in Mac OS 10.8.

Finally, I should note that my Macbook Pro contains 16 GB of memory and uses a Corsair Force GT solid state drive, but Parallels ran on my notebook without issues before I performed these upgrades. It's also pretty clear that you would need at *least* 4 GB of memory to run a virtualized Windows 8 instance on top of Mac OS, and you'll find that having anywhere over 4 gigabytes makes a world of difference.

I wholeheartedly recommend Parallels 8! The only thing I miss is the ability to enable anti-aliasing in video games, but that is of no consequence anyway.

product_title: Borland Delphi 5 Standard (New user)
review_body:
Delphi is the best all around tool i've used. You can do everything you can do in C++ and it's so easy. It's learning curve is almost the same one to learn Visual Basic. Delphi creates standalone executable without dlls, and your applications run since the first time like they are supposed to do. Ask anybody from VB to know the problems with VB.
You can create apps, web server extensions, dlls, ActiveX Objects and ActiveX dlls, Control Panel applets, your own controls and much more. You have tons of components, and you can get more tons of them for free at the web.
The standard version doesn't have database components, so you should get instead the Pro or Enterprise version, although you can import the MSADO library and use it the same way you use it at VB.
Delphi is what MS wants the .NET platform to be.
Highly recommended. It's sad that a lot of managers select VB without even considering other tools like Delphi, but if you know Delphi you will finish your projects before the others using VB and your app will run smoothly since the first time.

product_title: IMSI FloorPlan 3D Home Design Suite Version 10
review_headline: IMSI FloorPlan 3D Advantage over Punch Architect 4000
review_body:
I own both the IMSI (FloorPlan 3D Version 5) and Punch (Architect 4000) software titles, and the following are my own conclusions. I have no vested interest in either manufacturer. I have a doctorate in Mechanical Engineering, and have taught interactive computer graphics, so I guess I am more than usually familiar with computers and design.

I designed my previous home using the IMSI package, and after using it to capture the design, I passed it along to a draftsman to create drawings for the permitting process. I found that the package was easy to use (although a bit weird), and that it generally worked great. When we moved in, the home was absolutely spectacular! So, when we moved to another state to retire, we decided to repeat the process. Even though I still had the IMSI software (Version 5) and it readily installed onto XP, I thought that surely there had been improvements. So, I took the time to find the \\"best package out there\\". The reviews I read said that the Punch (Architect 4000) package was rated best, had the most features, blah, blah, blah. So I bought it, in spite of paying approximately 3X what I would pay for the latest IMSI version of FloorPlan 3D. The manual is about an inch thick, but I started wading through, thinking that this was the learning cost of a really good package. The manual seemed reasonable and there are TONS of features (read complexity), but when I actually tried to use the program, I couldn't get anything done. Everything was hard to do. Then, and this was the killer for me, whenever I saved data, I could never read the file back in. I tried everything, and eventually thought that it was my fault, so I went back to my old IMSI package because I had a house to design.

I quickly got up to speed because IMSI wins out hands down for its simple user interface. I struggled with both initially, but soon found that IMSI's wall layout tool, while weird, was useable. It's ease of use (tailorable wall heights, pushing even non-rectilinear wall segments around, changing wall thicknesses, immediate demonstration of dimensions and room square footage, changing wall and floor materials, colors, and texture, etc) allowed one to work pretty quickly. I was never able to use Punch's layout editor efficiently. Ever! Forget saving the data so you could work on a design again. Even just creating a simple layout was a huge struggle. Unless you knew the design beforehand, it was very difficult to lay out a floor plan interactively. This was what IMSI was good at. Even with a fully designed floorplan, I had trouble with the Punch program.

IMSI was also the easiest in viewing your design in 3D. Again, the viewing tools were weird and somewhat non-intuitive, but eventually useful. Punch's 3D viewer was totally useless, and I was never able to control the views, no matter what I did. And, \\"Hey!\\", I taught computer graphics.

After spending many hours getting a complete design (from my working with IMSI) entered into a freshly-reloaded Punch, I again tried to save my work. When I went back to work on it some more, it was unreadable. The file was there, but there was some formatting error that made it unreadable. I was furious, but thankfully, I had the IMSI design captured. So, I had a decision- Waste more time trying to debug a program I had paid 3X more for than the IMSI FloorPlan 3D, or spend my time getting work done on my house plan. Actually, I downloaded a free upgrade to Version 5.1 and got busy. Now I am thinking of purchasing IMSI's Version 11 as I am finalizing our house plan and like some of the new features and abilities of the new software.

To be candid, neither software package was bug-free. IMSI occasionally doesn't allow you to move a wall, but that is almost always because there is some constraint that is disallowing the modification. I found Punch to be even more restrictive. While I was able to exportthe IMSI design as a vrml file and e-MAIL it to my son to review, Punch had the greatest number of export file options. Too bad it always lost my saved designs. Neither package really creates beautiful 3D graphics, but IMSI's simple renderings were adequate for previewing the design work. I also liked IMSI's design methods using internal room dimensions. But, neither program made it clear how to proceed in starting a design from scratch. Nowhere did they tell you whether you could design the 2nd floor first, whether you had to layout the foundation beforehand (Punch), etc.

Finally, I should mention that I wanted to input site information for my lot, but that was too costly in terms of time. Interestingly, I downloaded Google's free Sketchup software, imported my IMSI design (in dxf file format), and was able to place it on the terrain using a Sketchup to Google Earth tool, and then interactively view it in 3D on my 10 acre lot using Google Earth. I found out that I have some serious grading and fill work to do on the build site.

Next, with Dashboards' widgets its certainly nice having these all these programs right at your fingertips to find weather, stock quotes, or movie times. Additionally the new programs like Automator and Safari with RSS are also great additions. My computers' overall speed seems a bit faster now, although I have noticed a few bugs they were minimal and should soon be patched. Bottom line is this is a great upgrade.

product_title: Adobe Photoshop Elements 8 -Old Version
review_body: PSE8 for Mac is great for all the reasons covered by the previous reviewers. As a long time PS2 and PSE3 user, I have used these programs to generate stunning art work, which usually begins with my own photos and then utilization of a variety of brushes, plug-ins, styles. I have a hunch there are others 'out there' who have intuitively discovered the grand set of tools available in PS and PSE, who may appreciate the following discoveries (much to my dismay and disappointment) before making any kind of upgrade to this version. The bottom line (and this is after several correspondences with Adobe tech support) is that many of my precious plug-in's (Kai Power Tools and Xaos Terrazzo) DO NOT work with this version!! Also, although brush,shape and gradient files can be added (dropped into the appropriate folders), the styles files CANNOT be added!! Anyone who has worked extensively with styles will know how valuable they are! There is an assortment of 'canned styles' included, but if you go to the preset manager there is no longer even a drop down to select 'styles' as in other versions of PS and PSE!! If any of this is of significance to a reviewer, and helps to avoid making a hasty purchase, then I will feel a little better about my own hasty rush to upgrade. Will I use PSE8? Of course, but I will stay primarily though, with the earlier versions that allow free addition of styles and work with my precious plug-ins! I'm so disappointed, but am learning the hard lesson that newest and latest, isn't always the best choice!!
