product_title: TurboTax Premier Fed, Efile and State 2013
review_headline: DOESN'T HANDLE FOREIGN TAX CREDIT CORRECTLY; OTHER SHORTCOMINGS
review_body: I have used Turbo Tax since the early 2000' s (with one exception in 2006, when I used TaxCut) and have been somewhat satisfied. I just finished my taxes for 2013 (yes, it's late, but I have an extension to October 15) and find that for some reason, I have had significantly more issues with the 2013 version. Because of this, I need to mail in my return because TTax will not electronically file a return to the IRS if the taxpayer has overridden one of its entries. The foreign tax credit (FTC) component has a huge problem. A taxpayer is allow to claim the entire credit on Line 47 of Form 1040 if it is no more than $300 (single) or $600 (married). The taxpayer can claim the entire amount with no reduction. However, I have not been able to do this on TTax without performing an override because TTax generates a Form 1116 which performs some calculations which result in a reduction of the credit. It is true that Form 1116 does not have to be filed in this case; the problem is that the calculations are affecting the line item on the 1040. The result is that I cannot file this return online. Another shortcoming on TTax Premier is that there is insufficient direction for properly filling out limited partnership information that a taxpayer might receive for, say, holding shares in a MLP (a real possibility if the taxpayer is an income investor). The MLP's Form 1065 has a plethora of information in the \\"Statement\\" section, but much of it cannot be entered into TTax. One final problem: TTax does not download a number of brokerage 1099's. It does this for the more popular brokers (such as Schwab, which downloaded with no problems), but does not do so for Interactive Brokers or Options House. That meant all th e sales have to be hand-entered. These brokerages do not provide sales information in a friendly format, so it can be a bear to have to enter this information manually.

product_title: Hoyle Card Games 2012 AMR
review_body: A good variety of games. Placement of the players' faces obscures my ability to read some of the cards well. I did not have this problem with a much earlier edition.

product_title: Avery Wizard for Microsoft Word

product_title: PowerDirector 9 Ultra - 64
review_body: I'm not sure my four year old computer has all the highest system requirements, but the software works great and has a really nice interface. I was initially impressed with the quality of the appearance (nice layout and color choices, like Adobe's pretty logo) and straighforward option titles, but the real beauty is in the output. I installed the software, a ten minute process, and within two hours had an amazing slideshow, using most of the automated options, to use for my daughter's grad party. The user's guide is great. I read all the instructions for making a slideshow while it was installing. It was easy to figure out the steps because every time your mouse hovers over an option, it tells you what that option does. Love that. I was able to import video from my Panasonic HDC-TM55 and my Flip HD camera with no issues. The magic movie option is really, really fun if you don't need to be hands-on and picky about each scene's length or the transitions. I love the idea of 'rooms,' such as the media room, effect room, title room, etc. You know where to go for just what you want to do. The Title room is my favorite because I've been so frustrated with that aspect in other software, like Adobe's Premiere Elements. Making titles in Microsoft's old version of Movie Maker was quite easy, but also quite limited. This is just as easy as Movie Maker, but it's pretty much unlimited in my opinion. You can make titles as easy or complex as you like. I will never use all the options available, but will enjoy the ones I do use. I would suggset this software is best for people who are familiar with video editing software. Beginners should try to download an old version of Movie Maker and stick with that for a while.

product_title: Microsoft Windows XP Home with Service Pack 3 Full New Genuine Version
review_headline: Not the disk I thought I was purchasing
review_body: I purchased Windows XP Home with service pack 3. The disk I received was Windows XP Professional Corporate Edition. So I am afraid to try to use it because of possible legal action by the corporation that this disk belongs too.

product_title: Norton Internet Security 2013 - 1 User / 3 PC
review_body:
I have used Norton products for the PC and Mac for over 20 years. Based on my latest experience, I will NEVER purchase another Norton product. I installed NIS 2013 shortly after upgrading to Windows 8. NIS 2013 simply doesn't work with Windows 8. I started having problems downloading emails, then problems installing program/app updates. I suspected NIS might be a problem, so I disabled the software. Then I couldn't re-establish NIS. I then uninstalled and reinstalled the NIS, same problems as before. While on the phone with Norton tech support, my computer crashes and I can't recover. They tell me to call Microsoft tech support. Windows recovery disk also doesn't work. MS also can't help, short of telling me to wipe my computer clean, then reinstall Windows 8. Finally, I was able to uninstall NIS while in Safe Mode. By the way, Windows 8 comes with Anti-Virus (which both Norton and MS failed to mention to me). I made sure that Windows 8 anti-virus was enabled and I haven't had a problem since.

Norton - you just lost a customer of 20+ years

product_title: Adobe Photoshop CS6
review_headline: if you need pro photo editing, this is it.
review_body: Ps is a great product and cs6 really does right by the user. The only reason I give it a 4 instead of a 5, is because of the difficulty of use. Ps has a true learning curve and it isn't user friendly.

product_title: Turtle Beach GRIP Arena MMO Gaming Mouse fÃ¼r PC, Black
review_headline: This is the way to go!
review_body: I have not found any other software this complete and easy to use. It teaches at my pace. I can review or repeat as much as I need for comprehension. The best on the market! You won't be disappointed.

product_title: TurboTax Deluxe Federal + E-file + State 2011 [Old Version]
review_body: Because one \\"employer\\" who should be paying me as a subcontractor (I really am self employed) deducts taxes in whatever state you work in (almost all of my work is out of state, and my other W-2 clients deduct my residential state tax or none at all) I have to file more than one state return. This was my first year with Turbo Tax since 2006 tax year. The first state return is included in the Home & Business software and is free. When I went to do the second state return, TurboTax wanted to charge me $39.95. I thought that a bit much and went poking around their website (not designed to get you human interaction very swiftly). The TurboTax \\"chat\\" person told me second state return is $19.95 had I bought the CD version. I explained I downloaded the software from amazon.com (after all it is 2012, and aren't CD's becoming obsolete for software?). He had me uninstall TurboTax, and download a new copy, promising I would be charged $19.95 for 2nd state return. I opened the new download, and it was still $39.95. Ultimately, he gave me the 2nd state return for free. I would have been happy with $19.95 and it did take 45 minutes to get to our conclusion, but free is free. Note that when filling out the state return, the interview asked if I had \\"high deductible\\" health plan. I said yes, knowing that those premiums were already deducted from federal AGI as Self Employed Health Insurance Deduction (SEHID). TurboTax leads me to deduct the health insurance premiums a second time, from AGI, even though the state return gets its info from the TurboTax fed return. I'm waiting for TurboTax tax rep to get back to me on that. I'm sure its an error in TurboTax, and have seen similar double deduction last year in H&R Block software - ironic that it was health insurance premium as well. I have to buy the expensive Home & Business version because I file a Schedule C. Yet it still seems the software is designed for someone in a less complex situation, one employer, period.

product_title: Broderbund Family Lawyer
review_body: Does the job for what I bought it for.

product_title: QuickBooks Pro 2011 - [Old Version]
review_body: I have used Quickbooks since 1996. Before this version I was using Pro 08 and got caught in the forced upgrade. I am a creature of habit and hate change. BUT can you imagine using the QB from 1996 in 2011? Even though I gripe, whine and complain I know that in the end the upgrade, for the most part, is for the better. I purchased Pro 11 off amazon last week when it was only $99, happy about that. I completed my work for the week and started Fri morning with my install. Some of the reviews on here really scared the heck out of me so I was prepared for a long, tear filled stressful day. I am happy to report that my install could not have been better. Took about 30 minutes and I was up and running. I even got a signature scanned for paychecks & I am working on the logo to get it just right. Everything is exactly how it was and I have no complaints with this new product. This comment is for the QB people on here - one thing that changed from the 2006 to the 2008 version and is the same in 2011 that I am not happy with is in Customers & Jobs. We are in construction. I will have a developer that we do several jobs for, those jobs will have several phases, so it will be at lease 3 teired. In 2006 I could add Developer, right click and add job (job name & info) then right click on that and add phase (job # with phase #). I used to be able to have each phase with a different \\"ship to\\" without having to add a million different ship to addresses. You guys should look at how that was in 2006 and make it like that again. That is probably the only thing I would change in QB.

product_title: Linux Mandrake OS 7.2 Powerpack Deluxe
review_body: I moved to Mandrake from RedHat because Mandrake supported a device I had that RedHat did not. This is a nice distro for users new to Linux because it's fairly friendly to install and is one of the best at having built in support for newer hardware. Mandrake also has two community tech support lists that are very active, and their programmers participate regularly. The PowerPack has some nice extras to play with, like ViaVoice and Arkeia network backup software. It seems to install well on a variety of machines. I'm very pleased with its ease of installation and its performance.

product_title: Nero 9 [OLD VERSION]
review_headline: Nero 9 was a disaster, but 9.4 released June 2009 is fine
review_body:
Nero 9.0 was an absolute disaster, a disaster made even worse by comments from Nero on their own forum that suggested they were well aware that Nero 9.0 was exceptionally flawed and that there were no quick fixes available.

They said to wait for an update... and in June 2009, an update finally arrived (version 9.4), and it has in my opinion made Nero well again.

However, it was unconscionable that they left everyone with only semi-working software for several months. During those months, people even started writing their own code fixes to restore functionality that had been broken. I imagine many people no longer trust the company after this fiasco.

But for the record, everything seems ok again. And it is a free upgrade from 9.0 to 9.4, of course.

product_title: Microsoft Office Home and Student 2007 [Old Version]
review_body: I am very satisfied with the product. It was easy to install and the price was right- about $50.00 less than purchasing it directly from microsoft. It was more economical than buying a new computer system.

product_title: Hidden Mysteries: Buckingham Palace - Secrets of Kings and Queens
review_body: Now these are small objects and my old eyes are having a hard time finding all of them now but I keep trying until I find them. There are some surprise and challenges as you play. It isn't one you can get done in a hurry.

product_title: Norton 360 2013 - 1 User / 3 PC
review_body: My computer continues to run efficiently. I guess Norton is doing its job. This isn't the sort of thing a user can review unless his computer has blown up

product_title: Microsoft Office 2013
review_body: Epic Fail out the door. I purchased Microsoft Office Professional Plus 2013, after installing, it will say it is downloading additional content. This window doesn't go away without the assistance of the Task Manager. Microsoft Word has crashed for me all day. It's currently locked up saying \\"Office may appear unresponsive... We're streaming a few required files in the background. This shouldn't take long\\" It's been over 45 minutes now. Support is a Joke. Try it for yourself. I highly recommend waiting until Microsoft deals with the initial release bugs. Stick with 2010 for a while longer. This one was pushed out the door way too early. If you use Microsoft Office, stay with your current version for a while. This version has not let me create a single file and crashes each time it opens. Microsoft Support as of 26 January 2013: [...] Clicking \\"Microsoft Office Professional Plus 2013 (All Languages)\\" Will take you to a page that is titled \\" Sorry, the page you requested is not available. \\"

product_title: Hallmark Card Studio for Mac[OLD VERSION]
review_headline: Beware if you want borderless printing
review_body: Hallmark Studio use to be good, now it is frankly a piece of crap. Their support is really non-existant they just email you the same instructions they have on their web site. The help file tells you to go to the setup on the Art Studio screen to setup borderless printing...only one problem..there IS NO SETUP option on that screen. No \\"borderless\\" settings work even though I DO have a new HP Photosmart Plus printer that of course CAN do borderless. If I were you I would not invest 3 cents for this program much less the full retail price.

product_title: Quicken WillMaker Plus 2013
review_body:
When I saw Quicken WillMaker 2013 I didn't know everything that was involved with estate planning. That's where the plus comes in. With WillMaker I was able to create many documents that will help before I move on from this life. These include my living will, heath-care directive, and limited power of attorney.

I have to admit that it took a while for me to get around to creating a will and doing estate planning. I guess it just made that reality of life a little too real to me. When I did WillMaker plus made the process easier than I expected. It was effectively painless.

I didn't use the support - but other reviews provide glowing reviews which I suspect are founded based on the well thought-out software.

This is a good DIY tool for straightforward estate planning: probably 90+ percent of estates. It probably gets a good start on much more complicated planning that will requires a visit to legal office. The head start that WillMaker Plus could provide in paperwork and organization may save hundreds or thousands in legal fees compared to going in with nothing.

product_title: Singing Coach
review_body: This product appears to have real value in it. The parts of the software that I can get to work have the potential to be great tools for improving your singing. Unfortunately, the meat of the product, the singing lessons, will not run on my computer and I have been unsuccessful at getting technical support for the product. Over the past week, I have sent emails and called durring business hours. No one was present to answer my calls and never returned the emails of voice messsages I left. At this point I intend to return the software.

The only time you even notice that it is installed is when it is upgrading or you have told it to scan your system and that is only because of the window on your screen. Ridiculous? Yes. Worth it? Debatable.

I am proud to say that you will not find a better team of people or TurboTax product to work with. TurboTax works real good for me each year. I will not use another system to do my tax returns.

product_title: Videostudio 10 Plus Box [Old Version]
review_body:
I have tried Sonic, Nero and Roxio products in the past with limited success since I need closed captioning to work (hard of hearing/deaf). I use a set-top DVD recorder with DVD-RAM and edit on my PC. Every program before has deleted the closed captioning and usually won't work with DVD-RAM so I had to first convert the DVD-RAM using Panasonic software.

Videostudio not only imports the DVD-RAM file directly, it also keeps the captioning intact. I find it very intuitive to use but I am more \\"computer literate\\" than average. I didn't need the manual at all.

Nero might be quicker to burn copies but it was miserable to create the DVD compared to this. Sonic MyDVD worked directly with the Panasonic software but if I edited the file at all it took forever and often failed. Videostudio seems to work as one package so I don't need MyDVD and Panasonic software anymore. It's a good thing because Panasonic doesn't support Vista and I just upgraded so I NEED something that works. This does.

product_title: Roxio Game Capture HD PRO
review_body:
Device haphazardly detects HDMI input, sometimes not recognizing a signal at all until the unit is powered on/off several times.

Software randomly locks up even when not capturing.

Will display HDCP content but won't let you record it? Bizzare.

The fact that it respects HDCP is commendable if you're a fan of DRM, but ultimately useless for the average consumer since it prevents you from copying a rather large portion of media that you legitimately own the right to enjoy. The offered alternative being to \\"just record in low def\\" isn't acceptable.

New versions of this device also seem to block using other capture software (ie: VirtualDub) which is frustrating considering the provided software is so unreliable.

product_title: TurboTax Deluxe Federal + State + eFile 2008
review_headline: Turbo Tax Deluxe -- Just as expected
review_body: Received the Trubo Tax Deluxe on the date promised. Product easily installed and is being used right now.

product_title: Adobe Photoshop Lightroom 4
review_headline: LR 4 will make a huge difference in your images!
review_body: I liked this software a lot better than LR 3, but then upgraded my computer so I can now use LR 5 and Photoshop CC. The upgrade to LR 5 is worth it, if your computer can handle it. If not, this is a really great value also. It just doesn't have some of the conveniences of LR 5.

product_title: ACD Systems FotoSlate 4.0
review_body: ACD Systems FotoSlate 4 has the potential to be a really great piece of software. Unfortunately it falls short for my use. Perhaps if you want a single document with different layouts for each page and are going to do a lot of adjustments by hand then this will be just the thing for you. What I was hoping for was the ability to take a large number of images and put them on multiple pages, either 6 or 12 per page, with the images scaled and rotated properly and with the file name as the caption. It looks like the software is supposed to do that but it doesn't. There is an option to \\"auto-rotate images\\" but it either rotates all images (even those that didn't need to be rotated) or it doesn't rotate any. So, all images are printed in either vertical or horizontal orientation, rather than the appropriate orientation for the individual images. It is possible to manually rotate those images that are wrong but it's impossible to select multiple images so you have to do it one image at a time. That's quite time consuming when you have hundreds or thousands of images to rotate. Although the ACD Systems web site has user forums and there is a link to submit technical questions, they seem to be either broken or simply abandoned and not actually in use. There are recent posts in the forums for other products but not for Fotoslate. Once registered you'd think I could post to the forum but that feature seems to be broken. It's too bad, really. I wanted to like this package and it is quite close to being just what I need. But for me, it's mostly useless.

product_title: Quicken Deluxe 2010 [OLD VERSION]
review_body: Everything as advertised, but major problems in updating to the current release. If you are willing to go through the hassle of the update, you will find that all works well after that.

product_title: Dell Windows Xp Professional Version 2002
review_headline: i had i version before sort of a ilega; when price was right i bought a legit version
review_body: excellent is onlything i have to sayit is far better than the windows 8.1 i have on my other computer which i will be removing and replacing with nwindows xp prowith service pack xp3

product_title: StarOffice 6.0
review_body: I am going to purchase this program as I am unhappy with microsoft's licensing program. Hopefully, StarOffice will out perform MSOffice 2000.

product_title: Windows 7 PRO 32 Bit System Builder 1pk [Old Version]
review_headline: From a ticked off Vista user
review_body: My son volunteered to overhaul my laptop, which I had purchased early in 2007 so that it would have the \\"new and great\\" Vista operating system on it. Well, as probably everyone knows by now, Vista was a colossal joke of an operating system. After enduring several years of slow boot-ups, computer freeze-ups and countless other problems, I followed my son's recommendation to wipe my hard drive clean and install Windows 7 Professional. He handled the work for me and my laptop's operation is so much improved that it's hard to imagine it's the same machine. In short, I'm very happy with the Windows 7 Professional product from Amazon. But has anyone thought of filing a class-action lawsuit against Microsoft for putting out a product as flawed as Vista? Windows 7 Professional is so much better that it makes me wonder why Microsoft ever put its name on something as bad as Vista.

product_title: Quicken Deluxe 20
review_headline: Will NOT download my retirement account data
review_body:
I use (TurboTax, Mint) or have used (QuickBooks Pro) other Intuit products successfully, but Quicken Deluxe 2014 is awful! I'm going to try to return it to amazon. It will not download my retirement account data. I've even tried uninstalling the program and reinstalling it. Nothing helps. It downloaded my bank checking and savings accounts just fine, but for my retirement accounts at one brokerage firm, it downloads the account numbers but shows a zero balance in each of them. At another brokerage firm, it downloaded one of my three accounts (and that one incorrectly--it showed the balance in securities and also in cash, showing double the correct balance), but won't download anything, even the account #'s, of the other two accounts at this firm. It's like those two don't exist. When I log into both these brokerage houses outside of Quicken, my info shows correctly for all six accounts. I've tried to download these into Quicken multiple times, trying \\"brokerage\\", \\"IRA\\", \\"advanced\\", etc. These are major brokerage firms, and I'm using Windows 7. I am ready to throw Quicken out the window!

In fairness, it did download one mutual fund account correctly, but one out of seven isn't good enough.

I have used Mint, and it downloads all of these accounts correctly, with no problem. It updated their balances today, correctly, and shows their transactions. I'm puzzled as to why Intuit's free program can do this, but their paid Deluxe program cannot.

I am also disappointed and surprised to learn that it will not transfer my Mint data into Quicken. I had planned to delete my Mint account and start using Quicken, but Quicken just doesn't work for my retirement accounts. My reason for wanting to change is that I'm just not comfortable having all my log-in information stored on Mint's servers.

Edit: I've just printed the return label. I'm pleased that amazon allows returns of software.

product_title: Dr. Seuss Preschool
review_headline: Does not work well on XP if at all
review_body: This game unfortunatly might be unstable for some windows XP. I bought this game years ago for my first child when we had windows 95 and it was wonderful!! She loved it and it was a great teaching tool. But when we upgrated to XP, everytime when I tryed to play it, it would just shut my computer down. I was excited when I ordered this one because I thought that it had been updated for XP but apparently it was not because when I recieved it, it does the same thing. It might work on some XP's, I'm not sure but I know it does not work on mine. I hate it, because I so wanted to use it for my other daughter who is 3 years old.

product_title: Mah Jong Quest III Quest Balance of Life
review_body:
I do love my games. This one is a good one and would recommend for your pesonal use or as gift.
It keeps me thinking.

product_title: Adobe GoLive 6.0 Upgrade [Old Version]
review_headline: Truly improved, powerful with the new Web Workgroup Server!!
review_body:
I stepped over GoLive a few years back, don't remember which version, but didn't get into it then.
I decided to get into it now during version 5 however, with the free upgrade to version 6, since I couldn't be bothered waiting for it to reach the market!
However the user-friendlyness has been improved a lot with GL6 and it is now not only a lot stronger and yes, slower, but also a bit easier to get around.

Oh, dear I forgot to mention the diagrams when I submitted this review the first time!! They have appered to me as the best thing yet with GL - just because I find them very useful. When you first start a site up (you can do it later too of course), you have the ability to create a site diagram, OK that might not be that revolutionary.. What is so great about them is that you can create them with different symbols from the objects palette; database, PDF, page etc and once you've set them up GL actually creates a site with all the pages you've specified in the diagram. Further more you can show the diagram as a PDF or SVG file to your client online! Of course you can use the diagram as a reference throughout the design process.
I was recommended GL years ago by fellow webdesigners in London who told me that it would be good for me since I don't know html and that way I would learn it. My London co-workers couldn't have been more right - I have learnt a lot since I've gotten GL and I am still learning. Now with version 6 I also find that I am learning ASP, JSP etc as well and I mean I learn it practically, there is only so much you can read yourself to!!
Web Workgroup Server 1.0 that comes with this version is also something that I've started to enjoy, especially with consideration to that it now makes it a whole lot easier for me and my collegues worldwide to check pages etc in and out of a website, without me having to do, way too much supervising either - it saves time for me and that is valuable!!
It's got a weblog with it, but I stillhaven't been able to figure out whether or not that shows who has been trying to log into the server and who had problems, or who got in straight away.
The other bad thing is that I was reading the instructions for how to set it up and while I was doing that, I missed the few seconds I had to change the \\"system\\" and \\"password\\" -> I found myself locked out of the server and the only way I saw, was that I had to re-install the whole thing and fill in the password before time-out. That was annoying, but of course it is very likely that I missed something, since I had to do that, considering the server is a whole new program and part of GL..
After I got in, it was however fairly straight forward to configure the website, publishing server and users.
I find that Adobe is best for me since there are so many resources over at Adobe Studio for one, you can find free actions and new templates and just get so many great ideas from other users on how to do things quickly. It's great because there is so many ppl around who you can ask for help if you need it.

product_title: Mixman Studio Pro 4.0
review_body:
Like the other reviewer from DeSoto, Texas said below, I too am experiencing crashes on a very robust installation of Windows XP. I am a hardware/software technician with over 10 years of field experience and I have a degree in Recording Engineering, yet, I cannot get this product to run on my system. I also have their DM2 mixer and used previous versions of their software on Win98 with no problems. I am hesitant to try their newer StudioXPro product fearing that it too will crash upon launch.
They really do have extremely poor support. They did NOT respond to any of my SEVEN e-mails regarding this problem. The only way to contact them is via e-mail. I even considered knocking on their doors when I last visited San Francisco, but their website only shows a PO BOX!
Until they get their act together, avoid MixMan. It's too bad too because they have a promising product line. They just don't know how to run a software company.

product_title: Toast 11 Titanium Pro Mac
review_body:
I have Mac OSX Lion and have used Toast for years with my macs. I talked myself into buying the Toast 11 Pro (I had Toast 10) because I really needed to convert my old family Super 8's that I had transferred years ago into my external drive digitally.
I had several (5) DVD-R's that would only convert 1/2 of the DVD-R digitally to ANY file format. I tried several times with several conversion formats with the same result: 1/2 of the DVD-R. The pre-process conversion would read that the entire DVD-R would transfer; but only 1/2 would actually convert. Iy did not matter if the DVD=R was 2 hours long or 45 minutes...only 1/2 was converted.

I finally had some DVD-Rs from the late 1990's of family that had audio as well as video as they were recorded originally on Hi -8 and put onto DVD-R.
These converted video OK to .mov files, but there were 2 second audio sync problems on the finished conversions. I tried several times with different formats--SAME PROBLEM. Unacceptable!
I purchased another program and I have had no problems with all of the situations listed above.

As far as CD audio burning...the Toast 11 program is great...but any older Toast can do that! No need to upgrade.

If you are going to burn CD's and/or Data files to CD or DVD/Bluray--I am sure that Toast 11 Pro will work fine for you. For Conversions: Toast 11 falls flat and short of expectations. School Grade: D+ and a lot of extra \\"Re-do\\" work for me.

product_title: Norton Utilities 15.0 - 1 User / 3 PC [Old Version]
review_headline: Pleased but very careful in useing this
review_body: I am pleased in all respects with this program. I have a Pentium 4,windows XP computer and only had very minor problems with installation. I took my time studying what each function did and compared it PC Tools Registry Mechanic which is basically the same thing and activated only those utilities which matched it and the little meter quickly went all the way to the right. So far I have not experienced any of the problems listed by other users in terms of loss of passwords or loss of anything period! Clearly when one buys new software,it behooves the person to study it closely to see if it is really going to fit the bill for your computer maintenance needs and so I give this program kudo's for doing exactly what it indicates!

product_title: Fate 1 2 3 Jewel Case
review_headline: Not what it appears, though it is what it is.
review_body:
Greetings all.

I purchased 'Fate: Jewel Case edition' believing I was purchasing Fate, Fate 2 (Undiscovered Reality) and Fate 3 (The Traitor Soul). It arrived on time and in good condition.

I'm running the game on Windows 7. When I attempted to load and install the game my computer had a difficult time reading the disk. I eventually needed to resort to opening the game manually through Windows Explorer. Although the load was very slow, the game loaded successfully.

At first look after installation it appeared I only had access to Fate 3 (The Traitor Soul). I became a touch irritated. Through the search process of looking for the first two Fate games I loaded a game storage site called \\"Wild Tangent,\\" a site where an individual can pay and play older games. Fate was there as was Fate 2 (Undiscovered Reality) however, there was a charge to play either of the games, which between the two would have cost more than double what I paid for the Jewel Case edition of Fate. Now I am more than irritated. I figure its time to send a very nasty note to the folks I purchased the game from and I headed back to Amazon to let them know my feelings in very clear and concise words. Luckily for me, I didn't get that far.

I choose to read through the reviews before giving in to my injured sense of fairness in the market place. First I read all the reviews of those who rated the game a 1. With a couple of exceptions in which the reviewer just wanted to hear him/herself rant, the reviewers experienced the same issue I did. I was feeling proud of myself now knowing I wasn't alone. However, there was a slight dent in my personal feelings of belonging to a disgruntled crowd. . . There were a whole lot more folks who rated the game 5 stars. Why that was, I decided I needed to find out.

The first Five Star rating I read was written by Oddlydrawn. He explained how Fate 3 (The Traitor Soul) contains within itself the other two games, as Fate 2 and 3 were expansions to the original Fate.

So good reader--if you have not read Oddlydrawn's review I believe you will find it very helpful and then, perhaps, like me, you will begin to feel the world isn't as bad as it was half an hour ago. :-)

~Somewhere in the process of getting older, I forgot to grow up.~o games, as Fate 2 and 3 were expansions to the original Fate.

So good reader--if you have not read Oddlydrawn's review I believe you will find it very helpful and then, perhaps, like me, you will begin to feel the world isn't as bad as it was half an hour ago. :-)

~Somewhere in the process of getting older, I forgot to grow up.~

product_title: Microsoft Windows Vista Ultimate FULL VERSION [DVD] [OLD VERSION]
review_headline: I love the new features - should have progressed more in 5 years
review_body: I beta tested Vista from early on and have run the complete version for about 2 months now via TechNet and Microsoft Connect. I love how it works and runs. Only real argument I have is that I run it 64 bit with a dual core and some programs are not compatable (not Microsoft's fault.) They need to catch up! On another note, Microsoft released details of this OS a long time ago, yet kept dropping features (new file system...) to get to an earlier release date. Again, I love it, but after 5 years of the \\"best\\" programers, I expected more.

product_title: WriteItNow 4
review_body: I've used this program (mainly for short story writing) for years. I love the latest version (4), particularly the storyboard feature, which makes it easy to visualize and reorganize scenes and chapters. The writing targets feature is great for keeping you motivated, and I also use the name generator a lot, to come up with authentic-sounding characters. These are just three of the many tools in WriteItNow, but it is the flexibility of the software that makes it a winner for me.

product_title: Roxio Easy Media Creator Suite 9 [OLD VERSION]
review_body:
Before you buy this software read all of Amazon's reviews, and the user forums @ Roxio. This software is riddled with bugs, causes serious system crashes, and incredible frustration. Read Roxio's workaround for the problems before you install this, because if it crashes your computer, you're going to be spending a day or two manually cleaning your registry.

The problems mostly seem to happen when upgrading from previous versions. I have used, and loved, Roxio since version 5, and have upgraded to every version since then with little or no difficulty. But when I upgraded from 8 to 9 all hell broke loose. Major crashes, not just of the OS, but other software. Incredibly hard time uninstalling Roxio 9. Thought I would have to do a clean install of Windows to get my system back, but after several attempts at deleting all Roxio references in the registry, and then doing a \\"system restore,\\" I got the OS stabile again. But this took about twelve hours to accomplish, and because of the system restore rollback, I had to redo a lot of work.

Save yourself some some aggrevation: READ BEFOR YOU BUY! If one or two Amazon reviews were negative you could chalk it up to \\"user error.\\" But there is a pattern of serious crashes with this software. You have been warned!

product_title: Microsoft FrontPage 2000 [OLD VERSION]
review_headline: If your looking to revise PDF files this the software you need!
review_body: The software is just what I expected. The quality of the cd was excellent condition. If your looking at revising PDF file you need it.

product_title: Jigsaws Galore! Beautiful Planet set 11
review_body: Lots of wonderful pictures to put together.

product_title: Nova Development US Hallmark Card Studio Deluxe 2013
review_body: I am so disappointed with this product. I previously had Hallmark Christian Studio 2 Deluxe and it was very 'user friendly'. There were many styles to choose from and you were able to be very creative. I spent hours going through these cards and there no 'pretty' cards. The majority of them were like cartoon drawings - not something I would send to an older adult. The messages inside were 'fluff' and though I knew it was not a Christian Card program, I did expect there would perhaps be some religious selection in the Christmas section. I was wrong. It was actually work in choosing a card and some of them, even in the Preview mode, were unreadable. You had to click all over the place to open, see inside, and close each card. All in all, with a choice of thousands of cards, I didn't find enough to even bother with keeping the product. (I misplaced my disc for my other program.)I spent weeks in deciding which program to get and went with the Hallmark name and my experience with the previous product I had been so happy with. It's being returned and I'm still looking for a replacement.

product_title: TurboTax Deluxe Federal + E-file + State 2011 [Old Version]
review_body: I use TurboTax every year, only had one problem which caused me a late penalty with IRS. If you take out money from your 401k, it you are not not allowed to get the 401k deduction for that year, even if you resume paying into your plan after the 6 month period where you cannot resume paying into your plan. Also, the price went down $10 the next week.

product_title: IOLO Technologies System Mechanic (3-User) [Old Version]
review_body: This is the only software that has ever kept my computers running smoothly without interfering with my use of the computer. I am really happy with how comprehensive the package is and how well it performs on all fronts.

product_title: Quicken WillMaker Plus 2015
review_body: Good for updating old Will

product_title: miBookÂ MKC10Â CookingÂ KitÂ IncludesÂ QuickÂ andÂ EasyÂ MealsÂ andÂ IrresistibleÂ DessertsÂ RecipeÂ Cards
review_body:
useful gadget for audio books & photos with SDcard

can watch videos on it too if they are in the right format

Can be an e-reader for text but not the greatest to use that way

I bought it for $20 not for the recipes although they are pretty good.. but to see if I wanted .. a kindle or other type of e-reader.

I read many books...and wondered if I would want to give up turning 'paper pages'. My conclusion? dont think other expensive electronic page turners..are for me.

While the quality of the screen on this
MiBook is good..and sound is not so bad either...that is not the issue..it is for me...missing the smell and feel of paper.

But I'm an old coot...maybe younger would think differently.

For the cook...it could be a fun platform to ..make your own recipes to customize and give as a gift to special people in your life.

This gadget...could be put to many uses other than what it is marketed as.. not to say..what it is may not be enough but it can be..much much more with a little tech savvy.

All in all I find this to be a good value and enjoyable to play with...I also listen to music on it..can play all my mp3 files with ease...so it does fill several niches

again...a well spent $20 saved me hundreds ..in that I won't buy other much more expensive gadgets... that I would not use.

Thanks Amazon seller for letting me buy/try a $130 gadget for $20 and ultimately I will...give it away ultimately...as a gift .. possibly with an SD card with home movies on it or me singing lullabyes...or loaded with family photos and clips of old family home movies. So many uses I can think of to keep it and similar..out of our landfills.

product_title: Photoshop Elements 13
review_body: I absolutely hate this software! Have used Elements for years, recently upgrading from PSE 11 because of a new camera ( 11 doesn't support the RAW for the camera). It locks up my computer constantly! I have all the specs needed to run this program. It is going in the trash and I will convert my photos to dng. files so I can go back to 11.

review_body: GREAT

The only reason I decided to buy WinDVD 5 Gold is that I purchased a new computer, and wanted to install a good DVD player. This is the best media players you can buy today. The best picture, Blu-ray discs, 3D, and every thing else out there you can play is supported (as far as I know).

The picture is tremendous on our Sharp LC-42LE540U 42\\" LED TV V with wi-fi.

review_body: This program is entertaining and easy to use. The interface is quite intuitive. The lessons flow naturally and are actually pretty fun and sort of addicting. A good indonesian-english dictionary would serve as a useful compliment to this product. It's only weakness is that it contains little on conversation. A listing of common phrases and their usages would be handy. You might also consider purchasing a good phrasebook.

product_title: ClueFinders: Mystery of Monkey Kingdom (Jewel Case) - PC/Mac
review_body: This is a good software for the kids, but was not developed to sustain their excitement. After the first few days, my kids became bored with it especially after they solved the entire puzzle. My suggestion is that software such as these, should be written in a format to enable the kids start afresh at the end of the puzzle.

product_title: Macromedia Studio 8 for Win/Mac [Old Version]
review_body: Excellent tool for website design. Now I need a complete workshop to learn all the tools it has.

product_title: Rosetta Stone V2: Spanish (Latin America) Level 1 [OLD VERSION]
review_body: This is a good program and method overall but the price is just too high in my opinion. I would recomend taking a look at Spanish Now by Transparent Language which is also has a good method and a very good program but much more affordable.

product_title: Greeting Card Factory 8.0 Deluxe [Old Version]
review_body: We shouldn't have to be engineers to get a program working. All I wanted is a greeting card program, so the other 99% is just a waste of the software. I should mention, I ordered v8 but was sent v9. Perhaps the v8 would have been a better program.

product_title: Acronis Disk Director Suite 10.0 [Old Version]
review_body: Having purchased Vista, but wishing to keep Windows XP MCE, I purchased Acronis Disk Director Suite 10 in order to set up a dual boot system that would accommodate both operating systems. In addition to the Acronis product I also had a copy of Norton Partition Magic, and since I had two identical desktop PCs to configure in a dual-boot mode I intended to use Acronis on one and Norton on the other. After a few hours of Symantec software torture I abandoned the Norton product, and easily configured both PCs using the Acronis Disk Director. I have yet to figure out why Norton Partition Magic would not step through the dual boot configuration process, but Acronis Disk Director 10 sailed right through without a hitch. I have been using Norton products for years, and while Symantec makes quality software they also engineer their product line with a sufficient number of traps to drive even the most patient geek certifiably mad. You may ask why Disk Director did not get the 5-star rating; the answer is that Acronis has a few unnecessary traps of its own (but not quite enough to coax you into using the software as a frisbee) So, if I ever have the occasion to again set up a PC to accommodate two operating systems (dual-boot), and the software choices are between Acronis and Norton, I will not hesitate to purchase Disk Director; I highly recommend this software.

product_title: Microsoft Office Home and Student 2007 [Old Version]
review_body: I have never downolad the Office 2007 but for some strange reason it appeared on my PC after I openned up a file from my colleague a few months ago or might be due to my regular Microsoft updates. Every time I open up my file, my PC will automatically open it in Office 2007 and requests me to purchase it otherwise I can not modify my file. Office 2007 seems like stealthly get into my PC without my permission. I am very happy with Office 2003 and really want to get rid of the Office 2007 from my PC.

product_title: Microsoft Windows Vista Home Premium Upgrade [DVD] - Old Version
review_headline: My System Wasn't Up To Speed
review_body: I'm sorry I didn't listen when I was advised to wait until I purchased a new PC. For Windows Vista, your system may lack resources. Though it will run, it runs much slower. At least with Windows XP, I could play my movies on DVD. My video card was not up to snuff for Windows Vista. I had driver problems but finally got the right ones. I found I was happier with Windows XP, so I went back to it.

product_title: Quicken Home & Business 2012 [OLD VERSION]
review_headline: Best upgrade in a few years
review_body: This is the best yearly upgrade in a few years. Faster, smarter, better integration with TurboTax. With as many version and data entry possibilities, there may a few users with upgrade issues. Quicken tech support has greatly improved. So, if you were waiting, stop and get this version.

product_title: ScanSoft PDF Converter Professional 3.0 [Old Version]
review_body: This app is incredible. I originally bought it for the \\"FormTyper\\" feature that lets you make unfillable PDF forms instantly fillable, but later found out it would let me edit text and graphics in PDF files. I previously avoided PDF files because they couldn't be used for anything really with Acrobat Reader, and Acrobat Standard was too darn expensive. This program is Adobe's worst nightmare - now people have a real alternative to their bloated, slow, over priced Acrobat solution. Isn't competition wonderful?

product_title: Quicken Premier 2010
review_body: Purchased this in early November 2009. Version 2010 R2. Found that it was incompatible with Union Bank checking (older versions work fine). As of now you will not be able to download UB transactions to Quicken. Union Bank claimed it would work manually if you downloaded and then opened the download file in Quicken but the UB support person and I spent a lot of time trying but that did not work. Union Bank claims there are other issues as well. So my advise is don't buy 2010 until well into 2010 after Intuit has fixed these problems.

product_title: Kaplan SAT/ACT/PSAT Gold Edition
review_body: Kaplan normally does a very good job with review materials. This one seems like it was hastily made and not updated very recently. It's still a good product, deserving of a good rating. It certainly addresses the right subject material, but I would like to see a name like Kaplan provide a more dynamic user experience.

product_title: Mac OS X version 10.6.3 Snow Leopard (Mac computer with an Intel processor required)
review_body: The price is so low, there is no reason not to upgrade! It gets your computer ready for the \\"next great thing\\" from Apple, and does so seamlessly and (almost) effortlessly. The refinements (not really new features, but close to it, such as, how the Dock and stacks now work) make life on the computer easier and more pleasant. [...].

product_title: Microsoft Windows 8.1 - Full Version
review_headline: Don't mind the reviews! It is a great OS!
review_body: I don't know why so many people hated it, I'm coming from a 10 year old machine that was using windows vista and since I first saw Win 8.1 I knew it would be great for my first build! I love it! The learning process it is really fun. Don't hesitate to buy it by the reviews!

product_title: Microsoft Windows 7 Professional SP1 32-bit DVD Software + Genuine Product Key & COA License
review_body: just what I needed.

product_title: DVD Copy 6
review_body: I just recently upgraded to vista, and was looking for a dvd copy software compatible with it; this works great, no conflicts; would recommend for anyone using vista

product_title: Dragon NaturallySpeaking Home 12.0, English (Old Version)

product_title: Microsoft Office 365 Small Bus Prem 1yr Sub
review_body: Hard to tell from MS descriptions of their products if encryption options are available. After rec'g the item and loading it the product does not support encryption so I had to return and upgrade.

product_title: Scrapbook Factory Deluxe 2.0 [Old Version]
review_body: It's okay and the interface is nice, but with the images on the box one would think they were getting elegant images for scrapbook pages, NOT, I hate cutsey and most of it is just that! Not what I want and since there is a 90 day money back guarantee, guess what? It's going back and the company better give me my $40.00 back! not an exchange either.

product_title: Learn Adobe Photoshop Lightroom 3 by Video
review_body: I was extremely pleased with this training video. The video player was very full featured; far better than any I have used in other video training I have used. Look over intro page ix of the accompanying book to get an over view if it's capabilities. Although it launches full screen, it can be reduced in size like any other on-screen window. Find the small handle at the lower right. You could of course shrink it down to the task bar, but it runs and looks great at both small and large sizes. What's more, you can pause the video at anytime, run you own copy of Lightroom and actually work through the same steps you are learning about. In fact, the image used on the DVD are also included on the DVD, so you could repeat the lessons with the identical images. (The video lessons are also on the DVD in .mp4 and .3gp format, so you may be able to work through some lessons on your iPhone/iPad or 3G cell phone while commuting.) It will pay to pause the first lesson and explore the user interface of the DVD playback software. It's not as complicated as LR itself, but quirky enough to make starting off somewhat confusing. You'll want to explore the LR interface at some point too. The Lightroom (LR) interface is designed around a good, flexible work flow, and the lessons generally follow that workflow. Of course, in actual use you can easily jump around the interface as you want, but seeing the software in an actual work flow is terrific. LR, like Photoshop, is a deep product, and watching it being used is actually far easier to do than trying to follow step-by-step instructions from a book. The DVD comes with a small book which you can remove from the packaging; it's got those small sticky pads holding the back of the book to the box. Just lift off carefully. The first half of the book is entitled \\"The Photograper's Eye\\" by Michael Jordan (but not that Michael Jordan.) This seems like basic filler, and is not related to Lightroom at all. The last half is pretty good,although a lot of those ridiculously small screen shots are included. The material covered is duplicated in Lesson 1.4 to 1.4.9 so you can at least see a much bigger image. There is also a handy keyboard shortcuts list. The book is also handy in case you want to change some of the settings without reloading the DVD. I have a few quibbles. In general, this DVD is aimed at Lightroom beginners. But much of Lesson 1 (1.1 to 1.3.7) deals with \\"What's New in LR3\\" which is almost useless, and frankly confusing, for someone using LR3 the first time. (If you just upgraded from an earlier version, this might be more interesting.) Start up your own LR and jump to 1.4 to begin the process of customizing your setup. At 1.4 you get a really useful, well explained review of the many LR settings. If you start with the 'Play All' option, as recommended, the interface takes you automatically from lesson to lesson, although there is no visual indication of which lesson and chapter number you are actually on. The titles are shown on the right hand sidebar (Chapter Videos) if you open it, but not the lesson numbers. You can use the dropdown at the top of the main dialog to see this, however. You can choose specific lessons from the opening main screen if desired. As you go, you can set bookmarks for sections you might like to revisit. All you bookmarks are available from one of the tabs at the top... a really nice feature! If you truly are a Lightroom beginner, this DVD will get you up-and-running quickly. If you have used Photoshop, and Camera Raw (CR) in particular, you will quickly see how adjustments in LR are so similar to CR, with LR adding so much more in terms of automation, asset management etc. Quirky start-up aside, this is an easy 5 star rating!

product_title: Teacher's Toolbox 6.0
review_body: I read a previous review but find my experience to be much different. Perhaps due to the fact that I was not a user of a previous version. I was introduced to the product by a colleague. After she reviewed with me the features of the product, I decided to purchase for myself. I have found that that there is very little learning curve to begin using the product effectively. The navigation is easy and the accuracy of reporting, averaging and curving is excellent. If you haven't used grade book software for your personal use before, I highly recommend this product.

product_title: Crack DAT PAT - Simulate the Dental Admission Test (2017-2018 Royal Flush Edition) [Digital Download]
review_body: This program has hundreds of questions which would prepare you for the test. I felt really insecure about the test before I started on this program. I felt more ready as I tested myself with the program since they had questions about things that I wouldn't pay much attention to. And my score actually showed that I have improved as I practiced more and more with this program.

product_title: Adobe Photoshop Elements 4.0 - Old Version
review_body:
Received this quite promptly from Amazon.com. Though I have Jasc PSP v8 I was looking for a certain (and, supposedly, superfast) format that was, reportedly, very easy to use with Photoshop Elements. When I tried to load photoshop Elements to my laptop (which is a little over a year old) it crashed my hard drive. After several futile attempts to fix the problem myself (was unable to even start the computer as it was in a crazy loop that wouldn't allow attempts at loading it up in safe mode even) I had to take it in to be looked at.

Techs were unable to find which exact file was corrupt (after several hours there were 100s) so they eventually did a system restore. So, added to the cost of the software I was also $170 out of pocket. Techs loaded Adobe so I wouldn't have a similar problem. I loaded all my other software without too much trouble. Had to remove their version of Norton.

Anyway, though I am able to use Adobe for the purpose for which it was purchased I am not happy with the software. It freezes. It is super slow when it's not freezing. I even have it open with nothing else running and it is still erratic. I HATE IT and it has cost me more money than I ever thought it would.

My advice is STEER CLEAR. Get Jasc's PSPA.

product_title: TurboTax Deluxe Federal + E-file + State 2011 [Old Version]
review_headline: Good Product but don't like the price games
review_body: I have used the three top programs TurboTax, Taxcut, and TaxAct over the years and tend towards TurboTax. The main reason I go to the other two is the price games TurboTax and Taxcut play. There is no substantive reward for using the program again the following year (yeah they offer you ten dollars off but you can get that by shopping on-line). I decided to buy on Amazon this year because I wanted to get it earlier. Just recently Costco but it on sale for another $10 cheaper. I installed it on Windows 7 Professional with no issues.

product_title: VOCALOID2 Character Vocal Series 03: Megurine Luka (Japan Import)
review_body:
This library is a Vocaloid 2 collection of the Luka Megurine voice bank. It is packaged together with the Vocaloid 2 Editor and if that is OK then there is no need to buy the Vocaloid 3 Editor (you can make the editor use English text by installing it, find the file "VOCALOID2_Japanese.dll" and remove it or change it to another name).

Luka is able to sing in Japanese and in English, with a nice soft voice and a good note-span. She can be easily imported to the Vocaloid 3 Editor (provided that you activate the voice bank first). There is a comprehensive manual included with the library - but unfortunately it is only in Japanese. Installation is straightforward, but is is in Japanese so it is a good idea to find some instructive youtube-videos to guide you. Also remember that the voice-bank must be activated and de-activated if it has to be move to another computer.

product_title: H&R Block Taxcut 2006 Home & Business + State
review_body:
According to reviews of TurboTax's Home and Business, it appears that TurboTax does not support S Corp (but probably does in the more expensive copr. package). Since many small businesses are S Corps, you probably will need to buy something besides TurboTax...like this program.

That is why I bought this product...I checked the product homepage (taxcut_com) and it said

\\"Complete Business Coverage - Helps you prepare returns for a number of business types, including Corporations, S Corporations, Partnerships, Limited Liability Companies (LLCs), Non-profits and Estates & Trusts. Plus, the program handles Payroll Taxes as well.\\"

So hopefully it will work for me without any additional software. I will try to come back and update this review once I try it out...but since it is from H&R Block, I figure it might not be the simplist program, but at least it will be accurate (they actually guarantees that...although most errors are from the users anyway).

Nice little perk is that the software comes on a USB jumpdrive for easy installation...and it also will import TurboTax files from previous years...

Sorry this review is not more informative, but after spending an hour digging around for S Corp info, I thought it would be helpful to mention that this apparently supports S Corp Businesses, as well as (unlimited) business state returns, personal federal and state as well as E-Filing... Overall it certainly seems to include alot of forms and features for one price.

product_title: Norton 360 1 User 3 Licenses
review_body: Norton doesn't work on windows 8 or 8.1. The worst part of windows 8.1 is Norton. It has to be reloaded every 2 or 3 weeks. The last time it was reloaded the Norton tech even said it doesn't work for 8 or 8.1. They also move my registry and program files so bad I had to go bad to a save point and reload the computer. The program is a nightmare.

product_title: NTI Backup Now Ez 2010 [Old Version]
review_headline: Keeps Shutting Down During Backup in Windows Vista Environment
review_body: I have had this product for a few months now. I have never been able to run a successful backup. I am in the Windows Vista 32-bit environment, and the backup will get about 2% complete when my computer goes dark and completely shuts down. I have been extremely disappointed with this product and its effect on my computer. I cannot recommend it and feel as though I've been sold a defective product.

product_title: Microsoft Office 2010 Home & Student 3PC /1 User [OLD VERSION]
review_body: As usual, Amazon shipped the product fast and efficiently. It arrived right on time, in good condition, and the download disc worked perfectly. I tried just using a product key but failed every time. Amazon was the only place to get the disc! Thank you Amazon! You rock!!!

product_title: Intuit Quickbooks Point of Sale Basic V11 2013 New User
review_headline: WARNING! TERRIBLE TERRIBLE PRODUCT AND SERVICE!!!
review_body: Whatever you do, don't use this! We tried to use this product this for our business in 2013. We were on the phone with QB's for hours trying to get it set up. We never could get it to work. We called to cancel it back in early 2014. I just found out they've been charging my bank account for over a year, it's Feb 2-15 now. We didn't realize it was this service that was charging us because we also use Quick Books for bookkeeping. I called today and was told that even though I've never used the service and was unable to figure out how to use the service, they are still going to charge me for over a year with them. They only have records of our first two phone calls with them, even though we called numerous times and did call to cancel. Terrible customer service, terrible product. Got Square instead and got that up and running in a matter of minutes. We've never had one issue with it.

product_title: Microsoft Office Home and Student 2007 [Old Version]
review_body: The product was puchased for my blind son to interact with a "Jaws" program to help him be able to communicate through his laptop. We're very satisfied with it.

product_title: Parallels Desktop 10 for Mac
review_body:
EDIT: I used to love the software and gave it 5 stars, but I had to rethink my decision and give a new updated review.

I was enjoying this product until I upgraded to El Capitan... I can't get into my bootcamp partition without being pushed to upgrade... I've already paid 4 times for upgrades/full version for round $260 already... I don't think it's right to keep pushing people to pay for upgrades over and over with every OS that Apple releases. I'm considering switching to something else where I don't have to keep paying for upgrades once or twice a year...

(Added pictures to show how many times I purchased this product...

product_title: Microsoft Windows 10 Home USB Flash Drive
review_headline: Terrible Invasion of Privacy, Terrible installer
review_body:
UPSHOT: YOU TURN YOUR COMPUTER/DEVICE INTO BIG BROTHER BY AGREEMENT IN THE LICENSE AT INSTALLATION, IF YOU INSTALL WINDOWS 10. Never before in history has such a 'license' created such awful terms. Look in the comments for links so you can see the language for yourself. I can't put the links in an Amazon review.

SERIOUSLY YOU NEED TO SEE FOR YOURSELF PRIOR TO INSTALLATION, WHAT HITLERIAN TERMS YOU'RE AGREEING TO.

Installation is also extremely glitchy. About 50% of the installers' reports I've read, are 'smooth', especially from Windows 8.1.. else, glitchy. Given the above warning, I spend a lot of time watching how people in tenforums, wilderssecurity forums, bleepingcomputer and even microsoft community, are suffering with installing this horrible new Windows 10. I do have it, but as an Insider. I write extensively about it in bleeping computer and vimeo PC World Alumni forum and brainout(dot)net frankforum (latter two are my own), so you can read more there. It has no confidential data on it, and the hard drive is removable.

I personally own 16 Windows machines which are eligible for this thing 'free'. So obviously if I found it good, would get it for them all, and say so here.

But Windows 10, is scary. First time, Windows is scary. You'll have to see it yourself to believe it: at least, I did. That's why I became an Insider, first.

So here, I feel I owe it to my fellow Amazonians to disclose the upshot of this awful installer:

1. It will only allow you to do a so-called 'inplace upgrade' ON TOP OF your current Window 7 or 8, which 50% of the time results in disaster. People do it, to keep their current programs and settings. Don't bet on this working. Even experts are getting it wrong, see the 1st paragraph's forums. That is also how the free version works. Just avoid this option like the plague it is.

2. The other option is 'clean install', which here is only available if purchased. But people who use this, are having really bad luck, and Windows help personnel always blame the seller, so make you go back to the seller. So here, unless the seller sells you support with the license (and they usually do not), then you shouldn't buy.

The problem with 'clean install' is the installer looks for a key. The key you are supposed to provide, is a Windows 10 key. The key you get is a Windows 10 key, but the installer often won't recognize it. When you call MSFT for help, often you're told they can't help, you must go back to the seller. So if they are not the seller, you're s.o.l.

More importantly, the license is downright frightening. It's so much worse than turning your machine into Big Brother, but Microsoft tells you that you agree to let IT play Big Brother on you, even if you turn off all the privacy destroyers baked into the thing. This is a series of lawsuits waiting to happen.

And what do you get for all this? Nothing you didn't already have. Frou-frou that doesn't work: Windows 'Hello' requires a special camera you don't have, Windows Xbox requires Xbox too, Hololens can't work yet, Cortana is a joke, Edge is a gray sheet of paper which gets papered with ads you can't get rid of, your search bar is turned into advertising if you search on the web, you can't get rid of Bing, you can't customize, there is no real Start Menu but instead a vertical version of the Win8 start Screen... and on and on with the nonsense.

Oh, and no you really can't revert within 30 days, they overwrite your windows.old folder with the first Windows 10 cumulative update. Which happens, the day or the day after, you activate. IF IF IF you managed to activate.

Do you really want to go down the rabbithole with Alice and be much poorer afterwards? I thought not.

It gets two stars for two things it does well: it runs old software and hardware which businesses use (not consumer stuff, business stuff).. really well. I use 1980's and 1990's business hardware and software, and Win10 can work with them. Consumer stuff, maybe yes maybe no.

The MSfanboy proselytizing is at an all-time high. Which should warn you immediately. If faith is warranted in God or some product, then it shouldn't need salesmen. So if everyone's trying to 'convert' you to it, something's VERY wrong with that idea of God or that product. Right?

DISCLOSURE is one thing. That, you need. Selling is quite another, and the fanboys never tell you the many dark undersides to Win10. So...

PLEASE DO YOUR HOMEWORK BEFORE BUYING THIS. Links will be in comments after this review is approved, so you can read the license fright for yourself.n work with them. Consumer stuff, maybe yes maybe no. The MSfanboy proselytizing is at an all-time high. Which should warn you immediately. If faith is warranted in God or some product, then it shouldn't need salesmen. So if everyone's trying to 'convert' you to it, something's VERY wrong with that idea of God or that product. Right? DISCLOSURE is one thing. That, you need. Selling is quite another, and the fanboys never tell you the many dark undersides to Win10. So... PLEASE DO YOUR HOMEWORK BEFORE BUYING THIS. Links will be in comments after this review is approved, so you can read the license fright for yourself.

review_body: LOVEEEEEE IT!!!!!

product_title: ScanSoft PaperPort 11 Professional [OLD VERSION]
review_headline: Very Disappointing Product - Use the free version instead!
review_body:
I have been a loyal customer and bought a full version of PP10, and paid to upgrade to PP11. During the last 18 months, I upgraded my laptop twice, and then upgraded my current laptop from XP to Vista. When I downloaded the Vista version and tried to reinstall it, it says the software cannot be activated. Turns out that they only let you install the darn thing 3 times.

THAT IS SIMPLY RIDICULOUS IN THIS DAYS AND AGES. To add insult to injury, they want you to pay full price and buy another full version.

Guess what. They lost me as a customer, permanently. I uninstalled it and use the FREE Paperport that comes with my Brother All-in-one printer instead. And then, I discovered that there are actually many free Print-to-PDF products that you can download from the web, such as CutePDF, or PrimoPDF.

Don't waste time with this product!

product_title: Writer's Dream Kit 4.0
review_headline: Extremely useful if plotting a long fiction is your problem.
review_body:
First for Mac users: I installed this on a Mac running OS X 10.3. It asked me which version of OS X I was running and offered 10.2, 10.3, and 10.4 as options. I selected 10.3 and it went through a preliminary install. Then it asked for the serial number on the card which came with the software. (If you are as compulsive about throwing away clutter as I am, try to restrain yourself and save that card! Otherwise, I don't think the program will turn on.) After I did this and provided the usual registration stuff, it got online (I should mention I was installing in an administrator mode)and had a chat with the company. Everything went very well. This program is native for the Mac OS X and doesn't require Mac Classic or anything like that. Thanks, guys, for making such a neat piece of software that also runs on Macs!

OK, now about using the program. I am the sort of person who gets a great idea and sits down at her computer and just starts going. Things go wonderfully for about five chapters, and then I run out of steam because I just haven't thought enough about where things are going, and it's getting hard to keep everything straight.

This program is like sitting down with a no-nonsense writing teacher who asks detailed questions about characters, motivations, goals, and so on and gives you feedback on whether or not you have enough information for a workable plot stucture and what's missing. (You are free, of course, to ignore its advice.)

The most difficult part about using this program is that the designers have invented a lot of terminology that you have to understand to use the program properly. (There is a PDF file on the disk containing a 300-plus page book that explains the theory and vocabulary in detail. I strongly recommend you read it first! Once you have that, the software is quite user-friendly.)

What I found especially helpful in the software were the dozens of examples of well-known stories that theauthors had analyzed in terms of their model of plot design. That model(this is oversimplified) is the idea that a story is like a mind trying to solve a problem and that different characters are like aspects of that mind at work.

If you put in the work -- and it is a LOT of work -- at the end you will have a detailed plot outline which can be printed out.

If you can write novel-length fiction on pure inspiration, you will probably hate this. If you have good ideas, but find yourself lost in the woods and hoping for a rescue party after about fifty pages, this can be a lifesaver. You get out of it as much as you put into it.

product_title: PC-Cillin Internet Security 2006 [Old Version]
review_headline: Great but eats up memory terribly
review_body: I have just upgraded from 2005 (which I loved) to 2006 with a clean install of 2006 to avoid problems. Read the manual, did everything correctly. It installed just fine. The 2nd day I am unable to open more than one large application at a time, such as Outlook and Firefox both at once. It eats up more memory than both of these apps together. My task manager says it is using 69,692 mg of memory just to run in background. I may have to turn off real time scanning to remedy this. What is the use of having the suite then? I have a Dell P4 with 756mg of memory. It has always been adequate to multitask before this. I may have to dump this 2006 anti-virus for another program. Even AVG and free zone alarm would eat up 1/2 of the memory as this. I guess you have to sacrifice safety for memory and the ability to multitask since I use my computer for work. Unless you want to upgrade your memory a lot, I wouldm't recommend this.

product_title: Dragon Premium 13.0
review_body:
For what it's worth. I bought this to use in transcribing prerecorded interviews. It has a learning curve, no doubt. If I were to speak into the microphone, I thought Dragon 13 did an excellent job of getting the words right. However, using it for transcribing on poorly recorded conversations proved frustrating. Not Dragon's fault but the copy of each interview varied so much in the interview itself and between interviews.
Dragon 13 Premium will transcribe downloaded conversations and it's very easy to set that up. But the results can be hit or miss depending on the quality of the recorded material.
Now as far as installs, I have three laptops all running either Windows 7, 7.1 and 8. I had no trouble at all installing the software on each and using the one serial number provided. The serial number shows up three times on the sticker placed on the sleeve that contains the software so I assumed that meant I could use it on three machines or combinations thereof. But no problem with installs on any of the machines and worked fine upon completion of the install.

product_title: QuickBooks Pro 2010
review_headline: Minor upgrade to annoying but ubiquitous accounting software
review_body: * The Install * We tested out QB Pro 2010 by upgrading our 2009 Pro install and loading our company file. The install took about 15 minutes and retained many of our settings from QB 2009. The installer did hang at the end hand had to be killed with task manager (Win XP). * First Run * After installing, we ran QB 2010 and it needed to download an update. This process took about 10 minutes, and then it needed to convert our company file to the new format. Not a big deal, but don't try to load a file from QB 2010 on previous versions--backwards compatibility is lost. Actually running the program, we find some minor updates, as well as many familiar old annoyances. The toolbar is again littered with icons for Intuit products we're not interested in (we had cleaned this up when we installed 2009). The Intuit Community pops up, but you can disable it in preferences. The interface is littered with Intuit products they want you to buy. For example, there is an item \\"Email Marketing\\" in three separate menus, Company, Customer, and Online Services. We tried this menu option and it complained that IE was not our default browser. (Duh, it's called security.) * Summary * QuickBooks Pro 2010 is a minor update (the new company snapshot is nice, the new products they're trying to sell you are not) feature-wise. The software works well enough to tolerate and everybody uses it. Accountants know it. This is why we use it. We wish there was another option for us as Intuit is not a customer-friendly company in our opinion. They try to hard to get you to pay for minor features that should be included. They should spend more focus on the customer experience and let the revenue streams follow, not vice versa.

product_title: Smith Micro Software Poser Debut
review_body:
Poser wasn't quite what I expected. I thought it would be very focused on figures, human and otherwise; but in fact, it's a surprisingly full-featured 3D rendering program.

As far as sample content goes, yes, there's quite a lot of it, and it's surprisingly varied. Once I'd put together a quick scene of a wolf eating potato chips, I decided to see whether I could pull in 3D models downloaded from the Internet. Happily, the answer is yes--Poser will read a number of common 3D file formats, so you can trawl the Internet for free models of sci-fi spaceships, Japanese Manga characters, or whatever else you want to incorporate into your artistic endeavors.

Obviously there are lots of things you can't do with Poser. It doesn't give you complete control over rendering, and it's not a solid modeling package or NURBS mesh editor. But it'll give you the chance to make some images or animations, and see if you're ready to go further.

The thing is, I've toyed with various free 3D tools over the years, from POV-Ray to Blender. Poser has almost all of them beat as far as UI approachability is concerned, and with the sample content and tutorials is an excellent place to start if you have an interest in 3D graphics. Yet even without an unapproachable interface in the way, I've come to realize that 3D is really hard and very time consuming to get just right. I don't think it's for me. But it could be for you, and here's a way to find out.

product_title: Brain Builder 3.0
review_headline: Works. Takes time but it works.
review_body:
I have been using the product for over a month and half and just now am I finally experiencing noticeable results. My ability to hold and manipulate information in my head is better. For example, Math is coming to me much easier. I've noticed that I need to write out my problems less and can finish them in my head. This is great for me because just two 2 years ago I dropped out of calculus but now Im doing fine. Another thing, for the longest time I hit a wall with my reading speed (I bought sofware for that too) but now that is starting to increase once more. The best way to describe it is that things are growing clearer.

Now for the bad. The software is very basic. For most, the exercises will probably too boring to do every day. This has been my experience trying to get friends to use it. And in my opinion, ten minutes a day isn't enough. I've been using for about an hour a day. The way I look at it is there will always be a diet that works or a method that gets you rich or a philosophy that makes you happy and there will always only be a few individuals that have the drive to become better. Without being too preachy, this software is for the individual that understands the importance of intelligence in succeeding at life and has the drive to do something about it.

Edit: It has been 3 years since using the program. Now that I am aware of what is out there and free websites that offer similar brain training, the price is too expensive to justify purchasing. Dual-n-back, a short term memory training program, has been more effective and more importantly there are free versions available. Another name to look up is Harry Kahne and his coarse in Multiple Mentalism. Both programs are very rigorous but produce results over time.
